28.description: When you go in to this location to get your hair done make sure you ask for Robby. He's been doing my hair for a few years at his previous salon and my experiences have been nothing but fantastic. My mother is a hair stylist and he was the first professional I ever saw outside of my mom and shhhh don't tell, but he does a better job and that says a lot.He does a fantastic job with color - he created a personal color solution for me as I am a faithful bright haired blond and it is difficult to keep it from looking brassy. My color has always ended up radiant and I have never been dissatisfied with his service. He makes great suggestions with regard to color, haircuts and the latest hairstyles and definitely knows what he's doing. Robby is extremely friendly and personable as well. I look forward to our monthly appointment as it is more than hair maintenance - it's a great social experience :)Don't waste any time or money - Ask for Robby stat!! You'll be more than satisfied.

1.description: I have thick, curly, shoulder length hair and while my stylist did a pretty good cut, I was disappointed at the wash and blowout. Especially with curly hair, I was expecting a thorough, repetitive shampoo and condition; it turned out to be very surface level. Drying my hair was fine, but when she got to the hot curler (which is an extra $10 for any thermal equipment used), she did not allow the curler to actually give heat to the curls so that the curls would stay and not dwindle away by the winds of this city. In the moment the finished product looked fine, but hours later curls were falling. I needed to use my own curling iron to ensure the curls would stay more than a day, which isn't usually the case when I get a blow out. I don't think she was a bad stylist, she just may not have had much experience with thick, curly hair.

9.description: Chatrika has been doing my hair for years, and she is Awesome! This Ulta has great customer service and very professional stylists!

23.description: I was super excited when I found out they were opening an Ulta right by my house!My CHI straightener  recently broke after owning it for six years. I bought one from this location, however it stopped working in less than a week. (Totally not Ulta's fault, but the manufacturer) The customer service at Ulta has been great! They told me to come right in and they would be happy to exchange it. Most places end up putting up a fight over something so stupid! I love this place though!

5.description: I haven't been able to find a stylist since over moved to Chicago (7 months ago)... Until now! I have curly, crash thick hair and have a hard time trusting people to work with my mess until now! Thank you Nelson for doing my second KeraStraight treatment and fixing my hair.... This treatment is amazing, it doesn't have formaldehyde and is a natural protein that's put back in your hair. Nelson is highly skilled and knowledgeable. I love that he is honest and doesn't try to make me product... He just gets it and is a pleasure to chat with! I will earn you that the process for KeraStraight is just that, my hair takes about 4 hours in totally but every minute is worth it! I used to take 45-60 minutes to blow dry my hair and with this treatment it now takes 20 and doesn't frizz or curl in humidity. Thank you for fixing me Nelson, can't wait for my color with you!

25.description: I have been visiting Robbie for about 4+ years now and have followed him for the 3rd time now to his new location at the Ulta Salon.  From the first time I visited Robbie, Robbie has continued to ask me, discuss options with me, confirm with me, before we even proceed with our plan for the day.  I feel heard and treated in a most professional, gentle, attentive and personal manner.  We have some conversation in a moderate way - and I feel I am there to relax and be treated with a very important and personal service.  My hair is very important to me and I have been frustrated with dozens of past hair stylists.  And, even though I've changed direction and styles over the years, have wanted to try this or that, Robbie has continued to be attentive and always offers a back up solution,  that "if you don't like it, we can always do ......".   Robbie does what he does best and makes it look effortless. I highly recommend Robbie for all of your hair needs - you won't regret entrusting your hair with Robbie!!!

12.description: I got my eyebrows waxed by Chiquitta at Ulta last Sunday, and I will definitely be a repeat customer!  I've had my eyebrows waxed and threaded on different occasions at different places, but lost confidence due the stylist never achieving the right shape of brow for my face.  However, Chiquitta took time to professionally map out the shape of my brows, and it didn't even hurt when she waxed.  Thank you!  See you soon!

21.description: Yesterday I decided I needed the long overdue trim so I called and got an appointment with Chatrika whom I'd never met.  We talked about my hair color as my grey was growing in and it was apparent that coloring was also in order.  I explained that I really wanted to let it all grow out, but also wanted it to look okay in the process.  Chatrika suggested some highlights to blend in the grey and showed me the color she would use.  I decided to trust her and go with it.  I will now tell you that this woman knows color.  It was, by far, the best color application I've ever had, and I've been to some of the city's "best" salons.  She also trimmed my hair perfectly.  Chatrika understands hair and she listens to what you want as well.  Ulta is lucky to have her.

16.description: Michelle is a great new addition to the skin care department.  Takes the time to get to know your skin, provides wonderful service and she makes my skin look and feel so soft after a treatment.  Jan B

17.description: You know how you go into a salon with an image in your mind of how you want to come out looking?  Well, I got my haircut with Nelson and I looked exactly like that image in my mind.  It was hair perfection in every way!  Highly, highly recommended!

10.description: Never going there again worse Service ever I got there nobody greeted me and I was looking for a specific item and they ignored me

11.description: The customer service is terrible!!! They pressure you into buying and then whenever I ask something, they all seemed bothered.

26.description: When Ulta first opened in the West Loop, I was super thrilled!  I decided to go in for a hair cut since I had not found a stylist I loved.  Nelson cut my hair and made it look amazing!!I have finally found my stylist!  I absolutely reccommend Nelson.  I went in and I asked him to do whatever he thinks looks best. He said he can lift my hair up and add some layers. As he was cutting, he would explain everything to me and share all the products he is using on my hair.  He is super gentle too. When I left the salon, my hair bounced and looked great. I went back again to see Nelson and once again, he made my hair look beautiful.  Go see him!

27.description: Robby is by far the best stylist that I have ever had! I met him about a year and a half ago when I walked into his previous salon. I had only planned on getting a hair cut, considering every other stylist I had gone to could not execute exactly what I had wanted with color. After chatting for a few minutes, I decided that I would like Robby to color my hair with the ombre trend. I was more than satisfied with the result, and have continued to see him ever since. He's wonderful with cut and color! I was so lucky to find him on a whim, and with just a walk-in. He also provides you with the best style tips and genuinely informs you on what products would work best for you. I have felt very overwhelmed with previous stylists I have had that badger you with product purchases.... you won't ever get that from Robby. As a client of Robby's, I have received very personalized service (which is very rare in these times). Besides always being satisfied with my hair, Robby has added in meaningful touches throughout the year such as personalized cards during the holiday's. It's nice to know that your business is appreciated!To sum up my novel, you will be in good hands when choosing Robby as your stylist!Thank you Robby!!

0.description: I would like to thank my clients for all the amazing reviews that you ladies have posted for me from the Ulta Beauty Hyde Park Location. It is very fulfilling to know that I've made a huge positive  impact on my clients salon experiences. As of 10/06/2015 I have relocated to Ulta Beauty the Greektown/ West Loop location at 16 S. Halsted. There is free parking in the building for all Ulta guest. I have been fortunate to have an amazing 24 year career doing what I love and that's making women feel good about themselves through quality and professional hair experiences. As I move on to my new Ulta location I look forward to continuously servicing all the amazing clients that have blessed me.  Thank You xoxo                 Sheree Smith               Master Designer

20.description: Robbie is awesome! He is the first person that can get my hair processed, cut, dried in under 2 hours. I love the color - which is a first. I've also had him style it for me on 2 occasions and he does a fabulous job.

19.description: I was super excited when I found out they were opening an Ulta right by my house!My CHI straightener  recently broke after owning it for six years. I bought one from this location, however it stopped working in less than a week. (Totally not Ulta's fault, but the manufacturer) The customer service at Ulta has been great! They told me to come right in and they would be happy to exchange it. Most places end up putting up a fight over something so stupid! I love this place though!

2.description: Sheree does an AMAZING job on my hair! Whether it's coloring or styling, I can rely on her for whatever I'm looking for. She also recommends great products for my hair! ASK FOR SHEREE!

18.description: At the Salon, Nelson is amazing!  First time I stopped in I was in a pinch to get my hair cut before a wedding. I didn't expect to come back.  I just got my second hair cut with Nelson and he did wonderfully.  He is very knowledgeable and insightful.  Knowing I'm a low maintenance no frills person, he made sure he gave me a style that was just that and didn't use crazy product on my hair, which I really appreciate!  Highly suggest.  The store is great too. Very addictive!

13.description: If your in need of a haircut, styling, or hair color you MUST ask for Chatrika but be sure to schedule an appointment ahead of time because she is very popular! You will not it regret it! She is the best!!

4.description: Great hair service, Christina (manager) does a great job and is very professional.

24.description: I was very happy when this Ulta opened. But there aren't words to describe how thrilled I was when the Ulta much closer to me in River Forest finally opened. Yet... I've been to the Greek Town Ulta twice since the opening in River Forest a week and a half ago! I just like the staff and the selection in Greek Town better.I'm a mom, and sometimes I'll have my boys in tow. (sorry) But, I've never gotten that "uh oh" face from any of the staff here at their mere presence. The same can't be said for the one in RF.  I've gotten a lot of great samples at this location as well!

6.description: I hardly ever give poor reviews, but after 4 visits this Ulta needs one. I love Ulta for their prices and being able to have a brief conversation on products with a Ulta consultant.That is not the case at this Ulta. I spent 10mins searching for a consultant, who rolled her eyes and responded w an attitude-filled "what do you want" after I asked if she could help me for a moment. Oh, and two of the Murad products I was looking for? Out of stock.Go to the Ulta on State Street, ladies and gentlemen.

22.description: I've become somewhat of a makeup junkie in the last year. I love, love, love Ulta and this location in particular. I know it can be a bit overwhelming for some people because of the huge selection but once you become acquainted with the store it gets much better. I've been here so many times including the day it first opened and I've never had a bad experience. The sales people aren't pushy and are very helpful when needed. Most of the time I do my research on a product before visiting the store so I already know what I want but something else always catches my eye. I downloaded the app on my iPhone (if you haven't already you should) you can view the weekly ad and they have a mobile coupon so I always have one available for a purchase. I just got a $50 gift card for Christmas so I'll definitely be paying this place a visit very soon! :)

15.description: I only go to this location because of Chatrika! She is one of the most talented and professional stylist I have ever had the opportunity to get my hair done by. I surely hope Ulta is able to hold on to her because I would follow her wherever she goes!

7.description: Sharee did a fantastic job with my cut and color.  She had such great reviews at the Hyde Park location that I decided to make the trip to her new location. It was worth it --one of the best stylist I've ever had! The color was perfect and the cut was exactly what I wanted. I'll definitely be back!

8.description: Chiquita was awesome! She did a great job on my brows and was very personable. Looking forward to me follow up appt! Customer service was really great here, I came in looking for a specific scent and quite a few people helped me. Ultimately I didn't find the perfume I wanted but they really did help me look at alternative options. I wanted to test a diff scent they didn't carry so I waited on making a fragrance purchase.

3.description: I had a great experience at ultra Greek town with sharee she was nice I had a hair cut highlights shampoo and style and I loved my hair she will be my stylist from now on she was friendly and personable and made sure I was comfortable and happy thank you so much sharee a good stylist is hard to find you are the best :)

14.description: Robbie is awesome! He is the first person that can get my hair processed, cut, dried in under 2 hours. I love the color - which is a first. I've also had him style it for me on 2 occasions and he does a fabulous job.

12.description: I've never had the coffee so this review is solely based on the gelato! It is very delicious. I've had the Disaronno more than once. It is unique and delicious! I've also sampled almost all of the other flavors. All great options. The pomegranate tasted really good. The price is definitely reasonable! It's not mind-blowing, but it's definitely great! It's kind of like a fresher, different flavored Talenti!

7.description: This coffee shop is part of the Mariano's Fresh Market establishment. This location has terrible service and not much of a selection of snacks, but the gelato is refreshing and the helpings are large. There is also a seating area in the back. Great for a quick rest but not ideal for your typical cafe lounging. The noise level is high and the music is occasionally interrupted by the grocery store loudspeaker. I RECOMMEND: The croissants EXTRA TIP: Iced Tea is unsweetened and can't be ordered otherwise.

19.description: My new favorite place to work and drink coffee.  Free wifi, free coffee refills, access to all of Mariano's groceries and bakery items.  My go to maneuver is buying some bakery items and a piece of fruit upstairs, then coming downstairs to buy a coffee and work for a few hours.  The free 2 hr parking is a nice benefit as well.

1.description: Every time I see hazelnut desserts, the fact that I'm lactose intolerant goes out the door. Just the thought of hazelnut desserts is making me drool as I'm writing this review.The first time that I tried Vero's, they had a Ferrero Rocher gelato ice cream, and it was AMAZING. If you were to ask me to kiss the floor and do the hokey pokey dance to get this ice cream, DONE. It's too bad that I haven't seen this flavor since that first time. They've had hazelnut gelato ice cream each time that I've visited, but not the Ferrero Rocher brand. Regardless, they're always an absolute party in my mouth.I usually get the mini size ($1.25 for two scoops) with either a sugar cone or waffle cone ($0.50). It comes out to $1.93, which is cheap considering what you're getting. Hint: Get the waffle cone because it's bigger, and you're less likely to drip ice cream on yourself (if you're a messy eater like me).There are plenty of seats in the cafe, so that you can sit down and enjoy whatever it is that you ordered. The only downsides are the flavors aren't all labeled and there isn't a clear-cut ordering or line-forming system.A bonus perk is that they have frequent buyer system. Buy 10 gelato items, get a free 12 oz. gelato or 16 oz. shake. *eyes sparkling in excitement*If you're shopping at Mariano's, I highly recommend stopping by here.

2.description: Vero's offers a plethora of flavors. Some are good, others not so much.There's free wi-fi and plenty of seats, as well as excellent service. The best thing about this joint is relative inexpensiveness of the gelato. $1 single servings to $6-$7 for a pint. Pretty sweet.

9.description: Ohmyword. Who still sells $1 gelato?! THIS place apparently. There were a myriad of flavors to choose from, all of which were quite good. It probably won't be the bestest gelato you've ever laid your taste buds on, but who even notices when your mind is so blown away by the fact it is $1! And in all fairness, it is truly decently good gelato. They also have comfy couches, funky chairs, and a modern fireplace for you to chill by. Super solid.

6.description: Free wifi AND beneath the best grocery store?!  Count me in!$1 gelato.  You can also often buy their $1 Mariano's OJ right in front.  A good working space, with a cozy fire and plenty of tables.  Gets full around lunchtime.  It's a surprise coffeeshop to park your laptop in!  I'm also curious about their wine/beer bar, which looks cozy.

18.description: Coffee is always good. always on point

10.description: Can't beat $1 gelato! My favorites are the classic pistachio and the Ferrero Rocher!

13.description: The gelato is good and plentiful.  It's not awesome gelato but it's definitely not bad.  AND you get a lot of sugar for the money.  Heap it in there!  Value score! (hence the 4 star rating)I'm not sure why the reviews knock the place for ambiance... You walked into a Marianos.. this is a grocery store.  I'm not sure what you were expecting but the noise level didn't take away from the enjoyment of my sweet treat one bit.  The seating space is pretty large and the last time I went I saw some opportunistic students there typing away at their laptops to take advantage of the free WiFi, availability of snacks and coffee, and the courtesy of not being asked to leave.  If I worked / studied here regularly I'd be massively fat.I kinda wish that it wasn't common practice to serve your gelato with a utensil that looks much like a mini shovel.  I KNOW that's how I use it... but you don't have to make it so damn obvious!  Mini teaspoons, please.TIP: Be sure to register your Mariano's card to be a part of their gelato club. Yep!  You read right.... fatasses rejoice!  You can eat your way towards FREE gelato.  I think the deal is 5 or 10 purchases scores you a freebie.

16.description: I am a true fan of this place.  The Coffee is great and there is nothing like a scoop of their Gelato after running around Mariono's.

17.description: Had the gelato and coffee, both were great. Get the mini, which is only $1. They have a large selection of gelato.

15.description: I really wanted to like this place, seriously. I have a standing coffee date with a friend every week. 3 weeks ago, we switched to this location instead of the Starbucks down the street. Free wifi, decent coffee and a good breakfast selection. What could go wrong? Well, the service is terrifically inefficient,  they'll skip you over a regular and in the last 3 weeks, they messed up my breakfast sandwich order twice. And when I mean mess up, I mean skipped it all together. When I asked the woman (both times the same one), she was short -  as if I had to justify that I actually ordered it.I hope they pull themselves together.

0.description: Yum yum yum!!!Mini, small, medium, large, and gallon sizes offered.  So many different flavor and they offer samples.  The cute spoons look like mini shovels and the price is unbeatable.  We got 2 mini gelatos and a single shot of espresso for $5.19, love it.

5.description: This is for gelato.How can you not like the gelato here.  Good selection, big portion, good service.  I eat a two scoop ice cream (99cents) whenever I grocery shop at Mariano's.  Most of all, however, it tastes great.  End of story.

11.description: I was visiting the area from out of town and stopped in twice to enjoy some gelato and take a break and chat with my friend. I didn't think the mini would be enough for me when I ordered it but it was more than enough.  It was fun to walk through the store afterwards, too.

8.description: 1 dollar for a "mini" gelato!! Best dollar deal ever! The cup is not so mini. 20-30 flavors to choose from...the only problem was that some were not labeled. Free wifi but this is not a place you would want to sit and relax...a bit loud since it is the lobby to Mariano's.

3.description: This establishment is part of Mariano's Fresh Market.  It offers sandwiches, beverages, desert, and a rotating assortment of gelato.  There is a little seating area for you to enjoy your food and drinks or just have some quality time with friends.  Oh, there is also free wi-fi for all those technological heads....SCORE!! This café is similar to a fast food joint where you would order at the counter and seat yourself.  There is no sort of organization to the ordering process.  Customers would just stand around in somewhat of a line, but the counter guy would just skip over people and would serve whomever he fancied.  WTH?!?  I can't say anything about their food/beverages because the couple of times I have been here, I only ordered their gelato.  It was ok, but I had better at other places.I would rate this café higher if it was better organized and had friendlier staff, but for now 2 stars will have to do.  I'll probably stop by again while shopping at Mariano's because of the convenience.  I also heard good things about their café items and definitely will be returning to check them out.

14.description: I'm in the process / procrastination of writing a book so I frequent wifi- and caffeine-powered spots at least weekly. Since I regularly shop at Mariano's, I decided to try Vero's for a coffee and work space. There were plenty of open tables, many even next to power outlets. I picked a spot, settled in, and quickly noticed fruit flies buzzing by. Within the first five minutes, I was so grossed out and frustrated by fly swatting that I had to exit and revert to the nearby Starbucks.I'm sure your gelato is lovely but please clean and debug your cafe.

4.description: Every time I am at Mariano's or nearby I stop to have a coffee and ice cream. Its very nice, cheap and staff is super friendly.

28.description: Absolutely the worst service I have ever seen from a spa type venue!!  I purchased a deal they put up on Lifebooker to try them out.  So I called to make my massage appointment for my birthday.  They then tell me the therapist is only there M,W,F and I am unavailable those days.  Like most people I can go to the spa on the weekend. I made sure to read through all the fine print of the deal cause there can be some and nothing is listed. Nothing offered.  He just kept saying "it's on Lifebooker, you'll need to take it up with them".  Not setting up a different day, offering something because of the mistake, contacting them to issue a refund or even apologizing! I read other bad stories below about buying deals for them.  There are so many places that offer massages in Chicago that I wouldn't waste your time on them.

1.description: The most beneficial massage I've ever had.I found a deal on Living Social and after looking at their website, it looked like they focus on wellness/health and improving the functions of my body.  I hunch over a computer and sit in traffic all day - I needed serious upper back/tight hip flexor help.I wasn't after pure relaxation.  I would not have been happy if I was lightly rubbed for 90 minutes, like a normal spa at a hotel/cruise tends to be.If you have a problem area that needs massage/stretching help, this is the place to go.  I told the massage therapist about my issues and for 40 minutes of the massage, she consistently worked on that for me.  She'd talk a bit to explain a certain stretch, make sure the pressure was OK, to ensure I was comfortable.  She provided a full body massage in an hour, but focused most of the time on where I needed the most help - she listened to me!!Ask for Montserrat.  She's really strong and explains why she's doing what she's doing if she senses you're not comfortable, or may be in a bit of pain.Also, one of these reviews mentioned being surprised when the covers were lifted and they were asked to turn over...have you ever had a massage?  Totally normal and the therapist is hidden behind the blankets.  It was not weird or uncomfortable at all.  And she says she's doing it before she does it.I'm writing this review the day after my massage and I am sore, but it's a great sore.  For those of us hunched behind a computer, or stuck in traffic most of our days - come and get that tightness worked out!

9.description: Dr. Z is an amazing Doctor. Not only because of his ability to pinpoint were your pain is located, and fix it, but also his keen ear for listening to his patients. He is very thorough, and very professional. His office is exceptionally clean and inviting, and his staff is very friendly. The office hours are great. If you have a 10 am appointment, be there on time, because Dr.Z is always on time

29.description: Don't let the florescent lighting, chiropractor vibe and less-than-enthusiastic receptionist deter you. This place is fantastic for a relaxing, spa-like massage that *also* happens to be incredibly good for you.See Monica. She is fantastic at deep-tissue technique. Good knowledge of anatomy, strong pressure, and will work on any special requests you might have (mine were my IT-bands). It's rare to find a masseuse who will honor such requests with the care and attention. Additionally, she took care to set the right "mood" in the massage room by using aromatherapy scents and heated eye masks. Highly recommend.

23.description: I had one massage and two chiropractic treatments so far. I am really happy with the place. My treatments gave me immediate relief the first visit. I am so thrilled to be pain free and so grateful for the service plans they offer for the uninsured. The monthly plans enable you to get adjustments for about $30 per treatment (and it includes a targeted massaging energy treatment from a machine that zaps away pain in addition to the manual adjustment) I highly recommend the place, I think the massages included with the monthly plan (from a person) are also quite affordable. I moved up from going to the discounted schools to getting treatments from the pros and I really could not be happier. I love this model of monthly plans, did I mention that? I found the customer service quite good as well, I had no issues with squeezing in at the last minute or running a bit late and I appreciate it.Update: I came back again for another health issue and still think this place is just great!

5.description: I had a groupon and made the appointment, but I showed up the wrong time.  The manager told me that I could not reschedule because they had already redeemed the groupon. I was upset but I understood and he told me I had to pay $30 dollars for another appointment.  I decided to reschedule and pay, even though I could of gotten a better discount because I was a new customer.   I asked for someone who had experience and I felt I did not get a full massage.  She did my back and it was just ok, but worth the extra 30 dollars I spent!

31.description: MASSAGE THERAPIST~ Monica. (although, she no longer works here)Bought a deal find certificate...you know how this goes...Is it really going to be any good? clean? enjoyable?The answer is YES! (to all of those things!)Had a fabulous hour "deep tissue" massage... and will definitely go back for more!!Thanks so much Monica and Body Works!!

25.description: NEGATIVE STARS if I could. I also tried to book a massage using a you swoop and got the same run around as many others. If you cannot handle the customers, do not offer the discounts, else hire more masseuses.  Total ripoff. I complained to you swoop who did nothing. Oh well, there are plenty of other facilities in this city who are eager to serve you and accept your money. I have yet to set foot in this place and never will. Caveat Emptor!

12.description: Dr. Zaffarkhan is wonderful. He listens to you when you explain the issues you are having and does a great job adjusting you! I would recommend him to everyone.

21.description: I came here after my husband bought a Groupon for a 60 minute massage for me.  I got there a little early since I wasn't familiar with the neighborhood.  There was plenty street parking which was good.  I checked in and the guy at the desk was very friendly.  I was taken back for my massage and it was great.  I was so relaxed and comfortable.  It had been way too long since my last massage.  I would get another massage here.  They are reasonably priced and some insurance companies cover it so I am definitely checking with mine!

16.description: I came here after my husband bought a Groupon for a 60 minute massage for me.  I got there a little early since I wasn't familiar with the neighborhood.  There was plenty street parking which was good.  I checked in and the guy at the desk was very friendly.  I was taken back for my massage and it was great.  I was so relaxed and comfortable.  It had been way too long since my last massage.  I would get another massage here.  They are reasonably priced and some insurance companies cover it so I am definitely checking with mine!

17.description: Dr Z is the man! Ive been having chronic mid and lower back issues for years and his treatments have made a huge difference. Thanks Dr Z!!

10.description: Got a groupon for a massage as a gift and was excited to finally redeem it. I set up an appointment easily by using their online scheduler. I stated the times that I was available, and received an email with some choices from which I selected my appointment time. I showed up to my appointment on a Friday afternoon ready to relax and let the stress just melt away. Unfortunately, this did not happen. My massage therapist was very random in her movements, if that makes sense - she would massage my upper back, then walk around and do my shudders, then randomly do my arm, then a leg, then another arm. There was no flow to the order of the massage. She had a heating pad which she moved around at various times throughout the massage as well. At one point she put it on my butt for so long that I swear I was sweating in between my cheeks (TMI? sorryyyy). She also did to me what she did to some other customers where she abruptly lifted all of the covers off me and told me to turn over.The worst part to me was that she was so rough with my shoulders. I  understand that it has been awhile since my last massage but it actually felt like torture. I was sore in my shoulders for days afterward... opposite of relaxing. It also was not an hour, but I didn't even care because I just wanted to get out of there.I would have given just one star, but she did point out at the end that some insurances allow you to get massages on your plan. That was helpful, but not enough for me to want to come back.I cannot speak for the medical side of this practice, but there are other places where you can get an amazing massage other than here.

11.description: I have been going to Dr. Z for a few years now. He has always fixed the issues that I have had whenever they have popped up. He is very responsive over email and also accommodates patients even when they are past closing hours if it is a emergency. The facility is clean and modern and Dr. Z always had offered for me to call him if the adjustments were not effective which I must say has never happened.

26.description: This review is in response to Yousef Z. of Body Works Health & Wellness comments on my prior review:I did not previously review the massage service I received at Body Works because it was 3 stars - adequate, fine for a chiropractor's office and great for a $30 massage plus $20 tip (I utilized an online deal).However, my review specifically dealt with a customer service issue I encountered at Body Works, not the massage I received back in December.  This is a much more serious issue in my eyes as a lack of customer service and follow-through is a management issue. I found the following comment from Yousef Z., 'As you can see, the ONLY negative feedback on Body Works Health & Wellness has been from people purchasing these deals online', a bit ridiculous.  My bet would be that the majority of yelpers utilize online deals.  So, perhaps Body Works should not offer online deals if they cannot provide adequate customer service to the individuals who purchase these deals?All customers, whether they purchased an online deal or not, should at least be able to book an appointment (even if it would be weeks or months in advance if you are booked up), be called back when you are told you will be and get called back in a timely manner when you leave a voicemail.  We are all busy (but maybe not as busy as Body Works seems to be) so we all appreciate those common courtesies.This is all I am saying on the matter and my original review still stands.

27.description: My husband and I bought a Youswoop for a massage.  I called to make our appointments at the same time.  However, they only have one massage therapist and she's only in on certain days.  That was a bummer, but we worked it out.  I booked a Friday around the lunch hour back to back so as not to miss too much work (and there is a Starbucks around the block, which was helpful).  I have to say the massage was awesome.  We had just gotten back from a trip and my shoulders/upper back were super tight.  She really worked hard to relieve my muscles!  I will definitely be back again!

0.description: A lot of chiropractors tell you that you have to have multiple treatments on a continual basis.  I have an old injury in a disk in my lower back; about once a year for a few weeks my back acts up and gives me some pain/discomfort.  Dr. Z treats me until the symptoms subside, and was very honest of his assessment that continual treatment was probably not necessary.  Although periodic adjustments are good for you, I was not being sucked into 2 treatments a week for the rest of my life.  I appreciate the honesty, and for the past few years, when my back does start to act up, there is only 1 chiropractor I have called, Dr. Z.  And I will continue to support the business in the future!

20.description: I came to Body Works last December because I was having pain in my left hip when getting up from a sitting position and a friend recommended I see a chiropractor, something I had never considered.   During my first visit, Dr. Z asked a lot of questions, gave me a thorough exam, and recommended a treatment plan and schedule to which I agreed.  Over the past six months, my pain subsided, and for the past two months I've been completely pain-free.  I also have more energy and, in my opinion, more effective workouts.  This place made me a believer in chiropractic as a great complement to traditional medicine.  (I am relatively certain my primary care doc would not have been able to address my hip issue without expensive x-rays, which probably would have revealed nothing.)  Moreover, Dr. Z is a great professional and his practice makes treatment affordable.

19.description: I must have had the same massage therapist (if that is what you want to call her) as Sondra B. below minus the ice ball. I purchased two massages because the price was so cheap.  I figured, even if it is a bad massage, it is worth $39.00.  Boy was I wrong.   All around bad experience.  It was so bad, I was going to give the 2nd massage to a friend and wouldn't because it would be embarrassing.  I will just eat it.Scheduling:  Understandable that it was hard to schedule an appointment.  I know that happens when purchasing a Group On, but it really was hard to find a convenient time.  I scheduled it for 4:00 PM and all of a sudden the day before my massage I received a reminder email for 3:00 PM, not a big deal, right?  Well I was running about 10 minutes late.  I get there and said sorry I was late and the owner said," what do you mean, your appointment isn't until 4:00 PM".  So I sped through traffic for nothing, had to pay for an extra hour of parking, which I was still OK with at the time.  The Dr. was apologetic and I forgave him.Massage:I have had probably about 50 professional massages in my life and this is by far the worst one I have ever had.  -The girl talked through the first 15 minutes and kept putting down my previous massage therapist (who was incredible) because he didn't tell me to stretch with a foam roller.   OK she likes to talk but she wasn't really massaging me while she was talking.  She just lightly kept putting massage oil in the same 2 places around my shoulder blades, without any pressure.-  Then she placed a heater over my back for about 7-8 minutes and didn't massage me.  Every minute or so she would kind of lean on my back with one hand over the heater and my blanket.  I then kept feeling this tapping feeling on my lower back where I thought she was texting somebody with her other hand.  I cannot prove that and I think it could have been her controlling the heater but she was continuously tapping. Can't you just set the temp?  She did this 7-8 minute heater treatment with the one hand lean and text tapping 3 times throughout the massage.  I think it was just something to waste time.-So that is about 35 -40 minutes of dicking around (pardon the expression).  In between the dicking around she took about 10 minutes to actually massage my shoulders.  For that 10 minutes it felt really good. -She then grabbed my arm and rubbed it for about 15 seconds like a 4 yr. old and repeated on the other arm.  She then moved to the IT band and found the usual sensitive areas which I love having rubbed out. Only she didn't rub them, she just  pressed on three separate places down my leg for about 5 seconds each and then rubbed my calf for about 10 seconds again like a 4 yr. old and repeated on the other side.  Oh yeah, she applied oil to the bottom of both feet but didn't rub them.  LOL!!!!!  What was the point of that, did she just want to soil my socks?-We then did a torso stretch on each side followed by 5 minutes of neck pressure points and weak rubbing.  OK.She also lifted the blanket without telling me and asked me to flip over.  Just like Sondra B. in a previous review.  Very surprising.I couldn't believe it when Sondra mentioned the blanket placement.  I was actually tangled up in my blanket several times throughout the massage and she wouldn't fix it.  LOL.  I was like a fish in a net.I was just going to send an email to the Dr. but there are numerous reviews of him being rude so I just yelped.    Don't go hear.  It is not worth the Group On.

33.description: Just got a fantastic massage! I feel great, and all of my knots were worked out. The place is clean, nice, and very relaxing. Thanks body works!

2.description: Dr. Z is incredible! I was having pain in my lower back and toe, and he went out of his way to accommodate me since I was leaving out of town- on a Monday night after hours. Super gentle, and definitely thorough in listening to all of my ailments. I was surprised that they even have Sunday hours for massage! I've been to several chiropractors out of state, and he's definitely one to keep while I frequently visit Chicago. You are in for a treat and more.Thank you Dr. Z!

32.description: I bought a voucher on dealfind for a 60 minute Swedish or deep tissue massage. I arrived on time and the massage was good. However, my massage only lasted 45 minutes. Of course I didn't realize that until after I got up to get dressed. I spoke to the owner(or it seemed) and he passed me over to the therapist and when I informed her. She said it's because I'm thin so it doesn't take as long. Now I have had plenty of one-hour massages at various spas in the city and overseas and they all last the full 60-minutes. Secondly, upon registering I was asked to complete a form indicating areas of tension where I mentioned my upper back. So if in fact the full body massage took less time to complete because I'm petite, then why not spend more time on my upper back where the therapist said there was still a lot of tension? I was told that I need to inform her of that. Really, what's the point in my filling out the form, then, if they don't intend to spend more time on that area? Lastly, she justified the shorter length indicating the 60 minutes includes undressing/dressing! Seriously! Then why am I paying for a 60 minute massage, perhaps they should call it a 45-minute massage and discount it for skinny people. Needless to say the effects of the massage wore off due to lack of customer service and getting shortchanged by 15 minutes. I have one more certificate so next time I will be sure to inform them to spend excess time on my upper back and perhaps I will have a better experience to report.

18.description: This was by far one of the worst massage experiences of my life. I have received over 100 massages and never encountered a massage therapist whose bed side manner was this unprofessional. She reprimanded and belittled me for not stretching (as I went in with shoulder pain and neck pain), talked the whole time, used a sanitizer wipe after touching my foot (barely) and put a dripping ice ball all over my back without warning and kept it on after I told her I did not want it on. She also had terrible blanket skills as I had crease marks on my face and body from poor folding - when it was time to flip over she, without warning, quickly lifted the whole blanket off of me and told me sternly to flip over. Lastly an hour massage lasted far less than that around 40 minutes. I would definitely not recommend this place if you are looking for a nice relaxing professional massage experience. I can't speak for the Dr or the chiro side of things as I left as fast as I could after that disturbing massage experience.

13.description: Went there on a first time Chicago trip in Dec 2014 with a group on discount. I was a little late traveling on foot and public transportation but, the remaining hour was worth it. The masseuse was newly certified but, knew what he was doing. It's on my lists of to-do's next time I get the chance to go back, and get a full hour's massage with aroma therapy and hot stones.

4.description: I am writing an update because the owner emailed me asking to either take my original review down or write a new review since I returned again after I said I wouldn't. Since the owner went out of his way to email me requesting me to delete my original review, it makes me question every single review written on Yelp. I'm completely turned off that I was asked to delete my review on Yelp about Body Works.The only reason I went back to this place was because there were no other wellness places in this area or near my workplace that accepted medical insurance. I went for prenatal massages. I was desperate because my body was in much pain. After I walked out of this place the second time I had an appointment, I received many emails and phone calls asking me to return. I thought that was a little tacky to reach out to me so many times.Now that I have given birth to my son and I don't need anymore prenatal massages, I can honestly say this time I won't be going back to Body Works.

24.description: THIS PLACE IS TERRIBLE!!!! DO NOT GO HERE AND DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR MONEY!!!! THE SERVICE IS AWFUL AND MASSAGE WAS NOT GOOD. I was running FIVE minutes late to my appointment and I called ahead of time to let them know and make sure it would not be a problem. The MANAGER answered and said that it was not a problem. I got there, got started on my terrible massage and half way through the masseuse started ARGUING with me about how she was going to cut my 60 minute massage 20 minutes short because I was 5 minutes late. RIDICULOUS. I tried to explain to her that I called ahead of time to make sure and she proceeded to argue with me. I was furious, ended the massage and on my way out asked to speak with the manager who was TERRIBLY RUDE to me about the whole thing. I went here to have a relaxing massage but left with anger and fury. DO NOT GO!!!!! Even aside from my personal bad experience, the place is ugly in side, filled with fluorescent lighting and smells bad. This place deserves to be out of business.

6.description: I am 30 years old and have experienced back pain on and off ever since I was a teenager. I hadn't experienced any significant pain or discomfort for the last few years until, just last week, while walking down some stairs with a backpack on, I felt a surge of pain in my middle back that greatly limited my mobility for a few days. A friend told me of a positive experience she had had with Dr. Zafarkan, so I decided to make an appointment to have things checked out. Although the pain from the previous week had subsided almost entirely by the time I got around to making an appointment, once we met, Dr. Z was very intent on learning my history of back pain as a teenager and suggested that we take a series of x-rays to try and get at the root of my long term issues. Immediate x-ray results revealed a rather severe misalignment in my lower vertebrae that, although disconcerting, would have gone completely unchecked had Dr. Z not been so attentive to my medical history. He concluded the appointment with a realignment session and electric muscle stimulation to help deal with the recent tightness I'd been feeling in my mid back. Additionally, he offered some advice on things I could do to help prevent the degenerative activity in my lower back, while explaining to me the extent to which my health care would cover future visits. Overall, very positive experience. I felt safe and cared for in the hands of Dr. Z and will certainly be returning for future consultations and realignment sessions.

22.description: First, I normally don't take offense to the reviews of others as I wasn't involved or present at the time of their visit.  However, I must say that the misconception that Body Works Health and Wellness is some type of spa is a bit alarming.  If you're interested in receiving additional treatment from a  health care professional in addition to your primary care physician and other specialists then this place is absolutely perfect.I spoke to Dr. Z over the phone before my visit and explained some of the symptoms I battle on an ongoing basis.  I immediately began explaining some of the symptoms I was experiencing that one would imagine a chiropractor would be suited for (i.e. lower and upper back pain).  To my surprise, Dr. Z began asking about other ailments that impacted my everyday life.  I mentioned that I'm often fatigued and suffer from spontaneous migraines that often disrupt my otherwise healthy lifestyle.  Dr. Z explained that I could benefit from a thorough chiropractic exam as all of my symptoms could be an underlying issue that could be corrected over time.I came in for an appointment about a week after our initial phone call and was so impressed by the overall look and feel of the clinic.  I met Dr. Z in person who started out by thoroughly explaining his process of evaluating symptoms along with what he would specifically target with me based on our previous conversation.  Again, to my surprise, the initial chiropractic examination was far more than I imagined.   Various tools and x-rays were used to not only fix my pain points but to understand the overall root cause.  I've been continuously receiving treatment for over a month and I simply am amazed at the results.  Dr. Z's intuitive blend of treatment along with an active promotion of what constitutes as a healthy lifestyle has dramatically improved my life.  His overall knowledge and passion to help his patients is why I've taken the time to write this review.  If you're feeling some of the symptoms I had or feel like your body isn't performing at its optimal state then call/visit as soon as possible, you won't regret it.

15.description: I've been into see Dr. Yousef Zaffarkhan 3 times and each experience has been great.I do see the negative reviews on here but that is for the massage part of the clinic which I have not experienced.I was referred to Dr. Zaffarkhan through a colleague who was going to him at the time.  The appointment process was easy.  I did have to do some paperwork on my initial visit but that is customary everywhere.Dr. Zaffarkhan has been doing various adjustments to my lower back and each appointment has seen good results for me.  He does an excellent job of explaining the procedures he does and how they help you.  He's located in the west loop so it was down the road from where I live and if you drive there is plenty of street parking.If you are in need of excellent and affordable chiropractic care then make sure you visit Dr. Zaffarkhans clinic.

7.description: If you're black, PLEASE don't go to this place! The Indian working at this place appreciates it as well! I walk in and there was a black guy sitting at the front. The Indian comes to the front desk and tells the receptionist to go to the back while he manned the front desk. ( I guess having two blacks was one too many! He was short and clearly uncomfortable with darker skinned people! It's crazy how foreigners come to this country, adopting racist, narrow-minded views toward blacks!

8.description: Dr. Z is great. His methodology is spot on and he really helped me with pain management when I was living in Chicago. Since then I have moved, but whenever I am in Chicago I still pay him a visit as his great chiropratic treatment is hard to replicate and find elsewhere.

30.description: Nice place!

3.description: This is in response to a false review by Duane A.I'm very black and have been visiting Dr. Z for a few years now for ongoing problems with my back. I've always received professional and honest services from the entire staff and highly recommend them. There is absolutely nothing bad to say about this clinic and I'm sure the previous poster had some other agenda than needing a great chiropractor. Visit them and you will not be disappointed.

14.description: What a fantastic place to go for an adjustment or a massage. The facilities are extremely clean and new. The staff is extremely friendly and professional.  Dr. Z is a great chiropractor with an extensive knowledge of what ails me. He has helped me get rid of my lower back pain and really assisted with my herniated discs in my neck. Iliana is a great massage therapist, and is able to work out knots no other therapist has been able to before. I highly recommend this place for any body part that needs fixing.

58.description: This place is superb.  Food, atmosphere, service!  Although I am biased by already having a favorite Greek joint back home in Detroit - New Helles - this place is by far my favorite Greek outside Detroit!  We sat outside in their courtyard, which slightly resembled ol' Trapper's Alley - a long gone gem of Detroit's Greektown that was my favorite Detroit attraction!  Lastly, the service was unparalleled - my waiter and bussers were very attentive, and were even comfortable joking around - it felt like I was family :)

56.description: DON'T GO HERE IF YOU ACTUALLY WANT TO EAT. After getting seated by the host, we sat there for 25 (!#%^@) minutes being ignored by everyone except the busboys.It wasn't crowded, there were plenty of open tables and a herd of waiters apparently taking turns pretending we weren't there. We finally got up and left, and went down the street to Pegasus where we had a delightful meal, prompt service and a wonderful time. Skip this joint and head to Pegasus.

29.description: Meh....A disappointment...I don't know how the restaurant survives with all that great competition around it! Service was good, welcoming guy was rather grim and rude. The food was at best average. Rather tasteless, expensive and non-distinct. We had the grilled chicken souvlaki with roasted potatoes (really, nothing great) and a moussaka (not great). We also had saganaki (that was good) and taramasalata (average). There are much better Greek restaurants in the area.

42.description: The patio alone is enough to keep me coming back to this restaurant. Maybe the best patio I've experienced in Chicago. My husband and I went for an early dinner (6:30) without a reservation got seated promptly to enjoy an alfresco meal. The service was so friendly and attentive. Our meals were superb. We got a bottle of wine, the gyros plate and pork sausage for apps which were amazing and ended up being so much food. Entrees we got a braised lamb shank and lamb with artichokes. I requested that my rice and potatoes be subbed out with green beans and I was pleasantly surprised that they not only obliged but they put together a veggie mix complete with green beans, peas, onions, peppers and tomatoes. Absolutely amazing. The lamb was so unbelievably tender it just fell off the bone. The prices are so reasonable especially considering how much food you get!! And that patio. Yes please.

23.description: It was 75 with low humidity, and I let my friend talk me into coming here again. After all, it's still the best open air restaurant in Greektown.  It had been about four months since my last meal at Athena, and I had low expectations. I was pleasantly surprised to find the food had improved.  My village salad was fresh and interesting, and my grilled salmon was super fresh and cooked perfectly. But the service was the same old, same old. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful when we asked for suggestions, but after we got our entrees, he had been assigned tables on the opposite side of the large room.  So he was never around when we needed something, like another glass of wine.  Not sure why this restaurant can't get the service end right.  I'm giving it one more star for the vast improvement in food.

47.description: First time I went to there, I really enjoyed the atmosphere. The outside tables are awesome with great view, there food is great.So I decided to book a table for next weekend for my wife/s birthday we asked for the manager and the he promised us that they can seat us outside. I called the day of the reservation to make sure we have the table outside and I've been told by the manager that they can't sit us outside because it's beautiful day and they don't want to lose  money. I don't understand why we can't sit outside even though we had a reservation...We are so disappointed.Shame

8.description: I love Athena!!By far my fav Greek restaurant in greektown.The servers crack me up here.  Always cracking jokes.I love their new atrium area.  It's beautiful & all seasons!Gyro platter is where it's at!  The tzatziki sauce is yummy as well.  You'll only smell like garlic for the next two days.

31.description: This is the first time I came here and the service was horrible!!! Not only did we wait for more than 15 minutes to get a waiter, our waiter was not even apologetic about it. The person who served us was Yani. He had no smile on his face and did not even care to answer our questions about the menu, maybe was having a bad day?  We complained to the manager about him right away but it made no difference.   Then Mr. Yani was having a conversation on the side with two other servers and pointing at our table. After this kind of attitude no normal customer will sit in a restaurant so we asked for the check right after appetizers.   In all honesty the blame does not go much to our server, but rather the management itself.   The poor communication from the time we were seated and the time we even received service was the sole issue.  The manager should have taken a more of an initiative in the customer service we should have received once we addressed our concern to them. Totally dispointed!!! Never going there again.

34.description: Outdoor area was awesome and the apps are great. Full dinner portion was good but nothing great at all.

16.description: The patio alone is enough to keep me coming back to this restaurant. Maybe the best patio I've experienced in Chicago. My husband and I went for an early dinner (6:30) without a reservation got seated promptly to enjoy an alfresco meal. The service was so friendly and attentive. Our meals were superb. We got a bottle of wine, the gyros plate and pork sausage for apps which were amazing and ended up being so much food. Entrees we got a braised lamb shank and lamb with artichokes. I requested that my rice and potatoes be subbed out with green beans and I was pleasantly surprised that they not only obliged but they put together a veggie mix complete with green beans, peas, onions, peppers and tomatoes. Absolutely amazing. The lamb was so unbelievably tender it just fell off the bone. The prices are so reasonable especially considering how much food you get!! And that patio. Yes please.

13.description: I really enjoyed eating here. Nice and big with a beautiful atmosphere. The food was REAL Greek, tasted like when I went to Greece this last summer. The service is great and the food comes out hot and quick. It is probably my favorite Greek restaurant in Greek town. I will be coming back for sure!

11.description: After reviewing reviews on yelp I saw this place and photos and thought we would try it out.Looks like they just did a makeover, the decorations and ambience were very updated and very nice.FOOD: we started with the fried cheese, and it did not disappoint. The waiter came out and place the cheese on fire and it was quite a scene, in a good way.The gyro plate was a plenty. So much food!!! And the tZiki sauce was one of the best I've had.Dessert was great, we had a custard-like plate that was made w orange and cinnamon and flaky pastries on top.SERVICE: from the minute you walked in, you felt welcomed in the restaurant. The host was very friendly and the wait staff was extremely fun and friendly and you could tell that they enjoyed working there.

39.description: We had a wonderful dining experience at Athena Restaurant in Chicago's Greektown.  The food was excellent and plentiful.  The Saganaki was as good as it gets.  The Spanakopita and Moussaka are highly recommended.  What was a very pleasant surprise was the friendliness and engagement of staff with our party to make us feel extremely welcome and prt of the family.  Can't wait to go back!

37.description: Have you ever really really wanted to like a restaurant but after you leave you end up being really disappointed? That is how I felt with Athena. After seeing the amazing looking outdoor patio when passing by on Halsted I wanted to give it a try. To be fair the patio is very impressive. Open air on a beautiful night with an ivy covered wall and views of the buildings in Greektown is definitely an experience. Unfortunately that's the highlight.This could possibly be unique to my table but the service left a lot to be desired. We didn't order drinks for 15 minutes and once we ordered our maybe we weren't checked on the rest of the meal. My party agreed we would have ordered at least another round of drinks if we had the opportunity. At least there were authentic Greek beers available. They tasted similar to polish and other European beers that many Chicagoans might be familiar with. The food was standard Greek fare. Saganaki was a must, just a warning if you're eating outside it doesn't get flamed at your table to avoid embarrassing situations in which your hair might catch fire. The calamari was ok, here you get the large rings but no tentacles if that's your thing. My party agreed the best dish was the lamb loin chops that were on special. They gave three nice sized chops grilled well. Everything else seemed kind of blah. The combo plate was just stuffed with food. I don't think any of it was particularly great but it was a lot. My wife got the moussaka and it just seemed like there was a big tray of it in a warmer and a square just gets plopped onto the plate. The only thing I'd have to recommend is the saganaki. It was rich and lemony and amazing. Athena was a bit of a let down for me. You get a great atmosphere but really average food. If bringing someone here to show off the city and wanting a cool ambiance is important to you, this is your place though. Just don't expect to be blown away by the food.

0.description: We went here for Valentines! It was very good. Not exactly Authentic Greek but they do offer a good amount of choices and large wine selection. Water bottles on the tables. The staff were quick and kind to check the tables often. We were able to change our reservation time when short on time. I ordered the Lamb which was amazing, so much lamb!!! We also ordered fish and even had room for dessert which the Chocolate raspberry truffle is where it is at with two cappuccinos! As it is norm for a Greek Restaurant the music in the background is very Greek, it played the same throughout dinner which was a tad much after a while. Overall an okay place to eat to fill you up.

38.description: Food was fine.  Service was atrocious.  Took forever to get lunchtime service at each step - taking order, getting food, getting check, etc.However that was nothing compared to how they handled bringing us the wrong food.  We ordered 3 hot appetizers for lunch - $30ish for 2 people.  For 2 of them, the waiter brought us the entree size, even though we pointed at the appetizer location on the menu.  We didn't realize it until we saw the check.  When we pointed this out to him, initially he said he needed to charge us for the entree.  After talking to his manager he said he could give us the lower price, and then quickly scooped up our boxed up leftovers without a word.  It was really weird.  When he returned we asked why he took the food.  He said it was the portion we hadn't paid for, to which we asked how he knew what quantity was in the boxes and why would he simply throw out the food instead of letting us take it?  Again his manager weighed in and they retrieved the food from the kitchen (hopefully not the garbage can!).  Anyway, won't be returning.

51.description: Great ambiance and great food. Really like the large outdoor eating space and the waterfall.

27.description: Food here is just alright. I had the char grilled octopus and the seafood kebab. The best part of the kebab was the grilled shrimp. The salmon and swordfish were bland. I do love the open air seating that they have here though, which is awesome on a summer evening. I wish we were seated closer to the water fountain/waterfall though. Service was pretty good, until the end of our meal when our server disappeared. Maybe he went on break or they swapped servers on us, but we waited a while to pay.

32.description: We were there probably on their busiest day of the year. Greek Fest Sunday.They handled the crowds well and really delivered!Great wine listBoth breads were delicious Saganaki was greatPork chops were thick and amazingThe lamb was so tender!!We watched the street fair craziness from the outdoor seating with the waterfall and resort like seating.The server was busy but attentive.Nice work!Our new favorite Greek restaurant.

54.description: I'm a boring greek food eater.  I always get the lamb chop lollipop also known as the baby rack of lamb.  As I ordered it, I did feel a little guilty but it sure tasted great.  Yeah, I'm going to hell for at least a year.  It was perfectly cooked with a pink bloody center and seasoned to perfection.  My partner enjoyed the Horta salad which is an acquired taste.  I liked their signature saganaki cheese appetizer.  Their outdoor space was lovely for a summer Chicago night out.  It was the best in Greek town from what I can see.  Cheers to becoming a big greek, or just big.

48.description: When my friend and I visited Chicago recently we ended up staying in Greektown. Each day on our walk to downtown we passed Athena and admired the big, beautiful patio we could see through the window. Eventually we conceded that we must pay the restaurant a visit before the end of our trip.We made a reservation for Sunday night, and luckily so because the place was packed and we had to wait a little. Once we were seated our server was prompt in coming to introduce himself and bring water. We ended up ordering Greek wine wine upon his recommendation and dolmades to start. My friend then ordered the moussaka and I got the vegetarian moussaka. Everything was brought out very efficiently and was delicious. The moussaka itself was an extremely large portion and we each struggled to finish it.Overall the service was very solid and the restaurant seemed authentic with a majority of Greek staff. Having been to Santorini before I'd have to say that it really did give off a similar vibe. The white decor and patio brick wall with overgrown ivy and flowers really added to the ambiance.

44.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this restaraunt!!!! What do I love so much about it, you ask? Everything!!!! The food is delicious and has been kept at the same standard the last 4-5 years I have been coming here. The valet parking is a huge plus, knowing how hard it is to find parking in Greektown, The service is top of the line! Very warm people , who are happy to be there. Oh, and the patio is amazing! Rain or shine, it is open, although they close it down with an awesome glass structure, if necessary. Awesome place, would definitely recommend it, check it out and you will forever be hooked .

24.description: What a beautiful setting tainted by terrible service. It's so gorgeous in there, I would rent it for a private event under the condition that I bring my own staff. We had such impersonal service by an older gentleman, that he made us feel like we were a fly in his food. The regulars that said hi to the employees, he made feel welcome and checked on them often. The food was just average at best, but the moussaka was inedible. I took a single bite and left the rest. For over 25 minutes, my food just sat there and at no point did he give us refills or even asked how the food was. We had to get up to get the check because it was time to go and no attention was given to us for well over half an hour at a half empty restaurant. The manager simply brought the check and said thank you. The hostess seemed to have more sympathy for us but she had no power to fix the situation. Anyway, in a nutshell, come to sit in their outdoorsy area for a simple snack and enjoy the scenery. Go have the actual meal elsewhere.

7.description: Came here for dinner with a friend because I live in the area and absolutely love seeing their patio. I was very impressed with food and service so I am not sure why all the negative reviews.We came in on a busy Wednesday night but got lucky and were seated right away. The server came by fairly quickly and spoke to us about food and wine options. After looking through the large menu we decided on the combination plate and saganaki to share.The food came out in good timing and the saganaki was spot on. Then the combination plate came out and we were almost shocked at the amount of food, it was a huge portion for the 2 of us. I am usually not a fan of the grape leaf rolls but they were absolutely delicious! What impressed me the most I think is the rice. So simple yet so delicious. There was a perfect balance of spices and moisture added with the peas, I could have some right now! The lamb was cooked to perfection, and the lasagna hit the spot.Our server was very friendly, the patio is gorgeous, and the bathrooms were clean.I can really see this place becoming our go to - "there is nothing in the fridge lets go out" place :)

49.description: Came here for dinner with a friend because I live in the area and absolutely love seeing their patio. I was very impressed with food and service so I am not sure why all the negative reviews.We came in on a busy Wednesday night but got lucky and were seated right away. The server came by fairly quickly and spoke to us about food and wine options. After looking through the large menu we decided on the combination plate and saganaki to share.The food came out in good timing and the saganaki was spot on. Then the combination plate came out and we were almost shocked at the amount of food, it was a huge portion for the 2 of us. I am usually not a fan of the grape leaf rolls but they were absolutely delicious! What impressed me the most I think is the rice. So simple yet so delicious. There was a perfect balance of spices and moisture added with the peas, I could have some right now! The lamb was cooked to perfection, and the lasagna hit the spot.Our server was very friendly, the patio is gorgeous, and the bathrooms were clean.I can really see this place becoming our go to - "there is nothing in the fridge lets go out" place :)

40.description: The food was OK. That's all I can say. I got the platter to get a sample of different dishes. Everything was dumped on a plate. The tastes were mixed. The sauce from one food was leaking to another. I end up not know what I actually ate! And what each was supposed to taste like. The staff were super nice though and the dessert was good. These two made it a 3 instead of a 2 star!

53.description: One of my favorite patios In Chicago. The food is very authentic. We started with the patzaria (beets with potato garlic spread) and the roasted egg plant spread. Both were superb and came out quickly? The grilled pita served along with eggplant, was super fresh and warm. Entrees were as expected. The lamb was tasty and the whitefish was good. Service was quick until the restaurant filled up and we had an overlong wait for our check.

30.description: This is my fav Fish restaurant. Good sea bass, good okra as an appetizer,fresh salad,good Turkish coffee and baklava. Love it!

46.description: we stayed in greektown and passed this place a few times while walking around town and ended up coming for dinner. the atmosphere is awesome. great place for a date. however I found the food was overpriced for what it was. I got the shrimp athena and it was okay, but i felt i could make it myself. my boyfriend got the combination platter and the macaroni was great and so was the potato and the dish with the ground beef. However on his plate the rice seemed just like filler and the leg of lamb and beef dish wrapped in a leaf was just okay. They have a large wine selection but both of our glasses were nothing to write home about. All in all, service was fast but over $60 for dinner and a glass of wine for 2.

1.description: Service was very friendly and attentive.  His recommendation for a wine was spot on.  He even stopped us from finishing our appetizers to make sure we had room for dinner.  It was New Year's eve, but he didn't rush us.And the food was wonderful!

55.description: great service! It was such a great time to have lunch with mom here. This was my third visit to this restaurant~ another awesome experience!

9.description: Not quite as godly as the name would have you believe.Being a fancier of Mediterranean cuisine, I hold all Greek restaurants to a high standard and find myself rarely disappointed.  Athena, sadly, was the exception to this rule.First off, this isn't your grand-daddy's Greek joint.  It's tailored to a much younger, hipper crowd and the decor reflects that.  The dining area is wide open and adorned with modern lighting fixtures, so it should come as no surprise that Athena is the new kid on the block.  Even the drinks on their cocktail list had cool names like 'Poseidon Punch', 'Zeus White Lightning', 'Hermes Highball', etc.  Fortunately the menu items are in the more traditional vein, like lamb kabobs, Grecian chicken, and stuffed grape leaves.The saganaki was made with kefalograviera cheese and was flambéed tableside, although the obligatory "OPA!" was considerably subdued.  Sad Eric.  What followed was a cup of avgolemono (egg-lemon) soup that passed muster, and an odd pairing of skordalia with beet salad.  The loukaniko (Greek pork sausage with lemon) was almost inedible: being extremely coarse-ground made for a lumpy, unpleasant time that doesn't bear repeating.  Had leftovers, didn't eat em.  The pastitsio (Greek lasagna) was the highlight of the meal, and it was agreed to be very good.  I didn't bother with dessert, although at this point their 3* fate was pretty much sealed regardless of a little baklava.Bread = 3Circuses = 2.5I found the service to be pretty lacking.  Our guy Stavros was curt and not the least bit engaging.  To make matters worse, my companion and I noticed that our plates (and drinks) were getting repeatedly slammed down on the table, to the point where she even commented on it.  When 75% of our meal came out at once, the servers played a hectic game of musical plates, which made me a teensy bit anxious to see my half-eaten soup make its way from directly in front of me to the other side of the table, with my companion's item now (incorrectly) placed under my nose.Also--and this is more of an afterthought--Athena does away with the traditional complimentary bread/olive oil/cheese and opts for the simple bread+butter.  So that's kind of a let down, to be honest.I MIGHT visit again during a summer day when the shutters are open, but I was far from wowed on this visit.  To reiterate, it wasn't an awful experience, but with an abundance of terrific Greek places to choose from--literally right next door--I can't see myself recommending Athena.

26.description: Came back (9 years after my first visit...) recently for dinner, and had a great meal.  Started with the saganaki, which actually wasn't particularly great -- not enough of the alcohol burned off, oddly.  But shared a bowl of the excellent egg lemon soup and that made things better. ;)  I had one of the night's specials, a braised lamb dish that was different than their usual braised lamb dish, which another guest at the table ordered.  I think mine had lemon in it, and it wasn't a thick tomato sauce like my friend's dish.  I loved it.  He liked his, so that's a win-win. ;)  For my son, I ordered the appetizer Kotosouvlakia, chicken skewers, and it was a very generous portion of four big skewers cooked perfectly.  Awesome!  Another friend had the "Chicken Breast Lemonati" described in the menu as "Strips of chicken breast sautéed with vegetables in lemon sauce and served over rice".  None of us liked this one - the chicken was meh, and it was just a big mess of veggies and some strips of chicken.  Rice was buried in there.  Definitely wouldn't order this one again.Service wasn't particularly great, but overall it was a great meal and I would return.  Definitely more of an upscale experience compared to the neighboring Rodity's, but I think I give them the edge on the food overall.

25.description: Today Labor Day was my first time eating at Athena Restaurant and sadly will not return and I will tell you why..I will start with the pros, the place itself has an impressive layout, beautiful to be fair. The food was good but not good enough to justify the mediocre service. I had the stuffed chicken breast and the prep time was fine, the chicken was juicy and tender, flavor was good. My girlfriend can't say the same for her Mousaka, though unless you like 'mush'. She only had one bite and left it all.Our server was not very courteous, welcoming, or friendly.  No follow up asking us how our food was or even attempted to make eye contact despite seeing that we were done eating and just waiting for 20+ minutes for him. It was not a full house and he clearly had plenty if time to ask his other tables around us how everything was and even take them all soda refills.So,  while I don't like to be unfair and judge a place based on ONE server, I decided to get up and ask for a manager which in turn was also a waste of time, not a single apology or even an attempt to fix the situation. With that being said, I am extremely dissatisfied and will never return. What a waste of $38, I would have gotten better service at McDonalds. Only reason they don't get a 1 star review is because the setting and food earned them the one star.Don't waste your time or money at this place.

12.description: Six of us made 7:30pm reservations for Friday night. We promptly arrived but only to wait 40 minutes for our table. The host was apologetic whenever I asked how much longer it would take. To my frustration, he could not give an exact answer. First, he said our table will be ready once it is cleaned. But when I asked a second time, he stated there were four tables ahead of us. I was not pleased. The point in making a reservation is to skip a long wait. If they cannot handle the capacity, they should regulate the number of reservations to accept. We were eventually seated and we had no time to waste. For appetizers, we shared the saganaki and char-broiled octopus with lemon and olive oil. The octopus was light with a generous portion. Each piece was tender and succulent. The saganaki is the flaming cheese so do expect it to be a bit oily. It goes well with the complimentary bread or by itself. For us, one order was enough to go around. I think our waiter should have given us a heads up when it was brought out. Nobody in their right mind would want a flaming surprise within a few feet of their head full of hair. For entrees, we ordered six entrees: dolmades, mousakas, loukaniko, paidakia, vegetarian mousaka, and veggie kabob. The paidakia was the highlight of the meal. A plate came with five thin slabs of butterfly lamb chops. It was perfectly grilled with a heavy usage of Rosemary but it did not overpower the lamb's natural flavors. The meat was particularly tender and juicy. Along with the lamb chops were a side of rice and potatoes. The rest of the meal was average. The dolmades are rice and ground beef wrapped in grape vine leaves and drenched in an egg-lemon sauce. It comes with a side of green peas. If you are unfamiliar with the cuisine, the grape vine leaves are edible. We had the mousakas in two versions and their appearance is similar to lasagna. The ground beef mousaka came with eggplant, zucchini, potato, cheese, and bechamel sauce. The vegetarian version is the same but without the ground beef. Both came with a side of rice. The loukaniko is homemade Greek sausage served with a rice and potatoes. It has a slice spice and is great for sharing. The veggie kabob can be skipped. One plate came with two skewers of tomato, onion, eggplant, green pepper, and zucchini. The items were drenched in olive oil and flavors were extremely light.
