To end the meal, we shared three desserts. The baklava and galaktobouriko were delightful. The latter is a light vanilla flavored custard in honey dipped filo dough. Both were served in square pieces so it was rather easy to cut and divide among ourselves. The Greek yogurt was served with dried fruits and honey. It was highly recommended by our waiter but it fell short of our liking. The yogurt was very creamy and the fruits were exceptionally sour. For approximately $30 per person, we had more than enough food and we brought four boxes of leftovers home. It is a good deal for that price and the grilled lamb chops deserve a return. But I do not see us returning in the near future. We would not mind taking our exploratory cravings elsewhere with better management.

But I do not see us returning in the near future. We would not mind taking our exploratory cravings elsewhere with better management.

21.description: Dined there on a Saturday night. Seated quickly, ordered and the food arrived in about 5 minutes! I ordered the gyros plate, and discovered that the meat was not hot but warm to cool and so was cold before I finished it.

17.description: My husband and I went here last week after a Chicago Bulls game. Located pretty conveniently near the United Center, and we were very glad that they stay open till midnight for a dinner after such games. Service was friendly, and the valet parking was good.  It was pretty quiet inside at that time of the night. Our wait staff was attentive without being pesky. They pour generous glasses of wine. My husband quite liked his Greek beer. The complimentary sesame seed bread was great. Their Bean soup was very good, quite an unusual tasting broth. Then I had the veggie spinach moussaka, and my husband had the lean cuts of lamb, which he really liked. He said it was unusual to find such lamb without all the usual fatty flesh around it. Portions are bit on the bigger size. We finished with a creme caramel which was lovely. Will definitely visit here again, and would recommend it to friends.

10.description: We had dinner here at Athena Restaurant with a friend and had a very tasty meal.Décor: First off, this is a BIG place! They have tables everywhere! We sat in the "atrium/patio" area (the roof was closed) and it was very nice. The rest of the place is all restaurant and there is even a small bar just inside the front door. It wasn't too loud while we were there, just enjoyable with others having quiet/average dinners.Bathroom: It is nice and yet just a typical bathroom, nothing special but it is clean and well litStaff: Our waiter was very nice, he even gave a great wine recommendation, and our food was prepared and delivered rather rapidly.Drinks/Food: We started out with beers and wine and moved to a couple hot apps. We had: Kalamari (very tasty with delicious sauce) and Saganaki (opa! So delicious!). For dinner we had: Mousakas (very good), Braised Lamb (tasty) and Gyros (of course... they were very good). Everything came to the table together and was nice and hot - like I've already said, we toughly enjoyed everything.Value: This is a nicer place but the prices are not out of the range you'd expect.All in all, we had a very enjoyable meal and this is a place where we would return to in the future.

5.description: Couple friends and I had stopped into Athena for a relaxing evening. Plus we were looking for a central location for all of us with an outdoor patio.I was greeted by the hostess and since my friends had not arrived, she asked me to let her know when they have arrived.  I was able to find a seat at the bar and had a glass of the house Pinot Grigio.  It wasn't to bad.  Once everyone had arrived, we were seated on the patio.We were greeted shortly after being seated.  We were fine with drinks so the server had went over the menu and the specials.  After a few minutes of reviewing the menu, we were ready.For an appetizer, we had ordered the Saganaki, Feta Zesti and Hummus. For the main entree, I had ordered the Pork Chop which was highly recommended by one of my friends.  Sorry, I don't remember what my friends had ordered.  The appetizers were delivered within a few minutes then shortly after that, the main entrees were delivered.  All of the food and service were fantastic.  We had opted to skip dessert.  The service went MIA after dropping of the check but luckily we were not really in a rush.Looking forward to go back to this fine restaurant.

3.description: Happened upon this place in a business trip to Chicago and we were quite delighted!! Although it's not completely authentic Greek food, everything we had was absolutely delicious. I loved being here for lunch because The dining room is all windows and created a lovely atmosphere. Our waiter was charming and made some wonderful recommendations for us!

35.description: Great service at the bar. Saganaki great. Feta cheese spread good. Pork chops awfully dry and overcooked. After I told the waiter that, he never came back to our table and had to hunt him down for the check. Guess he was mad I didn't like the pork chops? Won't be back but very cute outdoor area to say the least.

19.description: Have you ever really really wanted to like a restaurant but after you leave you end up being really disappointed? That is how I felt with Athena. After seeing the amazing looking outdoor patio when passing by on Halsted I wanted to give it a try. To be fair the patio is very impressive. Open air on a beautiful night with an ivy covered wall and views of the buildings in Greektown is definitely an experience. Unfortunately that's the highlight.This could possibly be unique to my table but the service left a lot to be desired. We didn't order drinks for 15 minutes and once we ordered our maybe we weren't checked on the rest of the meal. My party agreed we would have ordered at least another round of drinks if we had the opportunity. At least there were authentic Greek beers available. They tasted similar to polish and other European beers that many Chicagoans might be familiar with. The food was standard Greek fare. Saganaki was a must, just a warning if you're eating outside it doesn't get flamed at your table to avoid embarrassing situations in which your hair might catch fire. The calamari was ok, here you get the large rings but no tentacles if that's your thing. My party agreed the best dish was the lamb loin chops that were on special. They gave three nice sized chops grilled well. Everything else seemed kind of blah. The combo plate was just stuffed with food. I don't think any of it was particularly great but it was a lot. My wife got the moussaka and it just seemed like there was a big tray of it in a warmer and a square just gets plopped onto the plate. The only thing I'd have to recommend is the saganaki. It was rich and lemony and amazing. Athena was a bit of a let down for me. You get a great atmosphere but really average food. If bringing someone here to show off the city and wanting a cool ambiance is important to you, this is your place though. Just don't expect to be blown away by the food.

28.description: Just love Athena. The best Greek in the city. From the bread service to the baklava it's all fantastic. Get the saganaki (fire cheese). The experience will be memorable. Valet is free...in Chicago?! Eat outside, if you can.

45.description: Athena has the most beautiful patio of any restaurant in Greek Town by far. The food was very good as well. The kalamata olives were amazing. Order a bunch of stuff to share, definitely the way to go.

33.description: It is a shame that the men at the front desk ruin the experience for customers the minute you ask for a table. Maybe its because were female. I don't but its enough to ruin your dinner and the atmosphere. The atrium is one of a kind and awesome and the food is definitely good. But the way they treat people men or women is truly shameful.

43.description: The flaming cheese was visually exciting and delicious. I loved the tall witty bus boy, he was hilarious and quick to be of service- very professional. Great service from the waiter Danny. I ordered the chicken kebab and it was exactly what I needed!

2.description: I'm not the type to put a negative review but this was the worst Greek food I've ever had. Nowhere near authentic. I think if there is a good review on here,  (not to offend anyone) it's because you have no clue of what Greek food or anything other than Greek is supposed to taste like. Place is nice but food quality is horrible. I went to a different restaurant right after leaving this place. I'm 100% sure it came out of the microwave since it took 3 minutes to make right after we ordered and wasnt even warm. Such a disappointment. I wouldn't consider this if I was starving to death.

18.description: Food here is just alright. I had the char grilled octopus and the seafood kebab. The best part of the kebab was the grilled shrimp. The salmon and swordfish were bland. I do love the open air seating that they have here though, which is awesome on a summer evening. I wish we were seated closer to the water fountain/waterfall though. Service was pretty good, until the end of our meal when our server disappeared. Maybe he went on break or they swapped servers on us, but we waited a while to pay.

41.description: To be fair, I'm not a fan of greek food so I wasn't really sure what to expect going into this but the rest of my party wanted to try it so I gave it a shot.  The dining room is really cool because the roof opens up to allow outside dining feel and they also have a huge patio on the back which is where we sat.  The waiter was very helpful.  I kept it simple and went with a piece of grilled chicken.  It was a little spicy for my taste but I think I would have asked for less pepper.  My meal also came with rice and some type of potato which I would have done without.  The rest of the members in my party ordered the steak kabobs and they were excellent,  the steak was seasoned with something which made them out of this world.  I probably should have gotten that.  The environment was very cool and seemed like a lot of locals go there because the waiters seemed to have really great interactions with some people.  We did not order any drinks or desert so I cannot comment on that but for someone who isn't really a fan of greek food,  I was happy with my meal.

52.description: One of the mega restaurants in Greek Town that handles tourists with huge portions, quick service and good (not great) food.  I went here with family because it was near their hotel.  I've had better Greek food in the city but still glad we tried this joint since it is pretty well known.  The outdoor patio area is amazing.  The Greek Combo was hit or miss but I did really like the dolmades.  If I come back I will order that.  The saganaki was the best part of the meal.  They don't bring pita bread unless you order an appetizer with it and what they brought was minimal and slightly burned on the bottom.  Their regular bread that they bring looks like some pepperidge farm bread - nothing special.  The Greek salad was good but unfortunately after two bites they brought the dinner.  Zero spacing with courses.  Felt like they want you out as quickly as possible to turn the table over.  Beer list was also lacking.  It had just one Greek beer on it and almost everything else were domestic macro brews like Miller Lite.  This is Chicago, there are ton of great local craft beers.  I understand importing Greek beer might be expensive but that was annoying.

50.description: Octopus & leg of lamb was great! Love the patio! Bartender "Emilia" Shitty attitude and I would not come back based on her customer service.

4.description: Went here for my friend's birthday dinner. It is a very lovely looking place and atmosphere, and the prices are actually very fair for what you get. However, the Athenian Chicken (which was SO hyped up) wasn't as great as I thought it would be. The chicken was still very good, and the food as well, but it just didn't meet the expectations that I had for it. Everyone has raved about it, and I thought that it would be more revolutionary and outstanding than it was. Still good, just not life changing!

6.description: When my friend and I visited Chicago recently we ended up staying in Greektown. Each day on our walk to downtown we passed Athena and admired the big, beautiful patio we could see through the window. Eventually we conceded that we must pay the restaurant a visit before the end of our trip.We made a reservation for Sunday night, and luckily so because the place was packed and we had to wait a little. Once we were seated our server was prompt in coming to introduce himself and bring water. We ended up ordering Greek wine wine upon his recommendation and dolmades to start. My friend then ordered the moussaka and I got the vegetarian moussaka. Everything was brought out very efficiently and was delicious. The moussaka itself was an extremely large portion and we each struggled to finish it.Overall the service was very solid and the restaurant seemed authentic with a majority of Greek staff. Having been to Santorini before I'd have to say that it really did give off a similar vibe. The white decor and patio brick wall with overgrown ivy and flowers really added to the ambiance.

22.description: Couple friends and I had stopped into Athena for a relaxing evening. Plus we were looking for a central location for all of us with an outdoor patio.I was greeted by the hostess and since my friends had not arrived, she asked me to let her know when they have arrived.  I was able to find a seat at the bar and had a glass of the house Pinot Grigio.  It wasn't to bad.  Once everyone had arrived, we were seated on the patio.We were greeted shortly after being seated.  We were fine with drinks so the server had went over the menu and the specials.  After a few minutes of reviewing the menu, we were ready.For an appetizer, we had ordered the Saganaki, Feta Zesti and Hummus. For the main entree, I had ordered the Pork Chop which was highly recommended by one of my friends.  Sorry, I don't remember what my friends had ordered.  The appetizers were delivered within a few minutes then shortly after that, the main entrees were delivered.  All of the food and service were fantastic.  We had opted to skip dessert.  The service went MIA after dropping of the check but luckily we were not really in a rush.Looking forward to go back to this fine restaurant.

15.description: When the sun finally shines and the weather hits 70, the best place to enjoy dinner is outside. And when you're craving greek food and also want to dine al fresco- go no where else but Athena. We headed here last night and enjoyed another amazing dinner.Located in the heart of Greektown, Athena boast the largest and most beautiful outdoor dining area, complete with a gorgeous fountain. A retractable ceiling allows for dining in this part of the restaurant even if an the weather doesn't want to cooperate.For dinner we had the grilled octopus app, swordfish kebobs, roasted lamb, and a side of the greek vegetables. All delicious. Server recommended a great red wine, I believe it was called St. George. And for dessert, you can't beat their baklava. It's one of my favorite desserts and theirs is one of the best I've ever had.

57.description: Food was awesome, we ordered appetizers they were good. Yougurt with cherries was the best part of it.

20.description: Excellent excellent excellent!!!! The best Greek food we have ever tried.  A must come back over and over and over!!!  The feta salt fried cheese. Oh la la!!!  The Baclava is to die for. The Gyro (jeero) is excellent!  Everything. A great experience before going to see The Marriage Of Figaro opera! Opa!!!!!

36.description: We loved the indoor courtyard. A beautiful place to dine al fresco. All the food was excellent. We especially like the fried zucchini, bacalao, and arni fourno.

14.description: Alright so i am Greek. No honestly a real Greek raised and born in Athens and i hate going to Greek restaurants abroad simply because most of the times they offer food thats not even greek or reminds you of something Greek. Well not this timeSince this is my first time in Chicago my friends asked me to check out this restaurant to see how Greek is their food. I can tell you that its as Greek as it gets. Most of the dishes taste exactly as the ones you would have in a greek restaurant in Greece. Very good ingredients and a hige variety to choose from.Topping that is their wine list which surprised me with the variety of Greek wines they had. Keep in mid that Greece produces very good wine but in small batches which makes it very difficult to get wines outside the county. Add the amazing patio and the good service and there you have it

58.description: I want to preface this review by saying it is based on my first and only experience. I know several people who love this place, and have had both great food and service. Unfortunately, I did not! I ordered the Goat Cheese Wrap with grilled tofu instead of chicken. The first mistake they made was giving me chicken in my wrap. They took it back, but the second mistake they made was giving me a wrap with tofu, BUT WITHOUT GOAT CHEESE! Mind you the name of my dish was "goat cheese wrap." LOL. I don't plan to try this place again because it left a bad taste in my mouth. I will say that the juice I ordered (Jump Start Metabolism) was refreshing. That being said...a huge disappointment!

56.description: Soooo good!! We had the brioche french toast and the farmland bowl.... both were amazingly good!!!

29.description: I love this place!  I was here twice in the last couple of weeks... First time, I had the breakfast quesadilla with potatoes.  It was so good!  Love the flavors.... Such a big portion I had enough to take home for another meal.  (Admittedly I had to stop myself from eating!).   My husband had the Elvis (i think is the name) - basically an explosion of peanut butter french toast.  HEAVEN!!!  We both loved it!    I almost forgot they do have fresh squeezed juice so I ordered orange..it was very good but room temp which was a little meh.  Today we went back and I was tempted to have a repeat of one of our dishes from last week... but had to branch out - the rest of the menu looked so good.     He had a frittata which he liked (I didn't try it this time) and I went with lunch... The sound of a goat cheese and chicken wrap drew me in...I love goat cheese..   It was a great choice - LOVED it. Again - really large portion - which helps because its not exactly a 'cheap' meal.  I'd definitely order that again as well.    Fries were hand cut which i love-  wish they were a little more crispy.   Good service both times.

42.description: Fabulous brunch spot! Excellent service.  Food was fantastic. I had the chicken chorizo omelette. Coffee was superb. Highly recommend this spot.

23.description: Pretty good cafe and nice brunch. I particularly like the banana maple crunch. People are nice too.

47.description: Delicious vegan and non-vegan breakfasts (vegan pancakes, brioche french toast, crab omelette, and chorizo bowl all received thumbs up). Service is efficient and decor is cute.  Long waits, but to be expected on the weekend.  Would certainly come back if in the area (we were after mass at Old St. Pat's).

8.description: Had a really nice brunch here after landing from O'hare.Ordered the Hash Benedict, french toast and baked oatmeal.All were delicious.Hash Benedict was cooked perfect and the egg was spot. The potatoes that came with it were decent.French toast was just right. A little hint of cinnamon and not overly sweet. Didn't need any syrup for it. Baked oatmeal was a surprise. It was kind of like a creme brulee crust on top. It had a lot of raisins and bananas which I dislike, but it was still pretty food.Interior was nice, very welcoming. Service was great. Good spot to go!

31.description: Meli Cafe is our go to breakfast place. I always order their Chicken Flamego! Highly recommended if you are up for a little spice.

34.description: Food is amazing, service is great. A little pricy for a brunch spot. Try the corn beef hash, it's well seasoned. Overall, it gets 5 stars for me!

16.description: Very great breakfast place. They don't take reservations and if you go there on a peak time you have to be prepared to wait, there isn't much waiting space inside so you can be stuck in bad weather outside. It is worth the wait however.This is my second time here and both times the food was excellent. First of all and this is important to me, they keep the coffee flowing which I appreciate. This time I ordered a salsa crepe. I rarely order crepes for breakfast because too many places only have sweet crepes but this has savory and I went with the mexican themed. It had a chicken chorizo which was different but very good. There was also avocado and tomoto and it was very well cooked.The server was friendly and efficient.The only reason it wasn't five stars was because the inside was rather small and kind of crowded. However if it wasn't the wait would have been over an hour. I will come back but may try some of their other locations.

13.description: Overall: Great breakfast/brunch/lunch option with casual prices and atmosphere.The good: The food is delicious and plentiful. You will definitely not leave hungry. It's also pretty affordable. Plenty of options to choose from. Overall the service is friendly and the atmosphere is clean.The bad: The check took a long time to get taken care of. The food also took longer than expected. Very limited seating.Atmosphere: 8/10Service: 8/10Food: 8/10

11.description: Fist time dining in here it was a Sunday great first impression. Very friendly atmosphere and great food. This place was pretty packed when we arrive there was an estimated 25 minute wait we ended up being seated within like 10 minutes. The menus weren't too complicated. They offer a kids menu and specials along with the regular menu. Unfortunately they don't have many food options that include pancakes. Our waitress was really nice she recommended a few choices. I ordered the breakfast sampler which includes 2 pancakes eggs bacon and hash browns. The eggs were scrambled soft the way I like them. The bacon was crispy and the hash browns were flavorful. The only reason why I'm giving this restaurant 4/5 stars and not the whole 5 is because the pancakes were not to my liking. I recommend this place and I will be a returning customer.

39.description: Had a really nice brunch here after landing from O'hare.Ordered the Hash Benedict, french toast and baked oatmeal.All were delicious.Hash Benedict was cooked perfect and the egg was spot. The potatoes that came with it were decent.French toast was just right. A little hint of cinnamon and not overly sweet. Didn't need any syrup for it. Baked oatmeal was a surprise. It was kind of like a creme brulee crust on top. It had a lot of raisins and bananas which I dislike, but it was still pretty food.Interior was nice, very welcoming. Service was great. Good spot to go!

37.description: The boyfriend and I are huge brunch people. We could eat brunch all day every day. That being said, Meli's has some great brunch. It usually is a big of a wait, as the cafe itself is pretty small, but they'll send you to the bar next door while you wait so at least you can sit down, order some drinks, and watch some TV while you wait, which is nice. Service is usually pretty pleasant, albeit a little rushed, but it's to be expected, especially since they're so busy on the weekends. I usually get the french toast while my boyfriend usually gets some sort of omelet, which he switches up. Overall, we would come back to Meli's if we were in the UIC/Greektown area. Parking is a bit of a pain so you may have to circle around a couple of times before you get a spot.

0.description: I found the wait staff to be just what I wanted. No non-sense and straight to the point with respect and timeliness. I had the farm house skillet and it was soooo good. It's enough for two people, so come with an appetite Best Greek breakfast in GREEK TOWN

38.description: The service was good, we were waited on by 3 different people though. We were sat quickly and our food was delivered fast. I ordered the Elvis French toast. It was more of a dessert but still good. It has bacon on it which made the flavor odd. My boyfriend had an omelet and said it was nothing out of the ordinary. It's located in a nice area and perfect for a nice brunch date.

51.description: Phenom breakfasts and juices, I thought I would like this place, but ended up liking way more than I anticipated. I have been here many times and never gotten a dish I didn't like. Service is outstanding, can be a bit crowded at times, but that's to be expected with the neighborhood and product.

27.description: Meli Cafe is a fan favorite all around. It a no nonsense diner that truly has a place in my heart. Time after time, Meli serves up an absolutely divine breakfast....such as the one I had last Saturday!Walking into Meli your eyes are immediately drawn to the plates of those around you...the hard part is deciding which plate looks the best! Oh there are specials, egg dishes, omlettes, skillets, eye openers, breakfast tacos, an entire juice menu, pancakes, French toast...and I haven't even included the lunch...need I say more? Last week I went with the oh-so-hearty breakfast tacos served with chicken chorizo, avocado, cheese, pico, and even secret sauce. It was such a magical moment when my waitress graced me with my solid b-fast choice. My dining partners and I also couldn't resist the pancake section so we chose the maple pecan pancakes. WHOA....warm pecans and bananas folded right into the pancakes all topped with whipped cream and maple butter. Needless to say the rest of the day was pretty useless after devouring these two insane dishes. The service is fast, friendly, and muy professional. They pair creative dishes with classic takes on your breakfast and lunch favs. I've never had a bad meal at Meli. If you come on a weekend, you may have to wait a couple minutes to be seated..but trust me, it's always worth it;)

32.description: Coffee and brunch. Got some corn beef hash and a tasty spinach omelet. They give you a lot for the amount they charge. Great place for brunch.

54.description: I am very picky when it comes to my breakfast so when my husband and I went here I was a little skeptical. I tried the veggie omelette with the baby reds well done and I was shocked. Absolutely everything on my plate was fresh and delicious. The omelette was huge, the veggies weren't soggy and the baby reds were perfectly seasoned. I now go here every Saturday morning for my breakfast fix. Hubby always orders something new and let's me try. I haven't been disappointed yet. Highly recommend!

48.description: I have been here before a long time ago. I remembered i had a bad service last time but desided to give it another chance.The service was very pleasant this time. They accommodated us right away even though we had to wait about 15min for the rest of the guest to arrive.  So we where able to start drinking coffee. The coffee here is so good! If you are a crape kind of person this is a place you have to come to.  The crapes are amazingly delicious! I had the Cloud 9.  Everyone else loved what they order. I will definitely come here again and recommend it to my friends.

44.description: The eggs Benedict were not as good as I had hoped - the yolk wasn't runny enough for my taste but still very delicious. The potatoes on the side are the bomb though. Very cute place and open only for brunch

24.description: I tried eating here once. It was crowded. They had a wait time and I was okay with waiting. I actually never got to eat. They kept serving people who had gotten there after me, my mom and my sister. We left after about 15 minutes. It was too bad. The menu looked good. Maybe one day I'll go back and try the food.

7.description: Meli Cafe is a fan favorite all around. It a no nonsense diner that truly has a place in my heart. Time after time, Meli serves up an absolutely divine breakfast....such as the one I had last Saturday!Walking into Meli your eyes are immediately drawn to the plates of those around you...the hard part is deciding which plate looks the best! Oh there are specials, egg dishes, omlettes, skillets, eye openers, breakfast tacos, an entire juice menu, pancakes, French toast...and I haven't even included the lunch...need I say more? Last week I went with the oh-so-hearty breakfast tacos served with chicken chorizo, avocado, cheese, pico, and even secret sauce. It was such a magical moment when my waitress graced me with my solid b-fast choice. My dining partners and I also couldn't resist the pancake section so we chose the maple pecan pancakes. WHOA....warm pecans and bananas folded right into the pancakes all topped with whipped cream and maple butter. Needless to say the rest of the day was pretty useless after devouring these two insane dishes. The service is fast, friendly, and muy professional. They pair creative dishes with classic takes on your breakfast and lunch favs. I've never had a bad meal at Meli. If you come on a weekend, you may have to wait a couple minutes to be seated..but trust me, it's always worth it;)

49.description: The jalapeño bowl was amazing! Good service and atmosphere as well. The portions are very large so I always share but they are a bit pricey.

40.description: One of my favorite breakfast spots in town.  Actually, it's the best healthy breakfast in town. They have a great selection of juices and smoothies. My favorite item on the menu is the polenta pancakes. And I love the decor and the service is always courteous and attentive.

53.description: The breakfast is very good and the service is very attentive. They also have a good delivery service but the wait is sometimes lengthy. Their potatoes are phenomenal!

30.description: Went on a Saturday morning for brunch and couldn't believe how fast we got our food.  Prices are on the higher side ($13-$17 per entree) but portions are huge to compensate.  Would recommend getting something to share with sides to prevent major left overs.  Ambience is a casual, very diner-like scene.  Got one of their juices, which comes at room temperature, so just be prepared.

46.description: Soo good ! This breakfast place had been on my list for a while, and I was so excited to come here for the first time this summer. I got here around 9am on a Saturday, and it didn't really get crowded until around 10. The menu was overwhelming, but I ended up getting one of their specials of the day.  This special was the croissant french toast with fruit and almonds on top. This french toast dish was amazing! The dish was so rich, and even though it came with syrup on the side, it was not needed at all because of how moist it was.. The scrambled eggs with cheddar cheese I had on the side were memorable.  I don't know what they put in their eggs, but they were so fluffy, buttery and flavorful. I literally could go to Meli again and just have a plate of 2 eggs and be totally content. I can't wait to visit this place again for another delicious meal.

1.description: I kept passing by Meli's from my apartment to UIC, but I never stopped to check it out until recently...big mistake! Meli's is such a cute brunch place, especially in the summer; they leave the big windows open and you can have a nice meal with a gentle breeze. The big game-changer of this place is that they have a special section on their menu that is vegan AND Gluten-free!!! At last my dietary restrictions are acknowledged!!!!I had the Vegan french toast that was absolutely delicious. There were 2 pieces, and they were topped with fresh berries, with a little bowl of agave on the side. They also have vegan pancakes, tofu scrambles, and vegan sliders to curb all your craves. And for the regular dieters, it's a big hit too!

55.description: I found this place walking through Greek town, it's so cute and a delicious spot for breakfast and/or lunch. I had the pesto Benedict and it was delicious. The pesto was so fresh! Also, I tried the rejuvenator juice which was also great, all their juices are juiced to order so they are super fresh. This place does everything from scratch, even the ketchup on the tables. Everything from scratch deserves 5 stars in my book! I'll definitely be coming back.

9.description: I have been here before a long time ago. I remembered i had a bad service last time but desided to give it another chance.The service was very pleasant this time. They accommodated us right away even though we had to wait about 15min for the rest of the guest to arrive.  So we where able to start drinking coffee. The coffee here is so good! If you are a crape kind of person this is a place you have to come to.  The crapes are amazingly delicious! I had the Cloud 9.  Everyone else loved what they order. I will definitely come here again and recommend it to my friends.

26.description: Great vegan and gluten free French toast!!! I have a dairy, egg and gluten allergy and it was so nice to be able to eat something out for breakfast and it tasted GREAT!!!!

25.description: Meli in Greektown is a neighborhood favorite! Their brunch menu offers hearty traditional dishes such as corn beef & hash or my favorite: steak and eggs! The juices are exquisite too, freshly squeezed in house and they have a huge variety!Service is super friendly, but if you plan on dining in be prepared to wait 20-30 minutes minimum. The proximity to the other diners enjoying their delicious meals is a bit closer than you'll find in other restaurants; not objectionably so, but thought it is worth noting.

12.description: Solid neighborhood brunch spot. Expect a packed house if you come on the weekend. The juice/smoothie options were all great and made our breakfast feel healthier. Food portions are large and definitively shareable. I still prefer Wildberry Cafe overall but this is a good alternative if you're in West Loop or don't want to wait 2 hours for brunch. Limited parking in the area, but there are meters available ($4/hr eek).

59.description: This has got to be one of the best breakfast joints in town. It's located in Greek town alongside all the Greek restaurants. I obviously came here because of the reviews, and it did not disappoint. I had the cornbeef hash egg benedict and I'm seriously craving more. It was that gooddddddd. Like melt in your mouth good. The soft cornbeef hash, the warm yolk on top, the soaked English muffin on the bottom all in one bite....mmmm so so good. I also had the metabolism jump start juice blend, it had carrots, apple, ginger and I forgot what else but it definitely awakened my senses. I don't know about parking which is always a problem in Chicago but I highly recommend this place!!!

21.description: I found the wait staff to be just what I wanted. No non-sense and straight to the point with respect and timeliness. I had the farm house skillet and it was soooo good. It's enough for two people, so come with an appetite Best Greek breakfast in GREEK TOWN

17.description: Soo good ! This breakfast place had been on my list for a while, and I was so excited to come here for the first time this summer. I got here around 9am on a Saturday, and it didn't really get crowded until around 10. The menu was overwhelming, but I ended up getting one of their specials of the day.  This special was the croissant french toast with fruit and almonds on top. This french toast dish was amazing! The dish was so rich, and even though it came with syrup on the side, it was not needed at all because of how moist it was.. The scrambled eggs with cheddar cheese I had on the side were memorable.  I don't know what they put in their eggs, but they were so fluffy, buttery and flavorful. I literally could go to Meli again and just have a plate of 2 eggs and be totally content. I can't wait to visit this place again for another delicious meal.

10.description: Typically they say people only write yelps if they have had a bad experience in a place. ThAts not true for me. Only reason why im sharing my experience here because the experience will always be remembered. This was my 2nd time there, hence my reasoning to going back because i enjoyed it the 1st time. im going to tell u a play by play. i may b right in some peoples eyes and i might b wrong, but all in all Im still sharing. I ordered my food and my bf ordered his. he get his crepes and its this long ass blk hair strain in-between his crepes and just stickin out.  so i got the waiter bc thats just nasty tbh. The waitress comes bac and was like omg im sorry and asked if he wanted the same thing. he said sure. so he gets his meal and im ahead of him in eatin. so we r all done and the bill comes. the waitress looked nervous in placin it on the table and walked away. wen bill is opened they still charged us full price. im like oh huuh, only becuse i use to be a waitress and i understand (hairs may slip off scalps, accidents DO happen, i get it, but something of this nature u want to make sure ur customer RETURNS. Im like wheres the manager? he comes and i inquired about gettin something compensated off on our bill, he made it seem like he didnt hear me. I reminded him there was HAIR spotted in plate which is unacceptable and the manager was like but we made it over. im like annnd , we still had to wait and the overall experience of hair in plate is not cool. he was like i can give u 10% off. imlike watever. All in all, i would expect a manager to at least comp the meal with the hair or a larger percentage for the overlook of their mistake.  This happened 3/7/16 between 11-12pm. i rated a 2 bc the food is good but that was disappointing.

5.description: Reasonably priced breakfast/brunch cafe with a variety of menu items. I like the omelets, the breakfast bowls, the benedicts, the pancakes...basically everything that they serve here. There's nothing fancy/gourmet about Meli Cafe; it's a pleasant cafe with friendly people that serve delicious breakfast food

3.description: Loved it, definitely going back. Woke up after NYE2015 party, craving for some good food, me and my friends decided to check this place out. This place was awesome. They have a good variety of creative breakfast items giving enough options to meet everyone's variant food preferences. For that reason,looking  at their menu, I felt that I should order something different/unusual than the regular breakfast menu items like omelette or pancakes. I ordered "black pepper bacon hash" from their "Today's special" section. Bed of shredded crispy potato hash brown, bacon, green peppers, onions, red pepper, topped with melted cheese and covered with 2 over easy eggs(any style eggs, I choose over easy), served with toast( choose Rye) butter, fresh real pineapple jelly. So darn delicious. All my friends loved whatever they ordered. They also have some good smoothies and coffee . Loved their green machine and mango smoothies. Service was good too. Overall, I'll definitely and happily recommend this place if you are looking for something different and delicious.

35.description: This joint was O-K, nothing really stood out food wise, my breakfast bowl was tasty but not $15 tasty, my wife's Banana french toast was nothing to write home about either, but I can't scold them for we kinda landed here by mistake, so I guess we can split the fault. I did however notice that the cushion on the bench where we were sitting had payed its dues and needed relief to say the least. The service was meh at best for we never got water refills and there was a mild lack of charm in our server, but that is never guaranteed so whatever, parking is nightmarish and the pricing just makes the whole ordeal not worth the while, at least for me.Thanks but no thanks guys, it will be a while before we come back.

19.description: Both their homemade ketchup and marmalade are phenomenal. Coffee blend is also pretty great!

28.description: Cute little quaint place. Great and fast service. The waitresses are so attentive, filling up water glasses before they are even halfway gone, and checking in frequently.. But not annoyingly much! Just the right amount! The portions are not too big but still filling! You get your money's worth! I will definitely come back if I'm in the area again

45.description: The visit was just okay for me. None of the menu choices really blew me away or stood out. My food was good but not spectacular. And you can't substitute and pay an up charge to customize your order. I'll probably go back but not anytime soon. The only thing really memorable was the ambiance but I'd rather have amazing food.

33.description: Great place. I hadn't been to Chicago in many years, and a friend took me here. The place was packed, but the wait was not very long at all. Quick, friendly service, and the Elvis french toast is a few meals rolled into one. So good though. Peanut butter stuffed french toast, drizzled in chocolate, and covered in bananas and their bacon marmalade. I'd eat there regularly if I was a resident.

43.description: Great brunch spot  in Greek Town. Smoothies and fruit juices are fresh and breakfast specials are to die for. Meal: oatmeal pancakes, pear juice, and english muffin.

2.description: My partner went there for an early breakfast after staying at the Parthenon Hostel across the street.  Thankfully they were open nice and early at 6am before our train left Union Station.  Upon entering the restaurant we were promptly greeted and sat.  The place is well decorated and very clean.Soon our server came over and asked for beverage orders.  She was very nice and helpful.  The menu featured an extensive list of interesting options along with a page of specials.   I couldn't decide between a chorizo and Argentinian sausage breakfast bowl ( a special) or a hash eggs benidict.  I asked our server if the hash was homemade and she responded "Of course, even the ketchup is homemade!" :). She recommended the hash benidict and I took her advice! My girlfriend opted for the hash breakfast bowl called the "Emerald Isle".  The food was excellent and plentiful.  In particular, the hash eggs benidict featured homemade corned beef hash that was actually formed into thick patties fried like a burger to top the English muffin.  A ton of food for $14.  I am a big eater and I couldn't finish it, nor could my partner finish hers.  We also were given homemade strawberry jam, quince marmalade, and honey butter for the homemade toast.  I was very pleased!The only negatives I can think of were 1) the regular coffee was average and initially the coffee refill service was a bit slow, which seemed inconsistent with the rest of the place.2) The prices seemed high with the total for us two, including tea, coffee, and two breakfasts was $42 including tax and a 16% tip.  Maybe not too high for Chicago, but difficult if you are on a tight budget.  Most options are over $10.  All in all, this is a great place - tasty food, great service, and a nice location and interior.  I highly recommend it!

18.description: the food was ok, kinda bland, not impressed

41.description: I'd visited this place sometime ago. It isn't the best or as good as other reviews rate it. We ordered crepes, burgers and eggs benedict. Honestly, if you can't perfect the benedict, you shouldn't be claiming to be a good breakfast place. Crepes were good and do was the burger. Oz juice was fresh as well. Service was ok, not too great. I might give it a try again.

52.description: Only real negative thing I can say is that they have no liquor license. No mimosas with brunch if that's your preference. Otherwise the food was superb. I had the Lean & Mean which was not only very good but also filling. Larger portion than I anticipated. Overall they feed you well with their portions. Service was good too and they accommodated our party of fourteen with four people at an off table just not directly attached to us but next to us. Make sure your party is there on time otherwise they won't seat you until everyone is there.

50.description: Where's the zero stars option? The service here was horrible. Let me start with a quote from our server,  "you don't have to eat it." That's what one of the waitresses said to my mother after we told her that the blueberry pancakes did not have blueberries in them. It was the worst service I have ever had at ANY restaurant ever. Every single order that my party made was wrong. We ordered drinks, they never came. I ordered an omelet with egg whites, the entire egg was used to make my omelet. My father ordered jalepenos in his omelet, they were absent. My husband's food order was not put in with the kitchen and we had to re-order his entire meal - it came 35 minutes late. My father's coffee was not even correct! When the food came it was mediocre at best! I will never eat here again and recommend that you don't either.

4.description: Holy Crepes!!! do not leave without getting the crepes, even if you don't like sweets, for the love of god order the crepes. We came here with a group of 4 and they set us pretty quickly. We ordered our own entrees and got a crepes for the table. The plates were massive - each plate could easily feed a party of two. So I purposely didn't finish my plate so I could try the dessert crepe we got for the table. We ordered the cobbler which came with a ton of berries and tasted really light yet filling. It had just the perfect combination of sugars, syrup and fruit - enough to want you coming back for more!

6.description: Spent the New Years brunch here and it was wildly busy! After getting seated after 40 minutes I started with grapefruit juice which was amazing and so fresh. The meal itself was typical brunch, I would feel comfortable comparing to an eggsperience type of brunch. I had an avocado caprese wrap which was comparable to any sandwich shop. I also had their special which was a croissant French toast-- lackluster. They also messed up our order a few times. The service left a lot to be desired, especially after a 45 minute wait. I would return for an average brunch if the wait was not significant.

22.description: Waitstaff was rude and food is just so-so. This used to be a great brunch spot, but it has changed over the past few years. Not recommended.

15.description: The food here is pretty good, but the service is terrible. They take your name and phone number and don't call you. I came here for brunch on my birthday and the host told me it would be 30mins for our party of 2. We walked around for 20mins, came back, stood outside the restaurant for another 25mins and still no call. It was packed inside so I called to check where we were since it was now 30mins AFTER the time they told us (for a table for TWO) and they host rudely told me he was "too busy to check how close we were and we would be called when it was our turn!" We left and still NEVER received a call. They can keep that French toast, I'm never going back!

57.description: five stars for sure! Food was delicious and service was great! A tad bit expensive but definitely worth it!

20.description: The food itself was very good, but in general I wasn't very happy with anything else. The restaurant was overcrowded, the staff that seated us was rude, and the credit card machines allegedly can take only two credit cards to run the bill for the whole group.  If you are going with a group of more than two or three I would highly suggest avoiding this place for your weekend brunch.

36.description: I've visited Meli in the South Loop and Northside too. The service is just standard. Most of the tables at the Greektown location are conducive to parties of 4 with a few that can accommodate up to 6.The food is fresh and so are the squeezed juices, but it's nothing spectacular. The coffee is strong and always refilled timely, but overall, I've experienced better and think Meli is over-rated.

14.description: The service here was great! We were greeted and seated right away and the server was very attentive so for that I would have given 5 stars however, the food was terrible! I ordered the fresh berry crepes and baby reds. The baby reds were delicious but the crepes were very bland and well......just nasty. My friend had pancakes which we both agreed were not very tasty at all. We won't be back, the food is just not worth it and the space is very tight.

28.description: I really like this place, don't let the looks fool you they do an amazing job every time I've been in :)

1.description: Not great. Not even good. $25 for a pedicure that lasted about 15 minutes.  When i asked why there was no massage I was told by the manicurist that her hand hurt. I asked if my pedicure would be discounted b/c it didn't include the full-service. No, it wasn't.   She then asked me where I lived, how large my place was and what I paid in rent. I understand why this place was completely empty. I should have kept walking.

39.description: This is a great place to stop on your lunch break or after work to get a quick and cheap mani or pedi!  The staff is very efficient and they have a ton of colors and styles you can choose from!

9.description: 3 words : Obscenely rude & filthy.Oh ! and do NOT drink water there unless you have health insurance.

29.description: OMG, do not get me started on this place.  Ok fine, get me started.  It began 4 years ago when myself and two girlfriends came in here for quick mani/pedis before class.  I ACCIDENTALLY broke a bottle of blue nailpolish that got on the floor and walls.  The man and woman that were working started screaming in (Vietnamese?) and refused to even acknowledge my apologies...in fact, one even scolded me in another language.  For the rest of my visit, no one would look at me. My friends and I were DYING laughing, like literally in tears.  The best part of all this is what happened next: while my friend was beginning an eyebrow wax, the tech lady was holding her cell phone (with those little hanging cellphone ornament accessories dangling from it in my friend's face) in one hand while putting on the hot wax on with her other hand and then stopped halfway to answer her phone (the ringer was a karate chop - had to throw that in there).  She left my friend sitting there with hot wax dangling precariously above one of her eyeballs for several minutes.  At this point, all 3 of us are LOL.I give this place 3 starts because it is super cheap, and I hate to admit it, they do a great job on the actual painting of the nails (the guy is a nail polish wizard, its awesome).I have been back and not had an experience quite that bad, but have been made to wait for an hour (while I had an appointment) while people came in off the street and were serviced beforehand. They must remember me from the first incident.

23.description: I don't know WHAT to rate this place. So I won't be going back, but it's not because I'm unhappy with my mani OR pedi!  The "customer service" (different from the "actual" service) was creepy, and it's not a clean salon. So - my "2" is actually 2.5 rounded down - a "4" for the actual service and a "1" for the creepy-and-lackofcleaniless factors.Customer Service: The couple doesn't really interact with the clients which I found totally creepy. The woman was doing pedis for a young couple when I came in. I picked out my color and sat at one of the pedi stations. She never spoke to either of them. I waited for good while before the woman came and ran water for me to soak. While I was there another client came in and did the same thing! Sat at the station forEVER before she got water run so she could at least soak while waiting. She had to ask rather loudly if she could soak while she waited. So the guy just sidles up and starts my manicure. No 'hello.' Nothing. Just grabs my hand. Plus, while he was doing the manicure, he used NO solution or anything (not even Palmolive!) in the soak - just plain tepid water - and all they while, not ONE conversational word to me. After the woman finished with the young couple, she did a really nice job on my feet, but without any interaction. However, she and the guy "chatted" in their language. It was too, too strange. Lack of cleanliness: Dirty towels were piled up in a corner on a stainless hamper, dried up and empty pedicure supplies were stashed behind the pedi stations. The guy dropped the cuticle tool on the floor while doing my manicure - picked it up from the floor and kept using it on me! 'nuff said.HOWEVER. The actual service is quite good. The experience, "notsomuch."

5.description: This is probably my favorite nail salon ever. One time I even drove 30 minutes from the suburbs to get my nails done.Sure, when you walk in the salon isn't the nicest, but it's definitely not the worst. Plus, you come here just to get your nails done and not to live so who cares what the interior looks like. The man and woman running the shop are extremely nice. The man doesn't talk much, but the woman remembers me and always asks about school and how I'm doing. My pedicures and acrylic nails always turn out exactly how I want them. Their prices are very reasonable too. When it gets busy it can take a while to get service, but I don't mind the wait since it is worth it. If you let them know exactly what you are looking for they will make sure to do it. I love this place. Affordable and I always leave happy.

31.description: Do yourself a favor and never step foot into this place.  I walked in and asked how long the wait would be.. The guy says 10 minutes and tells me to sit in a comfy leather chair.. Ok good start I think to myself..So while my feet are soaking, I glance around the room and see that everyone is being waited on but me..But I think nothing of it, since he said 10 minutes.  Well maybe he meant 50 minutes, because almost an hour later, I was still in the chair with my feet in the water!!   I had asked a few times if I should come back later, but I was ingored, no response..  Since I had time to kill I noticed that on 3 different customers, they had FAILED to clean the supplies.. Eewwww!!  For a split second, I thought about taking a run for it, but my feet were wet and I had already waited sooooooooo long..By the time my turn came, no one apologized for the lateness or even said a word to me.. The girl started working on my pruny feet.. When she was done, she said "I don't know why everyone is so moody today".. I paid and left before they couldn't even tell me to sit under the dryer..  There are many more nail salons in the city, I'd prefer to spend time in. This for sure isn't one of them.

25.description: After my last nail fiasco, I decided to revisit a salon by my apartment, and it was a great decision. Although Greektown nails needs a little oomph in their deco/building, I'm always happy with the results. I always get the male nail tech when I go in, and whether it's a mani/pedi or full set, he is always quick and does a great job. I'm not the kind of girl that wants to be in the salon for 3 hrs, so I was super happy to be in and out in an hour yesterday with a nice gel fill in, a great polish, and only $25 spent! I will be sticking with my nearby business from now on!

12.description: Lynn is the best! Takes her time and makes sure you walk out with AMAZING looking toes! Clean place and friendly service

37.description: I wonder why other have stated that the nail techs "did a bad job" because I will not go anywhere else.  Their pedicures are excellent.  I have paid top dollar at a nicely decorated salon with soft music, etc. where the result were whack.  If you like frills and are afraid of diversity, this may not be your place but if you want a good pedicure and have an open mind, this place is great!

21.description: I wouldn't have even gave it one star but since we have to....-2 letters to describe this place EW. I'm so surprised it passes city inspections with the grossness levels. I gave it a shot  because my co worker gets her nails done here and they are always cute. I sat there waiting for someone to do my nails about 20 min because they have about 3 people that work there. But in my time sitting I noticed when a lady was finished with her pedicure the employee didn't clean out the bowl or the tools she used on her feet gross. So I really felt uncomfortable but my nails needed help. When I finally got in the chair the last nail shop did my nails to thick and she wouldn't give me a fill for a gel which is fine but she complained the entire time she took my old nails off. It was complaining that made me so uncomfortable because she wouldn't stop. Let me tell you I work in the beauty industry and making your client uncomfortable is a huge no no. So since I came on break and an hour had already gone by once she got my old nails off,I had to leave without getting my nails done. So this sums up my review dirty salon-rude employees- and lack of employees. I will NEVER step foot in this shop again!

16.description: This place was convenient because it on my way when I go home. I needed to get my eyebrows and nails done for an event I was going to, figured I give this place a shot. Why two stars?1) The woman put the wax on my skin without any precision. My eyebrows were so thin! I did not like it at all.2) They are not too friendly, and do not greet customers when they are walking it.  3) I noticed they didn't sterilize their tools, other than, rubbing it on towel that was on the working desk.I wasn't too please. Good prices though.

17.description: Sunny day, and NO ONE was in here, so I was helped right away. I went for a fill in for my acrylics despite having them initially done somewhere in the suburbs. SOOO many nail polish colors to choose from. The fill was $17.. what a reasonable price!!! At the end of the whole procedure, I looked at my nails and was so happy! I don't think they've ever looked this great!! They did a FANTASTIC job!!! Will FOR SURE come back!! I give it a 4 only because I wish it was a little fancier/cleaner for being in the city.

10.description: Customer service was awful - I was not greeted when I came in, no one ever asked for my name. I was just told the wait is 30 min.I waited an hour and was waived over to grab a color and sit down for a pedicure.The massage chair was broken and I waited 15 min before someone came to me. It ended up being the manicurist...he cut and filed my nails and painted them very hurriedly while I still sat with my feet soaking in the water. Very weird experience.Service and the broken chair would bring this down to a 3 star since it was only $32 for a mani/pedi but what really made me never ever want to go back is the pain coming from a cuticle that bled on my left hand and my throbbing, inflamed toe! The shop sucks, the service sucks, and the nail "technicians" suck. Avoid this nail salon.

11.description: I have never been in such a dirty establishment. I came in for a mani-pedi because I just moved into the area and was desperate! I had a no-chip on so during my pedicure my nails were soaking. The pedicure chairs are gross, the water is a creepy blue color (looked like a fish tank) and I literally could not wait until it was over. During the foot rub portion of the pedicure the man came over and started scraping off the no-chip so there was no way I was going to enjoy the rest of the pedi - a little cognizance would have been nice. The no chip wasn't coming off right away despite his scraping so he put all the cotton balls and tin foil back on. Oh, and the no chip scrapings that did come off crumbed all over the stacks of old dirty magazines, so if you see pink crumbs by the pedicure stations that was from me! During the manicure I couldn't focus on anything but the piles of crap behind the manicure station and the foreign-language TV show that was blaring from a laptop sitting next to me. Seriously. Despite my toes drying on a fan during the entire manicure AND while my nails were drying, both of my big toes were messed up when I got home thanks to the oily bag they were placed into. Not going back. Ever.

26.description: I've been going here ever since I moved to Chicago, so four years, now. The same gentleman does my nails every time. I get acrylics/fill ins. The prices are EXTREMELY fair and the staff is friendly, especially when you are friendly. I have had a pedicure or two from here, I was happy with the result each time. However, I am incredibly ticklish, so pedicures are a slight form of torture for me, otherwise, it definitely would be on my regular agenda. I am always very pleased with the service I have received from here, the main reason why I have been a regular for four years and will continue to be until I move from the city.

27.description: I just went there for the first time (fretting, cuz I HATE switching nail places, but I just moved really near) I didnt have an appt. Had to wait about ten minutes (expected). Had Lin, she was really friendly (as was everyone else) and did a fabulous job on my fill, french and eyebrow wax. I can walk there, so this is officially my new nail place!

35.description: So, its Chicago, and its freakin' cold, and my  nails are all always so dry, that I hate to go around with out them painted and sort of manicured. One Friday I wanted to get a quick nail fix before having dinner with some people.  A woman in my office recommended this place to me (our office is in the West Loop and she lives in the same neighborhood.)  and she is very "together" so I thought, sure! If X goes there, I'm sure its fine!It was not fine. It was a Friday after work, so I sort of thought it might be a little busy, but there were no customers. There was, however, a woman sleeping in a pile of clothes behind her manicure table, and a man (the owner?) sleeping in a pedicure chair. Not. Ok. The tools weren't clean, and the man continued to alternately sleep in the chair and give me dirty looks. The place is not clean, the staff are not friendly, my girl got up and left and talked on the phone for about 20 minutes, and the manicure was terrible. It was cheap, but even for 12$ it was too much. Save yourself the trip!

8.description: Amazing. Super low key and great nails. I got an acrylic fill and it was fast and cheap and great. So happy!

0.description: This is the best nail salon in all of Chicago! I've tried quite a few, but this is from now on definitely my go-to! Right from the very first time I was there, the woman (Lynn, I think is her name - who's also so sweet and funny), did my acrylics perfectly and exactly the way I wanted them, and they lasted for FOUR weeks without ANY problems! Seriously, they did not start to come off like almost every other place that I've been to. Extremely sturdy and also just very gorgeous, I consistently received compliments for them and all other times she's done my nails.I personally don't pay much attention to the salon, although it seems like a standard nail salon, so I don't understand why the complaints about it. Also, SOOO many nail polish colors!!! It's heaven!Not to forget, the price is just amazing. Plus the quality of their work makes me leave feeling like I should have been charged more. $25 for acrylics, $17 for a fill, and also $12 for a regular manicure (I think). It's so reasonable!I'm most definitely a regular here now.

38.description: While they do a good job here, I'm not sure if I would recommend this place.  They are particularly rough and after you ask/say something to them they do have a tendency to gab loudly to each other in a foreign language- and I can't shake the feeling that they are talking about me when they do so! This makes me feel uncomfortable.  And when I got a pedicure a girl ripped my nail off because she was in such a rush!

20.description: This nail salon is within walking distance of my home so I do go there quite often.  They do not provide nail designs but they do provide gel and no chip polish which is nice.  If you are looking for a nail salon which does a great job painting your nails this would be it.  The only down side is that they do not have glitter or special designs for nails.  You can only get one color on your nails.  The prices are reasonable.

19.description: Sadly, not open at 10am like their posted hours and answering machine say. =( We had to go elsewhere.

33.description: I tried this place recently with ignoring past reviews.The location is quite convenient, easy to find, and away from the loop, compared to other salons in the area. The store is a little cramped, but they work the spacing.I work by union station, so the walk is nice for a lunch manicure. Pedicures always take long in any salon so i recommend those for only after work hours. If you're pressed for time, be smart and request an appointment. The pricing is standard, even matching what i have seen in the suburbs. The people there were quite friendly when you are friendly, same as other nail salons. My girl did a great job, so I am definitely going back for a lunchtime manicure!

2.description: I went here because they were open later than other salons in the area and I needed to get in  Friday after work.  I called ahead to see if they could get me in right away and they said they could, but when I showed up I had to wait about 25 minutes (why not just tell me that on the phone?). My no chip manicure was sloppy, he got it on my skin (and left it) and I noticed after I left there was a small piece of hair stuck in the paint, that I could not get out. Gross.The part that bothered me most though was that the salon is NOT CLEAN.  They clearly have some loyal customers who don't mind, as the other women in the salon seemed very familiar with the staff... but I couldn't get behind it.  I may come back if this place has turned around at some point, but I doubt it.

34.description: I went here for a manicure - pedicure last week.  It was a great pedicure experience for sure but it took a long time!  I was there for almost two hours.. so yeah kinda a long lunch hour.  But my girl did a great job and she was pretty friendly so I would go there again if I'm not in a time crunch.

32.description: Very unfriendly staff and 2 days later my nails turned yellow.  I went back to get them fixed and they only fixed 4 nails...Will not return to this place and wouldn't recommend it to anyone else either.

18.description: I don't know WHAT to rate this place. So I won't be going back, but it's not because I'm unhappy with my mani OR pedi!  The "customer service" (different from the "actual" service) was creepy, and it's not a clean salon. So - my "2" is actually 2.5 rounded down - a "4" for the actual service and a "1" for the creepy-and-lackofcleaniless factors.Customer Service: The couple doesn't really interact with the clients which I found totally creepy. The woman was doing pedis for a young couple when I came in. I picked out my color and sat at one of the pedi stations. She never spoke to either of them. I waited for good while before the woman came and ran water for me to soak. While I was there another client came in and did the same thing! Sat at the station forEVER before she got water run so she could at least soak while waiting. She had to ask rather loudly if she could soak while she waited. So the guy just sidles up and starts my manicure. No 'hello.' Nothing. Just grabs my hand. Plus, while he was doing the manicure, he used NO solution or anything (not even Palmolive!) in the soak - just plain tepid water - and all they while, not ONE conversational word to me. After the woman finished with the young couple, she did a really nice job on my feet, but without any interaction. However, she and the guy "chatted" in their language. It was too, too strange. Lack of cleanliness: Dirty towels were piled up in a corner on a stainless hamper, dried up and empty pedicure supplies were stashed behind the pedi stations. The guy dropped the cuticle tool on the floor while doing my manicure - picked it up from the floor and kept using it on me! 'nuff said.HOWEVER. The actual service is quite good. The experience, "notsomuch."

13.description: Horrible service! First time at this place and will NEVER go back. I walked in and looked around for a color, sat down and waited. 2 ladies walked in after me for mani and were taken right away. After the First Lady was done, they called the second one up. Here I still am sitting and walked in way before them. I asked the man working there if I was next and he said "not yet". I asked once more is she going to do my nails? He totally ignored me! At this point I walked out.

4.description: Ok, so it wasn't the most glamorous nail salon I've ever visited. But I had a great experience anyway - solid acrylic full set for $25 (the lowest I've seen in this area otherwise is $40!), no extra charge for pointy tips (hallelu), I can tip on credit AND the $12(!!!) manicure is enough to bring me back anyway.

24.description: One of my favorite spots for mani-pedis.  I go here when I get sick of the other nail places that are crappy but have a Groupon or something.  Greek Town Nails is a good price especially for the job that they do and mani/pedis are only $32 Mon-Wed.This place is my favorite.  There is often a wait if you don't make an appointment because they are good and they are in Greektown/West Loop area.  Try not to drop in on Friday or you will wait forever.They do a thorough job and it takes a while before my nails ever chip.  Never had a bad experience.

6.description: Went in for my second fill in since I moved here. I am so satisfied with these folks. I usually steer clear of a 17.00 fill in, but no worries here! Affordable, good service and a quality job. I'm officially a regular now.

22.description: Service is great. Pedicure lady is awesome - gives the best message. Sometimes it's really busy but worth the wait. My nail color last a long time when I come here. My big toe messed up over night and I went back and she fixed it for me. You cant beat that.

15.description: One of my favorite spots for mani-pedis.  I go here when I get sick of the other nail places that are crappy but have a Groupon or something.  Greek Town Nails is a good price especially for the job that they do and mani/pedis are only $32 Mon-Wed.This place is my favorite.  There is often a wait if you don't make an appointment because they are good and they are in Greektown/West Loop area.  Try not to drop in on Friday or you will wait forever.They do a thorough job and it takes a while before my nails ever chip.  Never had a bad experience.

7.description: my nails are perfect.i got a full set of gel nails. perfect oval shape and not too bulky. the guy who did my nails was super attentive and friendly. they also had a large color selection and so many glitter polishes to choose from. i have never gotten my nails done without glitter on top and this place was glitter heaven. definitely coming back.

36.description: The Ms loves this place. It's become the go-to for pedi (ever three weeks or so), mani (every other pedi) and eyebrow waxing (every two weeks).  The Ms has no experience with their fake nail services, which could conceivably be bad (one review sounds terrible). So, if you're looking for an acrylic / gel review, consult another review.Leelee gives fabulous pedicures.  The Ms has never had a bad experience.  They seem to be rude to some, but, it appears that if you're nice to them, as the Ms is, they'll try to include you in their conversations / tell you what they're talking about (which might be you or your shoes, or could be lunch or the movie that's on). They might even stay open late to accomodate you. Or perhaps not. The Ms regularly receives preferential treatment, perhaps because she endeavors to never be rude, snobby, haughty or dismissive. Certainly this was not the issue of any other reviewers. They must have just been unlucky.

30.description: I occasionally stop in to Greek Town Nails every few months or so on my lunch break.  I work near Union Station and its about a 10 minute walk away.  The main reason I go is not for the experience (this is not a luxury nail salon) but for the price.  It's tough to find a $25 pedicure near downtown that's decent.  They have a huge nail polish collection in many colors and if you go a little before the lunch crowd (11:30ish), you won't have to wait.  Just try not to look at the decor or think about how "clean" the tools, etc. are.  They do wash my toes with soap before polishing so that makes me feel a little better!

3.description: They are really nice but that place just needs a deep clean. I went there for the price but I'm not sure I would go again. I got a no-chip manicure and clearly something went wrong in the process because it bubbled up. I told the technician and he said that it would get better with the topcoat......It didn't. They did "fix" it for me which involved just putting on more color coat and topcoat but it still isn't perfect. I guess you get what you pay for.

14.description: $25 pedicures? Hell yesThe employees do a good job.  It's not a swanky establishment, but you get good quality service for a great price.  No complaints here.

3.description: Came here several times over last 4 months.  I got a couple mediocre haircuts, a couple bad haircuts, and one good haircut.  Emilia provided the good haircut.  A couple different people provided the bad haircuts.  I won't be back here.  My hair is a simple cut so no reason for multiple people to screw it up and make it so difficult.

1.description: I won't be going back. The woman who cut my hair didn't seem to understand how to use clippers. She was fumbling around trying to figure out what 3/8 of an inch was. It was lopsided and she didn't even ask if it looked ok. She just said "You're done now" and was offended when I asked to check the back. I decided to cut my losses and leave before she made it worse.

2.description: The dude who gave me a haircut had no clue what he was doing. I wasn't looking for anything fancy or complicated. Im only complaining because he left my head very noticeably lopsided. Oh and he managed to give me a bald spot on the right side. What a joke...

5.description: I had some time after my reflexology appointment and went to my favorite salon to see if they had time for shampoo and blowout. They were booked and understandably so, as it was Friday afternoon and Good Friday. So i decided to go to Super Cuts . I had been here one time before and was satisfied with my previous service. Today when I arrived at approximately 530 pm. When i arrived the salon was empty. I was greeted by my stylist and explained that i wanted shampoo and blowout.  As I looked on the service menu it was quite confusing as it had three prices for shampoo and blowout . My stylist began shampooing my hair and the manager kept asking her questions regarding my visit. As they continued to talk back and forth i could not hear the conversation because my head was in shampoo bowl with running water. The stylist then relayed message that my service would be 25.95. I then replied to her that was fine and agreed to this payment. She did a great job with my hair and I was satisfied. Upon payment the receipt said 31.90. With two charges of 25.95 for blowout and 5.95 for shampoo! Ok seriously...so I asked for clarification of these charges and the manager then interjects in a very curt and rude manner telling me he told me the price. I respond no you told me the price was 25.95 and advise him that I didn't appreciate his rude tone as it is abrasive, condescending  and unprofessional. To add more insult to injury he then responds in aggressive argumentative tone that he is not rude and then points to the service I did tell you the price it was 25.95 and up. I am like is this really happening??? I work in Greektown and do my personal business in Greektown. ..shaking my head...is this fool really a manager number one and is this is really horrible customer service. In conclusion, I advise the manager that I work down the street and will not be back to Super Cuts. I ask his name and if he is the manager. His replies his name is Steven, I then ask for a card and he offers customer care number for Super Cuts. Thanks Steven I did call customer care at 877.857.2070 and I now understand why your salon is desolate. Unacceptable behaviour from manager. I still gave my stylist 30 percent tip as she cant help it her manager is incompetent.

6.description: I had some extra time before yoga class and needed to get a quick haircut. I called ahead to make sure there wasn't too long of a line. The lady was very pleasant on the phone and my hairdresser was quick, engaging, and did a very great job only cutting the really bad parts of my fried hair. The location is amazing, next to Mariano's and 2 blocks away from my fvorite yoga studio. Plus, you can park in the parking lot complex. How great is that?

0.description: Greetings I am a Professional and Licensed Cosmetologist!!I love Supercuts!  I have worked for Supercuts and will work there again!!  This company is the most consistent in service  that I have ever experience by far.  It is well organized, the company itself is absolutely concerned with its guest and clients that visit and come for anyservice.  Their products are very reasonable, Paul Mitchel, American Crew and Matrix anda few others which are a few of the top on the markets  best products list. All of these carry an array of shampoo's and conditioners for all textures of hair.  Supercuts without a doubt stand by their products and service!!  Everything Supercuts offer isposted very big  clear and precise, so all I have to do is walk in look at the services offered and determined what service I want and confirm that service at the desk with the receptionist before I began.  I love that I can walk in read a magazine for 5 or 10 minutes before I am in so one's chair.  I never had to wait more than 15 mins!!!   All of the location are great!!We cause the best things to happen together.Peace and Much Light

4.description: Came here the past few times to get my hair done did. Steven and Emilia know what they're doing over there. They're super friendly and the haircuts aren't too pricey.

58.description: I was really looking forward to the opening of Tapworks.  Unfortunately, I was very disappointed during my first visit here.  I know that they just opened, so I am hoping that some of these issues may be resolved...so I may go back to give them a second chance down the line.To start with, I want to say that the inside looks great. I like the decor.
