The actual bar is setup in the middle of the space, so that all four sides are open for people to sit at.  It's nice and spacious.  The rest of the bar/restaurant is set up with tall tops throughout.  There are a good amount of large tables to accommodate groups of 6+ people.  The seats are not the most comfortable, and to be honest, they will probably not function well for a lot of people since the seating space is fairly small (I'm of a small stature and I found it borderline comfortable to sit).After seating ourselves, as the sign told us to, my friend and I had to wait about 10 minutes before we were greeted by our server and given menus.  This would be more acceptable if the place was packed, which it was not.  The server was not very attentive throughout our time there.We ordered an appetizer and entrees.  After waiting for awhile, our server came out with our entrees.  As he placed our meals down he said "Oh...we just ran out of fried pickles.  Is there another appetizer you want to order?"  At that point, our meals were already there, so we declined.  I thought it was odd that he didn't come and tell us that they ran out of our appetizer in advance before bringing out our food.  My friend got a burger--looked good and she said it tasted good.  My friend pointed out that her burger had pickles on it, so clearly the kitchen had not run out of pickles entirely....and yet our server told us that they ran out of fried pickles?  This made us think even more that he had just forgotten to put our appetizer order in and was making up that the kitchen ran out of it. I got the breaded buffalo chicken sandwich...however there was barely any chicken on the sandwich. The actual meat was MAYBE 2cm thick and then there was a thin cornflake breading. It was served on a telera roll with cucumber and argula. There was more argula on the sandwich than there was chicken! The sandwich came with fries, which were basic...nothing special. Our server came by and asked us to close our tab with him as he was going home and said that another server would be by our table to take over.  However, after he left another server didn't come over for at least 30 minutes....and she came over to say that it was last call.  Mind you, it was only 11:15 and they are telling us it is last call?!  There were at least 20 people in the place, so I really have no idea why they were closing so early (their website says they are open until 2:00am).  I decided to ask this server if they had fried pickles, to which she responded yes, but the kitchen is closed.  I then asked if they had run out of fried pickles and she said no.  I told her about how our first server said they had run out.  She just laughed and basically said ooops I guess I just blew his cover and he must have just not put your order in.Again, I know this place just opened, however the owners have other bars, so I wouldn't expect Tapworks to have so many problems.  I may be back....but then again, Jak's Tap is just down the street and they have food I can count on, better service and the same drinks that I'd be drinking at Tapworks.If Tapworks reads this review, some advice would be to train/re-train your current staff on better customer service and the importance of being attentive...or hire some new people who already have good server skills.  Also, I'd take a closer look at the food coming out of your kitchen, as the chicken sandwich was one of the worst I have ever had, merely because there was almost no chicken on the sandwich.

56.description: Went for lunch, but it was "brunch". Unless you wanted fried egg on something, you only had 1 option. We didn't even get offered a beer menu, which was underwhelming once we asked for it. I realize they haven't been open long, but the place only had 2 other customers. Food was incredibly over priced, over seasoned, undercooked, and unimpressive. Sat with empty beverage glasses for most of the meal. We are in that building at least once a month, but won't be going back anytime soon. DO NOT TAKE KIDS!!!! They are not welcome, nor are you if you have one.

29.description: Not a bad place, but my shoes remained tied with my socks secured to my feet. I got the pulled pork nachos. They lacked BBQ sauce, which was on the table, so I'm glad that I know what should be on pulled pork nachos. The pork itself was nothing special and the cheese kind of made me queasy. Their sweet potato fries were too salty, but they give you a ton for $4. I have a feeling that their service was lacking due to the place packed with Hawks fans watching the game. All in all, I've been to worse places and I liked the vibe.

42.description: I came into after my volunteer shift to get a beer and a bite to eat.  My server Pheobe was great.  She was friendly and enthusiastic about my beer choice.  I'm a server myself, so I really appreciated the fact that she was so nice considering I was a single diner.  You'd be surprised how often I receive bad service just because I'm a woman dining alone.  I ordered the pulled chicken sandwich with tater tots.  The sandwich was delicious, but I found the tots to be a bit too overly salted.  No biggie though.  I went in hoping to get a burger, but there wasn't any just plain burger options.  They all had several ingredients on them that I didn't want.  I probably could have asked for a burger with heavy modifications, but I didn't want to be a pain in the ass (it's the server in me).Thanks to Pheobe for her friendly and prompt service, I will definitely be back when I'm in the neighborhood for my volunteer shift.

23.description: Giving a one star is too generous. My friend has a gluten allergy and asked for a salad. She specifically asked for a dressing that was gluten free. She got the salad and poured the dressing on to her salad and started eating it. We then realized it was the vinaigrette that had beer in it = gluten!  At this point she had already eaten half of the salad. Waitress didn't even apologize and the manager? didn't have much to say either. They brought her a new salad with oil and vinegar.. not like it mattered because the damage was done. They did however comp the salad.. that just makes the allergy go away right?

47.description: So excited about this new addition to the Greektown neighborhood and such a convenient location considering that I work on the second floor of the same building. Their wings are spectacular. The burgers are not to die for, but decent. Absolutely loved their fried chicken (but they should really say its fried chicken strips. Just a suggestion. I was expecting a drumstick of some sort) and mashed potatoes. The servings are large, befitting of the price. Definitely worth giving it a whirl!

8.description: Went in for a casual business lunch last week and noticed maybe three other tables mid afternoon...no excuse for the TERRIBLE service we received. Note to the upper management, watch your staff. The only server there completely ignored us as he was swinging back and forth from a table in the back to swigging shots behind the bar....at noon, no less. Doing this in FRONT of customers leaves less to be desired. The food is sub par at best. My team and I will not be back. I advise readers to do the same. Stay away!

31.description: Great rotating beer selection and tasty bar eats. Been in here five or six times and they always deliver. Highly recommend the Pork Flight - pork belly on bacon on pulled pork. Defibrillator is kept on the wall behind the bar, it's worth it. The wings are also great, smoked so there is a nice flavor.

34.description: An experience that started out bad and made it to average. I'd give 2.5 stars if possible but rounded up since I'm a helluva guy.When I arrived, I waited at the bar for at least 15 minutes and despite clearly holding my credit card in hand but somehow kept getting skipped over even though I was right next to a person who just got served and then the bartender would move to the other side of the bar and serve someone who arrived after me. Finally when there was no else to serve, I finally got a "what can I get ya?"For the second round, I was attended to quite quickly by a different bartender who was very polite and friendly - a tall guy wearing glasses. Tapworks Tavern & Grill has an excellent beer list and serves up bar food and BBQ. I didn't eat but the portions looked generous. They have about 12 flatscreens so it's a better option to watch a game in the West Loop.

16.description: Great place that could easily be a 5 star review but I currently can't justify it. The food is great, the atmosphere for watching a sporting event is great, lots of televisions. However, the service is SLOW and indifferent. This is mostly managements fault for not hiring more waitresses on busy days like Bears Sundays or last night Cubs 1 game playoff & Blackhawks opener. In addition, it appears management hasn't trained their waitresses to follow up with table consistently to see if they want more drinks or food. Our table of 6 had to consistently waive down our waitress to order our first round, order apps, or more drinks and order entrees. I can think of at 5 different occasions we had to do this. FYI - we were there for 3 hours and the bill could've been much higher. Hopefully management is reading the reviews on Yelp and can fix the issues with staffing and training.

13.description: The food is great!! Worked in the building, so we had this often. The waitresses and bartenders are so nice! They are very welcoming and it's nice when they recognize a familiar face! Especially Monica and Stephanie! Their beer selection is so good! I wish it were open later but regardless love this place!!

11.description: Good food, BAD service... Friendly but bad. I feel like they're always understaffed or management is trying to save money on  labor. I've been here 4 times on weekdays around 1pm and it's always been this way

39.description: Nice place for a game. Lots of TV so you won't miss any moment.

37.description: Came here on the first nice day this spring and got a primo spot by the open windows.  It never really got busy, though, which surprised me.  This place is great!  I hope they stick around!The menu reads like my dreams.  The whole thing is basically food porn, so pace yourself.  I came in knowing I wanted the Chilaquilles, but I was sooo tempted to go off course.  I didn't, and boy am I glad.  They.Were.Amazing.  You get a huge serving for $9 (no one finished theirs, we probably could have shared), and it's got a great kick.We started with the fried pickles (always a winner!) and the Southern Fried Mess (the name of my band in college).  I mean, it's basically poutine with smoked pork and tater tots.  How could you not???I didn't imbibe, but the bloodies looked great, they came with a nice slice of crisp bacon and fried pickles.  You can't beat the $2 mimosas.The value is spot on, we got a ton of food for not a lot of money, and the space is cool.  The service was pretty spotty, given we were one of three tables in use, but we weren't in a hurry so it was fine.  Definitely recommend!

0.description: This is good sports bar/bar food place with a good beer list. I went with friends for lunch on a Friday and had a couple of beers.  The service was good and the prices were reasonable.I had the blackened fish tacos, which comes with black beans/rice. The side was a little weak/skimpy. No other complaints.  While we were there, a guy I assume owned or managed the restaurant stopped by our table to invite us to a party the bar was having that evening. I'm too old/married for that kind of thing and had plans anyway. But it was nice to be invited and I appreciate management's interest in the customers.

38.description: This place sucked. I came here with a group of friends on my birthday last Thursday and it took 25 minutes for our beers to arrive. The place was less than half full and the staff members were frantically running around like it was some beer garden at oktoberfest, except they never seemed to have the damn beers. I wanted to like this place but there are too many other places to go where you can actually get drink service. We were going to order food but we closed out as soon as our drinks arrived!

51.description: Been here on 3 occasions and haven't had any issues. Was there for opening day when they only had like 5 beers on tap. I've never waited long for my food and now the beer selection is impressive. The longer they're open the better they'll get!

27.description: Tried to go Saturday night around 1130pm and it was closed! Chairs stacked and lights off.  Says it's open until 2am.What's up with that?Good food when it's open!

32.description: Solid addition to West Loop. Great place to watch sports with lots of TVs and different sized tables. The food is definitely above typical bar food and offers some basic BBQ and other good stuff. Has plenty of beer to choose from and changing beers on tap that has a good mix of local brews and other various breweries. Would like to try brunch here too as the menu looks good.

54.description: This pace is awesome! I live down the street and tried this place for the price time tonight and pleasantly surprised. The service by Eric at the bar was SO personable and told us exactly what we should order. I wold go back here any day of the week!!!

48.description: WHAT A SANDWICH! WOW! I've never had such a large, delicious, and filling Reuben before. And the sweet potatoes were great! The bartender greeted me as soon as I walked in and offered me a drink while I wait for my pick-up order. I had the $1.95 mimosa, and it was just perfect. Very satisfied with my first trip here! :)

44.description: As a server, you find that rare occasion where you have an unplanned Sunday off to enjoy food and drink amongst friends. Unfortunately our experience this past Sunday at Tapworks was far from enjoyable. Service was extremely slow, in what appeared to be an un busy bar. We sat for most of our experience with empty water glasses, and waited for 20-30 minutes after ordering drinks. Food was extremely slow, and several people's food came out cold. At one point, a manager was approached, whom was also the bartender, but he did nothing to address our concerns. Towards the end of our meal, my friend was told by our sever they were out of mimosas... Shortly after we noted the bartender and other servers bringing rounds of mimosas to other guest. Offensive, and completely unforgivable experience.

24.description: My friend who lives nearby recommended we go here (mind you, he's only ever gone once to have a drink) so we thought it would be cool to go in for lunch.  At first, it looks really cool in there and the potential is definitely there to be great but our experience wasn't what I'd hoped.  Number 1, the bartender had a really apathetic attitude.  What is with hiring people based on how many tattoos they have rather than having a great attitude nowadays.  It seems great service has been traded in for smugness and judgements on the beer you decide to order.  We were hungry and decided to start with an appetizer and order chicken wings and I asked if we could please have them extra crispy (they weren't crispy at all.)  We were brought some napkins and only one plate.  We had to ask for silverware by the nice waitress who brought the food out and then it was next to impossible to get our bartender's attention to ask for another plate so my friend got up to get it himself.  The wings, if made the way we requested, could have been very good and the beer we ordered which I think was like grapefruit or something is great for summer so I recommend you try that if you go here.  We left without finishing our wings or beer but I hope the kinks get ironed out so others can enjoy what should be a great hangout.

7.description: I came here for lunch with something like 10 coworkers today, and was not impressed. However, the atmosphere was nice and I would like to return for happy hour. They also apparently do a $2 mimosa, so I will definitely be returning for brunch in the near future.I did opt to be somewhat health conscious and order the turkey burger, so maybe that was my mistake, but I found my food to be bland and slightly dry. Judging by the menu, I expected the food to be a lot bigger and more exciting than it actually was. I recently wrote a review for Epic Burger where I also got a turkey burger, and I definitely preferred theirs. Almost everyone I went with loved this place and thought a 4 or even 5 (!!!) star rating was appropriate. Granted, they're definitely more generous with the stars than I am lol. Most of them ordered the Cubano and thought it was great. The service was decent, but a little slow, and the waitress didn't divide our check up correctly. We did have an excessive amount of people though, so I can see how it would get confusing. Otherwise, the restaurant did a good job accommodating to the size of our group.Like I said, I'll give this place another shot for brunch/happy hour.

49.description: Great drink menu- over 40 beers on tap. Menu has a ton of variety and executed well. I had fish and chips- homemade tartar was awesome, but fries were soggy. We were drinking the mimosa special ($1.95 on weekends) and after my friend and I each had 3 they said they ran out. We went there to watch the March Madness games and they told us they couldn't put the volume on even though everyone that was there was into the games. Awkward ambiance for a Saturday night- music went off for a good hour and not a lot of people there at all. Great set up and potential to be a go-to sports bar in the west loop, but need some surround sound or at least better music. I know they are pretty new so we will be back.

40.description: Ordered the fish and chips. Fish was light, flaky and extremely tasty. Would be better if a third piece of fish was given in place of so many chips. Steak tacos were very well packed with all ingredients. Just need to eat them a bit faster as they do not hold their warmth.

53.description: Don't hesitate - get yo' ass in here on a Saturday or Sunday!  $1.95 Mimosas on the chalkboard outside grabbed our attention like a pervert grabs your junk.  Of course, I had to do my research on this place before I stepped foot in the door and my fellow Yelpers didn't disappoint.  Mixed reviews absolutely means I have to try it for myself and I'm glad I did.  My friends and I hopped up on the first high-top we saw and admittedly the seat felt like you were sitting on some odd incline that you kept slipping down.  I'd readjust and felt like I was sitting on an exercise ball trying to keep my balance.  Meh, no thanks.  We spotted the booths in the back by the kitchen.  AWESOME...I'm always up for drinks and a show because you can see right in overlooking the line.  The food that popped up on the pass had my meat-eating friends salivating.  I stuck with the sweet potato fries and they were a HUGE serving.  In fact, everything was an oversized portion which made this a bang for your buck.  We didn't have ANY issues with service but I'm convinced we had the best one out there - Heather.  She was on top it and we didn't go thirsty or hungry.We will be back for sure and will bring all of our friends and family here as I highly recommend it!

30.description: Came for the Blackhawks game, there are tons of tv's everywhere so you can view the game without straining your neck. I had an awesome salad which was very filling. Probably not very very healthy but nonetheless delicious. I can't recall the name but it's pretty much a wedge salad with breaded chicken. If you don't like too much dressing I would ask for it on the side. Their beer selection is immense, and their Moscow mule was delicious, there are chunks of Apple in it which I had as desert lol. I saw a flyer for $2 mimosas for weekend brunch... Looking forward to checking that out. My significant other had a burger and he was quite content with it, tator tots were super crunchy on the outside which is how we like them. Parking can be difficult.

46.description: This is now my favorite place in Chicago. They have great food, a bunch of amazing beers on tap, multiple options of things with the word "flight" in the name, lovely service... I can't imagine a better place to kill some time between trains.

1.description: I've been here a few times as its only a few blocks from my home but nothing about it has ever blown me away. I think the prices are a little high for food that is just ok. They have a great beer selection its just a little overprices. For example, they are charging $9 for a Revolution Fistmas draft when you can find it for $6 a few blocks away. Minor things I know but just a little annoying. The service is always pretty solid but the place, at least when I have been in there, is never really that crowded.

55.description: Fried pickles. We even had to order two orders because they were so good! awesome beer list - finally a place with some breweries I haven't heard of on tap  and great atmosphere! Our server Heather was very attentive to our needs and super cool. Had an issue with the pretzel sticks and she took care of everything super fast! Get the ground mustard! Yum!

9.description: I am quite surprised by the number of sub par reviews for Tapworks. I tried it with my WL Crew a couple of weeks ago, and the consensus between all of us was this place rocks! Huge menu, plenty of beers on tap, and a cool sports bar ambiance. What's not to love?We came in on a Thursday night and were seated right away. The place wasn't empty, and it wasn't packed...just enough people around to people watch. We ordered a couple of beers, each of us a different one, and we all enjoyed. For food I tried the following: nachos, burger, and the pulled chicken. The nachos were solid...lots of toppings, but they needed to be distributed just a bit better...we took care of it by sharing pork and guac with the lonely chips. The burger was quite tasty and the pulled chicken plate was honestly better than a lot of BBQ joints in the city! So tender and the sauce was muy yummy....pair that with the BBQ sauce on the table and you will meet perfection! Unfortunately we didn't try dessert so I have nothing to report in that department. (Next time)While entering the bathroom I noticed Tapworks advertising for their brunch....ahhhhh $1.95 mimosas and bomb breakfast options! I can't wait to try it.In short, try Tapworks for yourself, I don't think you will be disappointed! Quality beers, quality eats in the heart of the West Loop:)

26.description: Glad to have this in our neighborhood and have been several times. Top notch bar food and a fine rotating list of beers. The service is consistently friendly and attentive. Only problem, this place has also been frequently understaffed. You might have to wait a half hour for that beer. Hope they get that kink worked out.

25.description: I went in here the first time with a co-worker to pick up some lunch we ordered.  The place looks nice it has a nice atmosphere,  typical bar to go and watch a game or have happy hour at.  Nothing spectacular.From looking at the prices and some of these reviews, I thought I was going to get some big massive meal that was going to knock my socks off.  I was very excited.  I ordered The Sunny Side Up Burger.  It was supposed to have a sunny side up egg, crispy pork belly and charred onions.  I have to say that this was one of the most tasteless burgers I have ever had.  There was absolutely zero and I mean zero salt... seasoning anything on this meat .. and it needed it.  It was a bland grey piece of meat. The Chunks of pork belly were a nice treat, but they were really too thick to fit on the burger.  So i decided to take them off and have some nice pieces of crispy pork... it needed some kind of salt too.  Not to mention the pork tasted like it was fried in the same oil as donuts... it was sweet.  The egg was over cooked.  I ordered a sub side of mac n cheese.  I think it was kraft blue box mac and cheese.  i'm not going to keep going.the meal was uber dissapointing.  I am definitely not going back for food.  Maybe beer.. definitely not cocktails, this is a beer place with out a doubt.  But then again you can get that just about anywhere.  I don't see the pizazz here that everyone raves about.  I am going to stick to Jack's Tap just west of there for food, same price but actually tastes good. Do it at your own risk!

12.description: I went in here the first time with a co-worker to pick up some lunch we ordered.  The place looks nice it has a nice atmosphere,  typical bar to go and watch a game or have happy hour at.  Nothing spectacular.From looking at the prices and some of these reviews, I thought I was going to get some big massive meal that was going to knock my socks off.  I was very excited.  I ordered The Sunny Side Up Burger.  It was supposed to have a sunny side up egg, crispy pork belly and charred onions.  I have to say that this was one of the most tasteless burgers I have ever had.  There was absolutely zero and I mean zero salt... seasoning anything on this meat .. and it needed it.  It was a bland grey piece of meat. The Chunks of pork belly were a nice treat, but they were really too thick to fit on the burger.  So i decided to take them off and have some nice pieces of crispy pork... it needed some kind of salt too.  Not to mention the pork tasted like it was fried in the same oil as donuts... it was sweet.  The egg was over cooked.  I ordered a sub side of mac n cheese.  I think it was kraft blue box mac and cheese.  i'm not going to keep going.the meal was uber dissapointing.  I am definitely not going back for food.  Maybe beer.. definitely not cocktails, this is a beer place with out a doubt.  But then again you can get that just about anywhere.  I don't see the pizazz here that everyone raves about.  I am going to stick to Jack's Tap just west of there for food, same price but actually tastes good. Do it at your own risk!

59.description: I feel like I owed them a second chance, so I went back for lunch today.  This time, I got the wings.  I will be bluntly honest-  they were overpriced and not very good at all.  On top of that, 6 wings for 10 bucks?!?!  I feel like I just got robbed on the green line!  However, I will go to their happy hour today.  Hopefully my third time back will be a charm.

21.description: Have come here for brunch several times. The food is extremely inconsistent. We usually order the exact same thing and it has been different each time. Ordered an omelette yesterday and it came flat as a pancake (no omelette fold over) and didn't have all the described ingredients. The service was also terrible. The waitress visited our table maybe twice during the meal. Didn't ask if we wanted more coffee, water, etc. She also didn't bring the toast that came with the food, and when I asked where it was she didn't know my meal came with it. As we needed more water, etc. we watched her standing at the bar drinking a beer with the bartender. The restaurant was not busy and she was extremely inattentive. Overall an underwhelming experience and we will not be returning.

17.description: Stopped in for a couple of beverages and appetizers. Great Food, great selections on tap and amazing service.

10.description: Came here on the first nice day this spring and got a primo spot by the open windows.  It never really got busy, though, which surprised me.  This place is great!  I hope they stick around!The menu reads like my dreams.  The whole thing is basically food porn, so pace yourself.  I came in knowing I wanted the Chilaquilles, but I was sooo tempted to go off course.  I didn't, and boy am I glad.  They.Were.Amazing.  You get a huge serving for $9 (no one finished theirs, we probably could have shared), and it's got a great kick.We started with the fried pickles (always a winner!) and the Southern Fried Mess (the name of my band in college).  I mean, it's basically poutine with smoked pork and tater tots.  How could you not???I didn't imbibe, but the bloodies looked great, they came with a nice slice of crisp bacon and fried pickles.  You can't beat the $2 mimosas.The value is spot on, we got a ton of food for not a lot of money, and the space is cool.  The service was pretty spotty, given we were one of three tables in use, but we weren't in a hurry so it was fine.  Definitely recommend!

5.description: Great happy hour spot.  Items our table tried during a recent visit: nachos, southern-friend mess, big quesadilla, bacon fat popcorn, hummus & pita, and probably others I'm forgetting.  Not to mention a huge beer list.  The staff did a great job keeping up with our large party of 12, and especially great at accommodating us given that we didn't have a reservation.

3.description: Fantastic bar manager (Rob) and a beer selection that is not to be rivalled in the West Loop. The burgers are great and the employees are the absolute nicest people. Last and certainly not least, the atmosphere is old timber loft meets cool and cozy sports bar. Will definitely come back frequently.

35.description: I enjoy the food and am glad for the addition to the neighborhood, but when the bartender decides that she can't see you for 20 minutes even when the bar is half empty then I wonder how she gets to rob the owners by pushing customers away.  Good luck if you go.  Be prepared to wait.

19.description: An experience that started out bad and made it to average. I'd give 2.5 stars if possible but rounded up since I'm a helluva guy.When I arrived, I waited at the bar for at least 15 minutes and despite clearly holding my credit card in hand but somehow kept getting skipped over even though I was right next to a person who just got served and then the bartender would move to the other side of the bar and serve someone who arrived after me. Finally when there was no else to serve, I finally got a "what can I get ya?"For the second round, I was attended to quite quickly by a different bartender who was very polite and friendly - a tall guy wearing glasses. Tapworks Tavern & Grill has an excellent beer list and serves up bar food and BBQ. I didn't eat but the portions looked generous. They have about 12 flatscreens so it's a better option to watch a game in the West Loop.

28.description: Great food.  Everything I've had here is delicious.  They've got alot of beer and even wine on tap.  $2 mimosa brunch special on the weekends is a plus.This place is a welcome addition to the neighborhood.

45.description: Been here three times now (only had food once) but I think this is, as others have noted, a great addition to the neighborhood. Plenty of seating options and TV's.  Service has been satisfactory each time and the food was great. Very large portions for the price. Beer menu is extensive. They have also had good tunes playing each time I've been in. I hope this place sticks around. I'm looking forward to trying other menu items.

33.description: A great beer list including new names in the Chicago area. The burger was delicious. Great bar seating for a game.

43.description: I came here with a big group of friends for brunch.  We had the run of the place which was great!  We put 2 tables together in the window and enjoyed their bloody marys and mimosas.  The staff was terrific.  Very helpful and there when we needed them.  I can't say enough great things about the staff.  They keep this place clean and running like a top!  The bloodies and mimosas were delicious!  We started with fried pickles which were dipped in corn meal to give it an extra crunch.  Very good.  There was also some extreme tater tot thing with beer bbq sauce.  It had a ton of meat on it so I only stole a tot or two to try the sauce.  You can tell that there's beer in it.  Very interesting in a good way.I had the chicken and waffles.  It was a little on the dry side but you can ask for more butter and syrup.  They go kind of nuts with the cornmeal thing.  But it traveled well so my boyfriend enjoyed half of it.  The prices were all great too.I would come back here to hang out in a heartbeat.  This place is friendly, easy, and delicious.

2.description: I consider this my local spot whether thirsty, hungry, or both. The food is very good and portions are large. Hands down the best is the Texas Chopped Salad. I like almost everything I've tried here. Service is always spot on. Great selection of beer, per the name. I would love a bigger bourbon selection , and maybe a new menu. But that's only because I've been there 20 times :)

18.description: I came here with a big group of friends for brunch.  We had the run of the place which was great!  We put 2 tables together in the window and enjoyed their bloody marys and mimosas.  The staff was terrific.  Very helpful and there when we needed them.  I can't say enough great things about the staff.  They keep this place clean and running like a top!  The bloodies and mimosas were delicious!  We started with fried pickles which were dipped in corn meal to give it an extra crunch.  Very good.  There was also some extreme tater tot thing with beer bbq sauce.  It had a ton of meat on it so I only stole a tot or two to try the sauce.  You can tell that there's beer in it.  Very interesting in a good way.I had the chicken and waffles.  It was a little on the dry side but you can ask for more butter and syrup.  They go kind of nuts with the cornmeal thing.  But it traveled well so my boyfriend enjoyed half of it.  The prices were all great too.I would come back here to hang out in a heartbeat.  This place is friendly, easy, and delicious.

41.description: I am quite surprised by the number of sub par reviews for Tapworks. I tried it with my WL Crew a couple of weeks ago, and the consensus between all of us was this place rocks! Huge menu, plenty of beers on tap, and a cool sports bar ambiance. What's not to love?We came in on a Thursday night and were seated right away. The place wasn't empty, and it wasn't packed...just enough people around to people watch. We ordered a couple of beers, each of us a different one, and we all enjoyed. For food I tried the following: nachos, burger, and the pulled chicken. The nachos were solid...lots of toppings, but they needed to be distributed just a bit better...we took care of it by sharing pork and guac with the lonely chips. The burger was quite tasty and the pulled chicken plate was honestly better than a lot of BBQ joints in the city! So tender and the sauce was muy yummy....pair that with the BBQ sauce on the table and you will meet perfection! Unfortunately we didn't try dessert so I have nothing to report in that department. (Next time)While entering the bathroom I noticed Tapworks advertising for their brunch....ahhhhh $1.95 mimosas and bomb breakfast options! I can't wait to try it.In short, try Tapworks for yourself, I don't think you will be disappointed! Quality beers, quality eats in the heart of the West Loop:)

52.description: The staff is very knowledgeable about the beer list as well as the food. They are also very friendly, accommodating, and don't mind going out of there for a customers request.

50.description: We are excited that a new bar/restaurant opened because this area lacks options. It has a pretty standard bar menu and the food is decent. They have a lot of beer choices and a nice bar set up. They also have a pretty good brunch, French toast was delicious and the $2 mimosas were actually boozy. We brought our daughter and they were very accommodating. They only have high top tables, but they have tall high chairs. We brought a stroller and  had to carry it up the stairs to the entrance, but there was room for our stroller once up there (it wasn't crowded so not sure how that would work if it was packed).

4.description: I stopped by TapWorks with a friend on a Friday evening for a few drinks after work. We had a slightly confusing, yet enjoyable, time.Décor: It's pretty much just a bar. Well, more a sports bar (there are tons of TVs and the four-side bar is large) with plenty of tables. As you would expect, the lighting is a bit lower but it isn't "too dark," just enough to maintain a bar vibe. While it isn't a huge place there is plenty of space for nearly any size group and everything is clean and inviting.Bathroom: Clean and inviting, nicer than a typical bar bathroomStaff: Our waitress(es) were very friendly and nice, the only problem was that they couldn't figure out which one of them was serving our table. Luckily it erred on the side of either of them stopping by frequently, but the confusion was somewhat comical (especially given that we specifically discussed it with both of them and they stated they'd "chat with her and set it straight").Drinks: We only had beers but they have a solid selection (including the standard lights). In fact, they have a pretty extensive beer menu with plenty of craft beer on it. Additionally they have a full bar. But don't get me wrong, the menu looks REALLY good and I am already wanting to come back to try some of the stuff that seems right up my alley.Value: The prices are decent - not super cheap but not outrageous either.This is a good, solid spot to come just for drinks or for food (so it seems). I'm eager to return and try the menu.

6.description: Don't hesitate - get yo' ass in here on a Saturday or Sunday!  $1.95 Mimosas on the chalkboard outside grabbed our attention like a pervert grabs your junk.  Of course, I had to do my research on this place before I stepped foot in the door and my fellow Yelpers didn't disappoint.  Mixed reviews absolutely means I have to try it for myself and I'm glad I did.  My friends and I hopped up on the first high-top we saw and admittedly the seat felt like you were sitting on some odd incline that you kept slipping down.  I'd readjust and felt like I was sitting on an exercise ball trying to keep my balance.  Meh, no thanks.  We spotted the booths in the back by the kitchen.  AWESOME...I'm always up for drinks and a show because you can see right in overlooking the line.  The food that popped up on the pass had my meat-eating friends salivating.  I stuck with the sweet potato fries and they were a HUGE serving.  In fact, everything was an oversized portion which made this a bang for your buck.  We didn't have ANY issues with service but I'm convinced we had the best one out there - Heather.  She was on top it and we didn't go thirsty or hungry.We will be back for sure and will bring all of our friends and family here as I highly recommend it!

22.description: Went here a few months ago with a good friend to watch a Blackhawks game. We sat up at the bar and were immediately greeted by two attentive and friendly bartenders who took good care of us for the night, despite it getting packed later on. The food was served hot and delicious (we had the deep fried pickles), and the drinks came so quick we soon forgot it was a weeknight. I remembered it was a weeknight the next morning though (ouch). I haven't been back yet as I'm not in that area very often, but had a great experience the one night I was there. You should check it out!

15.description: Came in here randomly after waiting too long at a nearby restaurant. Service was great, the manager even got us a round of shots. Would return again.

57.description: Fan - stinkin -tastic. My besties and I had a delicious dinner here. Amazing veggie burger. Great fish and chips. Insane tap list and a helluva good old fashioned.  We will be back. Also want to give a shout out to our server Laura who was fabulous.

20.description: Not a bad sports bar, plenty of TVs.  Good service, great beer selection and nice menu of whiskeys.  I had fried pickles that were over crispy.  Good selection for dinner and beer at the bar.

36.description: Food was awesome, had an amazingly large drink selection and TV's everywhere to watch the games. Highly recommended.

14.description: I'm surprised at all the negative reviews. Every time I've been here, the food is great, the service wonderful, and the atmosphere is just how I like it.Brunch is my favorite, and I'm loving the Bloody Mary bar. I will say I think it is a little overpriced, considering it doesn't even come with a beer back (I'm from Minnesota, so that's important to me!!). However, every brunch meal I've tried has been wonderful. I have especially loved the breakfast burrito, the chilaquiles, and the pork tacos. My husband loves their breakfast hash too. Also, the portions are huge. Keeps me fed for the whole day!Their beer selection is excellent and I appreciate the knowledgable, attentive bartenders. It's one of my new go-tos in the WL, and I will definitely be back!

12.description: Need 4 foot alter candles for a newly installed art piece?  They have 'em.Need a favor from a random saint?  They have 'em.Need some votives for those empty holders?  They have 'em.Need to some incense to ward of evil?  It is here.Need a can of "Evil Go Away" to spray on your mean boss?  Yep, that too.The store has kind of a creepy smell to it, probably from all those herbs and scented things blending in the air and they have a lot of serious religious articles for places of worship but they also have some crazy stuff like sprays to bring love into your life, to get evil out of your life and to bring in a cash windfall.Do I think they work?  Still waiting for the love of my life to drop in with a boatload of cash while warding off evil but who am I to judge?

7.description: A very nice place with a lot of candles and Christian artifacts. The lady who helped me select the candles I was searching for, was extremely nice and very helpful. She really listened to what my needs were and made suggestions. She was very friendly and knowledgeable. Thank you, Sandra!

19.description: Your one-stop shop for any spiritual tools or trinkets you may need, including rosaries, icons, amulets, oils, powders, sprays, soaps, and books pertaining to Greek Orthodox, Roman Catholic, and Afro-Caribbean and Latin American traditions.  The shelves are crowded with products, the air is thick with paraffin, scented oils, and herbs, and the prices are very reasonable.  Candles in all shapes and colors, and for all purposes (petitioning for intercession from your patron saint, protection from enemies, luck in the lottery) are made in house.  Shelves behind the counter hold containers filled with herbs sold by weight.  The women who work here are very knowledgeable, and can advise you how to resolve any dilemma you may have.  As mentioned, this store caters to and is patronized by practitioners of varying religious and spiritual traditions.  Please be respectful.

1.description: This was a neat little place that we stumbled into by mistake.They have a candle for EVERYTHING. Every saint, every holiday. If you need good luck, purity, to be rid of bad things, to make money. You name it, they have a candle for it. There are aisles of candles of all different colors and sizes, as well as candle accessories like snuffers and matches and the like. There's also a section of cleaning products to cleanse the home, and a little section of books. I was pleasantly surprised that I own a few. It caters to a predominantly Christian clientele, as made evident by all the saints. That said, there are a few questionably pagan/hoodoo items that I was surprised to find there. To each their own. What I didn't like was the staff. They were really kind of snotty and rude, like if they didn't already know you they couldn't be bothered. It felt uncomforable being glared at like that, so we didn't make a purchase and we left rather quickly.Still, if you're in Greektown it's worth poking around.

2.description: This place is essentially a hoodoo / rootwork dream. They sell herbs and roots (high john and lucky hand, even!), mojo bags, oils, Florida water, candles ... basically everything! One small note though - they have a $20 minimum on credit card purchases.

9.description: Looking for Nag Champa-scented bar soap? Here it is.I think this place could be classified as a Greek botanica? Not sure. I'll call it a straight-faced occultist's/witch's supply store. And it's open to the public!  Honestly shocked this place only has a half-dozen reviews. Other reviews give a good description of the merchandise.  Last visit I saw a local tough guy STOCKING UP on "Contra la ley" votive candles. This place is no joke. Definitely worth checking out after your next  Greektown brunch outing.

6.description: I bought some incense because their 10 cent sticks smell really good. I was a little shocked at some of the items that are there, but I found them a bit fascinating. I talked to the woman who packed up my incense for me and it turns out they have been around for about 90 years.

18.description: Pretty cool shop with all kinds of interesting things pertaining to the spiritual side of things. I wouldn't really categorize this as a christian store.. it seemed more... well... the words that come to mind would be-and this is all in a nice way... hocus pocus-y, spiritual but not exclusively christian ... and dare I say this would be a helpful store if you practice witchcraft or for those that are superstitious minded. I would have stayed longer to look around more but I was short on time. I came here for holy water and picked up a couple of candles I will burn in private ;-) and a potion. Oh this potion better not be full of lies saleslady. This shit better work!!! Good thing it was all cheap if it doesn't. I'll be updating this review of course. The ladies that work here are really nice and helpful. Would I come back again? Of course! BUT ONLY IF THE STUFF I BOUGHT WORKS. So to be continued....

10.description: Biked over and got my St. Christopher and St. Francis medals, no sweat, including chains. There were three people working behind the counter and at least two on the floor and in back. All very nice, though that may have been a little pre-closing giddiness. In addition to all the candles and medals, there are crucifixes galore and statuary, incense, etc. It's got more of a novelty than pious feel. I mean, I don't think the cardinal shops here, or whatever the equivalent is in the Greek Orthodox church. If you're in Greektown, definitely worth a visit while you contemplate where to stop for tzatziki.

13.description: My Grandma always tells me I'm her favorite grandchild when I buy her holy water from here. But I just have to say... I was kind of annoyed at having to dart in the rain to the nearest cash machine to pay for it the last time I came in. This $20 minimum charge policy is not awesome in a store that has so much merchandise far below that price.

16.description: If you're in the market for a candle to bless your court case, cure what ails you, find love, or keep the devil away, Athenian Candle Co. is the place to be!

17.description: Great selection of Greek Orthodox icons, candles, Catholic statues and religious books............but the voodoo aerosol sprays have no business in a predominantly religious Christian store.What's the message here?  Whatever sells?

15.description: I love this place! It can be a little pricey but I really love the quality of their candles. Oh and the employees are super nice!!

0.description: Every time I come in here someone makes sure I can find what I'm looking for! I've never really needed much help, but when I overhear the employees talking to other customers they really seem to know what they're talking about. I'm pretty sure it's supposed to be a christian store, but it has everything I need for my Pagan ways! VERY inexpensive and has a very nice vibe. Go check it out!

5.description: This store is a great place to go for icons. They have a pretty decent collection of saints and liturgical scenes. They have medals, candles, incense and many other items. Nice to see that they're still going strong!

11.description: Five stars for keeping up the act better than any other aerosol devil spray voodoo candle shop around.Minus one for being rude.Minus another for having a $20 minimum for credit card charges in 2009.

8.description: Athenian Candle Company is a wonderful throwback to another era. Look in the back room and you will see employees making candles. Long live the independent business. Meanwhile, wander around the store....Do you need incense? a Crucifix? A book that lists lucky numbers? A spray that will keep bad folk away from your house? Some hair dye? Various icons? Beeswax candles? This is your place. If you need some Christian stuff or some crazy superstitious ju ju (was I being redundant?) then this is your place. I usually get some lovely frankincense here (my Catholic upbringing precedes me) as well as the charcoal needed to burn it. Employees are friendly and make you feel comfortable as you browse. This is an interesting store for people of a variety of faiths, and/or the respectfully curious.

3.description: Really like this store.. however; bought a spiritual XXX candle that keeps going out.  This candle will barely catch a flame.  It was on a table 2 for 10.95$.  I'm curious as to if these two candles keep losing the flame because they were old or poorly crafted.  Not sure which but I'm throwing them in the garbage and will make another attempt.  I will order the new ones direct from the manufacturer.  Otherwise, I'm satisfied with the store, their selections, and their assistance in what I needed.  I would recommend this candle/spiritual store.  Helen was super nice and informative.

14.description: You do hoodoo? I do, and Athenian Candle Co. sure beats ordering mail order. I don't necessarily think the help is totally hip to what they're selling, but they are very well stocked with product, so who am I to complain?

4.description: I am indeed a fan of Athenian Candle. This is a store for hoodoo, folk magic, lucky number and dream books, herbs, talismans and candles for a wide variety of purposes. If you spend more than $10 they give you the option to receive a "blessing" which smells very nice. They have a surprising assortment of magical herbs, washes and sprays, but a lot of the washes, though they smell nice, don't look 100% legit; more like fragrance and water. The reason why the store does not receive 5 stars from me is the parking situation (which is rough in general in Greektown) which puts time pressure on a visit here, and they sell candles with metal wicks, which are known to produce toxins. Double check the candles you purchase here and ensure you don't bring home metal wicked candles. Also, they do not accept credit cards for purchases under $20, an unreasonably high limit in my humble opinion. Stop in if you can!

58.description: Oh TBK, how I love and hate you at the same time. Love that it is open 24 hours and the food is cheap. I love eating here when I'm drunk. But workers that forget half your order (no sides and drinks with my burrito)and skirt steak without a fork and a knife or napkinsand nasty table topis annoying enough to make me not eat here when i'm sober.BUT i'll be back when i'm drunk to annoy you with my drunkeness.

56.description: So after a night of delicious shenanigans around the city, we ended up at TBK.  (Yeah, we're tight so we're on a nickname basis around here!)My steak burrito and my tostada satisfied a drunken need only a hole-in-the-wall type of joint could conquer.  And that's just what they delivered.Fantastic food.  VERY fast service.  Hot, fresh, awesome.I will be back...

29.description: Literally, not authentic and not healthy, and certainly not delicious. I ordered the Veg Nachos. When I got home I opened the box and it was nothing but processed goop and sludge. Everything was processed, especially the beans and cheese. I wouldn't recommend the food unless you like cheap, tasteless, unhealthy fast food. This is not what I had in mind. Nothing fresh on this menu item.

42.description: This place is the pettiest business establish I've ever dealt with. The owner/workers really don't care about accomodating the customer; in fact, their pettiness drives people like me away. 1.) They charge if you extra if you want tomatoes, onions,  or cilantro, on your food if it doesn't come with it.2.) They used to charge $.50 for a cup of ice water and now only sell bottle water.3.) They have a steak and eggs meal which is actually quite good. I asked if they could switch it to chicken and eggs and they wanted to charge me $1.20 extra. I never knew chicken can cost more than steak. 4.) On another occasion I called for a pick up order for the chicken and eggs and they said since it's not on the menu they can't make it, but they made it  for me a week before  when I was present at the restaurant and paid the extra $1.20. I'd rather pay a little more and have good service than a business that keeps nickling and diming me everything. It's a turn off man! I do it 2 stars because their food is pretty decent.

23.description: This place is usually pretty good but the past few times I've come to this place on a Sunday, it sucked. I've paid the extra dollar for avocado on my tacos twice now and both times the staff was too busy talking to each other that they forgot the avocado. Also the beans were cold and the rice dry. The chicken and steak weren't nearly as fresh as they have been in the past. I wouldn't recommend coming here over the weekend.

47.description: small mexican restaurant with decent service that's open 24/7.. pricing is not bad either!i ordered a king steak burrito plate and steak super nachos with fries instead of chips..i notice they use cheap steak compare to other mexican restaurants... it is the worst mexican steak meat i ever had actually...the king burrito plate comes with a burrito , beans , and rice... the beans and rice was average and the burrito wasn't all that great since the steak was terrible..the super nachos with fries was goood even tho i took out the steak... it had cream cheese, nacho cheese, guacamole, and the meat of choice... but it was good! i could only imagine how much better it could of been with better meat with it..i will give this place another try and update my review .. just because of the super nacho fries was so good.. maybe their al pastor or chorizo will be better?

8.description: For the price better than Taco Bell this place is great!! I had the quesadilla. The chicken is pulled not any of the packaged stuff and the green chile sauce has a great spice that brings out the cheese and taste of the tortilla. Great place will be back for sure.

31.description: I went here with some friends and was surprised to find out they have vegetarian options hurray! I ordered the veggie taco it was pretty good. The place was small and crowded but open late.

34.description: This is definitely the after club/bar place to hit up. It doesn't matter how late is it the line is always out the door. Oh and ladies prepare to get hit on, the guys here will try relentlessly to get any girls number lol. I always get the carne burrito and it never fails!

16.description: Awesome tortas! First time eating there this weekend and I'll definitely go back again! Try their horchata as well!

13.description: The worst food (let alone Mexican) I've ever had in a restaurant. I bought chicken tacos and the taco just ripped and fell apart the moment I grabbed them. Everything tastes like a pile of mud. The people were very unfriendly and uninterested in serving. We were a group of four and none of us liked what we bought. The food is really bad and there is no restroom here. I would never set foot into this place again in my life.

11.description: Came here with my friend one day late at night because we were both bored and a little hungry. My friend warned me it was just okay, but we came because it is open late and it is close by. I ordered two steak tacos with cheese and they were okay at best. I had many tacos all over Chicago and this place unfortunately did not satisfy my taco cravings. I will probably be back if I am craving tacos late at night, when other local taco joints are closed. Service was good and friendly and parking might be a hassle depending on what time you come.

39.description: "Taco Burrito King has the best late night food in Greektown, it says so on the sign."

37.description: Yes, I'm a Taco Burrito King like-er.  It's not glamorous but a good option for those late night cravings of the unhealthiest kind.  Need a little somethin, then the Junior size burrito might just do.  If not, then the King or Super King size surely will fill you up. TBK has more than just burritos. They have all the other usual Mexican fast food fare. Breakfast options too.  Oh, and veggie options are served up at TBK. Open late so if you're in the area, easy street parking in front will get you in/out in a jiffy.

0.description: The staff is friendly enough and the food is a good value. It is semi authentic Mexican and good for a quick meal. I would recommend the combo platter which is a good taste of everything.

38.description: GOOD Burritos!! Their food is definitely on the heavier side but tastes great, are open late, and have really friendly staff.

51.description: This place had reallly delicious almost-pulled, marinated chicken (for the burritos/tacos). I just wish it wasn't so... drippy. My bag started to leak on the way back to the office (I only work a block away!).Really big, fulfilling taco. Delicious chicken! Oh, the nachos are DELISH!!!Next time I'll try the tacos. :)

27.description: This place is amazing. I get the tostada's and the chips and salsa. Greatly priced and clean.

32.description: This is basically the best after bar food EVER.  The burritos are huge and decently priced.

54.description: I come here around once a month. I have tried some different dishes of the menu ( I always get something different since I love to experiment with food). They have quick service and consistent taste. I like this place!

48.description: Good fast food joint for cheap Mexican food.  The steak burritos are good, but if you eat them too often (i.e. for lunch once a week), you'll get tired of tangy sauce.  The sauce they use on the red meat will drive you away from eating there too regularly.  Even with a line of 5 to 10 people you can get your made to order food relatively quickly. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat at this place, but if you are in the area and looking for something other than the typical fast food, it's a good option.Also, the only bad thing I can say about TBK is... DO NOT EAT THE CHICKEN!  I was warned beforehand by a couple of people, but since I'm not a picky eater I tried a chicken burrito.  I've only had bad chicken at two places in Chicago, and this was one of them!  It was cooked till the meat was really dry and even when placed in a burrito with all the other ingredients, the bad taste overwhelmed me.  I could only eat a portion of it and ended up throwing the rest away.

44.description: a must-stop for my son's horchata fix

24.description: My husband brought me here to take me on a walk down memory lane (his memory lane) since this used to be one of his spots back in college. He's only had the steak quesadillas and said they were really good. And yes, to my surprise, they were REALLY good and had a good amount of steak in it. We ended up trying some of their tacos too since I'm a big fan of those cilantro and onion simple tacos. Unfortunately the tacos came American style with lettuce and tomatoes I think, which kinda ruined it for me. Slightly disappointed, we went to wash our hands (they have a cool little sink for customers) and my husband tapped my shoulder and pointed to the grill in their half kitchen behind the counter. Sure enough, they were making tacos with cilantro and onions. So I guess they do make if there and we just didn't know how to order it.It was good enough to come back, but not amazing. But because I saw those tacos on the grill, I might come back for one more try.

7.description: So after spending time in Southern California and experiencing the plethora of Mexican cuisine there, I return to my old stomping grounds of UIC. I think the food is ok; my belief is that you definitely need to be under the influence of something (alcohol, weed, super glue, drinking a bottle of bleach, etc...) in order to enjoy.  As previously stated, the food is just your run-of-the-mill greasy slop. But what really put me off was the fact that the staff is very rude, and I even saw a cockroach dart across the floor. Yeah, there goes all my food into the trash after seeing that. Please go to a different place, and I'd maybe give it a second chance if they got their act together...

49.description: I'm speaking from the standpoint of being a vegetarian.  I loved this place while I lived in Chicago.  Plenty of menu options.  I usually ordered the torta sandwich and an horchata to drink.  The torta was flavorful, filling, and the horchata was sweet and cold just like it should be.  They were also very accomodating for any requests/changes I wanted to make to the menu items such as cooking with less oil, cheese, etc.  I'm definitely a big fan of this place.

40.description: Not tasteful, but decent

53.description: Mediocre mexican food served by mean employees who make no attempt to hide how much they hate you. Lots of bones in the meat and no matter how you ask for your burrito it will be made incorrectly.

30.description: Good place, if you need a quick bite to eat and enjoy Mexican food. The super burritos are especially awesome - they are big and cheap. Great tacos. 'Nuff said!

46.description: Sure I understand that it's a inexpensive restaurant surrounded by Greek restaurants but I didn't expect to buy a burrito and felt as though I would have been better off going to chipotle. Don't get me wrong, I've only eaten here once and it wasn't awful but it wasn't superb either. It's a cute (in a dingy way) burrito shop. I'm going to try it again and come back to update but don't let my one not so great experience stop you from trying this could be great late night joint.

1.description: Food still not bad but their horchata sucks now =( Ive gone several times in the past year and maybe its a new recipe but it reminds me of expired milk, blegh. Also they sometimes have to be told what their own monthly special is lol

55.description: amazing food makes it worthwhile eating in a place with impolite staff and low hygiene.

9.description: My husband brought me here to take me on a walk down memory lane (his memory lane) since this used to be one of his spots back in college. He's only had the steak quesadillas and said they were really good. And yes, to my surprise, they were REALLY good and had a good amount of steak in it. We ended up trying some of their tacos too since I'm a big fan of those cilantro and onion simple tacos. Unfortunately the tacos came American style with lettuce and tomatoes I think, which kinda ruined it for me. Slightly disappointed, we went to wash our hands (they have a cool little sink for customers) and my husband tapped my shoulder and pointed to the grill in their half kitchen behind the counter. Sure enough, they were making tacos with cilantro and onions. So I guess they do make if there and we just didn't know how to order it.It was good enough to come back, but not amazing. But because I saw those tacos on the grill, I might come back for one more try.

26.description: Ordered two tacos (Chorizo & Pollo) *Personally, I'd go with Pollo over Chorizo. Also, I snagged a Carne Asada Quesadilla which hit the spot for sure! Simple: Cheap, Cheerful staff, and stomach pleasing food.I'll be back!

25.description: Ordered a taco salad no shell and they sent me a plate of beef, jalepenos, and tomato literally swimming in a pool of bright orange coagulated nacho cheese!  I ordered a salad, how do you forget the lettuce!???  They did exchange but were not apologetic at all and basically said it was my fault for not specifying what type of cheese I wanted.  Wth!!!  Stick to the burritos because apparently they can't do simple things like taco salads.  They can however send you the nachos hold the chips!!!!

12.description: Best drunk food ever! Great hole in the wall Mexican food. Open all night. Have eaten here sober as well. Just as good.

59.description: I love this place I go to uic and it was the best drunken food ever it's like a ritual/tradition kind of a thing. Go out, get drunk, get tbk and knock out after. Great tacos and burritos. Even they're rice is good! I definitely recommend this place!

21.description: I ordered a King Burrito with no sour cream. My receipt said "no sour cream". I asked if the burrito had sour cream when it was handed to me and was told "no sour cream". I get back to work and it looks like I was given extra sour cream and I don't have the time to return it. Guess it's back to Chipotle next time I want a burrito for lunch.

17.description: Decent place for Mexican food in the area. Last time I had a chicken burrito which was soggy and it fell apart. Never had an issue at any other place. They do have a daily special which is nice....

10.description: Best late night eats to silence that monster in your stomach after a whole night of partying (or not, who's judging?) but then again, everything tastes better when inebriated ;)My orders here varies, I'd get the nachos, quesadillas, tortas or tacos and of course a huge cup of the horchata.I love that this place closes really late (5am on Su-Thu and 6am Fri-Sat), I will never go hungry in this part of town. :D

5.description: This place is so disgusting I'm not one to talk bad about a business I personally am a big fan of the one in Niles this particular taco burrito King is disgusting I don't recommend anyone to go there they will get you sick and not to mention the night staff on a Wednesday  night are so rude don't waste your time or money you will be disappointed.

3.description: So the first time I ate here was a total disaster! I ordered the steak burrito, and upon digging in I'm pretty sure that what I ate was not steak o_O, in fact, I'm not sure what it was. All I can confirm is that it was WEIRD. I may be a tough Mexican food critique but I can assure you that this is not authentic. My Mexican cravings drug me back in to give the place another try (thus they get a second star). This time I tried the CHICKEN super nachos. They were a tad bit amateur for my liking, but it was not as bad as my first fail. It came with chicken, guac, tomatoes, jalapenos, & can cheese (carnival style,ugh). Overall, I give the place two stars just for those of us who often have Mexican food urges, this will cure the call... but eat with caution o_o.

35.description: best place for quick mexcian food!!!!

19.description: Ordered a taco salad no shell and they sent me a plate of beef, jalepenos, and tomato literally swimming in a pool of bright orange coagulated nacho cheese!  I ordered a salad, how do you forget the lettuce!???  They did exchange but were not apologetic at all and basically said it was my fault for not specifying what type of cheese I wanted.  Wth!!!  Stick to the burritos because apparently they can't do simple things like taco salads.  They can however send you the nachos hold the chips!!!!

28.description: UPDATEI went to TBK last night and I was thoroughly disappointed. The guac had sweet onions or yellow onions instead of red so it left a gross, unnatural aftertaste. There was no jalepeno or cilantro, it was just one note of avocado and yellow onion. Nasty. And the chips were stale, don't plan on going back.

45.description: If you're ever looking for great tacos at an affordable price, Taco Burrito King is the place to go.  What I like best is that the staff is friendly and fast.  To top it off, it is open 24 hours a day.  Instead of McDonalds on the way back from the club, consider Taco Buritto King.  Your stomach won't be upset with you the next day.

33.description: Most TBK's are great spots for late night after drink munchies.As you may know, this location is very busy.  Last time I went in early November 2012, I had the worst food poisoning in my life.  The food was undercooked and somewhat off.  Normally I don't care about undercooked food because I have a strong stomach but now I know better.Less than two days later my stomach was so bloated, and I became so sick, I was rushed to the hospital and  I'm still paying my bills.No matter what experience you get here, its not worth the risk with careless workers at this location.

43.description: delicious, cheap & open late. Can't say I always feel safe here, though. Always seems to have some overly loud, arguing crowd hanging in or outside which explains the security guards at a taco joint.

2.description: I've been here a couple random times and both times the food was very saltyThe time I had a torta and the second time I had a quesadilla so both were different optionsI did not care for the guacamole eitherThe place is dirty too

18.description: Ordered two tacos (Chorizo & Pollo) *Personally, I'd go with Pollo over Chorizo. Also, I snagged a Carne Asada Quesadilla which hit the spot for sure! Simple: Cheap, Cheerful staff, and stomach pleasing food.I'll be back!

41.description: I have to give a 3 star rating because this places is okay with great food. Every time I visit the place I get great food, as long as I don't order chicken; it always seems like the chicken is days old in taste. This would have totally been a 5 star place for me because it's in the west loop, cheap, open late night and has good food continuously. The chicken I mentioned earlier wasn't my meal, I've tried some of my friends meals, I smashed my steak burrito meal every time. The biggest problem is the workers, their attitude is incessantly shitty, and makes me skip out on going there sometimes, but I just can't give anymore money to chipotle. They always get mad at me when I say no beans; The beans are good, but I get sick every time I eat them, besides it's my food, my money, I want it my way.

52.description: Not great food.  However, there's not a ton of fast food Hispanic food in the area.  Ground meat is fatty, steak/chicken is dry.  All the other ingredients are meh.  I ate here regularly cause my office was across the street, but I wouldn't suggest it to anyone.

50.description: i like cheap mexican joints! no problems here. i love their veggie burritos because they give you onions and peppers and shit instead of just plain rice, beans, and rice. tacos are okay, too, although i feel they're a bit pricey. i've never had a problem with the staff being mean; i've always thought of them as kind of nice. horchata was acceptable, nothing amazing, but sweet and tasty. i love the convenience of a mexican joint open late so close to uic. good job, taco burrito king.

4.description: They never come out to clean the tables, surprised the health dept hasn't shut it down.

6.description: I don't know who would eat tbk sober,  especially at this location. I have came here many nights some I remember most of them I dont. Lines can be long on weekend nights.  The food here is typical drunk fillings, greasy, cheesy, salty. It does it purpose, and fills a niche of being open 24/7, but simply on food I wouldnt come here sober.

22.description: Best late night eats to silence that monster in your stomach after a whole night of partying (or not, who's judging?) but then again, everything tastes better when inebriated ;)My orders here varies, I'd get the nachos, quesadillas, tortas or tacos and of course a huge cup of the horchata.I love that this place closes really late (5am on Su-Thu and 6am Fri-Sat), I will never go hungry in this part of town. :D

15.description: Very accurate orders and food is delicious. Mainstay for this family unless the food keeps coming out cold (let you 25) stable

57.description: Good food, good lunch specials, good service... you get the idea.  One of those places you can go and depend on a decent inexpensive meal.Its also one of those places you kind of forget to go back and compliment, because they are just so quietly consistent.  :)

20.description: I eat here frequently because it's convenient (and is open almost 24/7). My experiences have been varied. Sometimes the food is actually very good, other times it's soggy, bland, and gross (a friend of mine pulled a chicken bone out of her taco once). The staff are either friendly or rude. For some reason my card was declined there one evening, even though funds weren't an issue (I went across the street to Subway and it worked fine; and the next week I came back here without any problems). Just don't expect amazing things.

36.description: Anybody that gives this place less than 5 stars is no friend of mine.I have a physical addiction to their steak tacos.  Although they are priced higher at this location than any of the other locations I have been, they are still worth the money.  Two steak tacos with everything and a Coke Zero - that would probably be my last meal if I had to choose.  And I have no problems ordering that for lunch or at 2 in the morning after a long night of drinking.  TBK tastes good at all hours of the day!

14.description: Unfortunately, I was persuaded by a cab driver to  come here versus a great taco place in bucktown. I've never had a taco that has zero flavor and what I can assume is actually not steak in my steak taco. I would not settle on this place, you deserve better.

3.description: A big THANK YOU to Crystal, the manager, at this Game Stop. I only like to leave reviews for businesses and people who go above and beyond and she did that for me.  No other Game Stop would help me over the phone, but she did and so quickly solved my PlayStation Emergency that I was surprised at the other locations not willing to help me.  We had a PlayStation hiccup that she helped me with in 2 minutes and went above and beyond to text me my receipt copy to my phone.  Genuine, helpful and kind, we will only go to this GameStop now because of her and her associates. Every time we go there the they are helpful.  Crystal, I wish I had a picture of my boys face today when I showed him your text with his BETA codes for his game. we are coming in the next time she works to personally thank her.  A kind act makes someone's day.

1.description: Yeah I went to this GameStop and I had a good time. Talked with the worker (manager?) about Final Fantasy 13 series and then I bought Lightning Returns. It's probably not a great game, but the premise sounds weird, so why not...

2.description: For such a technology-forward company, this is actually the Land Where Time Stood Still. We stop in 1-2x a year to buy or switch out games...me and the kids dread coming here. It has to be the slowest, no the awfully slowest staff I've ever seen. They are nice yes. But man. Never more than one person working and each transaction even to purchase one game takes 7-10 minutes. Wow. Lord. My kids are growing up just waiting here in line. We wish there was a better option nearby. We may just have to switch to eBay or Amazon.

9.description: These guys sold my PS3 on me. Probably to one of their friends. I asked them to hold til Monday morning and I came in an hour after they opened and they said they sold it. Mind you I put $100 preorder deposit down on it months ago and I have a job so I couldn't race in and get it when it was released. Never going back to this location. I read some other reviews and it looks like this location has an issue with that!

10.description: I'm a casual gamer. One who doesn't mind calling himself a gamer, and furthermore likes to maximize his time playing video games. I'm married so my time playing video games is limited to when my wife is asleep, out of town, on a girls night, or is participating with games like Rock Band or Dance Central (which somehow aren't as valued as Battlefield 3). This all means that what I select better be good. Between my responsibilities and the wife's approval I don't want to waste time with crap games. And, now that you have a background on me I'll start my review of why I give this Game Stop 5 stars.First of all, the staff is super knowledgable. And, not just "my style of game is the best" knowledgable, but "you've got a wife, like shooters, don't have a ton of time, and need something for you" type of knowledgable. They have never lead me down a path that I've been dissatisfied with. They are friendly, and if you take the time to ask questions, you'll see how professional they are. I don't feel judged by them when I shake my fat ass to Dance Central or plan a night of DJ Hero with my silly friends (not like all of you reading this might be judging me).Also, this shop has parking. The shop is located well. It is a place I enjoy going to, and at the end of the day is much more the type of place to get great service then say a big box store. I like to support the local shop, and I truly like personalized service. I assure you going out of your way to buy here, and engaging the staff will be a great decision.

4.description: Did not realize how many options are out there and how complicated buying a gaming system has gotten (I was buying this as a gift for my daughter, so I was admittedly clueless). Went to Target and was not convinced that the salesperson gave me a complete and accurate run down on the different systems; pros and cons, etc. Thankfully I held off and went to Game Stop on Halsted. Within minutes of talking to their guy, I knew what to get and was out of there.

6.description: This location has some of the best customer service that I have seen in a while. The store manager was very warm and welcoming, and made sure that I got a good deal for the system and games that I was purchasing. Even though it is quite far from my home, I would definitely travel here so that I can continue to get the great customer service that I know they would give me.

11.description: Excellent customer service at this location. The employees are always in a great mood.  The store is organized and clean plus the employees are very knowledgeable.  Thank you!.

12.description: That's just weird to write about a girl like that on yelp.

5.description: The worst customer service I have ever received. The associate said he did not know the return policy, he did not want to educate himself with any of the stores policies. He also told me to come back in 2 days to purchase the item when the manager was in. He was very ignorant, did not know any of the future Console information etc. I am surprised this location is still in business. Very upset with this location.

7.description: I went here couple of times due to the close distance to my school. The cashiers there are friendly most of the times. But some of them really lack the knowledge about return policies and prices of the newer games. They didn't know the deals that were going on. Last time, I was looking to buy a game as a gift. I took their advice for it and got a new game. They told me about their return policy in case the gift receiver doesn't like it....well let's just say the game couldn't be returned. When we wanted to trade a game back, the price offered was so low that I'd rather keep them for myself. I haven't been back there since. I like GameStop, and I would recommend getting used games from them. Newer games and other gadgets...I'm not really a fan.

8.description: Always a fan of the franchise. The people are helpful and don't hold you up longer than what is necessary.
