I can speak for this location as well as the location on Broadway & Irving Park. I used to live up North so that was my go to shop and it too was fantastic. I love going in just to browse and I love going in even more when I know I will be purchasing something. The staff always makes it a much more enjoyable experience. I'm sure any Gamestop location is like this. I've never had a bad experience.

0.description: This location is awesome. A tall employee with glasses and longer hair gave me some top notch customer service. I thanked him for his work and he just told me to pay it forward. What a legend.

1.description: I scheduled a 90-minute massage for my boyfriend and myself (both members) on a Friday for a Monday morning appointment. This location doesn't have couples massage rooms. It's been a while since I've used one of my services since I learned Stephen no longer works there *insert long, dramatic sigh*. Every time I come, I'm offered water or fresh hot tea. We weren't offered anything this time, but I imagine it's because we arrived so close to our start time. My therapist was Jasmin, and she was fantastic! Throughout the massage, she checked on me to see if I was ok (I had the sniffles and she kindly offered tissue). During the second half of the massage, when she had me flip to my back, I noticed the light was a little bright but decided I'd adjust and not say anything. As if she could read my thoughts, and right on time, she asked if she could adjust the lighting for me. There were a few moments like this that caused me to love her even more! She was like magic! It felt like both hands were on me the entire time, but I know she kept adding the massage lotion. I don't know how she did it but she's great! The room was a little chilly but the bed was heated and the sheets were very warm. I didn't think I would find someone after Stephen, but I'm glad I did. One thing to note: I'd decided to cancel my membership a while ago, I just hadn't gotten around to going in to do so. If you want to cancel before your one-year is up, you have to submit a written request for approval from the manager. I haven't had many memberships, so I'm open to the idea that this may be standard, but I was still taken aback. I'm now well beyond my one-year, and inquired about terminating my membership. I was given a letter (about how I'm a valuable customer..) and told that a manager would get back to me within 48-hours. I guess it's not as simple to cancel, even after the one-year requirement has been met?

9.description: I have yet to find a good massage therapist here.  I always come in for a deep tissue massage because I work out and dance a lot.  I have yet to find someone here who can give me a deep tissue massage. I even had one guy walk out on me doing a massage saying that my body was not responding.  He ended the session 15 minutes early.  I always walk out disappointed.  I have had better results at other Massage Envy's.  I will not be going to this one anymore.

23.description: Everyone deserves a little TLC, and that includes me.  This is the closest Spa Envy by me.  This location just opened back in March, and I've been wanting to try it out.  So couple of weeks ago, when my back and shoulders felt real tired and restless, I decided to give them a call.  I got an appointment later that evening, which worked out perfectly.  Naomi, the girl at the front desk was very friendly.  She did try to upsell me the membership, but was respectful when I declined.  Naomi was just doing her job.  She didn't keep pushing like other reviewers mentioned about this place.  And I'm glad she didn't because that would have been a complete turn off.  My massage was okay, but not great.  The MT was pushing me to only ask for her next time because she is the only one that does this towel technique thing.  She also instructed me to only request to use the mint massage oil next time because she is allergic to the other scents.  So, if I pick another scent she won't be able to service me.  I found this a little weird and uncomfortable.  I don't frequently get massages, but I think I will return again, but I want to try other MTs there.

5.description: Shady, deceptive business practices. Will steal from you using fine print if you become a member. I filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau.

25.description: I would never go here again. As a regular massage goer, I always enjoy trying new places, different modalities, and finding therapists who are skilled in what they do. Massage Envy sadly takes all the joy out of the massage experience for me.The absolute last thing I want to do when exiting my session with any therapist is to be pitched about what I can buy, and how I should sign a contract to keep coming back. Half the reason I wandered into this place was to get away from the endless stream of advertisements and commitments and contracts of my day. It is supposed to be a time to turn off all that pressure, and unwind. I certainly do not want to buy a subscription to get massages, and find it unsettling how much this idea resembles that of a gym membership. Does anyone else remember the episode of Friends where Ross and Chandler are desperately trying to get out from under a gym contract, and it becomes abundantly clear this is never going to happen?If anyone really desires to get a massage a month for a reasonable price, buy yourself a groupon or living social deal now and again. Try new places, new therapists, and then you can find what you like and what works best for you. With any luck you'll find a place that sells a package of minutes (as many places do and many individual therapists do as well), and then you can use your minutes when you like, at whatever pace you desire, and have no obligation to buy another package when your minutes are used up. And if you happen to live in the West Loop, there is a place a few blocks west of this one, called Chicago Touch, and they offer reasonable prices, and packages for those who desire to buy minutes in bulk. They've got great therapists, and have never asked me to sign a contract. You also may want to consider a massage at one of the local massage schools (ie: Cortiva, Soma, etc) where students in the final stretches of their training are doing massage at discounted rates and offer pricing even lower than Massage Envy as an every day no commitment rate. Wherever your quest for therapeutic massage lands you, I hope it is not Massage Envy, as this is not a true representation of what massage is about. High pressure sales and financial contract should not be a part of any professional massage environment.

12.description: I agree with those that gave this place higher ratings. I'm surprised this place has so few stars!After reading about Massage Envy for at least a year or so, I made an appointment on exactly Sept. 30, 2013. I booked an introductory facial and massage. Both were awesome! Everyone was friendly and very helpful. Now everyone, listen closely, I personally love to research places that have memberships before I even consider speaking to an actual person about it. Why? Because an actual person's job is to get you to purchase a membership. Technically speaking no one can make you purchase anything you don't want. Even though I had already researched a lot about Massage Envy prior to this visit, I took the time afterwards to not just jump and start a membership. I asked more questions, I got my answers and more. So, there was no way I didn't know the deal beforehand. Stephanie was the one who I talked to FOREVER about the ins and outs of a membership. She was extremely patient with me, which was awesome since I really dug in and wanted to know what I was getting into. It's obvious that this chain of spas isn't at the highest possible zen and accommodation level, YET. However, so far I have gotten some awesome experiences here for the the price I pay. Each massage therapist is different which can be weird for some, but pretty cool to me. They listen to your needs. Some of them even let me know what I can do at home to continue my health and wellness needs when I'm not a the spa (besides the obvious of drinking water). Last month I had sort of a chiropractic experience, which helped me realize my left ankle is pretty bad and needs to be flexed and massaged more often lol. I have not encountered a lack of customer service, lack of respect, lack of anything that Massage Envy says they are there to offer and that's why I give them this rating.P.S. It's zen-like enough for me considering the fact that even though it shares a building with a grocery store, other establishments, is below a parking lot, and next to two busy streets and an expressway....I have yet to heard outside noise when being serviced.

21.description: Located in the same plaza as Mariano's in the West Loop, my wife and I decided to make an appointment for the both of us and try this place out. The introductory first time One-hour massage was $49 per person which is an amazing deal. So we made an appointment over the phone. The lady on the phone was very kind, helpful, and courteous. She took down all of our info and made the appointment. On the day, we showed up and were greeted with professionalism. The lady working there was very thorough with our forms we filled out and asked us questions regarding what we were looking for in regards to the massage type. The one hour massage was great. Both of us loved the professionalism and experience of our therapists. This place is great in regards to customer service and customer experience. They even have memberships which seemed like a great deal for people that live in the area or frequent massages. Definitely a great massage therapy session!

16.description: I did not know that when I signed a contract with this joint that I signed it in blood.  That part is my fault I should have read the contract carefully.  I do feel like they should make it clear that once you sign that paper they now own your soul.  My appointment was on 3/23/13.  The guy to preformed the service was really, really nice but he also had a TERRIBLE cough.  He said he had "just quit smoking" so he had a cough.  Lies.  I was sick two days later.  The massage was actually a lot more awkward than I'm putting into words but I'm being generous cause he was nice.  Just don't go to this place.  Any of them.  Ever.

17.description: I have been a member of Massage Envy for over 5 years.  I use to go the Streeterville location.  They have many good therapists at the Streeterville location.  I now live over by the West Loop and I am not impressed by the services of this location.  Every time I have come in for a deep tissue massage, I could barely feel the massage.  I specifically asked them on the phone when I booked the appointment for someone who is good at deep tissue. Today I left and the therapist let me out 12 minutes early and stated that my body was not responding because it was so tight.  When I came out, there also was no one at the front desk.  After waiting for a while a girl looks out from a door in the back room asking if I needed something.  She was on her cell phone and was the same girl who checked me in.  After telling her I was ready to check out, she said ok, give me a minute. Not impressed by this location at all.  It seems the people working the front desk do not know who to recommend based on what you are looking for or the therapists are just not good.

10.description: Had a facial with Mandy earlier this week. She was super sweet and did an amazing job! So amazing in fact, that everyone was complimenting me on my "glow" all week! The rest of the staff is also very kind and accommodating. Bonus: Parking is free for two hours. I will definitely be back!

11.description: This location opened up within the past month.  My boyfriend and I were excited because we wanted to try it since it is only a few blocks away from where we live.  The west loop location is located directly below Mariano's.  WE LOVE MARIANO's so we thought, wow, how convenient is that since we are at Mariano's almost everyday.  We decided to make an appointment during our STAYcation and relax.  They had an introductory rate of $49 for a 60 minute massage.  That is a good price for a 60 minute massage so this made us even more excited for it.  The downside to the actual facility is that they do not have a couple massage room. Now on to the rating... I am rating this location only 1 star because:When we got to the location, the first sentence that came out of the managers mouth who welcomed us in was, "Hello, Monica and Nate, you are late so we will get right to the paperwork and get you started."  That was a BIG turn off especially since this was our first time there and we were very excited.  I looked at my phone to see how late we were and it was only by 1 minute!!!  I think that it is extremely rude to greet your customers like that regardless if you are late.  I am sure she didn't mean it because she was trying to be nice but it just came out wrong and at the start of our service.  Now onto the the actual massage:My massage therapist was nice and asked me how I like my massages.  I think that is very important to take the time to listen to your clients needs.  I told her I like deep massages, especially since I was stressed and soar from work.  When she started the massage, it was definitely deep to the point where it hurt.  I did ask her if she can soften it up a bit and she did but for some reason she kept going back to a deep massage even after I asked her a few times.  At one point, she said, "well you said you like deep massages." I was shocked and irritated that she said that during a massage.  The whole time I felt uncomfortable and in pain.  I was hoping for the 60 minutes to be over and when it was I was excited to get out of there.  Now the check out time...When I left the room and went to the cashier, my boyfriend was already there waiting for me.  He was sitting on the chair talking to the manager.  I sat down next to him and the manager was very nice asking how everything was.  I didn't say anything to her about my massage because I felt bad and just wanted to leave.   The manager kept talking to us about who knows what and then tried quite a few times to get us to sign a membership on the spot.  She kept trying to up sell us the whole time even after I told her that I do not want to sign anything right now.  I actually laughed out loud at one point because it was so obvious she was trying to sell us!  After we left I told my bf about the experience and he had the same experience except that he wanted a deep massage but was given a soft massage....We will never go back again.

26.description: I did not know that when I signed a contract with this joint that I signed it in blood.  That part is my fault I should have read the contract carefully.  I do feel like they should make it clear that once you sign that paper they now own your soul.  My appointment was on 3/23/13.  The guy to preformed the service was really, really nice but he also had a TERRIBLE cough.  He said he had "just quit smoking" so he had a cough.  Lies.  I was sick two days later.  The massage was actually a lot more awkward than I'm putting into words but I'm being generous cause he was nice.  Just don't go to this place.  Any of them.  Ever.

I was shocked and irritated that she said that during a massage.  The whole time I felt uncomfortable and in pain.  I was hoping for the 60 minutes to be over and when it was I was excited to get out of there.  Now the check out time...When I left the room and went to the cashier, my boyfriend was already there waiting for me.  He was sitting on the chair talking to the manager.  I sat down next to him and the manager was very nice asking how everything was.  I didn't say anything to her about my massage because I felt bad and just wanted to leave.   The manager kept talking to us about who knows what and then tried quite a few times to get us to sign a membership on the spot.  She kept trying to up sell us the whole time even after I told her that I do not want to sign anything right now.  I actually laughed out loud at one point because it was so obvious she was trying to sell us!  After we left I told my bf about the experience and he had the same experience except that he wanted a deep massage but was given a soft massage....We will never go back again.

0.description: Been here a couple of times. This last time I had Victoria is she is great. Pretty thorough with questions and gave me one of the best massages. I was late, but I wish she had utilized the time until the end of the appointment, not sure if it was ended 5 minutes til the hour b/c of another appointment.  I bought the holiday special for the 3 month membership on a prior appointment. I would have considered 6 or 12 months but my job requires me to move frequently. I explained that to the front desk when I didn't want to get the 6/12 months but she was still hard selling me using a weird tone to answer my questions, so I wasn't too fond of that. Otherwise the massage experience itself was great.

20.description: The disgusting reason for a 1 star and why I would never return is that while paying, I scratched my head and a baby roach fell from my head onto a Massage Envy pamphlet I was handed. The lady behind the counter saw my disgust after I killed it and instantly blamed the Marianos upstairs citing a fruit fly issue. Having just showered prior to my visit I was absolutely appalled. Even if Marianos upstairs was to blame why would I return to a roach ridden building in light of the fact that employees are aware that vermin frequent the location and worst may be nesting in the facility. In addition, the fruit flys in Marianos, which I have seen, are not roaches. I have since contacted the Cook County Department of Health to investigate.

19.description: This place is horribly managed! I submitted 2 requests for an appointment online and received am email that someone world follow up on the phone to confirm.  That never happened!  So, silly me, I caked the next day to schedule a pre-natal massage on the phone. When I arrived they looked at me funny. Apparently the receptionist failed to make my appointment with a therapist who was pre-natal certified!  The best they could offer me to make up for their multiple mistakes was for me to wait 1.5 hours to see a prenatal therapist. What a joke- especially for a first time customer;  you'd think a business would want to leave a better impression!!! Even though they are located in my neighborhood,  I WONT BE GOING BACK.

2.description: I came here for a full body massage and a week later i came for a facial. The massage: The therapist would ask me questions of my issues, what areas i would like to focus on, and if there's any parts of my body i feel uncomfortable being touched (basically all questions on the form you need to fill out for the first time). It's good that she doubled checked everything with me. We started at 1:10 and ended before 2, so it was actually less than an hour. Is this normal with other places? I'm not sure coz i don't do massage on a regular basis. I like my therapist and the whole experience was good. If the front desk girl didn't hard sell me the membership I think i will give them a 4.5 star.The facial: It was a great experience and i enjoyed everything. Mandy is very good at explaining when she's doing my facial. She would tell me what she was going to put on my face and tell me how it would feel. I don't see a big difference of my skin appearance, but all the products she put on and rinsed definitely soften my skin. Also the music was so relaxing i almost felt asleep!

18.description: I am writing to inform  any potential customers interested in signing a  monthly membership with this company.If you would like to cancel a membership, you must move 25 miles away or provide a doctor's note that you can no longer receive a massage.None of this is explained to you when you sign up for a membership!

13.description: Chris was wonderful for a 90 min full body deep tissue massage.  It's a great place and great price if you are a member.

4.description: Called yesterady for a same day massage, and they were able to get me in by the afternoon. I had a 60 minute massage with Emma which was good. Sales reps weren't overly pushy about a membership this time around which I greatly appreciated.

24.description: Why does this place get so few stars? Cuz just the complainers care to review?? What a shame!This was my 2nd time to massage envy, the 1st was in Streeterville. Was treated both times, I guess if you are not a member it can be a bit pricey.I requested a male as I like deep tissue, and prefer more pressure than most people twice my size can handle. I am a petite female, but don't judge my book by it's cover, the more pressure the better!Luckily I got Sean who looks like he could play pro football. Usually I tell a therapist they can't hurt me if they try, but I knew he could crush me if he wanted to.He was excellent! He checked his pressure multiple times, and really helped get a lot of the tension I had built up in my neck and shoulders.I will certainly request him when I get the opportunity to return!I dealt with Courtney at the front desk. She was very nice. Is it her job to sell? Of course, and I understand; but you don't have to complain about it in your review, you can politely refuse.

6.description: I tried this place for the low price massage for first timers. The "custom massage" idea seemed fine until the actual massage therapist seemed clueless about what he was doing and asked me every single question I already filled out on the paper and talked through with the person who sat down with me beforehand. I've had enough massages to know that good massage therapists are able to just be able to feel for the areas on your body that are problematic, they have always found them for me. I told the massage therapist be could press as hard as he wanted and it was a pretty weak massage. That's why I usually prefer the male massage therapists, to have a very hard deep tissue massage, oh well. Then as I've seen others comment, the pitch they try to sell you as you leave has you walk out more stressed than when you walk in. The cheap massages here are not worth it one bit.

22.description: I have been to this Massage Envy location twice and I love it.  The front desk staff is as nice as can be and very professional.  My first time here I was running late and was frustrated because I knew that it would cut into my massage time.  That was when I found out that the actual massage was only 50 minutes, not 60 like they advertise.  I thought, "Oh no!  It's bad enough to have a couple minutes cut out of a 60 min massage, but to have minutes cut out of a 50 min??!!!"  (this is why I am giving 4 stars instead of 5, by the way.  I think if they say they do 1hr massages then the massages should be one hour, not 50 min)But they killed me with kindness, I guess you could say, and I ended up having a great experience and became a member.  By the way; memberships are how these people make their money, so if you don't want a "sales pitch", then don't go here.I've had Myron and Terrell for my massages here and will definitely ask for either of them next month when I go.  They both use really firm pressure and are very attentive to what you want.

15.description: Located in the same plaza as Mariano's in the West Loop, my wife and I decided to make an appointment for the both of us and try this place out. The introductory first time One-hour massage was $49 per person which is an amazing deal. So we made an appointment over the phone. The lady on the phone was very kind, helpful, and courteous. She took down all of our info and made the appointment. On the day, we showed up and were greeted with professionalism. The lady working there was very thorough with our forms we filled out and asked us questions regarding what we were looking for in regards to the massage type. The one hour massage was great. Both of us loved the professionalism and experience of our therapists. This place is great in regards to customer service and customer experience. They even have memberships which seemed like a great deal for people that live in the area or frequent massages. Definitely a great massage therapy session!

7.description: I can not believe that a place dedicated to help heal and relax the soul can be such a disappointment I went on board to join and paid my membership in full just to relax and enjoy without any financial burdens to my surprise I get a charge without my permission and was so unhappy with the way they handle my concerns they said that if I wanted to cancel I would need to come in person to cancel and will loose my massage I had already paid in full what a ridicules policy I now need to miss work and to top that off loose my prepaid massages what type of business are u running!warning do not go to any of these so called massage envy location not worth the stress, and so poor customer service

8.description: After being a member for six years they wouldn't let me use four services I had available unless I updated a credit card with them and continued to be a member.  What a racket.  Funny since I'll be doing an Ironman this year and would have given them so much more business for their not even decent sports massages.  Guess Athletico will be getting my business.

3.description: After two years of not going to ME we recently signed up again.  Our original membership was from when we lived in Texas so I'm excited that there is an ME so close to our apartment here in Chicago.Today was my first massage here and it was everything I had expected/remembered for the most part.  The massage itself from Dan was perfect and something I hadn't gotten before was a post-massage assessment about what to focus on for the next massage.  I'm kind of borderline on this one as it seems like sales pitch.  All the areas I said I had issues with were identified on the post-assessment.  Again, I'm borderline because I could feel the knots and such as Dan worked on me.  Jury is still out on that one but it may indeed be earnest.The absolute only difference I can attest to is so basic that it is hardly worth mentioning.  After the massage I was given my water in a plastic cup from one of those water coolers whereas the stores in Texas always gave you a bottle of water.  No biggie, I still feel amazing :)

14.description: Definitely a fan of this location, it's clean and easy to get to and park. I've been a member for so long because of my wonderful masseuse Steph. She's fantastic and sweet and always gives me tips afterward on how to stretch better. I always get a wonderful massage when I see her. I've been to multiple high-end places in my days and she ranks right up there!

58.description: My gf and I, along with a few of our friends, had dinner on New Year's Eve at Dine.  For the most part, I was not too impressed with the food.  The calamari was tasty but had way too much batter and not enough squid.  My gf also got a cup of lobster bisque, which tasted more like Tom Yum soup.  Don't get me wrong -- I like Tom Yum soup in general but not when I'm expecting lobster bisque.For our entrees, my gf got the fried chicken, which was good but no better than what you'd get at Popeye's.  That said, I'm not really sure if anyone can make fried chicken better than the good folks at Popeye's so maybe I'm being overly critical here.  As for my entree, I got the new york strip, which was well cooked but a bit on the cold side.  I suspect this happened because our server had to wait for the fried chicken to finish cooking so that he could bring all of our plates out at once.  On the plus side, their mac n' cheese was fantastic, as was the Red Velvet Cake we got for dessert.Service was decent, though I thought our server did not refill our wine glasses as promptly as he should have (there's nothing worse than not having alcohol at hand on New Year's Eve!).  At one point, someone (manager?  sommelier?) spilled a martini on my gf's coat by accident.  He was quick to apologize, offer his business card so that he could pay to have the coat cleaned and brought out another martini.  I was impressed with his classiness, as I've seen other places waffle about taking responsibility for spilling stuff on you.  Also, the complimentary valet parking is a nice touch.I can't say I loved my experience at Dine but I didn't hate it either.  I would probably give it another try since there were some other items on the menu that looked appealing.  If you haven't been before, it's definitely worth checking out -- just be sure not to set your expectations too high beforehand.

56.description: We went to Dine for lunch with a group of nine. The service was friendly, but our meals took forever (over a half hour) to arrive. This is unacceptable for lunch on a weekday. Otherwise, the food was okay to good. The two that had the vegetable wrap complained that the vegetable were too oily. My Portabello Raviolis were excellent though. Worth another try for dinner. As a side note, the kitchen is Kosher.

29.description: As of now I can't review the food, but I've been to the bar a few times, and it's always been a good place to hang out, watch a game or strike up some conversation. The bartenders and other staff are always friendly and attentive, as is the manager in the evenings. The space is large and open, and while some hotel bars can be a bit outdated, that's not the case here. Even if you aren't staying at the hotel, this would make a good place to grab drinks and/or dinner before a Bulls or Hawks game. Good beer selection, including some local brews, and the food menu looks pretty good too, but more on that next time.

42.description: Dinner last night was great!  I was a little nervous because in checking Yelp before we went, it seemed like the majority of the good reviews were quite some time ago.  Most of the reviews in the last year were not as complimentary.Well last night was terrific!  The calamari appetizer was very good and it was a huge plate.  The four of us were unable to finish it. Fresh.  Crispy.  Great flavor and nice presentation.The salads were great----highly recommend the beet and goat cheese salad with arugula.  The strawberry spinach salad was also excellent.A friend recommended the meatloaf and although it was very good over mashed potatoes and sauted spinach, the standout clearly was the scallops over mushroom risotto dish.  That alone is a reason to go back.Service was excellent and friendly. Value tip:  You can get $25.00 and $50.00 coupons for a few bucks at restaurant.com which makes this place a great value.  You can also book a table through opentable.com if you are into racking up points towards a $50.00 gift certificate.This restaurant is attached to the Crown Plaza hotel and if you valet the car at the hotel, have them validate your stub at the restaurant for no charge parking, minus the tip.Enjoy!

23.description: We enjoyed our stay at the Crowne Plaza Chicago - The Metro, and the bar at Dine was very pretty. The service was spotty, though. On a Friday night, the bartender was the only wait staff available, and it took her a while to take care of our drink order, and she didn't come back to our table very much. The prices were high, but expected, for a hotel bar in the area we were in. The fries weren't anything special, but it was $5 for one order (there were still a lot of them, just not very good.) The microbrews they had were good, but expensive. The second night we were there (Saturday) the lady seemed frazzled and rude. She barked at us and a couple of other customers when we accidentally sat in the closed restaurant area. It was busier that night, but not out of control. Seating was somewhat sparse, but not too close together that you were sitting on top of other patrons. I would recommend going out and trying other bars in the area over drinking at Dine. Dugans is particularly great, and only a block away, the prices are better, and the bartenders are more attentive. If you must stay at the hotel, it's not horrible, it's just not worth the prices, in my opinion.

47.description: Barf. We went here for Mother's Day dinner with my mom last night and today none of us are feeling too hot.  Our server tried, but he couldn't help the food, which was mediocre at best and disgusting at worst.  Among us we had scallops, risotto, crab cakes, a caesar salad and roasted asparagus, and the only thing I would ever eat again was the asparagus.

8.description: Very nice food, especially the burgers or the breakfast. However, service can be a bit slow, and prices are up there. Despite this, when our waiter was actually there, they always are very understanding and have never messed up my order.

31.description: My wife and I ate here a year ago because it is local for us. The restaurant was nice the food was all too salty. We have marked this on our do not visit again list and have stuck to it.

34.description: Went with a group of six for a weekday lunch.  The restaurant was freezing, the service was abysmal.  Unfortunately since we were a group of six, 18% gratuity was automatically included.  Normally I would tip 20% but this waiter would have been lucky to get 10% after we had to wave down the host for help during our meal and walk up to the waiter to finally get him to accept our credit card so we could leave.    The fries were good and the people who got the pulled pork and turkey sandwhich were happy with their food.  The veggie wrap and the buffalo chicken sandwhiches were not very good.  I'd have given it 2-3 stars based on food but service pushed it to one star.

16.description: Oh man, this place is odd. Definitely feels like a hotel lounge trying to be hip. The experience wasn't awful, but it was hilarious. First of all, it took a while for a server to come to the table -- I think it was the bartender doing double duty, though I did spy another surly server who made eye contact with me and didn't come over. My friend and I took advantage of the 1/2 off bottles of wine special (Mon nights) and that deal might just bring us back since we are often in the neighborhood on Mondays.The food was downright fascinating. We ordered a hummus & veggies plate and a side of mashed potatoes. Somehow it took almost 30 minutes for the food to arrive. Our server informed us that the kitchen had actually run out of BOTH but were willing to make both from scratch for us. Ok....The hummus was...not hummus. It was an oily, flavorless chickpea puree. Wrong consistency, no hint of garlic or lemon or any of the seasonings one associates with hummus. It would have been better for them to just go to the Dominick's across the street and buy some hummus.The smashed potatoes were better, but still bizarre. Almost a little bit sweet? They weren't terrible, but not what we were expecting.All in all, just a weird experience. And then at 10:45, all the lights came on because they close at 11. Strange.

13.description: This is a hotel restaurant. The food is good tasting and the service is quick and friendly. The portions are huge, particularly when ordering lunch or dinner. Breakfast, the meal I usually had here, was tasty and they had a good selection. Nothing terribly healthy, but you can customize your order to make it healthier.The atmosphere is good. It's comfortable and I enjoyed reading my morning paper while eating breakfast (yay hotel free papers!).

11.description: Perfect quiet place for the family. Easy to get to quiet, they meet my special requests, there are many. I order things that may not be on the menu.  One of my party,  didn't like what was served & they brought something different. The food is wonderful, I've never been disappointed.

39.description: Went last night.  Didn't realize it was located in a hotel until I got there.  That said the food was surprisingly good.  Was disappointed there was a large (empty) parking lot which we could have parked in ourselves, but we had to pay a valet (it's no longer free like in previous review posts).  I highly recommend the scallops appetizer with the polenta, and the risotto was fantastic too!

37.description: I'm surprised Dine isn't more busy. I thought the food was excellent. Nothing really creative but just good, solid, fresh food. They may have one of the best Caesar salads I've had. The romaine was super fresh and crisp accompanied by large crunchy croutons tossed in a quality dressing. Generous portion for only $6.The portobella mushroom ravioli was wonderful. Not too rich of a cream sauce, just right. Lots on peas to make me feel healthy.They have a great daily lunch and drink specials as well. The decor is a tad bland and basic but it is inside a Crowne Plaza.

0.description: I was hesitant because this is in a hotel but have been pleasantly surprised,  I stay here about once a month so I have eaten here often. Good is very good and portions are very generous.  Enough to share!  Soups are very good, sandwiches and burgers are fantastic, and breakfast is great.  I have never order a dinner so I cannot comment on meals.  Wine and beer happy hour and you can grab a free coffee to go in the morning if you are staying at the hotel.

38.description: Charges wayyy too much for a dismal breakfast. Seems like one of those places that only survives because people are forced to eat at the hotel because of logistics.The eggs were oddly powdery and slimy. The French Toast was soggy and tasteless. The granola was decent, though.I'd pay no more than $8 for the breakfast buffet, instead of $20. And for your $20 the waitstaff won't even be attentive in pouring your drink.

51.description: Went here with wife and aunt. Did not realize that it was a hotel restaurant. Just finding the place was a challenge since the address states that it is on Madison, but the actual entrance (past the parking lot) is on Halsted St. At least they have free valet parking which is a must in parking-challenged Greek town.The restaurant was mostly empty when we got there around 7:00PM. Our waitress, while cordial, was less than attentive with us, and seemed to pay more attention to the other tables seating more customers (= more tips). As the restaurant filled with more patrons, she became even less attentive. She even had helpers to serve the food and clear the tables, so she wasn't that busy. She simply liked talking to the men at the other tables instead of waiting on us.The food was decent, not great, but hey, it's a hotel restaurant. I had a rib eye steak ($38) that was trimmed in an abundance of fat (yuck) and topped with a couple spears of burnt, dry asparagus. Presentation was nothing special either. The red velvet cake was very good, but $11? It was also so huge, the 3 of us couldn't finish it. I expect that kind of dessert at Gibson's, not here.Overall, we were disappointed with service. The food was decent, though a bit expensive for the quality delivered. Valet parking was a plus, but not enough to salvage our opinion of the place.We probably won't be going back since there are better restaurants in the area that serve much better food in the same price range, with much better service.

27.description: Um, this place is in desperate need of a makeover.  The inside looks like an old banquet hall, but the waiters are dressed for a fine-dining restaurant.  I don't get what the theme is because nothing matches.Onto the food.  I was just going to order a salad because I'm on a diet, but I couldn't help but order the french fries because they sounded so good!  The fries were on their burger menu and everything else was on a separate menu.  Why?  Couldn't tell ya.  My food was good.  Not the best I've had, but not the worst.  My friend ordered the ravioli and it was very soupy.  My other friend got a pork sandwich (I think) and he was unimpressed.  Portion sizes were good all around.So, the bill showed that my fries were $5.  We all saw on the menu that they were $2.  I don't like to complain, so I was just going to pay it.  My friends would not let me.  They said that was ridiculous.  They asked the server about it and he said they were only $2 if you ordered off of the burger menu.  That makes no sense because fries weren't even listed at all on the other menu.  The server was apologetic for the confusion and even acknowledged that we're not the only ones this has happened to.  He had the manager credit the difference.Will I go back here?  Hmmm....I don't know.  I don't care about the price gouging, but I really, truly hate the whole interior of the restaurant.  It hurt my eyes.

32.description: This is a very nice hotel restaurant and great bar. Paul Jenkins the bartender is friendly and engaging and cracks people up. It's a great place to get warmed up before going out to a club or go to a Bulls or Blackhawk game. The people that go there are pretty chill. The food is pretty awesome. The chicken fetuccini alfredo is only the best I've ever tasted in my entire life. I will never eat that dish anywhere else but there...it's THAT good. They must put cocaine in it I swear...jk lol

54.description: It's a huge, airy space-- and, at lunch on a regular weekday, it's surprisingly empty (which was great for our big group). Dine is just a quick cab ride or a short hike from the Loop, so it's nice if you just want to get away from the crowded bustle that is downtown. They also offer complimentary valet-- which is great if you have friends driving in that don't want to waste time or money on parking. The food is standard, comforting, American fare so I settled on the Dine burger which was juicy, flavorful, and hit the spot. And I like that they have a free appetizer coupon online, which I gladly presented to our waiter despite my friends' embarrassment. Hey, you can't complain about free crab cakes. Haha. All in all, it's a nice place and I'd definitely come back.

48.description: I have been here a couple times for work lunches.  I really like the fried chicken but it takes 20 minutes or so to make so be prepared to wait.  The meatloaf is also a good choice.  I did have the daily special once which was soup and half a sandwich.  Disgusting.  It's not bad for lunch but I would not go for dinner.  It is always dead too so at least you know you'll get a seat.

44.description: They have a big fancy espresso machine behind the bar, but try ordering a macchiato, or an espresso, or even coffee and the bartender will tell you she doesn't "do" those. FAIL

24.description: Skip this place and here's why:I had made a reservation on Open Table for myself and 5 co-workers for a birthday lunch celebration for two of our team members.  We walk in and there is literally one other customer in the entire restaurant at a table.  Always a bad sign at the lunch hour, but I figured we were a little on the early side, so I'd give them the benefit of the doubt.  The hostess was on the phone taking what might have been the longest order ever.  She, along with two other staff members I spotted just let us stand there for at least 10 minutes while she continued to take down the phone order.  Finally she got off and I said we had a reservation, which was funny given no one was there. I let her know that we'd like to sit outside.  Mainly because the emptiness of the restaurant was awkward and it was also beautiful outside.  She then said, if you don't mind waiting a few minutes, I'll have someone push two tables together.  This was funny since clearly she had already watched us wait a long time, but I said that's fine.  Then, nothing happened.  We waited another 10 minutes....waited...waited....she was milling about, staff members were walking around.  Finally I see one guy go out and take the 30 seconds to push two patio tables together.  Then nothing happens.  We are still waiting at the hostess stand.  She is nowhere to be found, no one comes over to seat us, nothing.  I finally just took the initiative and told our group to follow me and we headed outside to seat ourselves.  That's when I noticed both of the tables were dirty.  One even had bird crap on it.  No set ups on the table and no staff in sight.  Now, all the red flags are going off while we continue to wait for a sign of human life at this restaurant to appear.  No one ever came back out.  After waiting about another 5 minutes or so, I looked at my boss and said "let's go".  We all got up and just walked off the patio and headed down the street to one of the other 50 restaurants within a 4 block radius.  I did call the restaurant while we were walking to alert them that their table of 6 (leaving one customer in the whole place) had just gotten up and left as no one seemed to want to serve them. I said no one cared we were there apparently.  The girl apologized.  I said that's ok, bad service equals a bad review.  Here it is.  Bottom line, there are far too many fabulous restaurants in this city to waste your time having poor customer service.  This place is not worth your time.  Wake up Dine, clearly there's a reason no one was in your restaurant.

7.description: Had the worst experience of my life me and my wife wanted to grab something to eat so we decided to stop by dine restaurant we were by the neighborhood so we decided to try something new while we took a couple of minutes to look at the menu my wife noticed there was a cockroach on the floor just crawling all over the place until a waiter kill it and just kick to to the side instead of cleaning it up after that my wife appetite just flew out the window very unsanitary so be careful if you eat at  this place might have a bug in your food if your not careful they migjt be infested

49.description: Went here on a rainy Saturday afternoon about 3pm with my sister and her 4 and 2 year olds. We were the only people in the place. Everything looked good- white table cloths modern and simple decor. We sat in one of the huge booths- which was good with kids and all. Our waiter was very attentive to the kids- brought kids menus, kids cups. And he provided very friendly accurate service. Very good. The food wasn't great though. I had the pulled BBQ pork sandwich, and it tasted like fish. The mac & cheese was tasteless. And the potpie was pretty tasteless too, and a bit too runny-soupy. I probably won't go back. Entrees were reasonable priced between $8-12 for lunch.

40.description: Very good food... price was on the higher to medium side. We had an excellent server, Roxanne. Me and my girl went in before a Hawks game. We chose this place because it was on the way and she printed off a Restaurant.com coupon that saved us over $20.00. We weren't starving so we decided just to order quickly and share everything. We each got a beer. Then for starters we ordered the French Onion soup of the day. Followed by the Scallops which were amazing. For our entree we ordered the Cajun pasta which was delicious. Thanks.

53.description: For hotel food, you could do worse. I haven't always been happy with the food, but the waitstaff seems to know their stuff and do their best to make up for any other offenses.

30.description: When I first looked at the menu, I was a little shocked at the high prices for what appeared to be a fairly casual restaurant.  I got one of the specials: a half chicken with garlic mashed potatoes and fresh cooked spinach, topped off with bacon crumbles. The flavor was fine but a bit salty and the breast was too dry. The potatoes turned out to be cut in small pieces instead of mashed and were not very garlicky. The bacon was more like ham chunks than crumbles and added to the over-saltiness. Not a great dish.However, the peach martini was awesome and the service was great. I was also impressed that they brought over a feedback card for me to fill out afterwards (I had not complained or expressed disappointment). I presume they are open to criticism and taking measures to improve which is something I respect.I probably wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again, but I'm staying at the hotel so I'm willing to give it another shot.

46.description: The new menu is amazing!!!! I would go back JUST for the rolls and white cosmo's. Crab cakes, fingerling potatoes, meatloaf and the amazing customer service were worth going back for.

1.description: I stay at the Crowne Plaza a few times a year, and this restaurant is located inside. First I came out of convenience, but most of the food is really good! I love that everything is made to order, and they've always been great about working with me and my dietary restrictions. The salads are yummy, and the steak is better than I expected! The sandwiches and fries that I've seen companions get look delicious! Ting has been our waitress the past few times and she's awesome.

55.description: Free valet is a plus, the fact that its in the lobby of the hotel is a minus.  The service was good, and the decor in the restaurant was surprisingly modern.  I was a little surprised at the prices, however.  I realize that its a restaurant in a hotel, but its not exactly the Peninsula.My tomato salad was good.  I should have ordered the chicken entree, but went with the meat loaf when the waiter indicated that it would be 20 min.  I'm not a meat loaf expert, but they pretty much served a gigantic, dense, hamburger on a plate.  It was very heavy and not very tasty.  The potatoes and spinach it came with were delicious.  My girlfriend had the scallops and was very pleased with how they turned out.  Overall, a good restaurant with an okay wine selection.  I left feeling a little sick to my stomach due to the pound of ground beef I had just eaten.  And I was definitely disappointed considering the kick ass pulled pork sandwiches they serve at Old St Pats.

9.description: Very disappointed.  Biscuits and gravy were very strange and did not taste good; it was sour and biscuits were dry.  Eggs were cold and likely came from a powder.  Several better options in the west loop.

26.description: Visited Last monday and I must say it was terrible. After watching one waiter and a whole lot of tables he finally found time to take our order. The biscuits and gravy were terrible and highly overpriced.

25.description: Great atmosphere, amazing Smoked Trout and the most comfy green dining chairs!Awesome place for a date or a big family reunion. Plenty of parking and cabs. I enjoyed the delicious garlic roasted chicken with glazed carrots and smashed potatoes and to carb it up, I added a side of Duck Fat Roasted Potatoes. Needless to say, this big boy brought home a doggie bag. :) I am looking forward to my next visit for dinner or lunch. I am eager to try the Tomato Basil soup with grilled cheese croutons.

12.description: My family and I came in on a Saturday night after my son's hockey game at Johnnie's Ice House and at first I was a little nervous as it's attached to the Crown Plaza Hotel and when we walked in at 7:30 we were the only diner's in the restaurant.  However, having the whole place to ourselves was great, the service was very attentive as you would expect if you were the only ones in the place.  The scallop appetizer with the Farro was outstanding as was the fried goat cheese.  The menu offers some real comfort food including a design your own mac and cheese which is great for kids and adults.  The chicken and the pork chop were perfectly cooked and delightful.  I would have given 5 stars but the fried green tomatoes were not breaded with cornmeal and although good could have been a little better.   Reasonably priced for the downtown and worth the trip plus valet parking is complimentary.

59.description: I came here for brunch while staying at the Crowne Plaza.  The brunch was good, but not great and way overpriced ($20/person for the buffet on Sunday).  The highlight was the made-to-order omelet station, which they will deliver to your table so you don't have to stand around waiting for it.  I'm a little confused as to why it was called the Sunday Jazz Brunch.  It was Sunday, there was brunch, but I didn't hear any jazz.  Maybe if they had some live music, it would be worth the price.

21.description: Love this place. Fits a little bit of every need. Great place to hang out at and have some drinks before a night out or sporting event. Or just a low key place to hang out if you want to unwind and enjoy a drink. The bartender, Paul, is super personable and makes the experience at Dine a 5 star. He really knows how to whip up a mean cocktail and will throw out some random jokes every now and then. Very nice dimples too! Food is very good and satisfying. Scallops and Caesar Salad dressing are top notch. P.S. Ask what the soup of the day is!

17.description: If this place were a little less expensive, I would probably give it 5 stars. The food and ambiance is just not impressive enough for the price.My boyfriend and I found a restaurant.com certificate, so we decided to go  here before a Bulls game.  We went around 5:15 and the place was empty.  I guess we were a little early for dinner.  The hostess and server were both very nice.We ordered just one drink each because they were pretty expensive.  I loved my drink which was some sort of concoction with Bailey's in it.  I wish I could remember what it was called.  Then we both had pasta dishes.  The portions were pretty large, but still it was nothing too exciting or impressive for the price we paid.  We had a nice time and people did start to arrive as we were leaving, so I know that more than just us had dinner there that night.  I would come back maybe for after work drinks or for the lunch specials.  I probably wouldn't choose to come here again for dinner just because of the prices.

10.description: We are really batting horribly since our company move to the Greektown / West Loop area.. Dine continues the streak.  Went for lunch.  12:05 and the place was empty.  Not a good sign.  Service was OK considering we were one of the few there.. but food was "meh" as the 2 star rating describes.  I had penne dish and they added radicchio to it.. I guess I could have ordered without it but it's not that I don't like radicchio, it can be delicious if combined correctly, but not with Fennel Sausage, Basil and Shaved Parmesan.. it basically threw in a bitter taste that although edible, not anything I would order again.  Dad always taught me not to order pasta dishes at non-Italian restaurants.. oops.But that being said, Dad would have approved of the choice the other diner being the BLT.  Again, meh.. she was hungry as hell or she probably wouldn't have eaten the half a sandwich (which is a lot for her, but I digress...)  Oh and for the prices of these meals - $16 and $12, I could have found much better at Marianos or at the food truck illegally down the street.  I tasted the fries.. they looked good, but looks can be deceiving as once I tasted, it was sad and soggy, kind of like our experience at Dine.  I would only go there again if I was drunk and someone else paid.

5.description: I have been there two times now for lunch on two different days. They have free parking if you are coming to the restaurant. The service was okay. The restrooms were clean. It was nearly empty both times when I came in. The food was nice but nothing special.

3.description: It was a long walk home from the Bulls game and apparently due to the holiday everything closed early...well we were starving so hotel restaurant it was. The bartenders were kind and made a really good sangria and my husband had a local draft beer. You know I wouldn't probably take my mom there on a tour of Chicago but it was much better than Jimmy Johns or a dollar menu. Prices were not bad for the hotel restaurant and portion was huge!! My picture shows about half of my meal left because there was so much!

35.description: For some reason I feel we have been getting extremely poor service lately and unfortunately this was the case last Saturday at Dine. We had a restaurant.com certificate so we decided to give this place a try. I have never seen a hostess move so slow in my entire life. When she noticed my boyfriend and I enter the restaurant, she moseyed on over taking her close to 5 minuets. We were then placed in the very back of the uncrowded restaurant in a room alone, and waited for another 15 minuets to be approached by a server. The food was ok, nothing special. I noticed a note that they have a bunch of craft beers now (Goose Island, Founders, ect.) in which there was none of- I believe they had Summertime. It seems like the only reason this place is able to stay open is because its attached to the Crown Plaza and in a bizarre location. This place is a no go for me.

19.description: Went here with a Restaurant.com coupon. Food was ok. Expected a little more. If I had to go without the coupon, would have probably not been worth it.

28.description: If this place were a little less expensive, I would probably give it 5 stars. The food and ambiance is just not impressive enough for the price.My boyfriend and I found a restaurant.com certificate, so we decided to go  here before a Bulls game.  We went around 5:15 and the place was empty.  I guess we were a little early for dinner.  The hostess and server were both very nice.We ordered just one drink each because they were pretty expensive.  I loved my drink which was some sort of concoction with Bailey's in it.  I wish I could remember what it was called.  Then we both had pasta dishes.  The portions were pretty large, but still it was nothing too exciting or impressive for the price we paid.  We had a nice time and people did start to arrive as we were leaving, so I know that more than just us had dinner there that night.  I would come back maybe for after work drinks or for the lunch specials.  I probably wouldn't choose to come here again for dinner just because of the prices.

45.description: I wanted to like this place.  I really did!So much that I ate there 2 nights in a row.  Well OK I was stranded the 2nd night due to one of the usual Chicago blizzards but hey, that still counts.The menu sounded promising enough: "dishes using fresh seasonal ingredients and pure cooking techniques".  I had had a long day at the studio after coming in on an 8am flight from LAX and fresh was a word I sorely needed to hear!  Ate at the bar, which is working out to be my customary thing when traveling alone on business.  The bartender was very nice, and poured me a pretty decent Consentino cab while my food was cooking.  I was immensely excited about the Alaskan Scallops (because I never cook them) and the goat cheese/beet salad, since learning I liked beets a few years ago.  Sadly sadly disappointed.  The scallops were a bit undercooked (which I can live with) but they were salty!  The arugula side was....also salty!  I basically couldn't really taste much of the polenta as I'm sure my tongue was salt-burned.  I've never left so much food on a plate before.  Ever.  (I could hear my mom's voice about starving people in the world.)  Moved to the beet salad as I figured it would give me some relief.  *Sad face*!!  Did the beets come from a can?!  I imagine these thick slices had never seen the inside of an oven because they were cold AND hard.  Weren't they supposed to be roasted till they were sweet and delicious?  And the peppercress that came with it? ....Salty!  I gave up and ate the goat cheese and called it a night.Second meal - organic baby greens with bosc pear and butternut squash.  I didn't realize it was squash either by sight or taste since it was diced beyond recognition.  The baby greens ...salty!  And dressed waaaay beyond an inch of its life.  (Note to chef - lighter touch please!).  Saving grace - the crab cake was succulent and delicious.  Side of arugula ......ok you know where I'm going right?Needless to say, not a meal I want to repeat.  Next week I have to be back in Chicago and I need a new place to stay at, if only in the off-chance I will be snowed in again and have no other dining options!

33.description: This place has seen better days. Food is mediocre; service is pleasant. Bread basket arrives quickly, but the rolls are dry and truly need plenty of butter. Trout was quite tasty, but potatoes were cold. Portions are large and prices reasonable. Coffee was bitter requiring lots of cream. Desserts are ok. All in all, everything here is just sort of down the middle.

43.description: The service was lackluster at best.  Our waiter was a kid whose only been there for a few weeks.  He couldnt recommend things on the menu when I asked what was good.  He rechecked our drinks twice.  Which, proved that his memory wasnt beyond writing it down and getting it right the first time.  The meatloaf that everyone rants and raves about was dry and cold.  I confirmed with him that the 18% tip was included when we asked for the check and presented the restaurant.com coupon.  When we all got up to leave, we were accosted by the restaurant manager asking whether there was something wrong with the service as we didnt leave tip.  It was an utterly embarrassing experience with the rest of the restaurant staring at us like we short paid the bill.

2.description: Food was good and service was amazing! Kathleen was a great server!  Very attentive and super friendly. Would come back here agains for sure. Parking is free which I hard to find at a restaurant in the west loop. Ask for Kathleen, she's is the sweetest!

18.description: If I could give Dine zero stars I would. I went for brunch, and I don't know if the food or the service was worse. There was hardly anybody in there, and it took about 10 minutes for the server to come over. Once he finally did, it took another 10 min to get coffee. We placed our order at this time and legitimately only saw our waiter one more time. After the bus boy brought out our food our waiter came by to check on us to see how the food was. I sent back my omelette which I would usually never do but it was loaded with cheddar, which I hate and didn't order. I wanted the gruyere cheese I had ordered and when the bus boy came back with my omelette, it was the same one with most of the cheddar scraped out then re-cooked with the gruyere and completely overdone. I hardly ate any of it as it was so terrible, and we never saw our waiter again. After sitting for about 20 more minutes we finally went to the hostess stand to find out that he had taken a break.The best part about this meal was leaving that Godforsaken place. The service and the food are completely atrocious, and you couldn't pay me to go back. Don't waste your money. I'd gladly wait 2 hours for Yolk, Meli, or Eggsperience to avoid this hellhole.

41.description: So I've been wanting to try this place for a while. Went there for breakfast on a fluck. There open for breakfast, how awesome is that. So my sister and I walked in we were the first people in there. My sister got a hot tea and i got a decaf coffee. There coffee was very good. So we checked out menu and what really caught my attention was that they had lox and bagels. I love lox and bagels but alot of breakfast places don't have them. oh and they were the bomb! There salmon was so fresh. my sister had a waffle with fresh strawberry's and whip cream and she absolutely amazing. We had a really nice time time and i defiantly want to go back.

52.description: For a hotel, the food was pretty good.  We went to the restaurant on a week night and it was surprisingly empty.  I can only assume that not many people choose to dine in a hotel restaurant because they think the food quality might be poorer than a 'normal' restaurant.  The emptiness of the restaurant added to the romance of our date, which was nice.  The atmosphere is very chic and elegant; I enjoyed all of the dark, rich tones of the walls and the seating.  The tables were dressed nicely with linens and everything was crisp and clean.Our waiter was very helpful in helping us pick out a bottle of wine.  The prices are also pretty good for a bottle.  I had the fish and chips, which was probably some of the best I've had, and my boyfriend had steak.  Only downside was the overall menu selection and the price - I'm generally wary of restaurants that push a "Nouveau American" menu of some nature.  I usually don't like the "American Classics" redone with a modern twist because that modern twist usually equals high price.  I feel like meatloaf can only cost so much.  Their menu was chock full of the "classics" which is nice if that's the sort of thing that you like, but I had sort of expected a bit more variety before we went.  Also, the menu selections were a bit pricey (average about $15-$17 per person for food only).  These things may prevent me from going back in the future because there's other places to get the same kind of quality American classic food for less.

50.description: It wasn't even busy during lunch, and we only saw our server at the end when he gave us our bill!  The hostess seated us and took our order.  Strange.Food wasn't even great.  Prices definitely do not reflect the cafeteria tasting meal.  We tried the braised short rib sandwich ($12) which was basically a pulled pork sandwich without the BBQ sauce.  The horseradish-sour cream was good, but overall the sandwich was still really dry.  The chicken pot pie ($10) was more unimpressive.  Really runny and chunks of white chicken were cut way too big!  It wasn't a traditional pot pie, either.  It was more like cream of chicken soup with a pastry top.  Not as fun to eat as a real pot pie.

4.description: Good food and good service, but it has a very cavernous feel inside.  With a name like "Dine," I expected something more intimate, especially considering the quality of the food.  Oh well, that's a silly complaint since dinner was still good.

6.description: I've eaten here twice, once for dinner and once for breakfast. I thought the food was good and the price was fair. The service was good, although they need to keep a door person at the front. I stood for a couple of minutes each time before I was noticed.

22.description: Oh man, this place is odd. Definitely feels like a hotel lounge trying to be hip. The experience wasn't awful, but it was hilarious. First of all, it took a while for a server to come to the table -- I think it was the bartender doing double duty, though I did spy another surly server who made eye contact with me and didn't come over. My friend and I took advantage of the 1/2 off bottles of wine special (Mon nights) and that deal might just bring us back since we are often in the neighborhood on Mondays.The food was downright fascinating. We ordered a hummus & veggies plate and a side of mashed potatoes. Somehow it took almost 30 minutes for the food to arrive. Our server informed us that the kitchen had actually run out of BOTH but were willing to make both from scratch for us. Ok....The hummus was...not hummus. It was an oily, flavorless chickpea puree. Wrong consistency, no hint of garlic or lemon or any of the seasonings one associates with hummus. It would have been better for them to just go to the Dominick's across the street and buy some hummus.The smashed potatoes were better, but still bizarre. Almost a little bit sweet? They weren't terrible, but not what we were expecting.All in all, just a weird experience. And then at 10:45, all the lights came on because they close at 11. Strange.

15.description: Love this place. Fits a little bit of every need. Great place to hang out at and have some drinks before a night out or sporting event. Or just a low key place to hang out if you want to unwind and enjoy a drink. The bartender, Paul, is super personable and makes the experience at Dine a 5 star. He really knows how to whip up a mean cocktail and will throw out some random jokes every now and then. Very nice dimples too! Food is very good and satisfying. Scallops and Caesar Salad dressing are top notch. P.S. Ask what the soup of the day is!

57.description: Ugh...how can people like this place.  The only thing good about it is a cool interior.  I've tried this place on three occasions and have been disappointed on all three.  The crabcakes taste like it was last month's left over crab.  I literally had to to spit it out into my napkin.  There is no way I could swallow it.  On another occasion I stuck with the burger.  Even this they couldn't get right.  My "medium" was so bloody that the bottom bun was too red and soggy to pick up and the fries were turning red from all the blood.  When I showed the waitress she brought it back to the chef and I could hear him bitching about it being a "perfect" medium.  (So much for the customer is always right attitude).  Of course when it came back, the burger was charred beyond recognition...and it was still on the soggy red bun.  The waitress offered to get  different burger but I already lost my appetite.  There are too many good restaurants in the west loop to waste your time at this poorly run hotel restaurant.

20.description: Two nights ago stopped in for a great alsatian flatbread like I had experienced in the past.  ordered it to go.  got home and i found the flatbread to be burnt - all dark brown and black.  I called Dine and the hostess could not have been nicer and more apologetic.  She gave me to Ben the manager who was also very nice and apologetic and said to come back in and he would buy one on him.  I was at the Crowne Plaza Hotel for a meeting tonight and afterwards I stopped at Dine to pick up the replacement flatbread.  When I got this one home it was the opposite of black and burnt.  It was undercooked, laden with way too much cheese and oil.  Again impossible to eat.  All I can say these days is that the kitchen is unfortunately very inconsistent and no one is regulating that kitchen even when they knew this was a replacement order.  Too bad cause now I will not be back.

36.description: Enjoyed this restaurant for dinner very much! Great Food, Service and Ambiance, plus FREE PARKING. (get your ticket validated from the Host/Hostess ) The exposed kitchen overlooks the open main dining area and the lounge/bar are is very comfortable. Right off expressway and sort of "hidden" off of Madison.(inside the Crown Plaza Hotel)  A great find in the south loop.

14.description: Meh.  Wasn't expecting much and I wasn't disappointed.  Service was friendly enough but food while not awful was mediocre at best

58.description: "The name of the establishment would anger the City of Brotherly Love"Full disclosure: I am a native Philadelphian.  This is one of the few places that caters to the late night drinking crowd. Needless to say, i have been here intoxicated and sober. Many of the items sold here are aim to soak up alcohol and whatever toxins you have imbibed for your nightly escapades. The accuracy of replicating the philly cheesesteak is dismal. The amount of grease that exist in one sandwich will eat through a paper bag if you decide to go for take out. You will only find me here when I am intoxicated beyond getting in a cab and are very very hungry

56.description: For years Philly's best has stood alone in Chicago as the place to get cheese teaks that could convince you that you were at Geno's Pat's or Jim's ... but now they have serious competition from Monti's (sorry guys).  Stopped in Sunday to refresh my memory .. ahhhhhhhhhhhhhh yes, still turning out some good cheesesteaks.  Right amount of cheese, could use some more onion, but the steak is correctly chopped and plentiful and tasty.

29.description: I got a small philly more like small order of bread & onions.. They put wayyyy too many onions on the philly and very little meat. This was also the plainest Philly cheesesteak I've ever had. The cheese fries were good the chocolate cake was actually decent. If your craving a philly go someplace else as you will be disappointed! ...Oh customer service was great also

42.description: I so miss this place since I've moved to the burbs. This place is as close as it gets to REAL authentic Philadelphia cheese steak. First time I had it about 4 years ago I was hooked. Would drive 20 minutes every weekend just to get me some of this. Got to the point where they knew me by name... Thumbs Up!

23.description: Great steak sandwich every time I'm in town I make sure to go to at least one of Philly's best

47.description: Seeing how I only ever have cheese steaks here after a long night at a show my rating is fairly limited.I've never had an authentic cheese steak in Philly and I don't expect this to be a substitute, but still good. I suggest skipping the onions as a few of my friends all agree they don't taste appealing for whatever reason. Last weekend my brother ordered something from the connected Greek place and they had no desire to make an effort. I don't know their association with Philly's Best, if at all, but I recommend going across the street to Mr Greek if you want a gyro or something.

8.description: They have by far the best Philly cheese steak ive ever had! You have the option of customizing it by adding other ingredients like mushroom, black olives to your original philly steak.

31.description: Great steak! I got cheesesteak with mayo added & pizza sauce it already comes with cheese and grilled onions. That bad boy was good!! The owners are cool, really friendly and likes to talk to you. Im glad my wife is pregnant cause it gives me a excuse to stop by more often to pick her up a cheesesteak

34.description: If a person from this restaurant ever in their life tell me that a Philly Cheese Steak Pizza is only Philly Cheese and no meat. DA Fuq you making this pizza for son? Da FUQ!I used to order from them all the time, but this debacle after this last pizza order. I can't deal with you any longer. You will not be getting any more of my money. Those were same good pizzas too.

16.description: Good food but overpriced. Ive had better. Also they made me apt for hot sauce wtf? Could you not? In Philly they have buckets of hot sauce for your philly steak

13.description: I like the cheesesteaks when the order shows up correctly. Ordered today and got a tinnnnny sandwich (smaller than they normally do) without the mushrooms, peppers or "boss sauce" that I paid extra for. The delivery drivers are abnormally unprofessional, which stinks because it actually makes me stop and think if I want to order because of them. Don't feel like calling because I sort of expect rude service, but I have not verified. Anyways, the sandwich is pretty good, though. I also like the cheese fritters but the mac n cheese bites are not worth getting as they remind you of over-microwaved, deep-fried leftover kraft mac n cheese.

11.description: If a person from this restaurant ever in their life tell me that a Philly Cheese Steak Pizza is only Philly Cheese and no meat. DA Fuq you making this pizza for son? Da FUQ!I used to order from them all the time, but this debacle after this last pizza order. I can't deal with you any longer. You will not be getting any more of my money. Those were same good pizzas too.

39.description: The cheese fries are Devine!!!!!

37.description: I'm giving 2 stars because I have had great food from here before, delivered in 15 mins. My last experience was horrible. I ordered one sandwich and fries and got my food almost 2 hours later. I live about 6 blocks away.... I called after an hour and the guy said they were on their way over. About 40 mins later they showed up. My food was cold and soggy. They also added spicy peppers to my whole sandwich when I didn't order it, so even if it was more edible, the jalapeño drenched bread would have been too spicy for me. I took a bite after scraping everything off and it was so awful. If they are going to be backed up like this on the weekends they should not have online ordering on several websites. Very disappointing...

0.description: Woke up at 100 am hungry on a Thursday night. Wanted a cheese steak, but didn't want to wait for delivery so I got dressed and drove over there. 1 on garlic bread, grilled onions and American. Seasoned fries. Hit the spot and I'm back to bed. My only complaint is the parking sucks. The only improvement needed is bikini valet service

38.description: Would love to review the food, but I never got it. I called to ask where the delivery was and was told to contact GrubHub and was promptly hung up on. Didn't receive a call or anything about my order while the delivery was supposedly here and GH verified they didn't follow proper delivery protocol. This one star rating is on behalf of GH for offering A1 2:00am customer service. Otherwise the restaurant is worthy of no stars.

51.description: I actually ordered a salad from here during my lunch. I ordered over the phone  for pickup and my goodness they charge for every little thing. They didn't have blue cheese, so I wanted to replace it with feta and they tried to charge me. Um, NO! So after I called them out about that, they took off the extra charge. When I came to pick it up, they had forgot to put chicken on it. Besides charging too much for nothing and forgetting my protein, the salad was very fresh and extremely good. I enjoyed it a lot.

27.description: I love this place, I usually head to the one in belmont were I used to work. Philly cheese steak is amazing! !!! Plus the sweet assortment are mouth watering.

32.description: I'm from the South, so I have no preconceptions about what a "real" philly cheesesteak should be. All I know is that the buttered garlic bread was toasted crisp and wrapped around the tastiest meat and cheese concoction I have had in a long time. The fries could have been crispier, but the delivery was faster than expected and everything in the order was incredible. Amazing late-night delivery discovery. Delish--I'm going to have to resist eating here again before I leave Chicago!

54.description: The Loaded Fries were a bit too plenty.But nevertheless.......Great!!.

48.description: The best I've had in Chicago. A little pricey but it's worth it !! Walked in on accident but it was worth it. I will be back !

44.description: 1st timer here, I was referred from an fb friend. I had the philly cheese slice of pizza & it was DELICIOUS!!!! The pizza crust was soggy & juicy & flavorful. The cheese & beef were proportioned perfectly. I really enjoyed this slice especially for the price. 2nd on the list was the philly cheese steak sandwich. I requested extra onions, peppers, & mushrooms. The sandwich was put together wonderfully. There was a nice amount of grease to it. The meat was kind of bland though Service was pretty good. I'll definitely be back for more.

24.description: The best drunk food you could ever get. Open late and the service is very fast.

7.description: I went to a party on Saturday night and lets just say we were hunnnnngry afterwards! This guy I met recommend Philly's Best so we headed over there around midnight. The place was packed!!! Of course we got the Philly Cheese Steak and it was delicious. I'm not sure how much it cost, but the size was perfect and I was definitely satisfied. It's great to discover new late night spots and have more options to visit. I will definitely come back here if I'm in the neighborhood.

49.description: It's a true Philly Steak nuff said! The only true steak I've had outside of Pennsylvania.  Glad to see someone has finally brought a true bit of Philly here.

40.description: We had the chicken philly and classic philly plus seasoned fries and onion rings and triple chocolate cake. All tasted great and the "small" philly was bigger than i expected.
