It was covered in tomato sauce and the cooked spinach was well seasoned with dill, onion, and other seasoning. The lamb was fall off the bones; there were small bones but it was easy to remove. Everyone was really friendly. The restaurant was bigger inside than it looked from the outside. The restroom is a spacious wheelchair accessible one room deal. Free parking across the street. For how much I love Greek food and how often I visit Greektown, I can't believe this was my first time eating here. This is my new favorite nice Greek restaurant.

38.description: I've never been much for Greek food, so perhaps I'm not the best person to review Roditys.Service was pretty good.  Our water glasses were regularly topped off and the servers were playful.But the food was a mess.  I had the chicken kebab and it was just several hunks of overcooked, dry chicken alongside totally mushy vegetables.  I ordered a side of potatoes, but the waiter brought the entire table's sides on one plate, so we had to pass it around.  Someone else ordered a side of rice and it had no seasoning or flavor to it.  There was an unidentified, flavorless red sauce poured over it.If you want to know how Roditys' food tastes, simply start smoking and don't stop for 50 years.  Then, bite into anything.  The end.I won't be back.

51.description: I went in, got seated promptly. I am new to greek food and the food was amazing! I loved it. Great greek atmosphere. Only reason I give it a three is because the waiter was not friendly at all. Was a "just here to take your order" guy. I wish the service went above what I expected.

27.description: Only went here because of the convenience of parking.   Had never been so I thought we would give it a shot.  Upon entering the restaurant's interior breezeway the stench of sewage hit us.  I should have walked out immediately.   Saganaki was decent but most are.  The grilled octopus was a complete joke.  At $14.95 you get a small appetizer plate of bland octopus.   Yes it was an appetizer but for the price I expected a large appetizer.    I should have known when at 1145am there was no one in the restaurant on a Saturday lunch, and only 4 others when we left at 1230.  Much better options on the street.  With everything said I just can't get the raw sewage stench when we walked in and again when we left.

32.description: I took my friends from New York  to Roditys last year. After sending cold food back twice, after putting up with poor service and overpaying considering the amount and quality of food we received we left and headed to Chinatown for some real food. So now we come to last night at Greekfest August 24, 14. I walked up to the Rodity's stand and saw that a women had a big plate of food on the counter. I asked what she had ordered, she told me the combination plate. It had a large skewer of lamb sitting on top of what looked like lettuce and other vegatables. So I said I'll have what she's having. He hands a plate of food to me that looked very different than hers. I asked where was the lamb? He said we just ran out but I put a lot of things under the lettuce. OK OK so how much? That'll be 17.00 dollars???? I said PLEASE...He said   there REALLY is so much fish and meat on that plate. So I paid him an outrageous 17.00 dollars. We could not find a place to sit down so we took it home. Guess what... no meat, no fish just lettuce and a quarter of a potato hidden by a large piece of pita bread he threw over the top of the plate. Thank you Rodity's for stealing 17.00.

54.description: We went to Rodity's for late lunch/early dinner this past week. It was dreadful. We were 1 of only 2/3 tables given the odd hour. There was a fly that we swiped at throughout the whole meal. We mentioned it to the server and both the server and the manager watched but did nothing. The whole menu was the same tired greek  menu from the 70's but the quality was even worse. We ordered beets and skordalia. Skordalia was ok but the beets were out of a jar. My cod plaki had been sitting and reheated enough that the bottom n sides had become hard. I was dining with 3 family members and everyone was very disatisfied with their food. We all arrived ravenous but still could not finish our food. This says a lot given the hunger and we're big eaters.

48.description: * Best fried calamari in the city!* Huge and delish lamb shank daily!* Mama's recipe for rice, peas, and potatoes!* Free valet parking across the street!  * Same great quality and feel for over 30 years!* Watch out for old waiter to pad your bill for a few extra bucks.

44.description: Stopped in to grab a bite last night .. Their food was okay. I wasn't sure what to order .. I wanted something more authentic but found myself sticking to a Gyro.. My other half ordered a vegetarian Mousaka. I nibbled at her dish and it was really yummy!  My gyro was so-so.. The meat was a bit  dry.  What did make up for my dish was the nice server. Older gentleman who gave us friendly pats on the shoulder and checking in to see how our food was.His sense of concern was cute!!. After our flaming Saganaki ,he comes back and asked my GF is she's hungry?.. well duh!.. the way he said it was adorable!. It felt like we were at a relatives house!. Feeling full, I set my dish aside and he says in his accent " No more? " I shake my head and smile, then he says " you take a few bites, eat a little more".. We chuckeld ,and well, did what I was told..lol He seemd pleased that we ate.  Oh and we received a way better "OPA" than the table next to us when the Saganaki came out..I like that there was free parking with valet right across the street. (especially in yesterday's crummy weather) ..  Fun experience! service was great!

24.description: Never going back again. Went with family for a special  ocassion.  Asked waiter if we could have separate checks cause there was 4 couples.  He said no. I asked him why his answer was I can't.   Waited 20 minutes for waiter to take our order and told him twice we were ready to order.Asked twice for water refills. Needless to say service was HORRIBLE  including the waiter. Don't waste your hard earned money on this place

7.description: Came here with my fiance for our 2 year anniversary and I have never felt more discriminated in my life. If you are not Greek, they will treat you differently.1. My fiance ordered coke, waiter brought him diet coke. My fiance politely said he had asked for regular coke. Waite took the cup and came back with regular coke, didn't even apologize or say a word for that matter.2. When he brought out our flaming cheese he did not say the "opaa!" that he said when he brought it to a Greek Family.3. We needed a little more time to choose our entrees and he said take your time. He didn't come back around until about 20 minutes. 4. When our food finally got here. He literally slammed my fiance's dish and sauce splattered his pants, the waiter did not appologize. 5. My fiance was waiting on a refill for about 15 minutes. We had to set the cup out to the side.I was so disgusted with the service we asked for to-go boxes. He asked if we wanted him to put it away or if we could do it. What kind of waiter asks?When he brought out the check, he was lingering around almost as if he was worried we would walk out with out paying. Mind you,  he was in the far back the whole time we were there and only came by once to see if everything was alright.So now when I look back to our 2 year anniversary, I will think of what a horrible experience I had at Rodity's. Thanks for that.P.S. the food was mediocre, not worth the outrageous prices.

49.description: This place needs another review from committed fans, old-timers who will have been coming here for 40 years when the place is 40 years old in 2013. We come back because we know the people, because we are at home here and because there are so many choices, all of them good. Renovations have made occasional changes, but "Silver Fox," the owner, still welcomes us as we arrive, whether from Texas, where we now live, or from somewhere else. If asked what is our favorite restaurant, we typically can't name one because there are always so many new ones to try. But when you've been going to a place for 40 years, that has to mean something. The waiters aren't particularly friendly. And they're all men. But that's a cultural thing. Get used to it. We've been to Greek Islands, sort of a trendy place, and a few others on Halsted, but if you want a place that's worth coming back to for 40 years, check out Roditys.

40.description: I've been visiting this Greektown staple with my family for over 30 years. My father introduced me to it when he was working in Chicago for Amtrak, and Rodity's was always on our agenda when we came for a visit. There is absolutely no better place in Chicago to get a gyro or saganaki. I can even remember the days when the gyro meat was served without pita (because pita was an unnecessary accessory for the stellar meat). The weight staff is always excellent, and you can usually find a seat even during busy meal times. The prices are reasonable, and the restaurant itself is clean and well-maintained. THIS IS THE PLACE TO GO IF YOU LOVE GREEK!Opa!!!

53.description: This is the best place in Greektown. For starters, I'm pretty new to yelp, but don't let that detract you from my review. We live a few blocks away and have tried every place in the neighborhood. Roditys is the place we come back to time and time again. From the moment you walk in the door to the time you leave you feel like family.  The food is exceptional, I'm married to a Greek and have tasted my fair share of food and there is nothing on the menu that has let me down. There maybe other places that have patios, roofs , etc., but that is just a mask for the non-predicable food... Roditys is the real deal.

30.description: My family has been going to Rodity's for over 30 years. If you want great Greek food, this is the place to go to. Saganaki, check!Lamb, check!Chicken, check!Fish, check!Wine, opa!Amazing service, ask for George.

46.description: The best, most authentic Greek food! Old school family feel. Very reasonable and you get tons of food! Must go on a Thursday or Sunday for the braised lamb with avogolemeno and horta (egg lemon sauce and dandelion greens) but everything, especially the lamb, is outstanding! Service is always great.

1.description: The free valet for this place is a great way of getting customers, especially when you don't want to deal with finding street parking.  That and the service were highlights to this place.My overall feel was that this place was probably awesome years before but now it's just trying to relive the past like a 40 year-old man constantly lingering on to his high school football glory days.  After asking the waiter if I was better off with the gyro plate or the kebabs, he firmly suggested that I choose the pork or chicken kebabs over the gyros.  My dinner date ordered the dolmades and a cup of the lemon soup.  The biggest complaint was that the total for our meal was $41 bucks and I left feeling unsatisfied.   The dolmades tasted pretty good but there were only 2 and I think we were charged for the full order $12 which is completely our fault for not noticing until after we left.  My kebabs platter just didn't hit the spot.  $15 bucks for 4 pieces of pork, some rice and one piece of potato and the pork was dry.  The service was good and the food came out quick, but I'm not sure if I would return.  It's a bit overpriced for what you get, especially the portions were as small as they were and far from perfect.

55.description: I'm no regular to Roditys but I do believe they deserve some kudos!A buddy of mine and I were in Chicago for the week to do some academic work. My friend, being Greek, insisted that we make our way to Greek town. Oh, but where to go? He speaks with the person who hands us the keys to our rental car: "Dude," the young man says to us (who says "Dude" anymore?) "You have got to go to Roditys for some killer eats!" We throw the address in the GPS and away we go!First score of the day is that Roditys has free parking! That's a major plus considering there is plenty of parking in the area that is not free!Once inside we ate like pigs! We started with the sweetbreads and then the appetizer plate (The Roditys Platter) and house wine (We probably should have stopped right there, although I was amused by the flaming Saganaki Cheese). We moved on to the Moussaka with meat, which was wonderful! And, we concluded with Sokolatina. Mercy, me, one of the better meals I had in Chicago!

9.description: Average ambience, average service, good food. Came with a friend for a light lunch and split the saganaki and the Rodity's platter. Saganaki came flaming which is always a fun display and was average in taste.The combo platter had tzatziki (delicious), taramosalata (strange), eggplant salad (tasty) and spanakopita (also really good). It was served with some pretty good Greek bread, but I was craving some pita (.. Is that not authentic greek?!)  I'm no expert on Greek food so take this review for what it's worth!

26.description: Dear roditys,My love affair with you started when I was 12,My first time was the gyros but I've matured since then and moved onto bigger and better things.The lemon soup. Then taramousolata,  saganaki. And braised lemon chicken with roasted potatoes. All of it makes for an unbelievable evening. I just can't get enough. I love you RoditysSigned, Your very satisfied patron :)

25.description: Have eaten here many times over the years but wont be going back again. This past weekend's experience was simply atrocious starting with the the service. It was off, rude. The food was bland, starting with the hard day old bread. The octopus was firm but tasteless. The lamb was bleak and bare. The quality here has deteriorated over the years. Shame. There are better options down the street.

12.description: Since I was little I have been coming to Roditys.  My mom and dad made this our go to place in Greek town.  Me and my brother's still come here and enjoy ourselves.  Service and food are always great.  Sure other places in Greek town are nice but to me Roditys is always consistent and it just feels like family, you can't beat that!  Favorites are broiled octopus, zucchini and skordalia.  The roast sirloin lamb melts in your mouth!  Portions are so much I always have leftovers.  Pricing is fair and flavours are on point and always satisfying.

59.description: armed with a groupon, we went to Rodity's for a weeknight dinnerwe shared the grilled octopus for appetizer, i had the sweetbreads and my fiance had bbq lamb ribs for entreesboth service and food quality were tired and uninspiringthere did seem to be a lot of regulars so i think there are quite some folks who feel sentimental about the place but for what we received, we won't be back

21.description: My family has been going to Rodity's for as long as I can remember. I always get a combination platter, because I can never decide on one specific dish; saganaki; and lemon rice soup. I moved away from Chicagoland 4 years ago and I am still searching for a comparable Greek restaurant. Rodity's is always one of my stops when I visit home.

17.description: This is my second time to Chicago Greek town. Rodity's was a convenient place for old friends getting together. My friends picked it as the free parking is right across the street as they drove from another city. I liked the olives and pita with yogurt sauce. I was not too impressed with the sesame bread basket which was a bit stale for me. My entree, braised lamb, was actually pretty good. It was tender and had all the right flavors. The green beans on the side was overly cooked and overly salty. I mixed those with my daughters "Beige" version spaghetti. The end result was pretty good.I was not very content with the services. Those boys was just there but not engaged too much with the job. One waiter was somehow offended by me for asking the separate check. Said I should have told him in the beginning. Then just wrote my totals on the same check and asked me to deal with my friends. Sorry, I really didn't want to bother you but you was not so busy as there were totally two tables in the huge lobby on Sunday. I have tried Greek island and Rodity's. I was not impressed with neither services. Let's try another Greek place here to see if this is just way in a Greek place.

10.description: Dear roditys,My love affair with you started when I was 12,My first time was the gyros but I've matured since then and moved onto bigger and better things.The lemon soup. Then taramousolata,  saganaki. And braised lemon chicken with roasted potatoes. All of it makes for an unbelievable evening. I just can't get enough. I love you RoditysSigned, Your very satisfied patron :)

5.description: Poor service, outrageously expensive mediocre food is the fare of this tired old Greek restaurant with tired old ownership and management.  If you're in the mood to feel taken advantage of, disrespected and made a fool of for delivering your money to this; rather than the numerous other dining options within one mile of this place, none will abuse you or your money more. My girlfriend asked for the appetizer spanikopita expecting to receive the 8.00 piece of spinach pie.  When the check arrived, I was surprised at how much it was and found that we were charged 14.95 for a 3X5 piece of spinach pie.  What did it cost, 1.50?  Perhaps less?  It was small, tepid, unspiced, bland, canned spinach, nothing special.  When asked why so much, the waitress was indignant and told us we received the "large full order entree" portion.  I asked her why she hadn't verified that is what she wanted rather than the half order or appetizer portion, she walked away.I saw her subtly communicating with the owner about my comments.  We paid and walked out determined to never return.  Not a thank you, not a goodbye, not a "pleasure to screw you" nothing.  Tired, old, has been place there to grab your dollar with no consideration to your enjoyment, value or satisfaction.  If that what you're in the mood for, this is the place.

3.description: The food, ambiance, service, and free parking were all wonderful! Two thumbs up.I've tried most of the restaurants in Greektown and my meal at Rodity's (consisting of dolmas, braised lamb, and spinach) was my favorite. I liked the meat-rice ratio. Usually, there is way more rice than meat in dolmas, but here, there was about 90% meat, which was a very nice surprise. Usually, lamb has a gamey taste that I am not a big fan of but here the lamb didn't have a gamey taste. It fell right off the bone and was very flavorful and delicious. It was cooked in a tomato sauce. I especially enjoyed the cooked spinach. I highly recommend the dolmas, braised lamb, and spinach!The restaurant itself is wheelchair accessible. There are two sets of doors to go into that are on an incline, which may be a bit difficult to open. If people see you, they are more than willing to hold doors open and help out. Everyone is very friendly and you can't beat the free parking lot right across the restaurant. Our valet was kind enough to pull our car right in front of the restaurant because my sister uses a wheelchair (and it was snowing). I will definitely be back!

35.description: For a randomly chosen restaurant on the west side, this place was pretty good. The tzatziki sauce was AMAZING, and the roast loin of lamb was so tender it about melted in my mouth. I would recommend this place for anyone looking for great Greek food at a reasonable price.

19.description: I've never been much for Greek food, so perhaps I'm not the best person to review Roditys.Service was pretty good.  Our water glasses were regularly topped off and the servers were playful.But the food was a mess.  I had the chicken kebab and it was just several hunks of overcooked, dry chicken alongside totally mushy vegetables.  I ordered a side of potatoes, but the waiter brought the entire table's sides on one plate, so we had to pass it around.  Someone else ordered a side of rice and it had no seasoning or flavor to it.  There was an unidentified, flavorless red sauce poured over it.If you want to know how Roditys' food tastes, simply start smoking and don't stop for 50 years.  Then, bite into anything.  The end.I won't be back.

28.description: Garbage is better tasting this place I've never ate at such a low quality place coming from a greek I will make sure everyone I know never steps foot here beware! They microwave the food fyi and the waitress who has a heavy accent rolled her eyes at me because I made a complaint she was the only women there so she is easy to spot end of the story don't eat here go to greek islands or even a hole in the wall is better than this over prices garbage

45.description: I thought their food was just okay and overpriced. For greek town their food should taste more authentic, rustic, and flavorful.Our service was fine but nothing special about it.We ordered the house wine and it was not bad but again we though it was overpriced.Our bill for 3 people ended up being close to 100 dollars with one bottle of wine and 3 entrees.They do have free parking which is awesome in that area but my recommendation is greek islands if you're in greek town.

33.description: I didnt like my food, I told them and they did nothing. $50 later I was still hungry and had to go home and eat. I wont go back!

43.description: We did not care for this restaurant.  While the service was good, the food was below average.  My husband had the pastichio,  he thought it was pretty bland.  My son had the fishermans plate, which consisted of fried cod, smelts and calamari. He is only twelve, and he thought  his dish was bland as well.  The cod was dry and  overcooked, and the calamari rubbery.  I had the souvlaki, which consisted of a single skewer with  4 small pieces of pork with some onions and one piece of green pepper. Again, this was bland, and very little value for the price.  My local greek diner does a bang up job on souvlaki,  2 skewers of pork which tastes of lemon, oregano and good olive oil.  All served up on a warm pita with a side salad and baked potato.  I always end up taking some home with me, and all for about 2/3 the price of what Roditys charges.  I would not go to Roditys again.

2.description: I've been to Greektown dozens of times, but only just recently made my way to Roditys, after being persuaded by my father to do so. Overall, it was a pleasant dining experience. Before we even get to the restaurant itself, there's free parking across the street for Roditys customers, which was a nice bonus.The decor is really nice, pretty typical of Greek places. There's really nice murals on the wall and Greco-style decorations. We were seated right away, and had a very bubbly waitress who seemed enthusiastic. We started off with two appetizers, the saganaki ($6.95) and the broiled octopus ($12.95). Saganaki is always delicious, and I have no complaints. It was done in the traditional table side manner, and was served with bread like usual. It's one of my favorite dishes, and it was done well. But the star of our experience at Roditys was the octopus. I'm a big fan of octopus, but generally I either get it in a cold appetizer or fried. Getting it broiled in such a dish was a first for me and it was delicious. It was absolutely perfectly cooked. It was soft, more like a fish consistency and way less rubbery than I was expecting. It was simply seasoned with salt and lemon, letting the natural flavors shine. I think I ate almost all of it, and I regret nothing.We also got egg lemon soup ($3) which was delicious, with just the right amount of lemony bite to it.After that, our waitress was MIA. We waited. And waited. And waited. We think she assumed we were just getting appetizers, but we had been planning a full meal. It was a good half an hour later before she finally came back and was surprised when we asked for an entree. That's right, an. Instead of getting the whole nine yards of main dishes and desserts as well, I ended up filling up on octopus instead. My dad ordered gyros to split, but I opted out of ordering anything else. The gyros were really well seasoned and well cooked, and it was a pretty generous portion. Had I not filled up, I could have eaten a lot of it.We ended up going to Artopolis for dessert.I'd definitely come back here, because I think one flaky waitress isn't enough to ruin the pleasant atmosphere and delicious food. That said, I'll definitely be paying attention to the service on my next trip.

18.description: After many  years  of  passing  by Roditys,  I finally stopped for  dinner.  We enjoyed  the  food very  much. The  staff  us very  friendly and prompt  with  the  service. Free parking  is a bug plus!

41.description: This is my second time to Chicago Greek town. Rodity's was a convenient place for old friends getting together. My friends picked it as the free parking is right across the street as they drove from another city. I liked the olives and pita with yogurt sauce. I was not too impressed with the sesame bread basket which was a bit stale for me. My entree, braised lamb, was actually pretty good. It was tender and had all the right flavors. The green beans on the side was overly cooked and overly salty. I mixed those with my daughters "Beige" version spaghetti. The end result was pretty good.I was not very content with the services. Those boys was just there but not engaged too much with the job. One waiter was somehow offended by me for asking the separate check. Said I should have told him in the beginning. Then just wrote my totals on the same check and asked me to deal with my friends. Sorry, I really didn't want to bother you but you was not so busy as there were totally two tables in the huge lobby on Sunday. I have tried Greek island and Rodity's. I was not impressed with neither services. Let's try another Greek place here to see if this is just way in a Greek place.

52.description: We celebrated my Dad's 70th birthday at Roditys today!  The service was outstanding and all who work there were more than friendly.  We all enjoyed our meal and had a fabulous time!  I would also like to give a HUGE shout out to the staff!  I lost my purse in the parking lot, and did not realize it until 2 hours later!  I called the restaurant and 3 people (including the manager) ran outside to search for my purse!  It was absolutely my lucky day!  The valet found my purse!  We would all go back again!  Thanks again, Roditys!!

50.description: Back in the area and had to make a trio to Roditys for another great meal. By far the best Greek food and the best service you can find. Have been eating at Roditys for 30 years, and always has been great.Thank you Jimmy for another great night. See you next time I am in townJack and Judy

4.description: Great food great service! Have been to a number of places in Greektown and this was fab!On'y complaint they could turn the lights down a tad :)

6.description: I highly recommend going to Rodity's with a friend that is Greek and everybody knows his name. WOW! We put ourselves in his hands and the journey was amazing! Saganaki, Gyro, Spinach pie, Lamb chops, Rice, Potato's Okra. Washed it all down with a bottle of Greek wine, I didn't even know the greeks made wine. ended with flan type of dessert with a flaky topping drizzled in honey and greeks style coffee. I could have easily spend 3 to 4 hours here eating. The service was amazing. We of course sat at the corner table in the back with our backs to the wall and near an exit, just like the italians. LOL!

22.description: This is my favorite in Greektown.  I dine here often.  The food, atmosphere and staff are authentic.  It's a cozy place for either a date or a large group.  The noise level is lower than some other Greektown restaurants, so it's easy to carry on conversation.  The restaurant is never crowded, and service is consistently fast, efficient and courteous.  The menu has pretty much all of the Greektown standards, and there are numerous specials each day.  All Greektown restaurants offer free valet, but Roditys has its own valet parking lot across the street from the restaurant, so the valet is very quick and convenient.

15.description: I had the Greek sampler platter during the Greek fest. The food was fantastic and the gyro meat was very tender. The line was disorderly and semi-chaotic but worth the wait.

57.description: This is our favorite.

20.description: Average ambience, average service, good food. Came with a friend for a light lunch and split the saganaki and the Rodity's platter. Saganaki came flaming which is always a fun display and was average in taste.The combo platter had tzatziki (delicious), taramosalata (strange), eggplant salad (tasty) and spanakopita (also really good). It was served with some pretty good Greek bread, but I was craving some pita (.. Is that not authentic greek?!)  I'm no expert on Greek food so take this review for what it's worth!

36.description: Traditional Greek food, not gyros. The food is good, a little over priced for he portions. What you are really paying for is the staff- friendly, knowledgeable, and eager to get you drunk. By the time you leave you might be family!

14.description: I have to say . The food, service, and the ambience was terrific!! I will most definitely come back

58.description: We order cakes and come here for desserts pretty often. My husband loves their tiramisu cake. He says it's the best one in Chicago he's ever had! We also love the mango yogurt mousse cake - we normally order this as a birthday cake for someone special every year. My co-workers and I came here for dessert after dinner. I had the mango yogurt mousse cake and shared with them. They all loved it - it was not too sweet, moist, and light. One of my co workers ordered their espresso tart - very chocolatey.. I thought it was very rich in chocolate so it wasn't for me but she really enjoyed it. My husband ordered their hazelnut prarline cake which he thought was okay. Really enjoyed just hanging out and chatting with some yummy desserts. Great bakery. Yummy desserts!

56.description: This place is adorable! My rating is strictly on the drink I just ordered...the espresso martini. Perfect dessert martini for a little kickstart to the rest of the night! I will definitely come back for the wine and desserts. Reminds me of a mini eataly...Greek style.

29.description: 4 stars for pastries 3 stars for service4 stars for ambience 2 stars for food I always love this bakery only for their pastries and cakes.  No matter what occasion or for whoevers birthday. I will come here to pick up the cake. My favorites are mango mousse cake, strawberries shortcake, tiramisu.. Etc. I had dinner had multiple times but the food is not good. At least, not good to my taste. The server are always speaking a bother language and it feels like they're talking about you.

42.description: Loved the food, and desserts. Nice Service as well.

23.description: i cant speak to the food or service but i got the mango mousse from here for a party and people LOVED it. definitely good place for the mango mousse

47.description: My all-time favorite place for desserts! I go there every time I'm in town, Never disappoints me :). Their chocolate mousse is the best!

8.description: Such a cute restaurant/bakery!!All I can say is: MANGO MOUSSE CAKE. It is so SO SOOOOOO good. Light, sweet but not too sweet, so yummy!! Can't wait to eat my way through their entire bakery.

31.description: I purchased Artopolis gift card from Groupon. First my first visit there, the gift card machine wasnt working so they couldn't load the rest of the money to the gift card. The second time that I visited, they finally worked. However, I didn't use up all the money that was left in the card. I am sure I have at least $20 left in the card. The third time I went in to get a cake, they said the card is invalid, it's not working. This is so frustrating that their system isn't organized in anyway and they are promoting their restaurant through Groupon. I am very disappointed.

34.description: Reunited and it feels so good.Anyone remember that song? That's how I felt when I finally had chocolate after weeks and weeks. My chocolate drought was worse than California's legitimate drought. Sorry, Cali residents.What I had: Valrhona.Milk chocolate and dark chocolate mousse.All up in my mouf. Too much chocolate, couldn't handle it...hahaha PSYCH. This dessert was gifted to me by the Norse Gods. Rich in chocolate and perfect in size.Also had the mocha, the whipped cream on top was sky high and I loved that. The mocha was nicely sweet, good balance of chocolate and coffee.Get it, get it!

16.description: Reunited and it feels so good.Anyone remember that song? That's how I felt when I finally had chocolate after weeks and weeks. My chocolate drought was worse than California's legitimate drought. Sorry, Cali residents.What I had: Valrhona.Milk chocolate and dark chocolate mousse.All up in my mouf. Too much chocolate, couldn't handle it...hahaha PSYCH. This dessert was gifted to me by the Norse Gods. Rich in chocolate and perfect in size.Also had the mocha, the whipped cream on top was sky high and I loved that. The mocha was nicely sweet, good balance of chocolate and coffee.Get it, get it!

13.description: Been here multiple times. It is a great place for a casual lunch or dinner or to grab a delicious dessert from the bakery. You can grab bakery items to go or sit and eat in the cafe, where you can order off the menu. I particularly enjoyed the Mediterranean Fest and Melinzana Crostini appetizers. I've tried multiple bakery items and they never disappoint! Service is sometimes slow, but this did not bother me at the time, as I was in no rush. Overall, this is the perfect little cafe and bakery!

11.description: always loved their food and greek coffee is absolutely a culture experience. I can never resist the deserts after ravishing a hearty brunch

39.description: What a great era to be alive and be living in Chicago.Because Artopolis exists.I love everything about this place. The artopita pastries are incredible. The Greek entries are delicious and hearty. The dessert and wine options are extensive. The atmosphere is laid back. I can't think of one bad thing about Artopolis! Thank you for the wonderful experience!!!

37.description: Artopolis is easily one of my favorite bakeries in Chicago. They're a cafe as well, but I've never come for anything savory. I head straight for the desserts!They have three or four bakery cases when you walk in, all filled with amazing treats. Behind that there is a display of all of their fresh breads. I have yet to have anything bad here. Most recently, we loaded up on baklava, chocolate-raspberry mousse, lemon tarts, and cheesecakes. The chocolate-raspberry treats were delicious. They're covered in ganache and are so rich, you almost think you can't finish a piece. Then, of course, you do. The lemon tarts I think are my favorite. They are just the right amount of both sweet and tart, the filling is thick without being too much. The crust is super crunchy and really sweet, which is a nice contrast to the tart lemon curd. The cheesecake... Well I never got to try that because my dad ate all of it. I think that's a good sign. The baklava is textbook and delicious, with heavy doses of honey and nuts with flaky pastry. I make a point now to come here whenever I'm in the neighborhood, and it's given me a reason to venture up to Greektown more often. I'd definitely recommend it. But, it's all so good looking and tempting, be prepared to walk out of there with a full box of treats.

0.description: We really like this place, which is a big deal since the "we" half of us is a bit picky, although I guess I can be too. Artopolis is comfy, like a real old pair of jeans or your dad's big ass lazy boy chair that you wouldn't be caught dead with in your place. You will see people dining alone, with friends or date night. Part cafe, part restaurant, part bakery and specialty small grocery it's an interesting place. I've dined here with friends for lunch, great soups, salads and specialty sandwiches. They're not big on many entrees, however you can put together a tasty meal, think small plates, mix and match stuff. Their traditional soup on the menu is lemon chicken with rice, is delicious and the bowl will fill you up, it's bigger than it looks. All I can think of after getting a third of the way through it was, "am I still eating soup?" The cafe part, you can sit at the cafe/wine bar and just do that in lieu of a table, or linger and have something from their bakery case. If that doesn't work the bakery case has a register so you can do a take out. You can also order whole cakes or other goodies. The specialty grocery items include, wine, olive oils, jams, and other little items. Nice people, nice place, good stuff, happy us!

38.description: Very mediocre food, poor service, and no environment. Many better choices in Greektown.

51.description: Delicious! I love how late this place was open, the drinks and coffee were yummy. I enjoy the Greek style bakery delights. If u want to go to a late night place this a good place to go

27.description: The inferno pizza DID NOT live up to all the hype of the other reviews. It was tasteless and doughy. The worst pizza I've EVER had at a restaurant.

32.description: The chicken and mozzarella is very delicious. It comes with salad of your choice also. For the dessert, walnut tart is my favorite.  Love this place!!!!!

54.description: Great food at great prices! I love their Mediterranean salad!! And their mediterranean feast dish has some of the best hummus I've had. If your going to be there, dessert is a must! Basically anything you get is AMAZING! But I do highly recommend an assortment of cookies! The service is friendly and fast. As a college student this is the place I frequently visit for healthy choices and inexpensive meals, that are always delicious.

48.description: I actually was excited to visit this place, but I discovered that it is way below expectations. Service is not that good there. Staff is not welcoming as it should be!! Probably because they recognize us as foreign!!

44.description: The food is good, the coffee is to die for, and the service is pretty good too. Don't get me started on their desserts.

24.description: THE BEST place to get desserts and coffee!!! I been there a few times and I took my family visiting from California this past weekend.  We tried tons of tasty  Greek desserts from the pretty glass cases  and coffee.They even have Greek alcohol if you want a awesome drink. The prices are perfect and it's even open late.  Service was perfect

7.description: Best walnut baklava also the chocolate raspberry cake is the best thing to have on the menu it simply melts in your mouth, it's ridiculously delicious you gotta try it!!!

49.description: Simply amazing!!!! Got to go! In the summer, you HAVE to try the iced frape coffee...The only restaurant in Greek town that has artopitas (cheese pies, spinach pies, etc) in an individual serviced packaging. The artopitas are fantastic. But so are the daily made various other cooked plates and the salads. Great potato salad (warning: it has garlic) and great desserts. Have to try the local Greek Loukoumades dessert. Buy some bread and deserts to go on your way out. Nice ambiance and the owner, Maria, is just a sweetheart!!!

40.description: One of my favorite places to get brunch and lunch in Greektown- the artopitas are my favorite! They're buttery, flavorful, and flaky; they just simply melt in your mouth. Truthfully, the sandwiches are okay, they're pretty good but nothing special. The artopitas are what truly steal the show. The two free sides that come with food are their potato and pasta salad- I have had both. I think the potato salad is flavorless and quite bland, and that the pasta salad is absolutely spectacular. Most of the people I have brought here seem to agree.The atmosphere is nice, cozy, and a perfect place to take someone if you wan to sit, chat, and relax.

53.description: I've been here a few times for lunch--the Artopitas are really good (spanakopita type savory pastries). The seafood salad was a little disappointing, mostly kalamari that was a little rubbery, but overall their hot food is good and their pastry selection is good as well. Expect to pay a little more here; prices are a little higher than I expected for a casual cafe, similar to the restaurants next door. Service was a mixed bag: the first time our waitress wouldn't make any menu adjustments for us, but the second time our waitress was really friendly and helpful. My recommendation is to get the artopitas or kebabs and save room for dessert.

30.description: Food is always good but service is extremely messed up. If they could improve their quality of their waitresses, I will definitely give this place 5 stars.

46.description: Sunday at 11 pm and it's busy. That's generally a good sign, though maybe it's because it's one of very few places around here open after 10. Service is slow. So slow that I actually gave my friend cash while I waited in the car. But they have a variety of nice desserts and an iced chai that's not quite an Indian chai, but not a white-girl chai either. I enjoyed it. I can see myself coming here in the future for evening study times.

1.description: This place is very good for dessert. Even at 9pm at night, they had a bunch of desserts still stocked. The service was a little slow. We couldn't find our waitress and she didn't introduce herself.I got the Le Symphony which is a chocolate mousse was good. It was rich and not as smooth, but you did get the chocolate flavor. My friend got the mango yogurt mousse. It was smoother than my chocolate mousse.Not bad. I'd go back to try more desserts.

55.description: The food was good but the service wasn't. The server kept trying to take our plates away when we weren't done and we had not given any reason to assume that. It felt like we were being rushed and there were plenty of open seats around.

9.description: Three of us came here after having dinner at a near by restaurant for some desserts.  Upon entering, this bakery / coffee shop, I had noticed how lively this place is.  This place is very well lit and just a cool vibe.You walk up to the counter and start to look at all of your options for desserts, coffees, teas, and soda.  After placing your order, just find a table or seating area and your order will be brought to you.  The service and food were outstanding.  I would recommend this place for great service and food and a little time to relax.

26.description: The galaktobouriko was great. That's the 4 stars for. Otherwise if I really reviewed this place based on the service it would not get the 4 stars. I have no idea who the girl was behind the counter but she was cold and fake. She asked me how the sweet was and I told her it was good. I also shared that my father had a place like this and instead of showing some interest, like anybody else had that I shared the story with in the past, she just ok me and left. I tried to be friendly but she kept the cold attitude, which I'm not used to, until the end. I'm sure they don't speak a word Greek even though they like to play a sophisticated Athenian radio station. I just have to say this: I was trying to guess why the girl was so rude for quite some time!. I came up with various thoughts. Maybe she thought I was a Greek sad looking for help? I'm trying to excuse them now but yes the truth is I do have the feeling that Greek Americans are not very friendly to Greeks that came to the US recently. That's not my case but I'm still trying to figure out why everybody else in the us treats me with proper customer service but not my "own" people. If they were. They were polite in general (the fake superficial style) to other people. Oh well, I guess it will stay a mystery to me. It's not my destiny to find my country's hospitality outside Greece. The galactobouriko was still good. Fyllo was crispy, cream was ok. Better than next door artopolis that they keep it in the refrigerator which is a big no no

25.description: Used to go here all the time. The Frappes & Fredos are awesome but disappointed in the food. There really isn't much taste to the food these days. The atmosphere is great & our server was good as well.

12.description: almond cookiessame great tasteas i remember from college!lots of the same great pastriessame cute interior.

59.description: Casual and cozy cafe with a great selection of desserts.  The loukoumades, especially, is heavenly.

21.description: Been here multiple times. It is a great place for a casual lunch or dinner or to grab a delicious dessert from the bakery. You can grab bakery items to go or sit and eat in the cafe, where you can order off the menu. I particularly enjoyed the Mediterranean Fest and Melinzana Crostini appetizers. I've tried multiple bakery items and they never disappoint! Service is sometimes slow, but this did not bother me at the time, as I was in no rush. Overall, this is the perfect little cafe and bakery!

17.description: Berry Cheesecake. That is what you must have at this place. I've had other desserts too, like the mango mousse, the coconut mousse, the chocolate eclair, the lemon tart, etc. And they are all good. But the berry cheesecake stands above the rest.

10.description: Artopolis is easily one of my favorite bakeries in Chicago. They're a cafe as well, but I've never come for anything savory. I head straight for the desserts!They have three or four bakery cases when you walk in, all filled with amazing treats. Behind that there is a display of all of their fresh breads. I have yet to have anything bad here. Most recently, we loaded up on baklava, chocolate-raspberry mousse, lemon tarts, and cheesecakes. The chocolate-raspberry treats were delicious. They're covered in ganache and are so rich, you almost think you can't finish a piece. Then, of course, you do. The lemon tarts I think are my favorite. They are just the right amount of both sweet and tart, the filling is thick without being too much. The crust is super crunchy and really sweet, which is a nice contrast to the tart lemon curd. The cheesecake... Well I never got to try that because my dad ate all of it. I think that's a good sign. The baklava is textbook and delicious, with heavy doses of honey and nuts with flaky pastry. I make a point now to come here whenever I'm in the neighborhood, and it's given me a reason to venture up to Greektown more often. I'd definitely recommend it. But, it's all so good looking and tempting, be prepared to walk out of there with a full box of treats.

5.description: My go to for a quick sit down breakfast. The food is fresh and delicious and the coffee is amazing!

3.description: Stop in after getting dinner at Mr. Greeks and I made sure I left room for dessert. It's really confusing upon entering though because there's no sign indicating that some one seat us or we seat ourselves or what... But upon arrival, we just wanted some dessert and approach the counter because there's no sign indicating the seating situation. So when we talked to the counter girl, since we wanted to have dessert there, we would have to seat ourselves and someone would come take our order. But we were already ready to order so we had to wait awhile for a server to approach us. Then when someone took our order, we had to wait when the dessert we wanted was already in the counter glass but whatever we waited. We finally got our dessert and it was pretty decent. I really enjoyed how moist the tiramisu was but I wish there was more cake in it and not just the other filling stuff but nonetheless it was still very tasty. My boyfriend got the strawberry shortcake and well there isn't anything special about it. But definitely a great spot for dessert though!

35.description: I've walked past this restaurant plenty of times but never went inside until a few weeks ago. My friend and I were choosing out a cake for my birthday and artopolis came up on yelp as highly rated for cakes, they supposedly have one of the best tiramisus in the city. Not that much parking in this area so we parked a few blocks away. We also ordered a chicken kebob plate with grilled tomatoes, rice pilaf, and tzatiki sauce.  I was able to try the mango mousse, tiramisu, and raspberry chocolate ganache cake. The chicken kebob plate was about $5 and had a decent amount of food on it, but not enough to justify the price. After trying the cakes I picked a mango mousse cake to order, and was not disappointed. The mango mousse cake is so light creamy and fluffy!! I would buy this for every special occasion if I had the chance. The other cakes were good as well but not enough to get an entire cake worth.

19.description: We order cakes and come here for desserts pretty often. My husband loves their tiramisu cake. He says it's the best one in Chicago he's ever had! We also love the mango yogurt mousse cake - we normally order this as a birthday cake for someone special every year. My co-workers and I came here for dessert after dinner. I had the mango yogurt mousse cake and shared with them. They all loved it - it was not too sweet, moist, and light. One of my co workers ordered their espresso tart - very chocolatey.. I thought it was very rich in chocolate so it wasn't for me but she really enjoyed it. My husband ordered their hazelnut prarline cake which he thought was okay. Really enjoyed just hanging out and chatting with some yummy desserts. Great bakery. Yummy desserts!

28.description: Devine service and the food was delectable. Our waitress was 03 Mariia sugest her she was very informative. We came back for desert and coffee. The deserts are awesome.

45.description: Extremely disappointing!! Placed an order for a birthday cake for my daughter's 3rd birthday, came to pick it up to find out THEY ARE CLOSED!!!! What a letdown... It is difficult to say they are closed on labor day and won't accept the order!!!!!?????

33.description: The tables were not wiped and extremely dirty when I sat down. It took a while for the waitress to come and she did not look happy or welcoming. Food wise- crepes were not warm, cold and bland. I make better crepes at home. The soup, artopolis pie, ceasear salad tasted fabulous.

43.description: Three of us came here after having dinner at a near by restaurant for some desserts.  Upon entering, this bakery / coffee shop, I had noticed how lively this place is.  This place is very well lit and just a cool vibe.You walk up to the counter and start to look at all of your options for desserts, coffees, teas, and soda.  After placing your order, just find a table or seating area and your order will be brought to you.  The service and food were outstanding.  I would recommend this place for great service and food and a little time to relax.

2.description: I had my first Spanakopita here circa 2005 and fell in love with Spanakopita. Been wanting to come back, but I haven't until last week. It wasn't very busy during early dinner time on a Thursday, but there were a few couples and families. I ordered the Jambon and Kasseri (Zamponopita) with a large amount of potato salad (you could get pasta instead of potato salaries) because I haven't seen other types of Artopitas anywhere else. It had Black Forest Ham, mushroom, peppers, Kasseri and Cheddar cheese wrapped in baked filo dough. The Zamponopita wasn't fresh because the filo was not crispy and the whole thing wasn't warm. A major disappointment from my Spanakopita memory. The potato salad was ok. The best part of my meal was the Greek white wine tasting. The Greek wine tasting was like $10 with four 2 oz Greek wines and you can pick between white and reds. They also have a world wine tasting for $2 less, but it had common wines I have heard of and tried. There is a ramp that goes from the main entrance to the café area that have accessible tables, but there are downstairs and upstairs seating area that are not wheelchair accessible. My sister says that there is a wheelchair accessible restroom stall, but I didn't check it out myself. I'll try the Spanakopita if I come again and make sure it's fresh and warm.

18.description: Pastries 4 stars and food 2 stars making it 3 stars.    We loved our dark chocolate mousse, tiramisu and lemon tart. Food, on the other hand, was a huge disappointment. None of our pizzas had enough spicy tomato sauce. In fact, the people who I was eating the inferno with all agreed there actually wasn't any sauce on the inferno. I believe they forgot to put it on. As a result, our pizza was dry. Besides not having enough sauce on the mushroom pizza, the overall combination of the ingredients just weren't on point. The feta cheese made it too salty. The orzo pasta with the beef wasn't anything amazing here either. I will not be coming back for the food. Only dessert.

41.description: This review is only for the desserts.  I ordered the Ekmek and the Valrhona Chocolate Mousse.  Both were only ok.  The Ekmek was flavorful with the Katiafi crust and the light custard and honey while the Valrhona was not sweet (bitter from the dark chocolate) and very one note.  I love chocolate, but this just didn't do it for me.

52.description: interesting, inexpensive, nice place if you're in a hurry. I love trying new things and the staff helps out quite a bit

50.description: Pass me the latte, cheesecake, pasta salad, & a sandwich please ! This place has it all & all of it is SO delish. Stumbling upon here on a lunch date with the girls & couldn't be anymore thrilled. Fresh baked breads & fresh meats with a huge variety of choices make this an easy pick for even the pickiest eaters. Fresh desert and a latte bar sets this apart from other neighborhood cafes. Good place for a first date- very relaxed & cozy ambiance!

4.description: I have fond memories of the handful of times I went to Artopolis when I was a college student but my last visit did not live up to my memories and expectations. When my sister and I walked in, I was unsure if we should seat ourselves or place our order at the kitchen. We sat ourselves and after quite a while, someone came to our table with menus.My sister ordered the Jabon Artopita and I ordered the Chicken Rigganatti. The Artopita did not taste fresh and it tasted like it had been sitting out for a while. It was not crispy like I expected. I'm under the impression that all the food is pre-made and warmed up when it is ordered. The kitchen looks a bit like a cafeteria with all the vegetables already cut up and ready to go. The chicken was crispy and juicy but bland. I wished that there was hot sauce to eat with it. I wasn't a big fan of the potato and vegetables that came with the Rigganatti--they were all a bit sour. On a positive note, I did enjoy the potato salad that came with the Artopita. I remember enjoying their sandwiches and fries in college so next time, I will try those items. Also, my sister did a wine tasting of Greek wines that she really enjoyed and that was reasonably priced. Our waitress was also friendly and attentive.

6.description: I've walked past this restaurant plenty of times but never went inside until a few weeks ago. My friend and I were choosing out a cake for my birthday and artopolis came up on yelp as highly rated for cakes, they supposedly have one of the best tiramisus in the city. Not that much parking in this area so we parked a few blocks away. We also ordered a chicken kebob plate with grilled tomatoes, rice pilaf, and tzatiki sauce.  I was able to try the mango mousse, tiramisu, and raspberry chocolate ganache cake. The chicken kebob plate was about $5 and had a decent amount of food on it, but not enough to justify the price. After trying the cakes I picked a mango mousse cake to order, and was not disappointed. The mango mousse cake is so light creamy and fluffy!! I would buy this for every special occasion if I had the chance. The other cakes were good as well but not enough to get an entire cake worth.

22.description: I don't know where to find an edible cake outside of Artopolis!

15.description: I DON'T EVEN LIKE UNSWEETENED COFFEE, BUT IF YOU'RE A COFFEE DRINKER THE ESPRESSO FREDO IS TO DIE FOR. My sister wouldn't stop talking about how she felt like she was back in Greece!!!! My chai tea latte though it wasn't sweet at all it was one of the best chai's I had ever tasted! They give you some sugar on the side and one packet of sugar was just enough for me! Baklava, Almond Baklava, Kataifi: All of the desserts that I have tried weren't EXTREMELY sweet. It was just a nice hint of sweetness to it, but wasn't overpowering. I highly recommend the Almond Baklava, it was very flaky and you can taste just the hint of almond in it. ALL REALLY GOOD. This place is a must try! It is on the border of Greek Town!

57.description: I couldn't get enough of this place! The breakfast ham and cheese pastry was amazing and the fruit was fresh and just the right amount of sweet after my savory.The tiramisu.... Where do I start? Just get one. The baklava was also fluffy and moist. Yum. Can't wait to go back.

20.description: Pastries 4 stars and food 2 stars making it 3 stars.    We loved our dark chocolate mousse, tiramisu and lemon tart. Food, on the other hand, was a huge disappointment. None of our pizzas had enough spicy tomato sauce. In fact, the people who I was eating the inferno with all agreed there actually wasn't any sauce on the inferno. I believe they forgot to put it on. As a result, our pizza was dry. Besides not having enough sauce on the mushroom pizza, the overall combination of the ingredients just weren't on point. The feta cheese made it too salty. The orzo pasta with the beef wasn't anything amazing here either. I will not be coming back for the food. Only dessert.

36.description: Since this is listed as a bakery first this rating applies toward the bakery.  When I pay $5 for piece of baklava it need to be good.  It was dry as the Sahara and when I called back in thinking they would just tell me to bring it back so they could swap it out I heard nothing back from the manager.  The food is good and great ambience, but the service has never been spectacular and bakery is subpar.  This is greek town you are not the only game I'm going to explore my other options. And please don't even try to send me a fake response after the fact because you really don't care.

14.description: I don't speak Greek but this restaurant should be Greek for DELICIOUS. if you live anywhere in Chicago, you must visit this place and order the lukamadies. I might have spelled that wrong but regardless, the food here is really good. The ambiance, decor and service are all wonderful. If I remember correctly, the bakery has a ton of selections. The bathrooms are very clean too Street parking is scarce but it's right near the blue line at UIC Halstead. Just exit the Halstead side and head north. This restaurant is in Greek town and close to the University of Illinois Chicago campus. It is totally worth a visit or two.

29.description: i love my new short hair cut! Rene did a fabulous job and best part I donated 10 inches of hair to locks of love!

42.description: Got my $20 haircut here - included wash, cut, blow dry/style.  The ladies were very nice, quick, and did the job right.  My haircut is basic, not too much going on - 2.5 cut on the bottom, layers, side swipe bangs, and thinned out.  Jeanette was nice and Saadia helped me on the front, but according to the reviews, she's very good too.

23.description: I have long straight hair, came in for a "trim". I lost four inches and left with uneven cut. Left side being more than an inch longer than the right.

47.description: What a fantastic place! I feel bad for people who work in suburban office complexes that are in the middle of nowhere. Yesterday I spent my lunch hour getting a luxurious scalp massage, deep conditioning treatment and hot new haircut and style all for only $27!I am in love with my new haircut (first time I've had bangs since I was three!) and my stylist (Saadia) was so wonderful. She really listened to me, I trusted her to give me a completely different style than any I've had in the past, and she gave me a fantastic haircut. I tend to dread going to the salon because I am not a fan of the usual forced banter that happens at hair salons about celebrity gossip or what-not. But Saadia was reassuring, relaxing and let me enjoy reading my book while still answering all the key questions I had about the haircut and how to style it. She wasn't judgmental about  how long it had been since my last haircut and she didn't do any heavy-handed product pushing.I highly recommend this Hair Cuttery in Greektown (they're open 9a-9p, Mon-Sat), and especially Saadia. I'm looking forward to a longterm stylist-customer relationship with her! :)Call to find out Saadia's current hours!

8.description: I was recommended to Stosh by a friend who had been going to him for years and I have been going to him for haircuts ever since. I've gone to several high-end salons in the city, and Stosh honestly has given me the best hair cuts compared to them. He is super passionate about his job and gives you great haircare tips for at home. I would recommend him again and again to any of my friends!

31.description: Rene is the best!!!

34.description: I'd never been to one of these chains and decided to walk-in after noticing how bad my ends were. I didn't need an appointment, got shampoo/conditioned, angled-cut, blow dried straight, and flat-ironed for $35. I have hair almost down to my elbows and it's fairly thick, so I thought the price was great!

16.description: Came in to fix a mess of a bleach job and came out feeling and looking amazing. Zee is great! Easy to talk to and didn't hold back. She knew it was gonna be a challenge. (I could tell by the look on her face when I let my hair out of the bun.) Still she showed me my options and when I picked a color that was lighter than she would have recommended she went with it dried my hair a little and asked if I wanted to go with the darker color. Of course she was right. So she added the color without any fuss. Definitely will be going back.

13.description: General cut, kinda pricey... Not my thing. Great people but way too generic and costly. There's equal quality at a better price out there

11.description: The 5 stars are for Stosh. I've seen him for a couple yrs. now, and he's super talented and a joy to spend time with. i highly recommend him- can't speak for other stylists.

39.description: Best Hair Cuttery there is. Anna did my hair the other day, showing great attention to what I was going for, an giving helpful recommendation along the way. Very satisfied, and will definitely continue going back.

37.description: First time at this location and I was pleasantly greeted by Saadia.I don't do anything fancy with my hair but I still like it to look fresh. I have long layers and side-swept bangs. I've been trying to grow it out to donate so I've just been doing trims for the last few months.Saadia was sweet, patient, told me what she was doing and listened to what I wanted. She trimmed the layers and bangs and thinned my hair out with a razor as my hair gets really thick and heavy after a while. She said my hair would look like it was out of a magazine when we were done and she was right! It was so shiny, soft, and flowing. I wish she could blow dry my hair for me everyday!I did the shampoo, cut, blow dry for $30. My cost would've been $15 without the blow dry (I have long hair).Will definitely be going back :)

0.description: I walked in on a Wednesday without an appointment.There were only 2 stylists that day & I was waiting on Lindsey (who was still working away), but Rene kindly took me in after she was done with her client so I wouldn't have to wait much longer.I asked for a shampoo & cut with a simple layered haircut ( I have thick hair ), & she did an awesome job! She didn't take long at all, & I LOVE my new haircut. I wasn't aware she was a "master stylist" & that she usually charges a bit more, yet she stillcharged me the regular stylist price.I'm glad to have found a stylist I can trust with my hair, yey!

38.description: I came here by a fluke.  I desperately wanted to change my hair style one day and decided to get some fringe.  I found myself in the West Loop area and found on Yelp that there was a Hair Cuttery in that area so I popped in.  Luckily, there was no one in line and I was next for a cut.  She got me in and out in less than 10 minutes.  And best part, my fringe cut only cost $5 bucks!!! Yep, you got that right!  $5 bucks.  Rene was awesome and several weeks later, I came back for a regular cut because she did such a great job on my bangs.  Another great job done!  I might just make this my regular joint.  Keep in mind that I am nowhere near the west loop.

27.description: I went here yesterday and I got the worst hair cut, EVER! I go here because it is close to my apartment and the first time I went here was quite good. Since however it has gotten worse and worse and yesterday my "stylist", was rock bottom.Bad customer service, very very poor hair cut, I had my girlfriend try and fix all the unevenness when I got home. I won't be going here again!

32.description: I walked in to this Greektown location in a pinch - I called my regular stylist too late and she was booked up for the weekend.  I had high hopes; there were good reviews, and besides, I just needed to trim my split ends....UGH.  Wish I had just waited.  I gave instructions to the stylist to take 2 inches off of all of my ends - and just to clean up my [very] long layers.  She did indeed take 2 inches off the bottom - but she took FIVE inches off of my layers.  Okay, whatever.  I can deal with extremely short layers.  What was agonizing was that she hacked at the layers, no blending was evident at all and some pieces were shorter toward the back of my head than the front!  She didn't even check the lengths to make sure it was even on both sides - though I could tell just by eyeballing it, that's how bad it was!  I was in shock - I paid, got out as soon as possible, and made an emergency call to my regular stylist.  She luckily had a cancellation and was able to do some blending - she was horrified and said she hadn't seen a hack job that badly in awhile :(I know this was only one experience with only one stylist.  I have to say her name did not come up in any previous reviews so perhaps she was new to this establishment.  I hope she sticks to only cutting men's hair in the future...unfortunately I will not be back to find out!Two stars because they were extremely prompt with checking me in and out (thankfully!), and the lady who cut my hair was VERY nice even though she probably needs a cosmetology school review.

44.description: So on my way home I decided it was time to stop in and get my cut cleaned up and take care of my dreadful roots.  I have gone to several Hair Cutterys and seen several different stylists with varying results.  I can honestly say that my experience at this new location was one of the best ones I have had with this company.The stylists were courteous and friendly taking the time to not only explain the plan for my color and style but also correcting flaws in my previous cuts.  I took an instant liking to Mykil so it was easy to pass the time while the color processed.The final result was great color and cut and a pleasant way to pass the time in the salon.  I'll definitely go back.

24.description: I used to be a fan of this place until one appointment went terribly wrong. I had a 9am appt to get a trim and highlights. After a four hour ordeal, there was a big orange spot in the front of my hair. We had to do the entire process all over. Four hours later, I could have died. I looked like a skunk with huge blonde chunks. At this point, the managers offered to re-do my hair for a THIRD time. I allowed them to fix it, but I literally came in that morning and left after CLOSING time. I was starving. A stylist offered me a granola bar, but literally that was 13 hours of my life I will never get back. I have learned that it's just worth it to spend the extra money at a quality salon. I actually reached out to the company via facebook to get an email or address to send them a letter, and they said they didn't have one. So their customer service is up there with the quality of their employees.

7.description: Scheduled an appointment with Brittany the assistant manager the day before. I got a trim, shampoo, and semi-deep condition (no blow dry). The total was $28, not bad for all of that!  This is my second time going to Brittany and I am satisfied each time. The first time I came in I got a trim and all over dye. I used to have ombre so we evened out my hair by dying it back to my natural color. Its only slightly faded but overall my ombre is still covered. The second time, was this time when I came to get the trim. Brittany evened out my trim and kept the length. I have already scheduled my next appointment to lighten my hair, i'll let you know how that goes!

40.description: I got a haircut from Anna last week and it was a great experience.  I wasn't really sure what I wanted, but she was very patient and helpful- showed me lots of pictures and talked me through it.  She was also great about explaining how to take care of it.  A week later, great haircut, I am very pleased. :-)

30.description: I needed a haircut at the last minute and came here optimistic because of all the positive reviews. I made an appointment the day before to see Rene, but unfortunately and unbeknownst to me, I had scheduled it at a very busy time. I had to wait THIRTY minutes after my scheduled time just to get started, and Rene ended up helping a guy about ten minutes before me, even though he came in after me with no appointment. I was instead helped by someone else who was visibly unhappy to be there, and although she wasn't unfriendly to me, I did not appreciate being asked multiple times whether I wanted to go shorter. I put a lot of thought into how much I want cut off, and such a question seems to me like a roundabout way of saying she doesn't agree. The style looked fine at the end after she had blown it dry, but now that I've dried it myself, I realize it is a little too short and just looks "meh."  The only saving grace for this place was that Rene was incredibly welcoming and cordial, but even that was overshadowed by the flat demeanor of everyone else working there.  I will never again underestimate the advantages of my regular appointment-only salon, and I'll gladly shell out more to get exactly what I want.

46.description: The "1/2 off haircuts" coupon for this salon is available at the following link:haircuttery.com/home/our…It's good through June 16th, 2010. :-)

1.description: Bottom line: got a sub-par trim and was charged for services I didn't ask for or receive.Details:The stylist didn't offer to give my hair a wash before the cut. She brushed it, but didn't re-part my hair (it was an obviously windblown, crooked part). The haircut came out looking fine, but more like a trim that my little sister would have done for me than something I paid for.During the haircut the stylist asked me if she could style my hair and framed it as a favor to her, something she wanted to do for fun. I said "sure," and that she could play with it if she wanted, but I was just in for the trim. She braided it, which looked nice but which was totally unnecessary for a Wednesday evening - I was just going to have to take it out before bed anyway. When she was done, she added an extra fee to the bill for styling - which I didn't ask for - and also charged me for a wash - which I didn't get and wasn't offered.

9.description: Decent prices, friendly and good stylist.

26.description: Jeanette knows what she does well! She takes her own sweet time doing the best she can do for your hair and if you are in a hurry just let her know, she'll take care of you in like under 10 mins. Trust me on this. She is quick and good at her work. It is walking distance from my place so quite convenient. $15 for a shampoo and haircut is pretty neat as well. I am very choosy when it comes to hair and i really like em. :)

25.description: Love this place.  Went there for the hell of it not expecting much and I was very pleasantly surprised.  Shampoo, fabulous conditioning treatment, cut and blow dry for $29!  OMG!  in love.  My stylist is fabulous too.  I was just back there and all the above with partial highlights - I believe it was $72!!  I would have paid that just for the color or cut in some other places and I am more satisfied here.  Sure I don't get the lemon water and the beautiful robe to sit in and all the employees fawning on you, which I never liked anyway cause I want to get in and out so I can get on with my life.  That's what I get here - great product and best use of my time.  I highly recommend them!!

12.description: It's been MONTHS and I still can't fix the mess Brittany made. My hair still looks terrible.  The only way to fix it is to cut off all my hair which I obviously will not do. Hopefully one day my hair will be long and beautiful again.

21.description: You have to go see Brittany!  I have long straight hair that  - you know the kind that can make you look like Marsha Brady if you're not careful?  Yeah, that hair.  Brittany does the most amazing layering job of any stylist I've ever been to. Not to mention the fact that she's cool and funny.

17.description: I've been going to Stosh for almost 2 years now and I can honestly say I've never questioned my decision to not try elsewhere.He is very personable and detail oriented.  He takes his time to do the cut right and I always leave a happy customer.

10.description: Was recommended by a friend to go see Stosh -- That was 3 years ago, and I've been with him ever since.  Great style and great conversation.  No brainer if you are looking for a go-to barber in the city.

5.description: I give up on this Hair Cuttery. I scheduled an appointment for a haircut, arrived 10 minutes early with no one waiting in front of me, then proceeded to wait 1 HOUR before they cut my hair. There wasn't a shortage of staff or anything, and when one of the stylists finally finished cutting someone else's hair, they decided to skip over my name and call the next person on the list. Luckily the person they called was a decent human being and let me go in front of them since I had been waiting longer. The unprofessionalism of this "salon" is astounding. Is is to much to ask to get decent service and in a timely manner? I'll pass on visiting this location ever again.

3.description: Jazz is pretty awesome. She knows how to cut hair well. This is a corporate business, where owners are I the haircut business. That's a plus point. They are not restricted to cut your hair in 15 minutes or less. It's nice that they don't rush the haircut like other businesses. Thanks so much.

35.description: All women know there is a certain stigma about going to a 'chain' hair salon.  I bet everyone has horror stories, disappointed outcomes, and overall low expectations for these places.I have really long hair, and have been going to the same hairstylist in my home town for 5 years. Since I've moved to Chicago, I haven't had a haircut.  That was 2 years ago!!  Prices in Chicago are ridiculous, I couldn't swallow $60 for a trim.  I researched places, called about 12 different salons, and thought to myself:  Alright, reviews look good, I'll try it for a small trim.  Whats the most that can go wrong?Rene, 9 months pregnant btw, was the kindest, most professional hairstylist I have ever experienced!  I got a Deep conditioning treatment, a great shampoo, cut along with a fringe, and an amazing outcome.  FOR UNDER $30!!  I am sooooo happy:1) for having the first cut in 2 years... 2) I've found a brilliant place to go and get pampered for great prices.To all of you who are wondering where to go: DEFINITELY try this salon.

19.description: I used to be a fan of this place until one appointment went terribly wrong. I had a 9am appt to get a trim and highlights. After a four hour ordeal, there was a big orange spot in the front of my hair. We had to do the entire process all over. Four hours later, I could have died. I looked like a skunk with huge blonde chunks. At this point, the managers offered to re-do my hair for a THIRD time. I allowed them to fix it, but I literally came in that morning and left after CLOSING time. I was starving. A stylist offered me a granola bar, but literally that was 13 hours of my life I will never get back. I have learned that it's just worth it to spend the extra money at a quality salon. I actually reached out to the company via facebook to get an email or address to send them a letter, and they said they didn't have one. So their customer service is up there with the quality of their employees.

28.description: I was hesitant at first to walk into a chain hair salon but was I SURPRISED!  I typically go to 2 different salons to get my hair how I like it.  Highlights at one, haircut at another.  Now I've found ONE.. Jeanette was my stylist and she was amazing!  Jeanette listened to what I wanted and highlighted my hair perfectly and her cut was beautiful.. Beautiful long layers... Sooooo if you're reading the reviews deciding best place to go... Just go...Believe me you won't be disappointed with Jeanette as your stylist!

45.description: I did it again... yup, I went to Hair Cuttery. I liked Rene so much that I followed her not just from Wicker Park, but from WP to Wrigleyville to her current (and hopefully somewhat permanent) location in Greektown.I've said it before and I'll say it again: I love my regular stylist, but at $65 a pop, it's great to have a cheaper alternate on rotation. Rene does a great job, keeping my hair cute and healthy in between my more expensive salon visits.

33.description: I love this place.  The four times I've been here I have always gotten a good cut at a great price.  It is quick and the stylists are open to your suggestions.  I've tried a bunch of other salons, and can't justify spending a ton of money on a haircut that will grow out in a few weeks.  So the Hair Cuttery is perfect for me.   A nice cut that grows out well, and is easy to get back into shape whenever I feel like it.  Yay!

43.description: Many people think Hair Cuttery is just for men's hair cuts--au contraire!  I follow my colour specialist & guru stylist--Anya--where she goes!  First @ Aveda on Clark, then Hair Cuttery in Greek Town!Like every girl I get bored quickly with my hair so I change it often (i.e. every 6 weeks or after every bad date).  I parked my scooter in the free parking in the back--I hate paying for street parking :) and asked Anya for something different.  1hr later I got a purple panel and blonde tips from my favorite Day Maker--Anya.This girls rocks--hands down!

2.description: I didn't even want to give them 1 star. I was a walk in client. V, the black lady at the first chair told me she would take care of me in 15 minutes. When I got to her I told her exactly what I wanted. I just got some $300  22 inch extentions put in and I wanted her to cut them into a V shape to give it a flowing look.
