She cut the front down to about 12 inches and the back looks choppy and fucked up. I was in tears!!! Brittney, the manager tried to step in and fix it but there was nothing she could do. They gave me the cut for free but who's going to pay for my $300 extentions???? I got my weave installed monday and here it is Wednesday I have to take it out because they fucked it up. I'm sooooooo pissed right now!

18.description: I've only recently started to go to this location but the staff is incredibly friendly. My favorite hairdresser Stosh has just moved here and I could not be happier. Despite the long commute I do not trust anyone else. My haircut could only be perfected by him. So please book him in advance because he is worth visiting. Home is where the Stosh is!

41.description: I think I just got a bad stylist but I received the worst haircut ever.  I will not return to this location.  I have been to other Hair Cuttery locations where the stylists were more professional and had more skills.

4.description: If I can put no stars, I would.I came in because this Hair Cuttery was convenient and I generally don't have bad experiences with Hair Cuttery. Unfortunately, I don't have the stylist's name (her chair is on the right side, second to the last) but she gave me the worst service and haircut I've ever had in my life. I just wanted my hair hanging above my shoulders and texturized a bit like with that scissor with teeth because my hair can be a bit bulky on the sides. I didn't get any of that.She just cut my hair just straight across, separating some of my layers and it's still past my shoulders when I said ABOVE my shoulders. She didn't even check to see if everything was even. Her technique was just weird like its how you think you would cut hair without any training.  I didn't want to complain because I didn't want her to mess it up even more! Id rather have my regular stylist fix her mistakes. I understand a blow dry isn't included but she sends me to sit under those blow dryers blowing cool air! Whats the point!? I just look at my hair and I just get disappointed, sigh.I've lost my faith in Hair Cuttery for simple haircuts.P.S. I gave her a $2 tip, I'm too nice.

6.description: I've been going to this location since they opened and I've never been so displeased with the service I recieved on Monday from Ashley. She totally disregarded a specific style I want. She cut my hair damn completely bald. Total opposite of what I asked for and I showed her a pic of the particular style.I can't see myself returning. Oh wait I have no hair to return for.

22.description: If you're an Asian guy, ask for Ann because she does the fade very nicely. My haircuts are generally very simple but the fade is the most important part.

15.description: Stosh is awesome for cut and color.  Love my new color and my whole family travels to Greek Town to see Stosh.  We are regulars for Stosh only.

20.description: Great hair cutting salon!! The value is great, the people their are so nice and their is exceptional service. For $17 I can get a cut and a shampoo! It's such a good value for versus some of the other hair cutting salons out there. I would definitely recommend this place to people A+:)

36.description: I originally came here and was seen by Anna who did a good job with my highlights and haircut.  I just recently came because my roots needed a touchup.  Anna was not available the day I needed, but Rene offered to take me in. I wanted my highlights re-done and Rene convinced me that going lighter would be a nice change for the summer.  As she brought out the bleach, I started getting anxious since I've had really bad experiences with bleach and I typically don't do drastic things with my hair unless I go to a more "established" (read expensive, well known) salon.  Rene did a good job calming me down- and then I found out she lived and worked in Hawaii- which is a HUGE plus bc that means she knows how to work with Asian hair-Not many people do.  That also means she knows how to bleach Asian hair without frying it- Which most people do.  I ended up with great color.  She did a great job trimming and re-shaping my hair too.  Overall, I feel Rene is a great stylist- and probably one of the best considering the price she charges.  I definitely will be back- she did a great job.  The styling was affordable- $106 (i believe) for a full head of foils and cut.  There isn't much small talk- she's pretty much all business, which is fine with me.  She's a busy gal with a lot of clients- I'm not much of a talker for a long period of time anyway.I only gave 4 stars since I just got my cut/color yesterday.  I plan to update this after a few weeks to see how the color sticks- and probably after I see her for a second time just so I can confirm how amazing she is.

14.description: I have been getting my hair cut by Stosh for almost 2 years, originally at the Lincoln Park location, now in Greek Town. I will not let anyone else touch my hair! I leave not only with a great haircut, but feeling great! Due to my schedule, it's hard for me to book with Stosh in advance. Luckily, they are super accommodating, and can always squeeze me in, generally within one or two days. The overall salon is clean, and everyone is very friendly! Great atmosphere! I wouldn't go anywhere else!

58.description: This place is incredible. Everyone who works here is as sweet as the baklava they make. The best thing though? The spanikopita. It is out of this world. The macaroons were pretty amazing as well.

56.description: Try the Floyera with Dark Chocolate.  Oh. My. Goodness.

29.description: I was very disappointed with this place. The baklava was very oily and not pleasant. After I noticed the prices I didn't try anything else.

42.description: I came here yesterday, great service! I tried 3 different items, I'm not going to even try to insult anyone by trying to remember exactly what I got and butcher the name of it. I'm not a big fan of honey, but when in Greektown, eat like the Greeks. I was really surprised at how much they made me like the pastries predominately made with honey! I am looking forward to trying new pastries next time I'm in the area!

23.description: I came here pretty unsure of what I wanted so asked the lady behind the counter who gave me the awesome recommendation of apple strudel - and when it came to my table it was huge! Tasted absolutely fantastic and was just generally awesome.

47.description: OK. Want great Greek pastries? It does not get any better than this place...at least that I know of.Small place on Halsted that has a great selection of quality Greek bakery goods.I have been driving down to this place for years and years. Only had a couple times when the pastries were not top notch. Seemed like someone else must have put on baking apron and sort of went a little light on the more flavorful ingredients such as honey, cinnamon and nuts. The young lady behind the counter is always so nice and accommodating. I think she might be the owners daughter. Sometimes her brother is behind the counter and I find him equally as friendly and accommodating. Nice family business with excellent pasties.

8.description: don't be fooled by the flashy, decorative atmosphere of the other bakery/cafe nearby. Pan Hellenic reminds me of the 'kafeneia' in Greece- unassuming but delicious food.the spinach pie is to die for! and the bougatsa (flaky pastry with custard inside) was not overwhelmingly sweet, perfect for morning. The almond cookies were delicious, too. AND they're open until the mid-evening on Sundays. We will be sure to return next time we're in Chicago.

31.description: This is for a box of cookies that I ordered on my way to a party. The lady at the counter was friendly and prompt, I got a pound of cookies (about 17 of them) for $11. I didn't think this was too bad, but then again I don't go to bakeries often. The bakery shop reminded me of when I was a kid and visited my grandparents in Brooklyn-- family owned, fresh cookies and pastries, with little boxed tied with string/sealed with a sticker. The folks at the party loved the cookies and I'll definitely be back to try some of their other goodies.

34.description: I am a virgin when it comes to Greek pastries so I have nothing to compare it to. I saw this pastry shop on an episode of Chicago's best and decided to try it. I tried the Bougasta.  I am very pleased. I had a flaky crust and the filling was just right, not too sweet.  I will be back again in the future.

16.description: I liked it. We tried some biscuits, the almond custard, among other Greek desserts - and it was overall a great experience. Great customer service and a nice, little shop for a date. Regret not getting the baklava in retrospect -- no Greek dessert honestly compares.

13.description: The lady in the store was so rude to me with no reason. I brought group of my friends to show them the store and she was so rude and embarrassed me so much in front of my friends.

11.description: Great, great, great Greek pastries, frappes and overall lovely shop. Try EVERYTHING as its that good and fresh. Loukoumades with chocolate sauce are incredible but only on weekends. Worth it.

39.description: Oh please, PLEASE go here.  I don't often start out this way, but I beg you on bended knee, go here. I was introduced to the place by a friend only a month or two ago, and when in Greektown with friends from out of state, I decided to take them there too (though I think one of them had already heard tales).   It's a small place, but warm and welcoming. The staff is friendly and really takes time with their customers- big smiles and comfortable conversation all around. We'd come for baklava and I'd remembered these small, blissful chocolate sandwiches. You'll see them in the display case.  You should waste no time and buy a few.   They are delectable.  Death by chocolate in petite, perfect packages.   The baklava is gorgeous, drizzled with beautiful honey and packaged up in perfect, light, crispy filo.  There is nothing here I would hesitate to recommend.  Stay for a while, get some coffee, and then do like we did...take some home.  You will not be sorry.  This is pure art. We went back the very next day for another taste.  Go. Taste. Love.

37.description: If you want to eat the best baklava ever, this is your place!

0.description: This bakery has been around forever--having replaced the earlier iteration that burned down.  They have all the classics--baklava, kataifi, galactobouriko, kourambededs.... They also have a nice place to sit and eat them now.   The owners are very friendly and knowledgeable about Greek pastries--they are glad to make up something special if you call ahead.  Of course, nothing is like YIayia's glyka, but this place is pretty good.  Highly recommend if you're in Greektown.

38.description: I LOVE their Greek pastries.  They also have Jordan almonds that are VERY HIGH quality that we purchased to use at the daughter's wedding.  The staff is very friendly and they offer a small selection of hot dish offerings as well as coffee.  I've only had their pastries to take home and devour with relish and much smacking of lips and swelling desire for more more more---I'm basically addicted to Pan Hellenic's offerings and the husband and daughters must do battle with me to keep me away!  They are not very heart healthy, but WOW they are tasty, and buttery deliciously addictive!I highly recommend Pan Hellenic Pastry Shop.  It's worth a special visit just to get pastries to take home.Street parking is VERY difficult but they have a 15 minute loading zone directly in front of the shop on Halsted.

51.description: I love everything there (even though I can't pronounce or spell most of the items on the menu).  My favorite is the shortbread cookies with chocolate in the middle dipped in chocolate (with sprinkles).  They are everything you loved about the Keebler fudge cookies, but way better.  The Greek pastries are very good (baklava, etc.), and also the Greek almond cookies (with powdered sugar).  They have several cookies that are gluten free, including the macaroons (the ones dipped in chocolate taste like the girl scout carmel delights/samoas).  A few other gluten free ones (somewhat random availability) including almond with powdered sugar. Highly recommend stopping by if you're in the area (and yes, it's worth a trip if you're not).

27.description: I dropped into this Greek cafe after dinner out and am so glad I did - stylish decor and atmosphere coupled with fabulous selection of homemade Greek and French pastries. This small, family run bakery/coffee shop serves everything from baklava to french cookies. Everything is home made. I had a french sugar cookie dipped in delicious dark chocolate, and covered in chopped nuts. My boyfriend had what looked like a chocolate sandwich cookie, but it was so much better! The cafe serves Greek and American coffee, and has homemade Greek yogurt with honey for breakfast, along with Greek breads. We are going back again to try out two more pastries, and strongly suggest you go to! It's right in the heart of all the Greek restaurants and would be a terrific way to end an evening out.

32.description: I have been patronizing this place since 2006.  This baklava haunts my dreams, in a good way.  Keep up the strong work, guys! :)

54.description: I can summarize my experiences at this bakery with the following: Hellas is much, much better. First, the pastries are not that great (and I definitely know my spanakopitas, galaktobourekos, bougatsas, tyropitas, baklava etc.). Second, I take exception to the markup on these pastries...way too expensive. Third, the people behind the counter aren't really friendly or helpful, which is the wrong attitude to have with an ethnic bakery where people want to try new things.

48.description: The heavenly scent inside the shop holds the nose captive. The sheer variety goods contained within astound the eyes. The friendly service entices you to fork over some metaphoric dough so that your tongue can join the party that your other senses are enjoying. And believe you me, that's a good thing!

44.description: love their cookies and baklava. always came here after classes (i went to UIC) and brought a case of cookies to work, and my coworkers loved then. want delicious greek pastries? come here!

24.description: Cute shop with very friendly staff always avaiable to give delicious recommendations on their fresh pastries. The shop smells wonderful and is such a bargain for their sweets! Come here often and always if you're near the blue line.

7.description: Had to walk off our dinner so we Yelped fordessert. This place had high ratings so we checked it out. It's a small Greek pastry shop. I don't know the first thing about Greek pastries, but the shop was clean and pastries looked fresh. We tried an assortment of cookies and 4 other desserts. The guy at the counter was not very friendly and didn't offer any information about the pastries, other than correcting my pronunciation of them. I tried almost everything and I have to say that it was all delicious. The shortbread cookies had a great balance of chocolate and cookie. The custard thing was smooth and not too sweet with a nice hint of lemon. The apple thing was crisp and had a nice balance of filling and crust. The other two things were similar in taste (almonds, honey, etc), not shape. I will be returning on my next trip. Maybe the guy at the counter will have less bakery angst.

49.description: Stopped in to pick up a few gluten free treats for my coworkers.  The place is small and cute and everything looked delicious.   I got a dozen assorted cookies and 2 dark chocolate desserts - almost $20.  Everything was tasty!

40.description: I admit the two tiny almond cookies I bought for $3.85 (which were tiny), were quite tasty but to buy a pound of them was over $17!  I wouldn't pay that much for cookies, no matter how fresh~sorry but I'm on a budget.  It's clear that this place is geared towards a wealthier clientele other than the surrounding college crowd there!

53.description: No one in the world makes Greek bread and pastry like George, the baker!  I know--I've travelled throughout Greece, and have several Greek friends (with mothers who are excellent bakers).  The bread is incredibly delicious and light, and the pastries are unparalleled.  I can buy only four of those little powdered sugar cookies at a time, because the are so good that they seldom survive the ride home.  If I get to heaven, I am sure that their borgatsa, macaroons, baklava, and loukamades will be there.A short vignette:  one year I went to pick up some bakery goods on Xmas Eve.  The bakery was packed with people picking up shopping bags full of advance orders...and me, who just wanted some bread and pastry for the two of us.  But the family who owns this bakery treated me like I was their most important customer and took their time, pointing out which items were specially made for the season.  They made a wonderful impression on me, and thus began our "small-talk" whenever I visit.  I'm so glad they re-opened after the fire in Greektown a few years ago--I would have missed them terribly.

30.description: Best greek desserts ever. Great people and sweets.

46.description: Finally tried this bakery! There was a good variety of sweets when I arrived during the evening so I'm sure the selection is even better during the day. Got the chocolate walnut macaroons, which were soft, rich, and delicious. Also tried the Napoleon, which was phenomenal! The employee was friendly and helpful as well.

1.description: Absolutely love this pastry shop. It's unique, a great environment, and worth the trip to Greek Town! They have traditional Greek desserts as well as some unique regular desserts. I recommend getting a few and sharing them with your friends. It's right next door to some delicious food places. The counter guy was helpful and helped us pick what to try, and even heated up some of the desserts upon request.The baklava is something you must must try. I'd love to come back and try more desserts.

55.description: Absolutely, hands-down, the best baclava outside of Greece. Even people who don't like baclava are stunned by how good theirs is. If you get it fresh, they might even put an extra ladle of honey-rose syrup on top. The spanikopita is also sheer heaven. The phyllo is so light and crispy, the spinach inside is fresh with good feta and sparkle of lemon. You can even buy honey from the owner's hometown. Opa!

9.description: I lived in the Chicago area for many years. If I got anywhere close to downtown, I had to run in and leave with boxes of these treats. Now, when I pass through Chicago, one of my first and last stops is to grab enough to last a few days. My judge of a good restaurant, or in this case a bakery, is whether they have something "crave-able", especially items that you can't get elsewhere. For me, at this bakery, you MUST get the chocolate "cookies" that are really mini, airy brownie sandwiches with a chocolate cream in the middle, and the melt in your mouth almond cookies with almond slivers on the outside and an apricot filling inside. Yes, the chocolate dipped macaroons are divine as are many other items. Just please ship me a couple dozen of each of the two "cookies" noted here. My daughter recently brought me back some, and they were as delicious as ever! I've eaten them - not nearly enough - since the 1980's...

26.description: My favorite spot for Greek pastries outside my yiayia's kitchen! Baklava, Melomakarona, Amygdalota, Kourabiethes...they're all delicious! Very friendly staff, these cookies and sweets are addictive!

25.description: Great place for a date. The coffee was excellent, and the layered fried dough swirl soaked in a light honey syrup was absolutely delicious.

12.description: Counter guy wasn't all that nice, I had a crack a few jokes to break him in... Baklava (1 teeny piece) and 3 almond cookies = $6Nice selection but probably wouldn't go back.... Baklava is better in my old neighborhood of Portage Park!

59.description: Best Greek pastries I've ever had... and I've done my research! Try the tiropita if you're looking for savory!For sweets, oh man, it's endless but my favorite is the chocolate floyera.. holy crap I spelled it right. Anyway try it, omg and the Loukoumades are the best in greek town. Don't even try them anywhere else or you'll kick yourself!Say hi to the friendly people working too, they take pride in their family business and the same pride and love comes out through the food!

21.description: One day after class in early November, we were looking for a place to stop in and grab a quick cup of coffee. We had been to nearby Artopolis before, but were looking for something new to try. Naturally, we walked into Pan Hellenic Pastry Shop because of its convenient location in Greek Town (we go to UIC).  What drew our eyes in particular was how cozy yet modern the cafe looks. We ordered two cups of coffee, two chocolate macaroons, and one large dipla (we had seen it and asked the server what is was. He described it as an egg based pastry fried and rolled in honey and cinnamon and sugar). The server (we can't remember his name :/ )   was extremely helpful and so nice. Max in particular was struck by his not-too-eager enthusiasm to explain the pastries to us and keep our coffees fresh. They serve Bridgeport coffee and it's delicious. The chocolate macaroons were very chocolaty and chewy. The dipla was amazing! It went perfectly with the coffee. Totally recommend it. Overall, our experience was awesome, so we will definitely be back. -Max&Kathy, Kathy&Max

17.description: This is my favorite bakery of all time.  My sister and I come here every time we're in town.I remember my first time coming here when I was in college about 8 years ago.  My mom told me that Greek pastries were the best so I stopped by to buy her some.  The owner was super friendly and even let me try a cookie!  I was very sad to hear that he recently passed away.  My condolences go out to his family.  It's a family run business.  The daughter and son now run it.  They are both friendly.  The girl is funny and a little sassy.  The were aired on a TV show recently.  I believe the episode was called "The Best of Halsted Street."Everything we've tried tastes good.  I don't know the actual names of the cookies because they have elaborate Greek names but we like the powdered ones, the crescent shaped ones made of almonds, and the baklava.  The powdered cookies melt in your mouth.     The only con is that it tends to be on the expensive side.  They charge based on the weight of the cookies.  The shop is pretty small but they have a few small tables that you can sit at to enjoy your cookies.They also have prepackaged items.

10.description: Excellent! Great Greek pastries. Quiet, nice atmosphere. Get the Milopita! (Also galactobutico and bougatsa). Awesome little place.

5.description: I. am. in. heaven. I just ate these powdered sugar almond crescent cookies. ..... WHY DID I ONLY BUY HALF A POUND?! I also ate some ginger honey cookies. Those were also divine.I always have a hard time parking in the area, but I'm glad I persevered. Plus if I had easy access, I would certainly turn into a ball. A ball filled with Greek sugary goodness. Rolling down Halsted street.

3.description: Such a nice place to enjoy a snack and catch up with friends. The staff is incredibly friendly, warmed up my dessert as I'm dining in and even prepped it with powdered sugar and cinnamon. Great selection of pastries, so many to choose from also got a mixed assortment that's perfect for a gift. Also has free wifi. :)

35.description: Hands down the best bakery in Greek town. The baklava is the best I've had anywhere - even in Greece - and all of the other pastries I've tried there have been great. Their spanikopita is divine, as is their homemade yogurt. I also buy olive oil and honey here. Delicious.

19.description: The young man running the store was totally friendly and knowledgeable, patiently explaining the best sellers and offering us samples to help us pick a mix of cookies to buy back for friends. The baked goods are fresh and don't taste mass produced unlike chain stores like Mrs Fields. The variety is pretty big so you can also grab pre packed stuff to go. The shop has a small seating area and I regret not having room for desert as I came here stuffed from (a Greece Islands) dinner! I will definitely return and leave room to eat something in store.

28.description: Counter guy wasn't all that nice, I had a crack a few jokes to break him in... Baklava (1 teeny piece) and 3 almond cookies = $6Nice selection but probably wouldn't go back.... Baklava is better in my old neighborhood of Portage Park!

45.description: What a terrific place, in Greektown and down the street from the Greek Islands, its a wonderful bakery with loads of very tasty, hand made Greek treats. Coffe is also excellent and a few table to sit in and enjoy it all. If you having dinner in Greektown, pass on the desert and make it on down the street and have your after dinner treat here.

33.description: This is my favorite bakery of all time.  My sister and I come here every time we're in town.I remember my first time coming here when I was in college about 8 years ago.  My mom told me that Greek pastries were the best so I stopped by to buy her some.  The owner was super friendly and even let me try a cookie!  I was very sad to hear that he recently passed away.  My condolences go out to his family.  It's a family run business.  The daughter and son now run it.  They are both friendly.  The girl is funny and a little sassy.  The were aired on a TV show recently.  I believe the episode was called "The Best of Halsted Street."Everything we've tried tastes good.  I don't know the actual names of the cookies because they have elaborate Greek names but we like the powdered ones, the crescent shaped ones made of almonds, and the baklava.  The powdered cookies melt in your mouth.     The only con is that it tends to be on the expensive side.  They charge based on the weight of the cookies.  The shop is pretty small but they have a few small tables that you can sit at to enjoy your cookies.They also have prepackaged items.

43.description: The BEST bakery in Chicago!  This is my first time writing a Yelp review and I felt I just had to because this place is GREAT!!!  Completely family owned and run, you can tell these people care about making their pastries fresh and delicious!  Everything, and I mean everything, is excellent.  The Galaktobouriko (custard wrapped in filo) is scrumptious, their almond cookies with the red cherry in the middle are my family's favorite (we give each other boxes of these for birthdays-- thats how great they are), and their spanakopita (spinach and feta wrapped in filo) is amazing.  You can definitely tell that all the ingredients are absolutely top notch.  I come back here again and again because their pastries are consistently awesome.  Plus, everything is reasonably priced.  If I lived closer I would stop in every day.

2.description: Ms. Rosa J's food adventure continues...Today we are going to talk about Greek pastries.  Therefore, it's pretty appropriate to travel to the Greek Town, near west side.  Too bad that Rosa wasn't vigilant to know the hours of the National Hellenic Museum (close on Tuesdays).  What did she do to make up for it?  Look across the road, where Pan Hellenic locates.  Upon walking into the door, a nice, great-looking young man assisted us with the ordering process.  I know it was too much to ask for the Greek gods to help us with the Greek language, but a picture was worth a thousand words.  Looked over the counters.  We made our decisions: baklava and galaktoboureko.  I know I'm proud of my intelligence as a smart retail manager, but the Greek language is really something else.  I know the young man behind the counter is the messenger sent from the Greek gods, because I saw that he was extremely helpful with other customers who had questions regarding the choices of pastries.  By the way, we also ordered the organic peppermint and green teas to go with our pastries.  The baklava was made just the way I liked it; it wasn't too sweet, yet the aroma of cinnamon was wonderful and ended up having a soothing taste.  On the other hand, the galaktoboureko was sweeter because of the presence of honey.  It resembled a custard, but it was unique like nothing I have had before.  Overall, I really dug the baklava, even though I liked the galaktoboureko as well.  The organic tea was great, too.  The young man was very attentive and provided great customer service.  Even though they do offer a temporary parking lot on Van Buren, I would say that taking the blue to UIC-Halstad is the most convenient option because it's literally a two (2) minute-walking distance.  Once again, like I've said a million times: show your love for local businesses.    Tonight the Greek gods and I are "cool."

18.description: Cute shop with very friendly staff always avaiable to give delicious recommendations on their fresh pastries. The shop smells wonderful and is such a bargain for their sweets! Come here often and always if you're near the blue line.

41.description: Everything is great. I grew up in a Greek home and the pastries at Pan Hellenic would rival any aunt's or grandma's best. Louie's cookies are bomb. Go eat them right now.

52.description: I went here for the first time a few weeks ago, not even knowing that it existed when I went to UIC more than 5 years ago. Back in the day, it was just a tiny, hole-in-the-wall pastry place, but more recently they remodeled so that it's a bit more open and has tables and seats. (Unfortunately, no bathroom, so don't drink too much coffee!)The coffee and cookies were so tasty and fresh, it was great to have someone constantly come by and check to see how my friends and I were doing. The owners were gracious and super sweet. I definitely will make my way back here when I come back to the city.

50.description: Everyone here talks about the pastries and no lie, they are fan-freaking-tastic. And that's what originally brought me in. But Pan Hellenic has a secret weapon that will turn you into an addict and that's.... homemade yogurt. What, don't think yogurt can be addicting? My friend, you haven't eaten their yogurt. Everyone loves Greek yogurt because it's thick and tangy. At Pan Hellenic they kick it up a notch. Their yogurt is thicker and smoother and a bit more tangy. Once you've had it you'll say goodbye to Fage. It's not cheap, but you're also not going to eat the whole container in one sitting. Put a little honey on it, close your eyes and you'll think you're in Santorini.

4.description: Excellent variety of Greek pastries and the best vegetarian mousaka in town!! I highly recommend it!

6.description: This place has the best cookies! And, honestly, I don't usually get that excited about cookies. But these cookies really are fantastic. I love love love the chocolate macaroon things, the almond cookies, and the honey cookies (apologies for not knowing the proper names), but really everything is great. I like to bring a big box of cookies from Pan Hellenic to friends who are hosting dinner or a party. The cookies are always super popular.The shop itself is charming and the brother and sister who run it are lovely.

22.description: The young man running the store was totally friendly and knowledgeable, patiently explaining the best sellers and offering us samples to help us pick a mix of cookies to buy back for friends. The baked goods are fresh and don't taste mass produced unlike chain stores like Mrs Fields. The variety is pretty big so you can also grab pre packed stuff to go. The shop has a small seating area and I regret not having room for desert as I came here stuffed from (a Greece Islands) dinner! I will definitely return and leave room to eat something in store.

15.description: i absolutely love this place. Whenever I'm craving one of the traditional Greek desserts that I grew up with, I come here. I also appreciate their tiropita and spanakopita since these are so time-consuming to make. Prices are always reasonable and service is always friendly.

57.description: Oh my, oh my. The baklava and various almond cookies I had were out of this world! I don't even bother trying the baklava elsewhere anymore. The place has a lovely Old World feel to it. Weekday hours are 9-8 (wish they were open a bit later) and on Saturdays they are open until 9. I'm not sure what their Sunday hours are; perhaps they could post their business hours on their website or Yelp. I can't wait to go back and sample some more delights!

20.description: Ms. Rosa J's food adventure continues...Today we are going to talk about Greek pastries.  Therefore, it's pretty appropriate to travel to the Greek Town, near west side.  Too bad that Rosa wasn't vigilant to know the hours of the National Hellenic Museum (close on Tuesdays).  What did she do to make up for it?  Look across the road, where Pan Hellenic locates.  Upon walking into the door, a nice, great-looking young man assisted us with the ordering process.  I know it was too much to ask for the Greek gods to help us with the Greek language, but a picture was worth a thousand words.  Looked over the counters.  We made our decisions: baklava and galaktoboureko.  I know I'm proud of my intelligence as a smart retail manager, but the Greek language is really something else.  I know the young man behind the counter is the messenger sent from the Greek gods, because I saw that he was extremely helpful with other customers who had questions regarding the choices of pastries.  By the way, we also ordered the organic peppermint and green teas to go with our pastries.  The baklava was made just the way I liked it; it wasn't too sweet, yet the aroma of cinnamon was wonderful and ended up having a soothing taste.  On the other hand, the galaktoboureko was sweeter because of the presence of honey.  It resembled a custard, but it was unique like nothing I have had before.  Overall, I really dug the baklava, even though I liked the galaktoboureko as well.  The organic tea was great, too.  The young man was very attentive and provided great customer service.  Even though they do offer a temporary parking lot on Van Buren, I would say that taking the blue to UIC-Halstad is the most convenient option because it's literally a two (2) minute-walking distance.  Once again, like I've said a million times: show your love for local businesses.    Tonight the Greek gods and I are "cool."

36.description: A welcomed addition to Greek town.  This place is legit Greek pastries.  I will no longer buy my desserts at the Artopolis bakery.  They pale in comparison to Pan Hellenic. We sampled the baklava rolled in pecans and the baklava roll dipped in chocolate.  Both were flavorful, moist, and unforgettable.  Once you have one you won't want baklava from anywhere else.  I'm pretty sure they offer coffee and other similar drinks but I did not taste any when we were there.  They did have tables though so it would be a nice spot to grab a cup and a pastry and relax with a book.  Service was also stellar.  I'm not sure if she was the owner, but the woman who helped us was extremely friendly and willing to answer any of our questions. I will be back.  Hopefully soon!

14.description: I love their pastries. They're really good, but a bit pricey. They're not too sweet or anything.

58.description: Dugan's - bastion of Irish pubdom in Greek Town, nominally at least.  It's the only real bar in Greek Town, as long as you don't count Jak's, which is more of a restaurant than a bar in my eyes.  Spectrum and Muses?  No.  Just no.  Anyway, Dugan's is bigger than it looks.  It consists of seating in the window area, then the bar, then more seating with an open area and juke box and then a back room with another bar that's open for parties and after big events in the area like the Old St. Pat's thing and the Randolph Street fest.  It's usually only crowded after those local fests or for parties in the back.  The crowd in here is eclectic: North Siders, South Siders, West Loopers, a few out-of-towners, a few suburbanites and younger and older folks.  It has more of a feel of a Sox bar than a Cubs bar.  It's just a smidge grittier than your typical West Loop or North side bar.  Sometimes you get a sense of danger in here, for whatever reason.The biggest problems with Dugan's, outside of it being dead a lot of the time late-night, are that it has seemingly no air conditioning, such that it's boiling in the summer, and the bathroom situation.  The urinals are high up (not quite as high as Casey Moran's where you're peeing uphill) and jut out.  When the door opens anyone outside of the bathroom can see you.  Pissing on parade.  I've had some good times here, but it's a miss more often than it's a hit.

56.description: Just discovered the Bloody Mary's at Dugan's which are amazing.  The bartender on Saturdays is great and she makes a mean Bloody.  The crowd is eclectic ranging from a few tourists, regulars and a party of groomsmen & groom drinking before the fateful ceremony at St. Pat's.  Love this place.

29.description: If you don't have cab fare to take you to a neighborhood with better bars, and you've forgotten that cabs are now required to take credit cards, you could still do worse in the West Loop than a few pops at Dugan's.  There's nothing wrong with a laid back bar, and I like the idea more than most people, provided that I have some good company in tow.  But there's something suspect about any place serving alcohol that can't draw a crowd at 9:00 p.m. on a Saturday night.  The back room, where some friends were hosting a birthday party, was lively.  The rest of the bar saw tumbleweed blowing across the floor.  Still, you have to weigh your options if you're confined to the area.  For a shot of normalcy--and none of that Protestant nonsense--you've got Dugan's.

42.description: this is a cool bar in Greektown just outside the west loop. its cheep for Chicago i had 3 cocktails and my brother had a beer and it was only 20 bucks. they have a video blowing game thats like golden tee. last time i was there the Bubble hockey game was broken.  they have a big patio.  they bartenders  are nice and friendly if your in Greektown i would check it out

23.description: typical neighborhood place for old people, really old people.  smells like stale beer all the time, never enough staff to get you a drink even when you walk to the bar to order, even when you reserve space for decent sized parties in advance, and the theme is dated, very dated.  in this day and age, there are better options available even in greektown, so you might as well take them and support them instead.the bartender is adequate, but there is only one bartender to fix all the drinks in the house.  i went in once with a party of ten and asked the owner to change the channel on one of the television screens and he just blew me off saying he didn't know how to do it.  i had called ahead asking if i would be able to watch a certain big ten game.  of course i was told when i called i would be able to watch the game if i brought a bunch of alums in.  i arrived with a party of ten rabid fans i assembled to meet at dugans an hour before tipoff.  we missed the game entirely.  the game was the reason we all met that night.  i was the goat that night because of dugans.  how hard is it to change a channel?  i might have somewhat understood if the owner was actually helping take beer and wine orders, but he just stood around eating popcorn the whole night blaming the bartender and busboy who were running their a*s*s*e*s* off for him all night.  pretty sad experience.

47.description: If you are into lesbian cops, this is the bar for u. Only Irish bar in Greektown!

8.description: Coat Hooks: yes

31.description: Had a great time here, met up with a friend that I hadn't seen in years that was staying down the street and was in town for for the week. The bartender was great! She remembered what everybody was drinking and as soon as she saw an empty glass was quick to fill it. Also St. Paddy's day is coming up I noticed they had free corn beef sandwiches for the event so that sounds fun! So if you in the area check it out its a good time!

34.description: Kind of a nothing bar. Greektown used to be full of interesting places that played interesting international music. No more, it seems. Free popcorn, which is always nice, and cheap drinks. Just . . . not bad or good. Just meh.

16.description: I've got to say the female bartender has got to be the rudest one I've come across.  I love neighborhood pubs and dives but when I ask for a water with a round of drinks and the bartender replies " not now. I'll get it when I have time" (literally) I will think twice about coming back. Good job dugans.

13.description: If two girls with accents are working the bar when you come, leave quickly. That's the feeling they give you. Über b!tches who act like they're doing you a favor by even taking your drink order.No thanks. I will never, ever come back here. Plenty of other dives in Chicago where they actually appreciate your business.

11.description: Around 8p last night I met 2 of my friends for a few beers. The bar at that point was basically empty with the exception of maybe 5 or 6 other patrons and (I think) an English Bulldog. We sat at the bar where we assumed it would be fairly easy to get served, but we were sadly mistaken. First off, when I arrived the bartender watched me sit down. However, she didn't feel obligated to ask me if I wanted a drink. She just stood there. FInally, after about 5 minutes we have to literally flag her down even though she was standing about 4 feet from us so that I could ask for a taste of the 5 Rabbits beer. She brought me the taste, set it on the bar nowhere near me so that one of my friends had to reach over and hand it to me, then walked away. She didn't wait to see if I wanted a glass or if I wanted something different. After a few more minutes we had to literally flag her down again, even though she was still standing about 4 feet from us so I could actually order. Once again, she brought me the beer and set it where one of my friends had to reach over to get it and hand it to me.Secondly, my friend ordered a Guinness. She poured a glass, set it down by the tap and walked away. Finally, about 5 minutes later we had to ask the other bartender what was going on. That bartender walked over to the other and asked if the Guinness sitting by the tap was ours. She indicated that is was and seemed to say something like "f*uck it" and walked away. The other bartender actually had to go retrieve the beer and bring it over.Finally, two other friends arrived. She actually asked if they wanted something to drink and in the middle of my friend saying "yeah, I'll have..." she walked away. Again, we had to literally flag her down even though she was standing about 4 feet form us.I don't know if this is typical of this place, but I assure you if it is my friends and I won't be back. This bartender seemed more interested in staring off into space, eating her veggie tray, talking to one specific guy at the bar and taking smoke breaks than she was at serving us. This bartender is a terrible advertisement for this place and I think the owners would have been embarrassed to witness this last night.

39.description: The best thing about this bar are the bar tenders and the prices... It's hot (as in warm) most of the time, the crowd is ok most of the time. It's a solid bar with a lot of room and outdoor area for all the smokers.. They don't have food but they do have popcorn.When you're in the area, must stop by! They let you take dogs sometimes too!

37.description: the place is solid, plenty of room in the back if the front bar is jammed on a weekend night, drinks are cheap enough, frank is the man and the bartenders are mostly friendly and cute though i recommend staying on their good side if you're planning a return visit ever, allie has an excellent memory, great as a last stop since it's open late if you want to avoid the weirdness at spectrum

0.description: I've been here a couple times and it's a pretty chill place. They have some great craft beers on tap and the prices are just a tad bit cheaper than the surrounding area.They offer free popcorn and there are a few arcade machines: hockey, Mrs. Pacman (it only cost a quarter...seriously, a quarter), darts, a jukebox, bowling, and golf. It's pretty spacious, though I've never witnessed it fill up. During the summer, they open the windows by the sidewalk.The people seem pretty cool and the bartender was on top of it as soon as I had just a mouthful left.

38.description: Dugan's, Dugan's, Dugan's... where shall I start? As an Irish pub in Greektown, it sticks out like a sore thumb. Some people enjoy this lack of consistency. For me, it's along the lines of "one of these things is not like the other." However, it's not going anywhere or should for that matter. I can give my Procrustean side a rest and hand it an honest review based on its performance.I went in on a low-traffic day. This is very fortunate, because it won't house that many people. Overcrowded bars are not for me. If I have no elbow room, I'm off to find something better. During St. Patrick's Day, I looked in the window and wasn't about to set foot in it.   There was nothing remarkable about the bartender. However, it's the first time I was offered a White Castle slider by one. I have zero idea what that's all about. Either you have food or you don't. Bringing in food from somewhere else misses the mark (i.e. the bar that offers microwaveable pizza to drunks at 2:00 in the morning). Surprisingly, they didn't carry the Sam Adam's seasonal (currently Noble Pils). They also had changed the tap on one of the Bell's beers, which is a small irritation. If it's not on the drink list, take it off immediately. I ended up playing the "guess which beers we still have" game with her. Sigh.The bar is set up in a fairly common manner. I think it would be cool if other bars had a copper top, but that's about it. As I think about it, Dugan's is an OK bar but not nearly as good as they could be.

51.description: DUGAN'S...... a girlfriend and I went here after eating at Greek Islands Restaurant. It is just steps from there, and very welcoming. The crowd is not your typical 21 year old crowd, which I am glad for. They play great music, and have a wide variety of beer. They have a big popcorn machine, which is a MUST have when you're there. The bartenders are always friendly, and seem very genuine about it. I think they enjoy their jobs. The drink prices are reasonable, and the atmosphere is beautiful. Try it!

27.description: Nothing special, but not a bad place to grab a beer. They have a rather extensive tap list with a lot of local beers and microbrews from around the country. The bartender was friendly and gave me a number of (unrequested) free samples to find the beer I wanted. My girlfriend ordered a Bloody Mary which was strong and which she seemed to like -- and our total bill for two beers and a Bloody Mary came to $14. Not bad at all -- especially since the bartender gave us free shots. Free popcorn and they also appeared to have free hot dogs, though I didn't take advantage of either. Not too many people there while we were there on a Sunday afternoon - a perfect place to spend a couple hours (and not far from Union Station, if you're waiting for an Amtrak train as I was).

32.description: Im not a cop or retired cop but I still drink here regardless.  Its an "Irish Pub" located in the heart of Greektown.  Used to be my hang out when I lived in the neighborhood but I have moved away .  I do go back when in town and in spite of the price hike(s) its still a good spot.  White Castle Wednesdays anyone?

54.description: Perhaps I've been tainted by the bars of Ickyville, but for the most part, Irish pubs scream "dude, bro" and then do a fist pump at me.  Not so much with Dugan's.  A much needed after work happy hour brought us here, and will most likely bring us back.  The ambiance is not really my style, but I believe we've covered that.  They have a decent beer selection including specials every day of the week, even Fridays.  Today's beer was $3.50 Smithwicks by the way.  The popcorn is fresh, and someone came by to give us fresh bowls so we didn't even have to interrupt our rantings.  There was also free pizza.  It wasn't the best pizza in the land, but being free increases the flavor of anything.  Also, I went to college in St. Louis.  Imo's sets the bar low for free pizza.

48.description: Little loud and a little divey.We were looking for a place to hang and this was recommended by our waitress as a walking distance bar to check out. She said it could get ruckus but thought it was a little early until that happens.We should have known it was not the bar for us when we saw the college age co-ed in the large open front window dancing while her male companion cheered her on.  We tasted a couple beers but despite the large selection on tap, we were hard pressed to find something we wanted an entire pint of.Sam left her wallet on the bar after showing her ID and had to go back to retrieve it. All was there when she returned, so it turned out well in the end. Our next choice of bars would make up for this one! ;)

44.description: My love for Dugan's goes back to my days at UIC.  It's really turned from a late-night "oops the bars are all closed" bar into a "great place to grab drinks after work with friends" bar.  Super nice bartenders and firefighters lend to the great neighborhood atmosphere.  I'll be back.  Again and again!

24.description: Dugan's is the only Irish bar in Greektown... It's the only 4a bar in the UIC area... and it's one of my favorite spots. It's probably one of the most laid back bars in town. Sometimes they watch the door, but most nights you can pretty much just walk in. They have free popcorn, decent specials, and a lot of different beers on tap, what more could you ask for? It can get a little loud at night, and in the summer they have the windows open. They also have a Juke box for music, and several arcade style games. I highly recommend Dugan's for a casual late night out.

7.description: Awesome pub.. Although beers from all the world, not too much.. friendly people.. free pop corn..

49.description: My dad came into town to visit!!! waaahoooo!  Luckily he is a fun guy - and likes to go out on the town.  So we did up Greektown for the first time, and met my friend out for drinks at Dugan's - a non Greek bar - in Greektown, that was recommended to my dad as he was barhopping earlier (while I was at work).  Dugan's was a blast!  They have a lot of beer specials, and a big chalkboard that displays all of them.  The seating around the bar is expansive, and our server was nice.  We had a fun night, and of course any bar with popcorn is cool by me.

40.description: I was staying across the street at the Crown Plaza. Stopped here several times. Great selection of Beers on tap....  This is a great place for drinks if you are in the neighborhood

53.description: Haven't been here in awhile, so when a friend suggested it for some drinks the other night, I was happy to see that nothing had changed about this place.Bartenders are still friendly, drinks are reasonably priced and that popcorn machine is still against the wall putting out popcorn and that popcorn smell that means you have to eat some,  There were also pretzel rods on the bar on this night, as well.Must have been the night for firefighters as the bar was full of them and my friend was asked if he was with them (hmm . . .I wonder if he had said "yes" what that would have gotten us?)Jukebox was playing good tunes and had we had more time- we just might have taken up a game of darts in the back.Always a good choice to grab a beer in Greektown.

30.description: Coldest beer you will find in chicago.  I have a blast every time I go here.  It doesn't serve food at all.  Be warned!  They have a popcorn machine, occasionally order out and share it with everyone, but otherwise, you'll have to eat elsewhere or order a pizza to the bar or something.

46.description: Best neighborhood bar in West Loop!  Always friendly (Maggie is my favorite).  Every once and a while they have complimentary pizza, sandwich, etc. afternoons - a super cool and generous touch.  Check them out!

1.description: Very dark and depressing. Indifferent service. But they do have a good selection of beers!

55.description: It's an Irish Pub. It's Chicago. Its not supposed to be sparkling clean, its not supposed to be a beacon of good taste, its not supposed to be mild mannered. Its a place to tell dirty jokes, drowned yourself in a pint of Guinness, and relax.Its nice to see an Irish pub in Chicago that is not inhabited by jock douche bags.

9.description: Good bar, it's a bar - you go here to drink and enjoy the company you came with. You're not here to wear your sunglasses at night or sport your skinny jeans. Sit down and drink up. Great prices and properly poured drinks.

26.description: If two girls with accents are working the bar when you come, leave quickly. That's the feeling they give you. Über b!tches who act like they're doing you a favor by even taking your drink order.No thanks. I will never, ever come back here. Plenty of other dives in Chicago where they actually appreciate your business.

25.description: Dugan's, you grungy amazing punk. This bar in Greektown is equally good on a summer or winter Sunday when you can't imagine going back to work for another week. Its bar is in the middle of the room, which makes for great views and plenty of seating, and there are always good microbrews on tap.The other important assets are worth mentioning, but I can't describe to you how important it is that you choose just one or the other:1. Free popcorn - yay, everybody loves this OR2. Nudie photo hunt - sorry our high scores will ensure you never make it onto the board.If you are wondering why you should not eat free popcorn out of a communal bowl while punching furiously into a shared screen displaying pictures of slightly different naked people, I recommend picking up some tums and chicken soup on your way home from the nude poisoning you are about to endure.But, Dugan's rules! Yay for Sunday fundays.

12.description: This bar is as frustrating as it gets, and in my opinion it's a problem with ownership and the overall setup.  On the positive note, the beer is cheap, even seasonal crafts are only $4 on a Saturday.  Now onto the negative.  On a busy Saturday night, the place is staffed completely by two bartenders and a bar back.  These bartenders have to service an entire 4 sided bar top in which every customer will have to stand at to get a drink (no waitresses and the second bar was not open).  It would be difficult for even three or four bartenders to service that many customers in an acceptable frequency.  Hence my last visit, we had to stand at the bar for more than half an hour just to get a drink.  We asked the bartenders if it would be easier for them if we started a tab, or paid cash as we went.  They said it was better to start the tab, which we did.  We were there for three hours, two of these hours involved waiting at the bar for the bartender to look up and hopefully seeing us.  I even waved my arms around, remembering how movements attracted the Tyrannosauruss Rex in Jurassic Park.  It actually never worked, she must not have had any dino DNA in her.  We eventually gave up, closed our tabs and cut our losses.  You may ask how we were able to get our tab if service was so bad.  Let me tell you, it wasn't easy.  It took 45 minuts of standing at the bar leaning over and trying to make eye contact with a woman who was trying her best to count every floor tile behind the bar.  Eventually I made a loud noise to get her attention and held something shiny up to hold that attention.  Wasting no time, I got my gruop's tabs and we made a slow dash for the door.Our journey to the door would have been much quicker had it not been for the crowd of people standing around the bar taking up every inch from bar to wall.  Now Dugans is a decent sized place,it makes up for it's lack of girth by being extremely long (at least that's what it tells it's dates).  The bar area is located in the front, with some tables and games further back.  Unfortunately it was not bearable to stand near the back as they were blasting "Barbie Girl" and "Macarena" super loud in that area, so it was mostly empty.  Everyone decided to migrate to the front where they could drown out the loud music with the sound of frustrated patrons.With all of this said, I doubt I will ever return.  Again I can't blame it all on the bartenders, who were busy the entire time I was there.  It's the owner's fault for not properly staffing their bar on a weekend.

59.description: Just a plain ol' neighborhood bar, but with some nice extra touches.  For example, the beer selection:  I chose a Guinness before I noticed the Young's  Double Chocolate Stout and the Great Lakes Edmund Fitzgerald.  Also, they have a big popcorn machine full of FRESH popcorn.  Yum.  The two ladies working on Saturday night were very friendly (one of them very cute too).  We commiserated with them over the cadre of obnoxious frat-minded patrons who clustered around a video-game screen shouting "GO GO GO GO GO GO GO!" over and over and over...Ugh.  Those poor girls had clearly had their fill of those shenanigans but they didn't mention whether those guys were regulars.  If not for those guys, this would have been a B+ experience.Sports on TV, decent 90s/00s music, everything else that I mentioned...it's not a destination but it's a fine choice if you're looking for a place to have a few drinks, say, after an event nearby.  I would go back.

21.description: Never used yelp before but felt compelled to due to the situation that i witnessed at Dugans Tavern today. A man entered during A busy Bear/ Packer game demanding that the bartender give him his credit card that he had left there on a previous day. The bar had constant drink orders and when not immediately serviced this man called the bartender by a derogatory and sexist name. When the bartender asked if he could please call her Megan the man became even more disrespectful towards the bartender.  After receiving his card that was hidden between at least 20 others his girlfriend "Asley B" made a quick comment on the way out how they would be sure to post a negative comment on yelp. Sure enough, she did... I usually only go to Dugans around football season for the big screen, free popcorn and hot dogs which usually get better as the season progresses. It's a reasonable price sports bar in the downtown area. I give this bar 4 stars overall.

17.description: This is our favorite dive bar by the house. They've got a great beer selection, popcorn, and I can bring my pup? Sign me up! It's chill and not crazy loud. They've got darts, Megatouch, and some other games in back. It's the perfect place to just chill and have a few drinks.

10.description: We came here for a "happy-hour" event. I put the quotes around happy-hour because we got there at around 9:30PM. It was a Thursday so not a whole lot of people were there. Since it was drinking paid for by a vendor, the liquor was flowing like the tears of a woman after watching the movie "The Notebook." (I cried too). Anywho, the place is more "divey" then trendy, which was cool. They have a section near the back where they setup some free food. Tonight was hotdogs and the popcorn machine was popping some delicious salty popcorn for those wanting to soak up the booze. Also in the back was an electronic dartboard and a jukebox. Overall, nothing special about the place that sets it apart. The crowd looked more like regular people, versus yuppies, which I wouldn't find at a dive anyways.BATHROOM REVIEW - the bathrooms are located near the jukebox at the back of the place. In the bathroom, there are two urinals, a sink, and a stall. Peering in the bathroom stall, it was dingy, but what you expect for a dive? The door look somewhat securely so no risk of someone walking in on you while your dropping a friend off. Overall, clean, the best part I like is that the door swung outward, meaning, once you've taken care of emptying your bladder, no real need to grab a paper towel and touch the handle to open it; You can just push the door open and be on your drunken way. SIT or SQUAT? This was a tough one -- but like all bars, I would never place my bar ass on something that some other drunkard has. I'll SQUAT.

5.description: Alright Dugans... every time I come here it's a relaxing atmosphere, bartenders are friendly and reasonably attentive even when it's crowded. There is a good variety of Craft Beers available as well as the standard big name beers. Drinks are priced reasonably for the city I suppose, we got two drinks - glass of 5 Lizards and a Tequila Sunrise for  $10. Oh, and I dig the free popcorn. Fresh and tasty.During summer the front is almost completely open allowing creating a nice flow of air throughout the whole place. Toward the back of the bar are some arcade games and a dart board. The mens room is clean and considering the small space, is pretty well ventilated too. All in all, I like it and I'll be back from time to time.

3.description: Not coming back. I'm currently sitting at the bar waiting for the bartenders to acknowledge me after 15mins to get a drink. I know texting on her phone is important, but come on.

35.description: This is definitely the best normal bar in the West Loop area. The bartenders are incredibly friendly and the place has FREE food. That's right, free food. There is always free popcorn, usually free hot dogs in the evening, and free pizza on Fridays! And the funny thing is, the free food at Dugan's is better than the food at Haymarket. Ha!Dugan's is just a real, neighborhood-ish bar, sandwiched in between the theme parks of Greektown and Randolph street. It's worth a visit. Or ten.

19.description: If you don't have cab fare to take you to a neighborhood with better bars, and you've forgotten that cabs are now required to take credit cards, you could still do worse in the West Loop than a few pops at Dugan's.  There's nothing wrong with a laid back bar, and I like the idea more than most people, provided that I have some good company in tow.  But there's something suspect about any place serving alcohol that can't draw a crowd at 9:00 p.m. on a Saturday night.  The back room, where some friends were hosting a birthday party, was lively.  The rest of the bar saw tumbleweed blowing across the floor.  Still, you have to weigh your options if you're confined to the area.  For a shot of normalcy--and none of that Protestant nonsense--you've got Dugan's.

28.description: Just went back to Dugan's for the first time in a couple years, was in the 'hood on a Thursday night and it was convenient for a couple beers with a friend.  A little disappointed to see that their specials aren't as great as they used to be, but there were about 20 people in there, and everyone was having a good time.  The bartender could have been a little more attentive, but it wasn't a big deal since we were looking for a dive to just chill at.  The free popcorn is still awesome!

45.description: After a recent visit to the west loop, I came to discover that there are quite a few great hot spots in greektown; hadn't really been in the area socially since my days working with Amtrak. Dugan's has that neighborhood feel with a small-town atmosphere. It's usually crawling with law enforcement personnel and city officials, so if you're looking to find some useful contacts, this is the place to frequent. It's the only irish pub in greektown as a matter of fact.Their somewhat-communal main bar area was an absolute plus if you're all about meeting and mingling with new people. The bartenders were really friendly and approachable; the decor was a bit plain, but unique enough to grab my attention from time to time. They have a pretty great BEER LIST that will keep you on your bar stool far longer than earlier planned. They have an area in the very back where, I assume, they open up for private events and parties, so that's always a plus. All in all, I had a great experience at Dugan's and will probably return with friends in the near future. I live northwest of the city, but I found that the commute was well worth it! :-)

33.description: Appalled is the word that comes to mind.  My group had horrible service on a Friday night while celebrating a birthday.  Bartender chose to call one of our friends (rhymes with witch)When we brought this to the attention of the owner we found out that it was the manager swearing at us!  Unbelievable!!  He chalked it up to drinking and us causing the raucus.  WHAT??  Really, an owner condones their staff and manager to swear at paying customers.  Too many bars in Chicago to damper our lives.  If  you visit this joint, please note the surly bitter betty attitudes.

43.description: Dugan's does not have food, but with that said, they sometimes have food off to the side for FREE!!!! Free food always makes me happy. But if you don't get the chance to get free food, they always have freshly made popcorn for you to nibble on.The drinks on specials are well worth the price.

2.description: Back off pretentious folks, you're about to walk into a no frills, chill kind of pub that makes for a great evening out on any day of the week.Dugan's has become a go-to spot when you need a cheap drink and some freebies to share with friends. The bar has multiple open areas including the front, where you can order from their daily specials (as low as $3.50 for a draft) and partake in some of their freebies. While they don't serve any food per se, they do offer FREE popcorn (plus your choice of seasoning including garlic parmesan, cheddar, etc.) and HOT DOGS. I certainly appreciate these especially after you've had a drink or two. I also learned that Chicago folks don't add ketchup to their hot dogs. Pardon me for being out of state.The free snacks and cheap drinks makes me come back. Only real issue I have is the extremely loud music in the back even when there aren't a lot of people, and the inconsistency with their shots. One round we'll be served in shot glasses. The next? 8oz cups. Get it together Dugan's!I still appreciate the chill environment and look forward to coming back again.

18.description: This little establishment is the anti Greek in Greek town.............not that it is a bad thing because Dugan's is an Irish Pub/Bar.....I always get those confused.I've passed by this place many times, but never went in until I was on a double date with another Yelp couple........yikes.....am I getting a bit too much into this Yelp thing?!?!  Nah.......We had a great dinner down the street and decided to have a few after dinner drinks.  This is an Irish pub/bar with real Irish bartenders.......at least that is what I thought I heard over the blaring music (hint.......it's a bit too loud...turn it down folks).  Funny thing about the bar, they actually printed up little folded cards that say "Dugan's on Halstead" on one side and on the other it has a penguin (like those shown on old Guinness Ads and is written, "Gone Puffin' Be Right Back" which I assume allows one to walk away from their bar stool and drink without it getting taken or taken away.The place was packed and I've heard through the grape vine this is a big place for folks in the industry to hang out.  This particular evening was full with what appeared to be to me folks after work and lots of Chad's......or something from the West Loop that looked similar?No food, just liquor, but there is free popcorn at this location.............which I STRONGLY recommend considering before eating.........a past review tells a store about these machines.  Not that they have this problem, but one never knows.This is a nice break from the more casual Greek watering holes in the area and now that I've tried it, I'll be back again.

41.description: You can get beer in pitchers, need I say more?!!Well, I will. This is a great place for drinks if you are in the neighborhood (say, after a nice dinner at one of the gazillion Greek restaurants near by). It's cheap, no frills and again, beer in pitchers! Don't judge, once in awhile I like to regress back to college days when all I could afford was pitchers of Bud Light. When I worked not far from here I used to stop in every few months. Now I am far north and rarely in the 'hood so it was fun to stop back in last weekend. Everyone's still friendly and you can still get drunk for cheap. Win and win!!

52.description: This was my 3rd time being at this establishment and it made me so furious that I had to actually sign up for a yelp account to express my dissatifaction and astonishment that this place can still be open.  My company frequents Chicago for business and we stay at the Crowne Plaza, so this place is conveniently located.  Our previous visits have been during the work week so that may account for some of the disappoinment.  However, I have to say we may have to start utilizing the hotel bar.  This evening there was this rude bartender there that didn't look old enough to be serving alcohol. She spent the ENTIRE night socializing with what appeared to be her "friends" that we sat with empty glasses forever.  The other bartender finally waited on us.  The most appalling part of this entire evening was the guys sitting next to us, doing shot after shot (with the already intoxicated 12 yr old bartender) ....walked away with a $5 tab while she overcharged us for 2 drinks and I witnessed her putting our cash in her tip bucket!!!!!  I could not believe my eyes!  So if you want to go to this place, I would recommend going during the work week.  I only gave it one star because it made me, but it's definately a zero!

50.description: This place is pretty big and I imagine it gets crowded on the weekends. Iwent to this place ona Sunday Night and I love bars with open doors and windows in the summertime. They give free popcorn and it was kinda of mushy when I went. It seems like they have good reasonable prices and drink specials. I still don't understand why there is an Irish bar in greektown. The place is actually pretty fancy to many of the suburban Irish bars I have written about in the suburbs and wonder if this use to be a greek place. It may have been where they got the touch of class when they remade this place into a Irish bar. Only joking. Good new west Loop bar as reconstruction of the old skid row area continues with cool places like this.

4.description: Still a great place to hang out, But the not so courteous, More less than cordial mannered lackey said I had to move, Because of some unbilled band that was set to perform......Why can't they have better announcement procedures??????. I mean, It's NOT a costly thing to do. I Iiked sitting near the Xmas tree.....I mean you could have blocked the seats or moved them when the bar opened, If the band was expected to perform that night.......But the arrangement protocol was below amateur......And one stooge jamming the jukebox with some wanky, unfamiliar, unsavory tunes was also a minus.....

6.description: This place only servers drinks. There's free popcorn from the popcorn machine . We had 2 summer ale, came out to be $5 each, great price for a good beer . But atmosphere and ambience was meh for a Saturday evening!

22.description: This is the rudest most ridiculous place I've ever been. Don't go here if you want service. Meghan is absolutely terrible.

15.description: Dugan's, you grungy amazing punk. This bar in Greektown is equally good on a summer or winter Sunday when you can't imagine going back to work for another week. Its bar is in the middle of the room, which makes for great views and plenty of seating, and there are always good microbrews on tap.The other important assets are worth mentioning, but I can't describe to you how important it is that you choose just one or the other:1. Free popcorn - yay, everybody loves this OR2. Nudie photo hunt - sorry our high scores will ensure you never make it onto the board.If you are wondering why you should not eat free popcorn out of a communal bowl while punching furiously into a shared screen displaying pictures of slightly different naked people, I recommend picking up some tums and chicken soup on your way home from the nude poisoning you are about to endure.But, Dugan's rules! Yay for Sunday fundays.

57.description: I have worked in Greektown for almost 4 years and have been coming here the whole time.  I must say this is my favorite neighborhood bar in the city.  The staff hasn't changed since I've started going there and they remember you and your name.  The patrons and employees are friendly and you never leave not meeting one of the local neighborhood residents.  They have free popcorn all the time....and you can sometimes get mini hot dogs, pizza and yeah Jimmy Johns delivers there too!  It's an all around great place to visit and if you're in the neighborhood I would strongly suggest it!

20.description: Really enjoyed the couple of hours I spent at Dugan's on Saturday evening. It was not very late, maybe 8 p.m., when I arrived. I sat at the bar (large and in the middle of the room.) The bartender was very nice and helpful. She gave me a couple of generous pours of several different beers to try, to help me pick out a local microbrew (I'm usually a pretty standard Bud light drinker.) She also poured me a small shot of their melon flavored liquor. The crowd built up quickly, and, by the time I left, it was pretty busy. The people there seemed friendly, a few of them made light conversation, but I didn't feel like I couldn't sit alone and enjoy myself without being bothered (I was alone while my boyfriend was at an event at the United Center with his brother.) I left right before the band came on, so I can't speak to the live music. The atmosphere is very casual, and the facilities themselves are old but maintained. Quite a few large flat screen tvs, which they kept on hockey and the UFC event that was taking place at the United Center.  The back area was hosting a birthday party, and had dart boards and arcade games. The microbrews were fairly priced, and they had a special on Bud light (switched over to that after trying two local beers.) Didn't feel like I had to spend a lot to keep a drink in front of me over the course of two hours. If you're looking for a regular old bar in the greektown/west loop area, this is the place. Most other "bars" in the area seemed higher end and more like restaurants (definitely not my style.) I would definitely go back, especially since it is so close to the Crowne Plaza Metro (like, a block away!) which is where I plan to stay during any future trips to the city (separate review.)

36.description: I/we went to this bar LATE in the night after we saw one of the best bands ever! RUSH!! :)We really wanted a snack and drinks but being a Tuesday night almost everything was closed in Greektown. We walked in after freshening up in our hotel room across the street and it was somewhat empty which was fine after a fun/loud concert. This is a great place to stop in if you are in the area. The bar staff was SUPER nice. They have free popcorn and they put out a table of free food toward the back. That night it was hot dogs so SCORE there were our munchies. LOL. Great music selection in the jukebox. Good people watching spot as well. I find it a little funny that they stick an Irish pub in the middle of Greektown but hey a bar is a bar. Right!? We were informed of one sweet tip/perk when we were getting our tab which I will keep for myself. :)I will def check them out again next time I am down for drinks. It is not a far walk from Union Station so that is also a plus. Cheers!

14.description: I/we went to this bar LATE in the night after we saw one of the best bands ever! RUSH!! :)We really wanted a snack and drinks but being a Tuesday night almost everything was closed in Greektown. We walked in after freshening up in our hotel room across the street and it was somewhat empty which was fine after a fun/loud concert. This is a great place to stop in if you are in the area. The bar staff was SUPER nice. They have free popcorn and they put out a table of free food toward the back. That night it was hot dogs so SCORE there were our munchies. LOL. Great music selection in the jukebox. Good people watching spot as well. I find it a little funny that they stick an Irish pub in the middle of Greektown but hey a bar is a bar. Right!? We were informed of one sweet tip/perk when we were getting our tab which I will keep for myself. :)I will def check them out again next time I am down for drinks. It is not a far walk from Union Station so that is also a plus. Cheers!

1.description: It was the closest one I could find and saw first, I was in dire need of a manicure  the lady cuts too much cuticle and it was peeling and drying the entire week. polish chips. bleh. there are a bajillion nail places in the west loop. don't make the same mistake I made.

0.description: UNSANITARY and rude owner!  Owner tweezes her own eyebrows, then uses the exact tweezers on the customers WITHOUT sterilizing the tweezers.  When asked to at least use the witch hazel I brought to clean the tools, she has a fit and goes off in another language.  After reluctantly cleaning the tweezers, she was very rough during the entire procedure.  Her older daughter was there to witness everything.  It was obvious the daughter was embarrassed by her mother.Will never go there again!

58.description: Beautiful supermarket with great location and parking accessibility. This place lives up to its 4-star rating and then some... the PISTACHIO MUFFINS OH MY GOODNESS... and the abundance of fresh produce have me starry eyed! it's a gem!!

56.description: I'll never buy a beef or lamb meat from any mariano's stores AGAIN, most of their meat looks so fresh, but in fact they are decayed and smell so bad. When I returned this meat back to the costumer service, she was so cold and so careless, like nothing seriously happened!  If I did not hesitate to cock this meat, I could defiantly had a food poising. No one care and no one said sorry.

29.description: This location is like its siblings - relentlessly clean, cheerful, well-stocked, pretty affordable, and so on. Its location is very convenient, right off the highway and close to the loop, too. Minus one star, though, because of its insanely inconvenient parking lot(s). That ramp... :o

42.description: Manager Adam - thank you for delivering a pizza to my family at a hotel across the street when we complained that our pizza was a bit overdone. We have received unbelievable service at Mariano's every day of our 5 day vacation in Chicago. I wish I could take you home with me.

23.description: Very happy with this grocery store and I usually shop at Wegmans :)I was most impressed with the prices which I expected to be higher in Chicago.
