47.description: Ugh the deli counter!  There are never less than 5 people back there....2 of which actually help customers...neither of which know which meat is which and have to ask the other 4 people.  No one seems to know what 1/3 of a pound is.  Always plan for extra time if you need any lunch meat or sliced cheese.  And avoid this store on Sunday's at all costs.  Unless it's early in the morning.  No parking the staff is always in your way restocking.

8.description: Marianos is literally it... The beginning and the end of all markets! Everything is fresh, the employees are so friendly, and their food bars are always on point! I have yet to have a bad experience in marianos, there is always parking even on holidays. The food bars  can be a little on the pricey side but depending on what you get, you can get your money's worth. The desserts are fresh which is difficult to come across. The wine and beer selection is out of hand, I truly believe that there is no need to go anywhere else for your grocery shopping/dinner/general home purchases. They carry everything!!My favorite part: buy a nice drink and enjoy yourself while you shop!

31.description: This place is my JAM!  I love all Mariano's, but there's something about Mariano's in the city!When I'm not going to Costco and buying jumbo bulk sizes, I love coming to this Mariano's.  They have everything anyone could want.  Also, who wouldn't want a lovely view of the city while doing their shopping?!BUT..BEWARE THE PARKING SITUATION ON SUNDAY AFTERNOONS.  I went for a quick run this past Sunday and holy Jesus...that parking lot is an absolute clusterfuck on Sundays.Still.  I love you, Mariano's!

34.description: Wow this Mariano's kind of impressed me. It has everything from a first floor cafe, seating in the main grocery for things like oyster bar specials, and everything else a Mariano would have. With a pretty decent sized organize produce section (and sometimes cheaper than Whole a Foods prices) I definitely can't complain! Close to the Brooklyn Boulders climbing gym and on my way home - I will definitely be here again.

16.description: The 6 dollar deal on 2 sides and a protein is no longer offered at this location. Now you can get 1 scoop for $3, 2 scoops for $5, 3scoops for $8 and so on....The brussel sprout-lentil salad with shredded cheese is hearty. Its my favorite of the three. The quinoa artichoke salad tastes like your average marinated salad.   The asparagus-chickpea- kale-pumpkin seed salad looks better than it tastes. Its crunchy, but kind of bland in flavor.I still think the kale detox smoothie is the best around. The pineapple and apple give it a smooth flavor. The kale and spinach blend in with the fruit. The ginger and cayenne add a slight kick. I've  tried similar drinks around town and they were too watery or bitter.

13.description: UPDATE 8/27/15.  Happy to report that the fungus has disappeared (a new produce manager I was told), but there isn't as much variety as there used to be. They no longer carry roasted chickens that aren't shot full of grease and additives.  And the last two times I shopped here I was overcharged. A few weeks ago I didn't notice until I got home that I'd paid $12 for two artichokes... irritating but not worth a trip back. And earlier this week I happened to look at the screen as the checker rang up my 75 cents/pound potatoes at $1.79/pound. She refused to correct the mistake. They did correct it at customer service, but the manager I asked to speak with didn't apologize or even act surprised.  So much wasted potential here.

11.description: When a supermarket is more food court than supermarket.  I bought a steak, handed over to some lady and they grilled it for me while I drank daisy cutters.  Totally Zef.  Wikus van de Merwe would eat steak here when not at garden center.youtube.com/watch?v=f1Kb…

39.description: This is my favorite grocery store in Chicago!  Everything there is so fresh and priced so reasonably.  I love the pizza there as well as the bakery.  I requested the bakery to make superhero cupcakes for my husband's birthday party and they made them and had them ready on time.  Not only that but they were able to customize them in 8 different ways (1 for each character) at no additional charge.  It was way more cost-effective than to do it somewhere else.

37.description: Since my last review, I've moved to Chicago and this location became my main grocery store. I've been shopping here about once a week since December. I have to say, the quality is totally unpredictable when it comes to the produce. I've bought fresh basil that turned moldy within one day. I also just cut into an onion (that I bought this morning) and it was moldy inside. I didn't even know that was possible!  How long has this onion been in the store?!  Other items I have purchased have gone bad very quickly. And there are times I've avoided certain items altogether (avocados come to mind) because none of them that were out for sale were fresh. With Whole Foods now open, I'll be doing my shopping there starting next week.  Higher prices are worth it if the food is fresh. I can always get my junk food when I'm at Target :) I will say Marianos has a great return policy - but you shouldn't HAVE to return groceries. Ugh.

0.description: I normally go to the Mariano's in Lakeshore East but visited here to get some deli food.  Really like this place!  It's better than the other Mariano's I've been mainly because of the oyster bar!  They had a selection of 7 different oysters, the most I've seen in a super market in Chicago and happy hour is from 2-4PM every day where oysters are $1.75 each.  Loved the Kumamoto and Malpeque ones I ordered.  Also have not seen any supermarket sell Kumamotos!  The staff at the oyster bar (chatted with him, I think his name is Christopher or Christian) was really nice.  Also you can call the seafood department and order oysters for your parties at $1.75 each.

38.description: My third review of this place in about 2.5 years.  I have to warn people, if you drive to this Mariano's you will be damn lucky to shop at this store. Think I'm joking? Ok, try parking on a Tuesday at 2:30pm as I did last week. Literally nowhere to park. Now imagine 5:30 pm or a Saturday or Sunday. My wife and I have given up on this place and now shop at the three other Mariano's in the between the South Loop and Roscoe Village. I love the store inside, I really do. However, at any time of day, you will spend more time looking for a parking spot (in what is the worst parking lot in the history of parking lots) than you will shopping.  I can almost promise you that. Bottom line, this store is not accessible.

51.description: Horrible parking situation! Waste of huge space for such a small parking arrangement that packs cars in the tiniest a pockets and people driving wrong way all the time cuz their arrangement was horribly planned. Awful!

27.description: The best one I've been to! They have a cafe/lounge on the first floor and second floor so you can come here to study or just to stare at the fire place. Yeah, I never thought I'd see a fireplace at a grocery store. Also on the first floor they have a gelato store... it's $1.25 for a scoop! O and you need to hit the second floor for all the free samples. If you have no money, just keep circling around on the second floor and all the nice Mariano workers will feed you. Besides that, this store has EVERYTHING you can ask for and has a better selection then Jewel-Osco and Target nearby. Parking on the roof! so don't pay for parking anywhere nearby. the only downside is the wifi has been consistently horrible. I've seen people study on the third floor and they even have a small kitchen for people to use I guess, or maybe it's for workers?

32.description: This is a very nice whole foods with extremely friendly staff. I think the groceries are on the high end of the price spectrum but that is what I expect when going to whole foods. There gelato and deli food is very good and great for a quick dinner when you don't want to cook.

54.description: I love Mariano's but this location not so much. Had a sandwich from there that had tomato's that I think we're supposed to have been green, but they were actually brown borderline black.  Also got a cupcake, that was overcooked and hard as rock.

48.description: For all of the Pretentious folks who feel the need to Fit-In.. This Mariono's is for you!! ..This store says "I pay High Taxes, This is my neighborhood, I'm really cool"  .. this store is actually Cool .. The ground floor has a Gilato bar (thank the GODS Above) as well as a Wine bar, A fireplace with chairs and a sofa to relax (Yes in a grocery :) ... This location has managed to squeeze different depots within the store, the sushi bar makes you feel like you're at a regular restaurant.  The hot food area serves up great soups and sandwhiches amongst other entres..The prices are about 3% higher than Jewel Osco but Where else can you shop, eat fine dining, drink at a bar and eat delicious ice-cream all while leaving with a gallon of Milk?

44.description: I stop by to get lunch at the hot food bar, which is for the most part consistently good albeit a little overpriced. While sitting in the 'cafe' section however, don't even bother attempting to use the 'free wifi.' *Worse* than dialup modem speeds... if it even works at all. Really bad.edit: some ping stats on what traffic does on the wifi--- fd-fp3.wg1.b.yahoo.com ping statistics ---33 packets transmitted, 12 packets received, 63.6% packet lossround-trip min/avg/max/stddev = 905.444/1528.863/2391.230/460.395 msouch

24.description: Sometimes they make really bad smoothies, coconut water and pineapple thats all I can taste in my smoothie. Just follow the receipt please...

7.description: Decrease in rating, why?  It seems dirty, the service seems less, and prices are less great since Whole Foods came in.  Makes me sad.

49.description: When they opened their prices were reasonable but as they have gained customers they have raised prices.  It is a small store so the variety of items is not as extensive.  The small awkward parking lot now has 4 spots permanently rented by Enterprise so its impossible to get parking at this location. I no longer will be shopping here.  Your customers should come first. I don't live within walking distance.

40.description: Once upon a time, there was a really horrendous Dominick's at Halsted and Madison. The store was filthy, the employees rude, the shelves perpetually understocked. The employee manning the self-checkouts would actually yell at customers. It was ugly.Then Mariano's came, and for a while, it was beautiful. The service was amazing. Everything in the store was well-stocked. There were helpful employees everywhere you turned. It was actually a joy to go shopping. Then a year went by, and at some point, once Mariano's had all the customers (and Dominick's had long closed by then), they decided that they didn't give a damn about any of the things they had built their reputation on. The counters went from being fully manned to having to wait forever for someone to (half heartedly) help you. The shelves began to run out of stock (and since Mariano's diligently fronts its shelves every day, weeks could go by before someone would notice a particular variety was out of stock). You've heard the old saying "judge someone by how he treats the waitress?" I judge a store by its service counter. For me, this was mostly the deli area. When I first came to Mariano's, there were several helpful, knowledgeable people behind that counter. If you came really early, you were helped by Eugene, who always got the order right, stacked it neatly, etc. Everyone else gave quality service, too.Those people are long gone. There are always - ALWAYS - more people in the back room (Mariano's apparently does a big catering business). On three of my recent visits, the employees apparently didn't understand that you actually have to peel the plastic back on the item you're cutting. Mmmmm, cheese with plastic chunks! That's when and if help is available. I've been walking out lately, because 15 to 20 minute waits for help (at times that are NOT during the busy lunch hour) just seem ludicrous. So essentially, the crap experience that was Dominick's has just moved across the street. The honeymoon's over, Mariano's. No amount of jaunty piano playing and wine while shopping can distract me from your plummeting quality. PS: I co-sign the complaints about parking. It seems that all of the city Mariano's stores were built with exceedingly small parking lots. Someone in design/planning underestimated what was needed.

53.description: Parking is terrible.  There aren't enough spaces and the aisles are narrow, so getting in and out can take 15 minutes.  Plus, the escalator for shopping  carts is out of order more than any other grocery store I use.  It was out today at 10:00, and there was a wait of several minutes to use the elevator.  Selection of food has gone down, too.  The  prices are good, so I shop there, but often need to go to Jewel too.  I will say, the employees are friendly and the store is clean.

30.description: I love the prices, fresh food, sushi, and most importantly the wine selection.Everyone here is very helpful if you need anything.  What a great grocery shopping experience.

46.description: I only come here for their juice bar. Fantastic! Nothing else quite special though, the juice alone worth the visit.

1.description: Went there today for the first time and have to say I liked the staff, food selection and price. But the parking being above ground I subtracted a star. Not enough parking, and my friend found parking a scary experience. Otherwise I liked it. Not sure if I will be back before I try out Pete's Food Market, but not bad.I had heard good things about Mariano's from others, and I'd say it met expectations.Last thing I'll say, a small touch, but added to my experience: all the staff where wearing clean white shirts with ties. More professional appearance helps in unexpected ways.

55.description: Never again.  I used to eat here for lunch at least twice weekly since they opened, also picked up some light groceries here and there as well. Parking gradually became tougher to get, especially since they lost a whole row to a bank.  One way in, one way out of the elevated lot. Not uncommon to be stuck trying to either park or leave. Today I spent 15 min trapped in the lot and wasn't even able to park.  It's just a matter of time until there is a serious accident or a fistfight in the lot.  It's a real hazard. Good quality food, decent grocery options, but simply not worth the headache. I totally understand it is a city location, but this is poorly executed. If you are a local yuppie with a pushcart you are in luck. The rest of us not so much.

9.description: Love this location and especially LOVE the fact that they keep the peach gelato in stock which is one of my guilty pleasures!!

26.description: Sad to see what happened to my favorite grocery store, fresh fruit and vegetables selection is no longer that great, now I go elsewhere and the couple of times I have come back the selection sucks.What happened?????

25.description: This is my go to location because I just live up the street. Don't bother coming here between 5p and 7p (if you have a car) because you won't find a parking spot in the garage. Anyways, I love this place. They actually carry my favorite moscato which is a huge bonus. I also LOVEEEEE their muffins, and basically all of the baked goods are to die for. My favorite grocery store with pleasant workers hands down

12.description: Mariano's West Loop, you used to be my first love but now have been replaced with Pete's Fresh Market on Madison and Western. Living 5 minutes away, Mariano's was where I did all my grocery shopping. However, in the past year the produce selection has suffered greatly. There is usually fruit that is rotting or about to that is still displayed at an expensive price (e.g. rotting peaches at $2.99lb...no thank you!). I still visit frequently for small staples and pricing wise, its WAY CHEAPER than the Whole Foods down the block but I really wish management would address the poor produce selection.

59.description: Love Mariano's. Clean store. Great selection. The bakery is fantastic. You literally cannot go wrong with anything you pick from the bakery. Great soup selection. The deli has a good selection of meats and cheeses, as well as salads. The staff is friendly and helpful. Parking lot on the roof.

21.description: UPDATE 8/27/15.  Happy to report that the fungus has disappeared (a new produce manager I was told), but there isn't as much variety as there used to be. They no longer carry roasted chickens that aren't shot full of grease and additives.  And the last two times I shopped here I was overcharged. A few weeks ago I didn't notice until I got home that I'd paid $12 for two artichokes... irritating but not worth a trip back. And earlier this week I happened to look at the screen as the checker rang up my 75 cents/pound potatoes at $1.79/pound. She refused to correct the mistake. They did correct it at customer service, but the manager I asked to speak with didn't apologize or even act surprised.  So much wasted potential here.

17.description: This place has an amazing selection of--everything.  However, on THREE different occasions over the past couple of months I have had cashiers not even acknowledge me.  Not make eye contact, not respond to my greeting, and not even verbally give me a price.  It's disappointing because this is a great store but at least at Target and Whole foods (my other nearby options) I don't get ignored.

10.description: Absolutely LOVE this place. I came here for the first time a few months ago and just fell in love. I walk here with my friend every once in a while during our lunch break at work. I just love being able to get freshly made food for a decent price. I am a huge fan of their mac and cheese, as well as their orange chicken. My friend swears by their cake pops and chocolate-covered strawberries, though I haven't tried those yet. I'll have to remember to grab some next time! What's cool about this place is that they have a section upstairs with small tables and chairs, so you can eat there if you buy their hot & ready food. I also just love their grocery options. They carry so many hard to find brands, along with TONS of healthy options. They are always giving out some sort of free samples, too. Who doesn't love that?! If you ever get the chance to sample their house-made orange juice, DO IT. I haven't even tried any of their wines yet, but I'm sure they're amazing. Their walk-in beer cooler is pretty sweet, too. Great selection. There is just so much here, I can stay in this place for hours. Too bad I only get an hour lunch. I'll have to make a day out of it and just come out on a weekend! You should too!

5.description: It's Lent. It's Friday. All the options at the hot food bar had beef or chicken or some other kind of red meat.  I take this as an affront to Christianity and an insult to Catholics. I don't care what else this place sells or what great prices they offer. If they don't have the thought to accommodate my faith, they don't deserve my business. In the dining area all the tables are dirty and food and paper scraps on the floor. No one around to clean. Very unpleasant place to be. Think I'll check out Whole Foods a block away and see if they still respect believers.

3.description: The best one I've been to! They have a cafe/lounge on the first floor and second floor so you can come here to study or just to stare at the fire place. Yeah, I never thought I'd see a fireplace at a grocery store. Also on the first floor they have a gelato store... it's $1.25 for a scoop! O and you need to hit the second floor for all the free samples. If you have no money, just keep circling around on the second floor and all the nice Mariano workers will feed you. Besides that, this store has EVERYTHING you can ask for and has a better selection then Jewel-Osco and Target nearby. Parking on the roof! so don't pay for parking anywhere nearby. the only downside is the wifi has been consistently horrible. I've seen people study on the third floor and they even have a small kitchen for people to use I guess, or maybe it's for workers?

35.description: I have given this store more than a fair chance.  Today I was in the store at lunch time.  When I approached the checkout lanes there were 6 cashiers.  Two cashiers loudly announced that it was their break time and closed their registers.  I waited to check out and had to hear the cashier tell the bagger how drunk she was last night and how much she hates working at Mariano's.  Not once did the cashier or bagger look at me or speak to me.  I am glad Whole Foods is now open!

19.description: Unimpressed.The parking lot is a demolition derby on steroids. The store is clean. The produce could have been better. I couldn't find cauliflower without brown spots. I guess people like being able to eat in the store but it's not my thing. It is better than Whole Paycheck..I'll give you that. By the way they have a Whole Foods going in across the street, that should be interesting.Signage/design not good for a first time customer. Had to see which way to enter. Nothing special about employees' customer service.With exemplary customer service and better monitoring of their produce it could be  good.  Add to parking,I give them vague for trying to offer free parking in a congested neighborhood.

28.description: The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Also, this Mariano's location like many others will season and cook your purchased meat, which is very generous. The staff at the grill were superb with preparing my chicken the other day. I am now a regular because of this great experience.

45.description: Positives: Good location, clean store, friendly service. Negatives: Poorly stocked at times, selection could be better, inadequate parking during peak times.

33.description: Overall happy with Marrianos store only thing that disturbs me is that the lower level parking lot always has employees cars parked there customers looking for spots to get in and out and employees there for hours I see them walking out in uniforms and most businesses have a designated area for employees which is not the premier parking on first floor I think Mariano's should consider this as well

43.description: I would love to say that this is my go to place for groceries as I live and work in the west loop, but I cannot.  The parking lot is horrible, it is even impossible to get a spot in the middle of the afternoon on a weekday.  I will not be returning.

2.description: I am quickly becoming a fan of Mariano's and folks need to realize that this is the going to be the new standard of grocery shopping.  I usually hit the one in Aurora as it it 5 minutes from my job, but since I was in the area today, decided to stop in this location.Holy luxury grocery shopping Batman!!!This place truly has it all.  Oyster bar, juice bar, spice rack, restaurant seating, candy/sweets bar (love the donuts and large cupcakes), deli, etc.  No stone is left unturned regarding this place.  It's the best one I've seen yet and I've been to a few Mariano's.  Just to compare, I went to Whole Foods down the street.  Shook my head and walked out.  Yes I do shop there for certain tolietries and other items no one else has, but it was no different than any other Whole Foods location.  Plus Mariano's is very much cheaper.  I'd honestly be willing to drive to this location to shop here on a early Saturday/Sunday morning as they are open at 6am.  But probaly not during the week as I am sure it's a madhouse it probably is on a weekday afternoon/evening here.

18.description: Came here to do some quick grocery shopping after the gym. They have a parking structure, so you don't have to pay for parking.  I can imagine how crowded this structure would get when it is really busy because there isn't that much parking available.The best way for me to describe Mariano's would be Whole Foods  + Safeway combined, they have a glorious dine - in area, plus a very large selection of organic, and non - organic foods. Prices are a bit higher than an average grocery store, but not as much as Whole Foods. They have amazing freshly squeezed non - pasteurized orange juice here, non - pasteurized orange juice is the best because it is so sweet and is not as tart as pasteurized orange juice.  The juice here is also very affordable, hence why they tend to run out each night.  I love the large cheese selection they have here, as well as the glorious amount of samples. Will come back here and try the fresh food soon!

41.description: Parking, parking, parking!!!! Parking up top is a nightmare. It doesn't matter what time of day or actual day it's a nightmare. Grocery shopping should not include swearing on a weekday. Weekends - always busy. The parking lot is a free spot for the neighborhood and businesses. It also seems a haven for taxi's  hanging out waiting on fare calls. Mariano's needs to install a pay system. If you visit the grocery or related merchants within 2 hours - validate a purchase receipt. That should cut down on the neighborhood free parking,Wholefoods was an easy in and out on a wed afternoon. Mariano's.... good luck to you.... Wholefoods is more expensive but not circling the parking lot swearing is time saving which does off set the more expensive food cost. Easy in & easy out saves a ton of time.

52.description: This is my go-to Mariano's and the best supermarket around. Great quality and good prices. Sushi bar, oyster bar, juice bar, and wine bar all inside for you to enjoy while you shop. My fiance and I have had the $10 sushi lunch special several times (seaweed salad, soup, and a sushi roll), which is a great deal. I can always find the best fruits and veggies here, including hard to find things like fresh figs (in season). Great liquor selection, good bakery items, clean store, and a live pianist as the soundtrack to your grocery shopping! My favorite place for food shopping!

50.description: Marianos is literally it... The beginning and the end of all markets! Everything is fresh, the employees are so friendly, and their food bars are always on point! I have yet to have a bad experience in marianos, there is always parking even on holidays. The food bars  can be a little on the pricey side but depending on what you get, you can get your money's worth. The desserts are fresh which is difficult to come across. The wine and beer selection is out of hand, I truly believe that there is no need to go anywhere else for your grocery shopping/dinner/general home purchases. They carry everything!!My favorite part: buy a nice drink and enjoy yourself while you shop!

4.description: Mariano West Loop. Customer service could be better. On several occasions I had to ask the cashier to smile. And today I had to ask for my receipt and for a thank you. I don't understand, why can't they be like Chick Fila, "My pleasure". At least a smile and a thank you, there are other grocery stores that I could choose.  Maybe that's what I need to do, go spend my money somewhere else.

6.description: The meat I bought 1/22/16 exp in 2010 and they act like they cant put customer service or mngr on ph whats the big deal.

22.description: The 6 dollar deal on 2 sides and a protein is no longer offered at this location. Now you can get 1 scoop for $3, 2 scoops for $5, 3scoops for $8 and so on....The brussel sprout-lentil salad with shredded cheese is hearty. Its my favorite of the three. The quinoa artichoke salad tastes like your average marinated salad.   The asparagus-chickpea- kale-pumpkin seed salad looks better than it tastes. Its crunchy, but kind of bland in flavor.I still think the kale detox smoothie is the best around. The pineapple and apple give it a smooth flavor. The kale and spinach blend in with the fruit. The ginger and cayenne add a slight kick. I've  tried similar drinks around town and they were too watery or bitter.

15.description: Sad to see what happened to my favorite grocery store, fresh fruit and vegetables selection is no longer that great, now I go elsewhere and the couple of times I have come back the selection sucks.What happened?????

57.description: I just had lunch at the oyster bar and it was such a great experience. I had their lunch special which included a choice from two soup options, 3 jumbo shrimp, 3 oysters, and 2 crab claws. Francis served me today and he was so thorough. He asked me which oysters i wanted. He let me sample both the Cioppino and lobster bisque. I ended up choosing the Cioppino. I told him how I preferred my oysters and trusted him to select them for me. He gave me his east coast selections and they were so good! Those are also some of the largest shrimp I've ever seen. The crab claw were on the smaller side though. They also have happy hour on just the oysters 2-4pm (everyday?). And I overheard Tuesday is $10 for half dozen oysters plus wine/beer. What a deal!I've loved all my Mariano's experiences. It serves as so much more than just a grocery store. I once hung out here to have a beer while waiting for a table at Au Cheval to become available. It's really such a fun place

20.description: This place is awesome! Great atmosphere when you walk in. Its always very lively and vibrant when I'm at Mariano's. The food they serve here is pretty great. The have the best freshly squeezed orange juice I've ever tasted! I always get food from their buffet and have to grab a large bottle of their orange juice. It's simply amazing!

36.description: I've had better luck with employees lately.  They seem to be getting a little better although it's still no where near as good as when they opened.  I used to get organic milk there all the time, but they raised the price and everything they put out the last few months is about to expire.  I emailed their management and they said they'd fix it.  I went back for the first time since Whole Foods opened, but it's still the same.  All the organic milk was only a few days away from expiring.I'm also disappointed by the change they made to the sandwich bar a few months ago.  I used to be able to order what I want with minor customizations (like no mayo).  Now they pre make it and won't let you order what you want.  Overall this is a good store.  It's just that chances are if I go here they won't have any milk that isn't about to expire which will force me to have to go to another store and regret wasting my time going here.

14.description: I'm surprised I haven't wrote a review on this Mariano's before because it is one of my favorite spots.Even though they are building ones throughout the city this is still my go to one.  It is more than a grocery store it is truly an experience. They have a juicing station where you can get some fresh squeezed juice...oh yum!They have a grill where you can buy a steak or other types of meat and they will cook it for you.  The soup is a little expensive but it is so good and I have had several flavors.  They have a salad bar, sushi bar, a very nice wine selection, fresh fruit and a ton of other things that makes this grocery store stand out from so many others.I like that you can taste something before you buy it so that if you don't like it you aren't committed to kale salad if that's not your cup of greens...lol  After you have allowed the experience to penetrate your mind they have a simple area where you can go and chow down on your meal.  They have complimentary cucumber water which is D'lish but they have these small Dixie cups so you need a few in order to quench your thirst.I also like the fireplace with the chairs around them...where you can relax a bit before you are enthralled with all that there is to see and experience.I love coming to this store because I always discover something new.  I even forget to check in and that's saying something about me.If you haven't visited this location you should it is one of these best in the city.Enjoy!!!!

3.description: The archetypical "cabbie joint," with minimalist (and frankly somewhat grubby) atmosphere. (People muttering in any number of languages, with Al Jazeera on the big-screen TV, an actual functioning mosque in the basement, etc.) Pakistani food predominates, though I've seen some Egyptian things as well. The food is a bit meat-centric, but otherwise somewhat similar to Indian. Naan is made to order and quite well done. The chicken biryani is excellent, and make sure to order a masala chai for after your meal -- it's the only good example of the art form for a mile in any direction.A good value for the money, though I'm disappointed that they shut down the $6 buffet (thank you, Chicago health department), which was the best part of the Kebab Corner experience. The atmosphere can be a little weird (not to say intimidating) for honkies coming in off the street, but I've always been treated extremely well by management.

1.description: When you think Greektown, you dont immediately think "Kabob." But according to reports, this place has been around for ages.This place was something I had been wanting to try, as I pass it daily on my way to work. I finally got bold (hungry) enough to go there. The huge parking lot for the place is 90% cabs, which to me is a good sign, as it tends to mean value and some type of flavor.The door looked somewhat like a non-traditional restaurant. Couldnt explain why. But I stepped in, and the first thing I noticed was the hollowness. PLace had very high celings, and somewhat cavernous. The cooking area was off toward the back, and the eating area was to the left and front. a stairway going down to a basement was in the middle of the room. This place is very hole-in-the-wall-ish, and is exactly the type of place I like. And no windows.A lady with a burka was at the counter, and asked if there was a menu. She tells me "Everything you see here is delicious", which meant no menu, and no published prices. I *did* see a list describing entrees for $6, $8 and $12 for a full order. I suppose its somewhat of a fixed price for any items. Behind the glass warmers I sw very familiar Indian-type curry stews with chicken, lamb, and some mystery meats. There were some Indian-style samosas and those other potato or onion thingies too.The food looked Pakistani or Afghan to me, which was fine. Since I was to meet a friend for dinner later, I deicded to go light. I asked about bread, she said that they had "good naan bread." I went with that, and some rice, and a samosa. Again, very Indian, but everything was Halal. Paid $6 for the meal (kinda steep, shoulda gotten a protein). The rice was somewhat cold, and tasted like it had been sitting there all day. But at least the samosa was excellent, and so was the fresh, hot naan.As I waited for my food, I turned and watched the big screen tv tuned into Al- Jazeera. Man, that channel is dpressing. So much strife in the MIddle East. I thought it was funny, however, when the news showed Momar Qaddafi of Libya, and the cab drivers eating started to laugh at him. He *did* look kinda silly, but it was just funny to see the cabbies laugh at him.I will return to try a protein dish, and give an updated report.Also, I noticed men constantly walking in and out of the basement, which kinda threw me off. I also saw a partially folded sign saying something about shoes. I was thinking the only reason I would see something like that is if there were a mosque or somthing there. I later found out that was the case. I just thought it was odd - a mosque inside of a restaurant.UPDATE: Demoted to 2 stars, after my lunch date and I were whisked away involuntarily to another room, apparently because of prayers or something. The door was rudely closed behind us after we were relocated, which was just bad social etiquette. I realize that there is a Mosque in the basement, but this should not excuse the tacky treatment we received. I would give it one star if it wasnt for the delicious food. $21 lunch for 3 dishes.

2.description: This isn't Indian food- it's Pakistani food.  Not Hindu veg-friendly, but Muslim no-pork.I had a mixed vegetable curry sort of thing (it was in a thin broth instead of a thick ghee-based curry), some super-spicy daal, and naan.  They warned me about the daal being spicy, but I didn't expect that- wow.  The vegetables were ok but more stew-like than anything.  Nothing amazing here.Like Pilsen, my friends and I were constantly asked to please move to the front room.  Was it because we were women?  Was it because there was actual functioning air conditioning?  Was it because they thought we were uncomfortable, being surrounded by cabbies speaking Arabic?  Who knows.  We didn't move.

5.description: the food is terrible, the service bad and the prices not cheap! i suppose if you are a cabbie its ok, but not for someone off the street looking for a place to eat!

0.description: 2.5 stars for Kabob Corner.  My fellow food whore convinced me to try out this place, telling me that "it has to be good, all the cabbies go there!"  I was a bit apprehensive, due to it's shady appearance and the fact that we are both girls and neither one of us is a Middle Eastern cab driver.  However, the people who work here are both friendly and helpful.  Aside from a few "What are THEY doing here?" glances from the cabbies who hang out here, everyone left us alone.There isn't really a menu to speak of here.  They had several dishes pre-made, but we decided to order something fresh.  The cook said he had chicken and beef kabobs, so we ordered one of each.  Even the naan was fresh made--we watched him roll out the dough and put it into the oven.  Our dinner consisted of 5 pieces each of beef and chicken kabob over rice, with sides of hummus, tabbouleh and naan.  The chicken was tender and flavorful, but the beef was a little dry.  The hummus was REALLY good--very lemony and smooth.  We both loved the piping hot and fresh naan as well.  The tabbouleh salad was also refreshing.  I got the impression that this place is pretty big, but we stayed in the main dining area, which is basically a cafeteria.  It's a little grimy, but don't be squeamish!  There's a pool table and a big TV--unfortunately, NOT showing Al Jazeera the night we were there!  There's also a coin-operated massage chair, to work out those knots from sitting in a cab all day!  If you're running short on cigarettes, batteries, or if you are in the market for cellphone accessories, you can get those here too, at a little counter at the back of the room.  There is a prayer room downstairs, with people constantly going up and down.  There is another room behind the cafeteria area, maybe another prayer room?Definitely a unique dining adventure.  Great to see a different side of Chicago.  I would maybe go back for the hummus and the naan.  The food was good, but I think you can get the same quality food with a better atmosphere elsewhere.

4.description: Love this place.  It's what I imagine a truck stop on the road to Kandahar would be like... and the food (the naan, the biryani, etc.) is outstanding.

58.description: I live in the area and decide to try it out after seeing them on Chicago's Best. Well this place should be featured on Chicago's Worst because that is where it belongs!  The service sucked. It was not crowded yet the service was very slow. Customers behind us began to leave. My boyfriend and i ordered the chicken gyros and Greek fries. The meat had no flavor at all. The taziki sauce was bland. The Greek fries were oily and tasteless. This place is over- rated. I won't be back. JUST PLAIN GROSS!!!!

56.description: Beef gyro was stacked with meat. The quality of the meat was great. The tzatiki sauce was perfect. Most places make it too strong, not here. Just right. I have tried many different gyros all over the city, this is top 3 easy. Don't add too many toppings, keep it simple.

29.description: I've been on yelp for maybe 3 years and have never felt the need to write a review....until now. The gyro pizza brought tears of joy to my eyes and is the single greatest thing I've tasted from a gyro joint. Shout out to Justin for the great customer service!

42.description: While their food is good, they do a poor job with order accuracy.  I have ordered from them several times through grubhub and they almost always forget at least 1 item. It is not worth the hassle so no more ordering from them!!!

23.description: One star for the staff. The folks who work Tuesday evenings around six are seriously creepy and slow. One dude whistles incessantly and the other is insanely slow at putting together orders. He's forgotten, on three occasions, to put fries in the fryer halfway through my order every single time resulting in a fifteen minute wait total.This is all just mediocre service for just okay food. The kicker came when three young black men in their early twenties came in to order. The cashier kept calling them boys and after they left, he cleaned off their table (and apparently their leftover food) and said in a super loud voice "I tried to to tell them they wouldn't like the hummus. They don't serve that in the ghetto." My boyfriend and I are white so I guess he thought it was "cool" to announce that for our amusement. For real? Get it together.

47.description: I'm not one to be high maintenance or a complainer but I'm warning the people who want delivery and overall if you are looking to not eat spoiled food to just be careful.The hummus was spoiled - I know this because it starts to ferment when it goes bad - a carbonated almost fizzy, sour taste - signs it has turned. It also had a slimy texture which also means no bueno.  I called. They didn't believe me - I offered to bring it to them to show them their batch was inedible and people could get sick if I wasn't the only one who received it. He said his driver would be over shortly to get it as well as bring me a new order of hummus and a new sandwich (there'd been the spoiled hummus on that, too).  Anyway, they bring me my sandwich - which still had hummus on it - the bad batch - and no new hummus which was probably for the best since they can't seem to get their act together over there. The manager wasn't good at handling the entire situation meaning that the customer service was awful - no people skills.Last complaint about this lame excuse at a Greek Gyro joint - they took two hours to bring the second "fixed" order to me - and I'm a 1.4 miles away. If I'd decided to crawl  there and back, I would've beat the driver to my house easily in the same amount of time it took to arrive. They'll be out of business soon considering the inauthenticity of the restaurant compared to it's competition in Greektown as well as the much higher quality of said competition.... Not to mention you most likely will receive better customer service the down the street at Micky D's or Domino's. But hey, good thing there's over 600 other restaurants in Chicago that you can order from.

8.description: First off: most pix on Yelp for this business are PROFESSIONAL PICTURES It must be posted by the owners of the place! Shame on you yelp for allowing that!My experience: based on the oh so fresh and yummy pix I saw here for this restaurant I decided to order a late night meal, it was digusting! Everything was cold except for the soup, the potatoes were soggy and gross like they're week old!  The spinach pie thing also tasted old, the spinach filling is so old and nasty! And also the crust tasted like it was fried in old oil yuck! I threw away all the food and only had the bread and soup although I was hungry  :(  If they don't feel like making a late meal then they shouldn't do it! U don't have to send gross food for a meal! This place should be shut down.ANSWER TO MR MICHAEL M:the fries got to me like that I didn't leave it until it got cold and soggy! And feta cheese is my favorite that's why I was so excited and wanted to try these items! By the way I cook and I know the taste of old food and old oil! If I wanted cold and old food I would've just got something from my fridge! I'm so upset from the way of handling your business even more of this answer!

31.description: I came in after working out and was pleasantly surprised that they have a protein loaded sandwich! I had a chicken gyro on a multi grain pita and it was delicious! They specially made it spicier for me, but it wasn't that spicy (I'm a spice freak, don't trust me when I say its not spicy). Adam and Justin were the dudes behind the counter, and they were nice guys. They were sociable, and informative about the menu!

34.description: This was my first time here. It was like these guys didn't know what the hell they were doing.  First I come in and order a gyro and an order of fries. The guy goes somewhere and this other guy says to me " oh we have a gyro already made, would u like this one?"  There's a gyro sitting on the counter waiting for the condiments to be put on it.  So I look at him with the side eye. He says "I can warm it up again for you if u like?"  I think to myself "Really?? You Noodle."  I tell him "You know what, I wanna change that to a chicken gyro"  He looks at me and says "OK I guess I got me a gyro, don't want it to go to waste. I thinking whatever.   So the first guy I placed my order with starts cutting the chicken off the spit. Next he has to weight it.  First time I've ever seen that at a gyro place. Damn y'all that cheap you just can't cut the meat off and know how much to cut off to make a nice sandwich?  wack!!  Meanwhile a guy comes in behind me and orders a chicken salad. So instead of going to cut the meat off the spit to start warming it up on the grill he proceeds to make the guys salad making sure every tomato and green pepper was counted correctly while making it.  This has got to be the cheapest place. just put the damn veggies on the damn salad already dammit!! OK back to me. So it's time to take my gyro off the grill. He picks it up and turns around then realized he didn't have the wrapping paper on the counter. He has to put the gyro down to get the paper on the counter. He asks me what I want on it, I tell him and we're almost thru right? Wrong?  He tells the lady to ring me up. Remember the order of fries I ordered with the gyro. Well they didn't. So the fries weren't dropped, but I see fries in the warmer tray and I think to myself she better not give me them old ass fries after all this time I've been waiting for this raggedy ass gyro.  She drops some more fries then proceeds to ring me up, but says nothing of the fact that I now have to wait for my fries to be cooked. I stand there and wait knowing it's gonna take a couple of minutes for the fries to be done so in the meantime I go get my pop from the machine. I come back and the lady is putting my fries in my back. I must be crazy or something but I know dam well those fries didn't cook that fast. I don't know what she did but all I know is that when I tried the fries some were warm and others were piping hot.  I'm really not feeling this place.  I asked the guy for a tray to carry my stuff to the table since I wasn't asked in the beginning if it was for here or to go. There was a stack of dirty trays sitting on the counter that he started to reach for then realizing they were dirty. He looks around like he didn't know where the clean ones were, finds them and I go on my way.  what a fuckin mess this place is and at 11:30pm on a Friday with no one in front of me.  $12 and change for a chicken gyro, sm fry, sm pop.  The gyro was pretty good. The fries were mediocre at best based on what I stated before.   Imma try them again (but it might be awhile) cause maybe it was a bad night and for my first experience it wasn't that great. For the time being I'll stick with Mr. Greek for my gyros when I'm in the area.This part is in addition to what was written above. Now that I've had a chance to sleep on it, the way the two guys working there were acting I think they were high on something. They weren't drunk cause they weren't wobbly or slurring their speech. Their slow movements, me constantly having to repeat myself, the way they were interacting with one another, the weird way the guy was filling the salad bowl for the customer behind me, yeah these guys were high on something.  These are the type of guys that burn your establishment down.

16.description: The chicken and lamb/beef gyros we picked up from Gyro-Mena were great - the meats and the tzatziki were good.  I'd say the proportion of the toppings could've been done a little better but it's hard to complain when the pita was stuffed completely full.  Unfortunately, the fries were...almost refried and very sad, so I'm not sure if I'd venture beyond gyros next time.

13.description: ordered theChicken Breast plate..its served with rice pilaf ..greek flat bread and a side salad.. its pretty good! chicken was well seasoned.. and the rice was soft with the right amount of flavor. chicken and pork mixed gyro sandwich.. it was pretty hard to build my own gyro because they had so many different sauce to choose from and i suck at deciding lol...  but i didnt really enjoy the meat of the pork.. it tasted really weird for me .. other then that.. it was good..will come back to get their lamb gyro sandwich and other foods.

11.description: Ok, so my lifelong dream of going to Greece has come true and i'm STILL HAVING A HARD TIME FINDING A GYRO AS GOOD AS GYRO MENA!! Amazing. Great job guys you really do have one of the best Gyros I have ever tasted! That Turkish Cucumber sauce.... smh! Can't wait to get back to Chicago :)

39.description: The chicken and lamb/beef gyros we picked up from Gyro-Mena were great - the meats and the tzatziki were good.  I'd say the proportion of the toppings could've been done a little better but it's hard to complain when the pita was stuffed completely full.  Unfortunately, the fries were...almost refried and very sad, so I'm not sure if I'd venture beyond gyros next time.

37.description: Ordered from Grubhub (it arrived within an hour).It tasted alright, nothing special, but my issue is with the what happened hours after my meal. I got really sick about 4 hours after my gyro. My boyfriend had the same thing, American style gyro and fries and he woke up around the same time that I felt sick. He said he didn't feel well either. The difference being that he didn't have to make a trip to the bathroom like I did. Maybe we just reacted badly to it but I really don't see my self ordering from here again. Or ordering a gyro for a while.

0.description: This is my favorite place to stop in and get a Gyro.  They are not the fastest place but thats because the perfect gyro takes time!  I love that you can build it up however you want. They do not skimp on the ingredients. By the time I add everything, the thing is massive.  I have tried all the meats and my favorite is the mix of the pork/lamb greek style. I have never had delivery so I can not comment on how that works, but given how long it takes while in the restaurant, I bet delivery takes a lot longer... Plan accordingly or just stop in!

38.description: A couple friends and I went to Gryo-Mena the other night after purchasing an Amazon Local deal for the place recently and were very pleased. We tried the American (beef/lamb) and Greek (pork) gyros with various sauces and toppings. All were good though I am still partial to the American gyro, and the toppings and sauces were piled on to fill the pita. I hate it when you don't have enough tzatziki sauce to cover the meat but they didn't disappoint. We went in the evening and street/metered parking was was easy to find. The place was clean and offered a nice sit down area if you didn't want to take off with your food. Would definitely repeat when in the area since they gyros in Greektown always seem to taste better than other places in the city for some reason.

51.description: Best gyro in Chicago hands down. They do it the right way just like in Greece. Get the pork or the chicken. Try out the gyros roll.......good stuff.

27.description: Delicious food, huge portions, cheap prices. This restaurant has character too. Hilarious signs line the place. Definitely recommend trying it sometime

32.description: Chicken gyro was not very good at all, the place looks clean but the cooks look like greaseballs! Why are u sweating so profusely I wanted to ask, but didn't and it is absolutely true that they weigh their meat which by the way was way to dry. Never going back though ok I'm lying maybe another drunk night.

54.description: Had the chicken this time with pita and it was great. No concerns about being dry and I enjoyed it with the yogurt sauce. Did try the loukamades this time as well, but would probably say that Artopolis would be a better option for that (lighter and with nuts).I imagine that their beef/lamb American gyros would be similar to any other gyro joint and I don't think it is made in house...so I'd just bounce between the chicken and the pork on future visits - and try any other sauces left to try.Could it be cheaper? Unlikely based on the location, meat quality, sauce options, and size. Keep in mind plain ol' beef/lamb gyro that is smaller down the street starts at $5 + tax.

48.description: Being half Greek, I grew up thinking of gyros as an entree, not a fast food  or something you threw down your throat after the bars closed. It's been kind of a traditional dish for me. Until now. Gyro-Mena has re-interpreted  gyros in a good way. First, they offer chicken. In addition to being lower in fat, it tastes very good. Second, they offer a wide variety of toppings. Greek tzatziki. Turkish tzatziki. Whole grain pitas. White pitas. A variety of onions. You get the picture. And the toppings they offer make sense.They're not just a bunch of silly toppings designed to impress the consumer with variety.An as an added bonus, between noon and 1pm, the restaurant hires a belly dancer for your dining pleasure.

44.description: Best gyro in greektown hands down. The beef/lamb combo is quality meat, very well seasoned and has a more natural consistency than all other gyros I've tried elsewhere. Also, the facility was super clean and had nice decor. I normally hit the Mr Gryo across the street and that place looks like it needs a visit from the city health inspector. Also the customer demographic was gangbanger free, which is a plus.

24.description: I've lived in the area for 5 years and have tried the gyro at almost every place in greektown and have never been satisfied.  That is until I found this place. Pork gyro on pita with tzaziki, cucumbers, tomato and lettuce.  In my opinion this is what a gyro should be.

7.description: We ordered here when we were lazy on a Sat afternoon.The chicken pita was delishThe gyro plate was mehThe greek salad was just ok.I think if we just got eh chicken pita and maybe a gyro pita...we would have loved it.Order that and you will be happy.

49.description: Ummm...ordered from here at 11:30pm via grub hub and was told it would be 80min for delivery. Ok. Over an hr and a half later called to check on status of order, was informed that it was on its way. Ok? 30 min later called to confirm delivery and was then yelled at before being told it was on its way. It never came. Fuck this place.

40.description: Some people grow up eating pot roast and meatloaf... I grew up eating gyros. I wouldn't normally be compelled to review a gyro place because the taste is pretty consistent no matter where you go (except for that one time I ordered one in SF - YUCK!), I do feel compelled to review Gyro-Mena. When I lived in Wrigleyville, I frequently ordered from the location on Belmont, which was great. When I moved downtown, I was so happy to see that I'm in the delivery zone for the Greektown location. My waist, however, may not be. But I digress. Here's all of the reasons why I love Gyro-Mena:- Their meat is sliced perfectly - not too thin, not too thick. - Their pita bread is amazing. Seriously - I don't know what they do to them (brush them with oil, perhaps?), but I could eat them plain. - They're incredibly accommodating with my stupid requests via GrubHub. (Hi guys, I'm the annoying person that always asks to swap out the pita and pilaf and onions/cucumbers and Greek salad!)- They have late delivery hours- They deliver frappesI do wish they would offer the option to order an extra pita via Grub Hub. That being said, I just noticed the response on someone else's review that you can actually order directly from their website. I just took a look, and that order form has wayyy more ordering options than GrubHub, which is good to know. :)

53.description: Great for a late night snack, but the portions are more like a meal, fresh, tasty, and friendly staff, great price, very clean, only place that had falafel in that corner.  Close by the loop so a quick shared ride makes it convenient.  I would visit again and recommend it for a casual group sit down place.

30.description: Saturday eve.Place is empty. I am the only soul walking in along w/ my family.Not mi first run with Gyro Mena. I know how to do a simple order.Asian chick behind the counter already in bad mood. (gosh, noooo please).Food mediocre and cold. Portions for gyro plate and a sandwich smaller than average.The atmosphere between the tired cook and bad mood lady, gets awkward.  I need to leave and stat!!.I hate the fact that my voucher from Amazon local HAS to be used at this location, because on the other Gyro Mena by Belmont, everybody is extremely polite and the service excels. I feel welcomed all the time.

46.description: Excellent food! Greek Fries are mm mmmm good!Weekday lunch...forget it and call ahead! I waited 10 minutes to order with only 3 people in line and was before noon. 2 people behind the counter, 1 at the register and the other taking 1 order and preparing it at a time. If they address that situation it can earn another star. And the Philly place next door, oh you get the order taken promptly but takes 15 minutes for the steak sandwich.

1.description: Giving them 1 star since there isn't an option to give them 0.  We placed an order for delivery and waited 2 hours. When we called to inquire about the status of the order, they apologized by saying there was only 1 driver who was delivering 30 orders.  I'm sure the gyros taste great, but I wouldn't know because I'm still waiting.... We ended up sending my little brother to go pick it up even after waiting the 2 hours and being charged for tip and delivery.... Should not state that you provide a delivery service if you are unable to actually provide the service... I would not ever depend on this establishment to deliver an order to you... My recommendation is to go pick it up or dine-in if you are truly dying to try this place..

55.description: Great gyros. Crispy becausenthey put the meat on the grill before serving it. Good rice pilaf as well. And the Greek pizza is delicious. A great new place that the other nearby establishments should fear.

9.description: Love this place.....food is so fresh and satisfying. Delivery is efficient and polite. Have ordered via Grubhub several times without issue. Reasonably priced and worth every penny.

26.description: Meh. When we walked in, the place was empty (it was very cold that night). Despite that fact, it took 15 minutes to order the food because they only had one guy for a while (while other guys appeared to not be helping), and the one guy kept stopping to put our orders together for what looked like orders submitted online. The food itself was ok, but not great.

25.description: First off: most pix on Yelp for this business are PROFESSIONAL PICTURES It must be posted by the owners of the place! Shame on you yelp for allowing that!My experience: based on the oh so fresh and yummy pix I saw here for this restaurant I decided to order a late night meal, it was digusting! Everything was cold except for the soup, the potatoes were soggy and gross like they're week old!  The spinach pie thing also tasted old, the spinach filling is so old and nasty! And also the crust tasted like it was fried in old oil yuck! I threw away all the food and only had the bread and soup although I was hungry  :(  If they don't feel like making a late meal then they shouldn't do it! U don't have to send gross food for a meal! This place should be shut down.ANSWER TO MR MICHAEL M:the fries got to me like that I didn't leave it until it got cold and soggy! And feta cheese is my favorite that's why I was so excited and wanted to try these items! By the way I cook and I know the taste of old food and old oil! If I wanted cold and old food I would've just got something from my fridge! I'm so upset from the way of handling your business even more of this answer!

12.description: I wish I didn't have to even give this place 1 star. I'm usually forgiving with most places. Well I ordered from Grub-hub tonight at 1.02am. The estimated time of delivery said 2:45am. Now that wasn't stated on there until we ordered because that would have been waay too late for a Gyro. Well at about 3Am I called Grub-hub to see about my order. The woman spoke to the someone at Gyro Mena and they said it was still on it way and arrive at 3.04. Yes like 2 hours for a Gyro and I'm sorry if there is an issue with an item just call me! So at 3:45 after still not getting food. I called the restaurant. No one picked up. I Google the place and they closed at 2am it's like 4am. Called Grub Hub again they picked up for them. Must be a different line. Lol! Then they wanted to call Grub Hub back and just disappeared and wouldn't pick up. So I didn't get my food. I could have drove to Mr Greek in Greektown for a better gyro in the time it took. Hell I could have gone to Greece. My problem is that if they couldn't or wouldn't fill the order why not tell Grub Hub. I could have ordered better food at 1:30 then I did at 5am.

59.description: Love the sandwiches at this place.  Delicious gyros that you can customize just like you're at Subway or Chipotle. Love the Tzatziki sauce.  Check out the "Bruson's Best" episode for this place: youtu.be/Y7aAmTxNaUM

21.description: Adam is an excellent employee. He exceeds expectations for this type of establishment. He was very attentive, open to conversation, and generally friendly. The gyro is great especially when you add bacon to it.

17.description: When we walked it the place was totally empty and being 5pm I would have expected at least a few other people grabbing dinner (there was no one). My family and I overlooked the menu and approached the register to order where we stood for 3 minutes without being greeted or even looked at when there was one person hiding the counter near the food and 2 others I'm the far corner  behind the register. So we place our order and he takes less than half of our order ( just a gyro and potatoes) starts making it with his back turned and continues to run back and forth up and down the line not looking to face us again. .. almost seems like it was intentional... then another man shows up (one that was in the far corner and asks me to pay. OK so as I tell him our order (2gyros 3 soups and a saganki) he looks at me asks if it's for here or to go I reply for here  and his eyes bulge out of his head.."is that a problem?" "No just a question... oh I see someone else over there now" ... ok judgy judgy ... if I wanted to sit here and eat it all myself what's it to.you anyways lol. Now to the food the gyro was good very thick slices of meat but good pitas were a little greasy but still yummy tzayziki was yummy and flavorful, my avgolemeno soup I felt lacked flavor and saganki was good could have more.flavor but not bad by any means... Greek potato again greasy some had more flavor than others but overall wasn't extremely impressed. Although I will say the place was clean ... the service sucks and for service and lack of flavor on a c ouple.of my favorite dishes I will not be returning... back to windy city gyros we go for our fast gyro means and Greek islands or Santorinis for a nice dinner.

10.description: Saw them on Chicago's Best while i was having a midweek Greek craving and ended up ordering the gyro salad, Greek fries and spanakopita for delivery... All were fine, spanakopita was the best out of the three.  Definitely had better gyros in greektown, but to be fair I would give them one more try, especially for the chicken (the episode was covering the best chicken places).

5.description: Delicious meat and good dishes equal a Greek goodness meal for me! My friend and I ordered a whole bunch of dishes for delivery and I found everything to be quite tasty. That being said, my main thang was the Greek Chicken Breast over Macedonia Inspired Rice Pilaf. The marinated 8 ozs chicken breast was so moist and fresh sliced up over the rice, which it paired quite well with. Greek food isn't normally my go to genre of cuisine but Gyro-Mena may be slowly etching away at my heart.The gyros were great, too! They shove the fries right up in that bad boy.That Greek flatbread was enjoyable! I'm such a noob I had never had anything like it before. A bit of cheese on the crusty bread made it heavenly!They deliver thru GrubHub!

3.description: I'm a fan, a big fan of Gyro-Mena! Or as my workmate, Joey Vegas says "Lets go, it's time for Gyro-Mania!"  I do feel like their pork gyro is the main event here.  There are three choices: lamb, pork, and chicken, but IMO pork is the champion of all champions!  So why, not walk all the way deep into Greektown?  Toppings!  I top my pork gyro with lettuce, thinly sliced onions, tomatoes, hot giardiniera, kalamata olives, and feta!  "Whatcha gonna do when pork gyro runs wild on you, brother?"  Fries are also great, and almost big enough to share... almost.  I don't share =/  Remember to grab a fork, so you can eat your gyro down enough to fold it!

35.description: Slow and inaccurate service on several occasions. A soup and salad combo (all that was ordered) arrived for deliver over an hour after ordering with no dressing or bread. In the store they look very lost and confused. They do not know how to cook properly.  The system is currently very flawed, and it is a shame. We got home yesterday after going into the store to speed things up, while giving it another chance, and found that the order was missing the fries, there was little meat in the sandwich, and the soups were filled 3/4 of the cup.  I have no other chances to give. This place sucks balls.

19.description: OMG. I just finished my food, and I HAD to write about my meal.Please keep in mind that I never WRITE reviews... I just like to READ them! haha!Okay so I have zero groceries, had a mediocre breakfast lunch ish so I felt that I deserved to order some decent food....Instead of the usual route I take on Grubhub, I suddenly had a craving for some greek food! I dont know why I dont eat greek food that often..So the minimum is $15 and the delivery is $4. I had a hard time meeting my minimum because they are so reasonably priced! I ordered pretty much everything that I wanted. (planning on having some for leftovers) I went with the chicken plate entree instead of my first choice of the gyro entree because the chicken entree came with a side of flatbread and the gyro one didnt. The delivery was about 45min? Faster than the quoted 1 hr. (Which is good) First off, the chicken is the most delicious chicken i've had in my life time. Seriously. The chicken is tender, well flavored and just a tad sweet.  Its just a beautiful taste! I also ordered the greek potatoes over the greek fries.  The yelp pictures convinced me.  While the potatoes are good, I wouldn't say they are amazing.  They are a tad too salty for me and a little too oily.  The Rice Pilaf that came with the chicken is sooooooo good too.  It isn't dry it is just perfect yellow rice! So, the tzatziki on the side was $1.  It is THE best i've ever had as well!!!! It isnt runny or bland.  It is the perfect consistency with the right seasonings.  The greek salad that came with it was also good.  The veggies were fresh.  However, they are very very generous on olives. (I hate olives...) Okay and ..... I also ordered the home made cheesecake.  C'mon which restaurants have HOMEMADE cheesecake?! I haven't tried it yet so I cant comment on the dessert.  The slice is really big and looks fluffy and heavenly though.I gave it 4 instead of the 5 stars that it deserves because they forgot my flatbread!!!!!!!! I changed from the gyro meat to chicken entirely because of the flatbread!!!! =(!!! I called and the guy told me he will give it to me next time... SO i guess I will be ordering from them or better yet visiting the actual restaurant! While eating, I was texting with my BF letting him know how mind blowing this greek food was.  He asked if it was on halsted and jackson.  I looked it up and I told him that it was!  He said that he had a gyro here a few weeks ago and agreed that it was really amazing, he said that their greek fries were delicious as well.  I think next time I will try those instead of the potatoes.

28.description: They do use olive oil on their pita and construct the gyro in a very neat manner. Tzsiki sauce is Solid! Plus they have belly dancing and philly cheese steaks at their sister restaurant connected to their restaurant. Dont want pepsi, you can get coke at their philly spot.I think this is the perfect spot for gyros if your with a girl. Very comprable slice to Zues which is my personal favorite just not as much meat. They have a build your gyro option which im not a fan of (reminds me of Chipolte). Overall I left satisfied and will return.

45.description: We tried Mr Greek gyros and no comparison, this place is better.  Friendly service, great portion sizes, and tastier gyro meat.  Also they have awesome grilled onions and other add ons for their gyros.

33.description: Ordered via GrubHub for a weekend dinner, and they took the full 90 minutes estimated to deliver, so hopefully you aren't that hungry when you place your order. That being said, the gyros were really good - both had lamb, and the meat was seasoned well and tender, good amount of meat and the portion overall was large enough for lunch leftovers the next day as well.  Plenty of topping choices to customize your gyro to your heart's delight. The rice pilaf was ok, not the best I've ever had but not the worst either. Same goes for the avgolomeno (chicken rice) soup - good, not great. I'd stick strictly to gyros next time I order.

43.description: We ordered here when we were lazy on a Sat afternoon.The chicken pita was delishThe gyro plate was mehThe greek salad was just ok.I think if we just got eh chicken pita and maybe a gyro pita...we would have loved it.Order that and you will be happy.

2.description: Ordered delivery. Ordered a gyro and a salad. Was soggy and super gross. No other way to really describe it.

18.description: Meh. When we walked in, the place was empty (it was very cold that night). Despite that fact, it took 15 minutes to order the food because they only had one guy for a while (while other guys appeared to not be helping), and the one guy kept stopping to put our orders together for what looked like orders submitted online. The food itself was ok, but not great.

41.description: Best handwipes I've ever used. Made it an overall very enjoyable experience after eating my deliciously messy gyro.

52.description: AWESOME!!! So glad we finally gave this place a try. From the service, to the prices, to the food (most important of course!) - everything was just great! Adding this place to the go-to lineup.

50.description: OMG. I just finished my food, and I HAD to write about my meal.Please keep in mind that I never WRITE reviews... I just like to READ them! haha!Okay so I have zero groceries, had a mediocre breakfast lunch ish so I felt that I deserved to order some decent food....Instead of the usual route I take on Grubhub, I suddenly had a craving for some greek food! I dont know why I dont eat greek food that often..So the minimum is $15 and the delivery is $4. I had a hard time meeting my minimum because they are so reasonably priced! I ordered pretty much everything that I wanted. (planning on having some for leftovers) I went with the chicken plate entree instead of my first choice of the gyro entree because the chicken entree came with a side of flatbread and the gyro one didnt. The delivery was about 45min? Faster than the quoted 1 hr. (Which is good) First off, the chicken is the most delicious chicken i've had in my life time. Seriously. The chicken is tender, well flavored and just a tad sweet.  Its just a beautiful taste! I also ordered the greek potatoes over the greek fries.  The yelp pictures convinced me.  While the potatoes are good, I wouldn't say they are amazing.  They are a tad too salty for me and a little too oily.  The Rice Pilaf that came with the chicken is sooooooo good too.  It isn't dry it is just perfect yellow rice! So, the tzatziki on the side was $1.  It is THE best i've ever had as well!!!! It isnt runny or bland.  It is the perfect consistency with the right seasonings.  The greek salad that came with it was also good.  The veggies were fresh.  However, they are very very generous on olives. (I hate olives...) Okay and ..... I also ordered the home made cheesecake.  C'mon which restaurants have HOMEMADE cheesecake?! I haven't tried it yet so I cant comment on the dessert.  The slice is really big and looks fluffy and heavenly though.I gave it 4 instead of the 5 stars that it deserves because they forgot my flatbread!!!!!!!! I changed from the gyro meat to chicken entirely because of the flatbread!!!! =(!!! I called and the guy told me he will give it to me next time... SO i guess I will be ordering from them or better yet visiting the actual restaurant! While eating, I was texting with my BF letting him know how mind blowing this greek food was.  He asked if it was on halsted and jackson.  I looked it up and I told him that it was!  He said that he had a gyro here a few weeks ago and agreed that it was really amazing, he said that their greek fries were delicious as well.  I think next time I will try those instead of the potatoes.

4.description: Gyro + anything else you can think of + affordable price = best cuasi-greek food joint in Greek Town, Chicago.Seriously, in a neighborhood with 2-3 Greek restaurants per block if you only care about the food and not the looks, and if you are on a tight budget this is your place. The Gyros are better than in any other fancy place I tried nearby, the food is fresh, the staff is super friendly and... where else would you get a gyro in a pita rolled with Fries and Bacon? :)

6.description: Gyromena has taken over as the best spot to get food after a night out in the UIC area. You can't go wrong with the regular gyro or the pork gyro. The food is always on point! This place is a hidden gem right before the Jackson entrance into 94.

22.description: Let me preference this review that both my friend and I are both greek, like my big fat greek wedding greek.I went there with a buddy and ordered 2 pork gyros and loukoumades (greek fried honey balls for you non greeks). Then it went all down hill. None of the gyros cookers were on. There was chicken, pork, lamb and beef in there but not cooking. After we ordered, the cook cuts off 2 servings of pork, but cuts the meat so deep that all you see is raw pork. Then he puts the meat on the flat top with some liquid I only assume is oil and covers it up. At this point, my friend is disgusted since his family has owned a restaurant for their entire life and never has he seen gyros cooked on a flat top instead of a gyros cooker in a greek restaurant. It doesnt end there. At this point, he has canceled his order because he asked the cook if he cleaned that knife before cutting other food with it, since he just cut raw pork. The cooks response is that he rinses it off with water. Ok so now we are down to just my pork gyros and loukoumades. After about 5 minutes, he lifts the lid on the flat top and takes a knife to cut the huge chunks of pork. Cutting it into smaller prices will make it cook faster and all the way through so I am okay with this. However, after he was finished cutting the raw port, he takes the knife over to a hand washing sink and rinses the knife off with water, then takes a paper towel to dry the knife off. He then puts the knife back. Hmm. 5 more minutes pass and the gyros comes off the grill, they add my toppings which look fine and my gyros is done. Now onto the loukoumades. They take out a tub of what I am guessing is batter and scoop globs into one of their two fryers. The same fryers that they are making the fries and every other friend food on the menu. So they are cooking my french fried loukoumades and the lady making them takes a basket and pushes the loukoumades down under the oil. I tell her that you shouldnt do this because then they will soak up the oil. She response that they will float if she doesnt and this is the way her boss told her to cook them. Any real greek knows that loukoumades are fluffy light friend balls that float. Let me emphasis the 'LIGHT" aspect of that. So now I am expecting my french friend oil soaked dough that she takes out of the fryer and puts a little cinnamon on and what had to be less than a tablespoon of honey. Loukoumades are supposed to be doused in honey. To top it off, she takes the hot metal tin that they are in and puts it into a PLASTIC BAG. Yes, a hot metal tin in a plastic bag. I held my tongue, paid for my food and exited the establishment.When I put home and pealed off the now melted plastic from the metal container, it reveals dry heavy fried dough balls that are more like french fried donut holes than loukoumades. I added some more honey to them to see if they got better. Nope, all it did was make them more sticky so the flavor stuck around longer. Finally, lets see about the pork gyros. Opened it up and the pita was heavy and oil soaked, but okay, I wont eat the pita, lets just eat the meat and toppings. The toppings were excellent, great flavor from the feta onions and sauce. Ate some off the smaller pieces of pork and they were fine, cooked and good. Got to the other half of the gyros (the bigger pieces) and cut them open. Yup, my fears have now been confirmed, the pork is RAW. Needless to say, I didnt finish my gyros.The atmosphere of this place is awesome. Love the idea of it, but if you are a greek restaurant, then you better get greek food right or else stick with pizza and hot wings. This is Scientia Potestas Est saying the boycott will continue until cuisine improves.

15.description: Mostly empty when I came in around 5:30pm. This is cafeteria-style service and the gyro plate was fine. Come here for a quick bite to eat without overpaying. Just keep in mind that this is fast food, what Panda Express is to Chinese, this is to Greek.

57.description: Hands down best place to get gyros!  Made to order like you're at chipotle.  Must go Greek style!  meaning fries in yo sandwich...  "Awwwwwyeah"!!

20.description: Love Gyro-Mena!! I work overnight at 111 W. Wacker at the overnight concierge desk.
