I ordered soon after I got to work on Saturday, March 14 during a busy period for all delivery supporting restaurants due to the St. Patricks Day evening when everyone is getting turned up at parties and clubs and I was so pleased to have my meal 45 minutes earlier than expected. The driver was real chill and the food was still hot. Ill be ordering again soon. Thanks Gyro-Mena for superb service!!

36.description: ordered theChicken Breast plate..its served with rice pilaf ..greek flat bread and a side salad.. its pretty good! chicken was well seasoned.. and the rice was soft with the right amount of flavor. chicken and pork mixed gyro sandwich.. it was pretty hard to build my own gyro because they had so many different sauce to choose from and i suck at deciding lol...  but i didnt really enjoy the meat of the pork.. it tasted really weird for me .. other then that.. it was good..will come back to get their lamb gyro sandwich and other foods.

14.description: I wanted a good Greek delivery place - found it!! I got the lemon-orzo soup with and add on Greek salad and the gyro plate with rice. The salad and soup were perfect. The soup was still steaming! The gyro plate was really good. I wasn't the biggest fan of the rice but I'm not a rice person. It was solid. Now, was it the best Greek food ever? No. But it was cheap and comforting. Definitely ordering again.

58.description: Good pita sandwich, good Greek fries (feta and oregano).  Nice outdoor dining and the windows open in nice weather.  Also if you are still a smoker, great news! apparently the Illinois law or people's health don't matter bc if you are caught here on a Saturday night (Greek music party night) people smoke in here That takes 1 star away.  If you play backgammon and don't have a job or are a student, this is your spot during the weekday with a frappe.Not sure what the problem with the waitresses are, never had a big problem.Parking is valet for $5 on the side. That's about it.

56.description: I usually come here on a weekday afternoon for some soup and a cocktail. The service is nice, but they never come to check up on me. After about 20 minutes of waiting, I have to go ask for my check. But the egg lemon is good!

29.description: Since moving in the area, I passed this place for a few months before reading the reviews on Yelp.  Do not go here if you are looking for your typical Greektown experience.  This place is like a technopop night club with great Greek food.  I highly recommend their pork.  On our first visit we split one of their platters and there was plenty for both of us with enough to take home so the portions are generous.If you want some great food without the typical Greek experience, this is your place.  This place is a little quirky but definitely a good dining experience.

42.description: The kabobs, burgers, and Greek fries (feta, oregano, and lemon) are all delish. I definitely recommend the Penny Salad (so much meat!).Drinks are well priced, and the bartender has a heavy hand.If you like Greek music there is a DJ on Saturdays and there is parking nearby (metered during the day).Service is polite. Decor is very cute.Best time to go is in warm weather when they open the windows. This is a pretty solid place.

23.description: Ugh. Just a normal place. Nothing special, although outdoor seating is nice in Greektown. However, did not try food.

47.description: Food was fabulousThe greek fries with feta are to die for...I have been dreaming of them. The pita bread was super fresh along with the hummus and vegetables. The gyro was also delicious...I was not a huge fan of the saganaki and I think it is because they do not bring it out while it is on fire. (That sounds silly but I am being serious) By the time that the saganaki made it to our table it was hard and chewy.Wednesday night specials are $5 vodka drinks so my friends and I were livin la vida loca and I will definitely be visiting more frequently. (On Wednesdays)The service....it could improve. Our waitress was hungarian and came off as somewhat rude. More than rude it was almost as if she was annoyed by us or was judging us.

8.description: I just ordered from this place on Grubhub and just a few thoughts:1.) A slice of Feta for my village salad - very generous!2.) Grilled zucchini that looked like the leathery skin between Bruce Jenner's ass cheeks.3.)  The cold yellow piss of Sasquatch - oh wait that's Lemon Soup!4.) Enough bread to feed Sally Suther's needy kids.  They need the bread...not me.5.) Last but least, enough oil dressing to lube my runs so they slide out like a kid going down the water slide at Indiana Beach.So if this sounds like an option for you - be my guest and go place an order.

31.description: This is one my top comfort food places in Chicago.  When I just want a beer and shish kabob sandwich this is where I go.  Plus they have $5 valet.

34.description: When I think of Greektown, I think Athena and Greek Islands.  Big, sprawling restaurants with tacky Greek decor and flaming cheese galore.  9 Muses is not your typical Greektown experience.  It's definitely more of a Eurotrashy bar atmosphere where you'd picture Mafioso-types hanging out with Greek techno/pop music playing in the background.So... yeah.I was completely entertained by my surroundings.  I totally dig these weird places.  But that's just me.I highly recommend the MEZE plate, which is a plethora of gyros, grilled chicken and pork tenderloin and it's YUMMY.  Perfect meat.  Perfect spices.  The tzaziki sauce rocks and the pita is nice, soft and warm.  It's also cheap.  $20 or something like that and it would easily serve 4 people.A different flavor for Greektown, but I liked it.

16.description: When I think of Greektown, I think Athena and Greek Islands.  Big, sprawling restaurants with tacky Greek decor and flaming cheese galore.  9 Muses is not your typical Greektown experience.  It's definitely more of a Eurotrashy bar atmosphere where you'd picture Mafioso-types hanging out with Greek techno/pop music playing in the background.So... yeah.I was completely entertained by my surroundings.  I totally dig these weird places.  But that's just me.I highly recommend the MEZE plate, which is a plethora of gyros, grilled chicken and pork tenderloin and it's YUMMY.  Perfect meat.  Perfect spices.  The tzaziki sauce rocks and the pita is nice, soft and warm.  It's also cheap.  $20 or something like that and it would easily serve 4 people.A different flavor for Greektown, but I liked it.

13.description: I had been here before like about 2 years ago and noted the amounts of people who  would not converse with anyone who was not greekI took that review down myself on my own volition due to the fact that it was 1AM and 2 years ago. I feel that is fair.I was here recently and noticed they changed the menu. The food was awesome and for those of you checking the score the service was great and prompt.I had Beef Kabob.This place gets really hopping after 11PM on Friday and Saturday Night with a variety European and middle eastern  professional who live in the area. They have a DJ who plays good euro style musicThe vibe is really cool.The drinks are stiff as well should you be looking for that type of service :)

11.description: I think this place is worth coming to, at least once in your visit to Chicago.  Not for the night-life specifically, but for its food and drinks, and very friendly staff.  I actually think the night life is for people who want to bring back memories of visiting Greece, which is not necessarily for everyone.  For those on my boat, come in the afternoon for authentic Greek dining and a nice frappe.  It is worth a try, and you are likely to appreciate the experience.

39.description: This place reminds me of the restaurants my two little old 2nd cousins would take me to in Greece.....really authentic and delicious.  In Greece they shut everything down in the afternoon to take a nap and then open up again around what we'd call the "end of the day" so they don't eat dinner until about 10:30pm......this is that type of place youd' go to a 10:30 in Athens and sit outside on the veranda overlooking the Parthenon.  THE FOOD IS VERY GOOD and uniqiue and special.  If you want to eat where the GREEKS are eating, go here.  If you want some of the more expected dishes then go across the street to the Pathenon which has the more traditionally expected dishes for Americans who want Greek food.

37.description: Great food with outdoor seating. Not a huge menu and not what I would call traditional Greek. I had Schwarma, which was excellent. My friend had a pork dish that was outstanding. I highly recommend

0.description: hummuschicken kebabshish kebabsoft juicy chickenflavorful beeftasty pitachunky hummusgreat vegetables

38.description: I love greek food, bar atmosphere, and alcohol.  This place does it right at a resonable price.

51.description: Would give 5 stars BC the good was great but the service is poor. I had the grilled chicken pita platter, it was grilled to perfection.

27.description: Amazing food, sat outside for lunch. Can't comment on the night/aspect but the vibe was cool. Good house music, not the most incredibly authentic Greek food but it was still great

32.description: I love how understated this place is....I feel more people should be coming here . I like the food, the service is attentive and it is never crowded.  The chicken shwarma salad and pork salad looked delicious. I ordered a gyro pita and you KNOW that was delicious. Another friend ordered the lemon rice soup which she really enjoyed. Don't be like everyone else and pass 9 Muses up....it's a good spot!

54.description: If I could, I would give 0 stars. I've never been anywhere where servers have such attitude. Do they know it's their job to bring you water? After a busboy brought us water, our server had the nerve to yell at him for doing so. WTF??!! We left immediately afterwards, as I have better ways of spending my Sunday afternoons. Avoid this place like the PLAGUE. Unless you want to be treated like the plague, that is.

48.description: I feel conflicted giving this place 2 stars, because the food actually wasn't bad.  It should get at least 2.5 stars for that, but oh well.  Whether a 2.5 star place is a 2 or 3 star review is always a judgment call and I'm going with 2 stars for this one.  Like another restaurant I ate at once in the area,  there was an incredibly rude and pretentious vibe here.  I don't know if that's just a "West Loop" thing.  It's like these restaurants want some sort of status that they don't yet have, so they act really rude and snobby to compensate for it.Anyways, our waitress was really rude and bitchy.  She had an European accent, which I assume is the sole reason why she got hired.  I could go on about why I got such a bad vibe, but there is no real point. Anyone else who has experienced the gross West Loop vibe will probably know what I'm talking about.Also worth mentioning is the worst wine pour I have ever seen in my life for someone I was eating with.  $7 for what looked like maybe 2 ounces of wine.

44.description: The food was so so. I tasted a hint of middle eastern spices. You cant go half ass on Arabic food, so stick to something else. The food was a little mediocre. The iced tea was old which pissed me off too

24.description: If you get in you lucky, they have someone at the door who tells you it's a private party, even when the place is not that full. It's face control, if the owner who stands behind the guy telling you it's a private party likes how you look, then you will get in on a Saturday night, doesn't matter if you work in the neighborhood and frequent the place during the week.

7.description: High prices.Not enough foodSimple.Not the greatest taste but competitive.Hope this guys pay attention to this reviews.thank you.

49.description: Good burgers (turkey or beef). Nice salads. Generally a good place to visit -- unless you are with kids. At night, it was pretty loud with music, and the disco-y lights looked like they were a little premature to break out the booty-shakers. Their version of simple noodles (I know, why would you come here for noodles) made the error of cooking with Olive Oil and serving with butter. Or at least that's what it tasted like.From the regulars who happened to be the burger-eaters: They both lamented how the fries were now wilty. Still with taste, but without the crisp. Took forever to get some sort of of breadbasket --- hey, it happens, but it would have been nice.Overall, fine. Never been my favorite Greek Town establishment, but it is nice to have variety, right?

40.description: Honestly, I did not expect much going to this place as most of the spots in Greek Town are mediocre at best.  Very pleasantly surprised with the food.  I had the chicken shish-kabob and it was really excellent.  As good as it gets.  My wife had the Village Salad which was also excellent.  This place has lots of people lounging around who are too cool for school, but the food is worth it.  The prices also makes it a very good value.  Overall, very pleasantly surprised.

53.description: I love this place! A friend of mine recommended on a dreary day last spring and sure enough it's become a favorite of mine. Of course, it the only restaurant in Greektown with no valet but it's still a cool place to hang out. Good bar selections. I recommend the Tigania and the Roasted Florina Peppers. Yummy!

30.description: Great service and great food! I had the chicken kabob and it was delicious! I will go back to try the gyro dish.

46.description: This is absolutely the Coolest and Hippest place to hang out at in Greek Town!   It offers everything you could want!!   Excellent Coffee!   Fantastic Food!  Any Kind of Drink you could ever imagine!!  Wonderful Desserts!  I must continue by saying that it has very beautiful outdoor seating with lush and beautiful plants and flowers that make you feel like you are in the tropics on vacation!  In my opinion, the owners of this fine establishment are very kind and hospitable!  Yanni and Niko regularly greet the guests and welcome them as they walk in the door!  I have personally never had a problem with any food or drink item that I have ever ordered!  The alcohol is always the best quality!  I also find that the crowd that frequents this establishment is usually very nice and cool!

1.description: Went for lunch.  Had the Chicken Schwarma ...  A couple of problems.. number one, hard to eat the pita.  Way too much creamy dressing and difficult to bite without it making a mess.  Overall tasty, but I think I should have requested the salad version.  The chicken itself was seasoned well.  As for the sides, I opted for the oven roasted potatoes, but they didn't mention they were covered in lemon, which made them almost inedible - plus I was expecting them to be a bit more well done.  Price for 2 came to 21.00 without tip.  I'd go back, but someone please remind me to go the salad route next time.  The same chicken schwarma in salad form with a balsamic dressing sounds like it might be a much better option.Service was incredibly fast, but then again, it was pretty empty for lunch on the day we were there.  Weather was very cold, so perhaps that was the reason, or that the place is just not worth the challenging climate conditions.

55.description: servers are nice ("niiiiiceee!"), oh the food's good too. best gyros in greektown.

9.description: The only reason I am giving this place one star is because they delivered my food in a bag with a handle that I can re-use to clean out my cat's litter box. Now, on to my review....I had this craving for greek food ever since I tried the Athenian Room, which, by the way, I give 20 stars on a 5-star scale, but they DO NOT DELIVER. UGHHHHH. But because I had showered and put on my softy pi's and was all settled in for a Pawn Stars marathon, I thought, eh, I'll just order Greek food from GrubHub. A gyros and fries is a gyros and fries, right? WRONG.Like I said, I was all set for those fat, lemony tasting fries sprinkled with oregano and a yummy gyros. Chumlee had just pissed off Rick again and then "DING DONG" my order from 9 Muses was here...yay!I started unpacking my order (2 gyros and an extra order of fries--my husband always steals mine.) I opened the styrofoam container and to my HORROR.....the fries were not fat and juicy...but anorexic skinny ones like McDonald's....burned and soggy and ICE COLD..but worse...sprinkled with some cheesy stuff resembling feta but tasting more like soggy cottage cheese.The gyros wasn't much better; but instead of thinly sliced strips of meat, they had put big chunks...and surrounded it with red onions (like a hot dog) and congealed tzatziki sauce...again...ICE COLD. I tried microwaving the piles of goo, but now all I had was hot chunks of meat with steaming hot goo and soggier burned fries.BUMMMMMMMMER!!I never do this, but this order was so out-of-control bad that I contacted GrubHub. They got right back to me (good job) but said 9 Muses would NOT refund my order...OR send me something else!SOOOO now I'm out almost $30 for food I threw in the garbage and probably the rats in the alley won't even eat. And guess who will NEVER go to, or order from 9 Muses again? You've got it..ME...and I hope YOU, TOO.

26.description: I love this place. Everything here is delicious. I've eaten here twice and both times had great experiences. Both times I ordered a chicken salad (one time it was a Chicken Shawarma and once it was Grilled Chicken). Each time I got beautiful fresh greens and a TON of well-seasoned perfectly cooked chicken. The cappuccino here is also delicious, as are the hummus and olives and pita bread. It's never super busy, either, which is also nice. I don't know why more people don't given this better ratings.

25.description: To be seated within the restaurant but to feel like you're outdoors! It's a Sunday evening around 6pm and the front windows were wide open. We were showcased as we dined away. I certainly don't mind the attention and Greektown scenery. It was a bit early and we had an appetite for small bites: roasted Florina peppers, calamari, beef kabob, and creme brulee. The peppers were soft and soggy. It did not please us much but the flies liked it. The calamari and beef kabob were standard. They were generous portions and filling. My friend had the creme brulee and said it was too sweet. I think he even scooped off the top layer of caramel before he devoured the rest of the dessert.Note: The gyros seem to be presented in a deconstructed manner. Seems quite interesting to lure a return. P.S. Parking was free!

12.description: Yawn!  Just another fail for me this past weekend.  This place was very ok and average at best.  I had a special which I can't remember, but it was a chicken kebob on pita bread.  It was ok tasting accept the chicken was dry.  I requested the mashed potatos but they were very boring and not very hot.  The highlight of the whole meal was the very attractive and friendly waitress we had and that is it.

59.description: I love 9 muses. Ive never had a bad time or a bad meal there.  The sandwiches are really good and the dinner plates are delicious.  Of course, for some reason I always have the gyro platter...I know thats kind of boring but its soo good.  I have had the enormous pork chop dinner, very tasty.  Carbonara pasta, good.  Just about anything you order is good and they will make adjustments and substitutions better than BK. The appetizers are all good. Fun place with good energy. Good date place that wont break the bank.

21.description: I go for the rotisserie chicken and artichoke salad.  So yummy and huge enough for two meals.  Good coffee and surprisingly excellent desserts.  The tuxedo cake is a lovely combo of cake, mousse, frosting, and love.

17.description: 9 Muses is fantastic! I went there for the first time tonight and the people were so nice. The waitress suggested the feta roasted peppers and they were delicious! I also really loved the spanikopita and tzatziki. The outdoor seating was fantastic on a warm summer night and the place has wonderful atmosphere.Not only was the food awesome, but they totally saved me tonight. I stupidly left a pretty valuable piece of equipment behind, only to realize after driving away. When I came rushing back they came out waving to me that they had found it. Thanks 9 Muses, you saved the day! I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in the neighborhood. :)

10.description: All the Greek restaurants on this strip seem almost identical, so to try something new my friend and I came here for dinner on a Friday around 530.  It's smaller than the big famous restaurants, and doesn't do as much of the "Greek" decor.  Just looks like a casual restaurant/bar with sports on and strange euro music.  Didn't have much atmosphere so I got a little nervous at first, and not seeing a crowded dining room made me cross my fingers and hope that the food would be good!The menu actually has more Middle Eastern and Mediterranean influence rather than just straight-up Greek.  It's a smaller menu than you'll find at the other Greektown joints, with some original choices.  We each got a glass of wine (presented nicely, in pretty rounded glasses with mini-carafes alongside), and my German riesling was nice and sweet.  I ordered the chicken kabob, and when we saw our huge plates coming we were like "holy crap, did we really order all that food?"  My kabob platter had 5 big pieces of chicken, a salad, pita with tzatziki sauce, and a separate plate of rice.  And wow, did the taste surpass my expectations!Chicken was juicy and tender, with a delicious crisp-char on the outside.  I could only eat three pieces since there was just so much of it!  The salad was simple, mixed greens, red onion, olives, tomato, and feta, but the dressing was subtly tangy and very appealing.  The pita was warm, and the soft fluffy rice went great with the crispy chicken.  My friend felt similarly about her souvlaki platter.I ate as much as I could.  I only wish I could have eaten more!  The only thing I didn't like was the service.  After the food came we had a very hard time trying to get them to clear our plates, and then it took them almost 20 minutes to bring the check. Server was standing in clear sight of us, just watching TV.  I had to just creepily stare at her until she happened to look at me and then gestured with my wallet.  That was kind of annoying.  But not so much to take away from how great the food was.Sounds like this turns into a really different place at night!  More like a Greek nightclub with food?  Trust me at 6 pm it is nothing like that!  At the early dinner hours it is pretty quiet but you will get a great meal!

5.description: That cheese was amazing, even if it wasn't flaming.  My salad with kebob...the perfect lunch.

3.description: Our favorite in Greek town. Great bar-type Greek sandwiches and specials. Love the gyro platter and Greek fries

35.description: RUDE BOUNCER. tall older man and ignorant. wont be coming to this place. this probably wont matter but whoever u are rude bouncer saturday night sept 29 about midnight..  if u cant take  jokes and playfulness. go back to where u belong GREECE! and TAKE A CHILL PILL MAN! 0 star to rude bouncer!

19.description: The best grilled calamari ever.  I often get off from work late and can always count on this place for a great fresh plate of food. Lovely outdoor seating area and friendly staff.

28.description: I had been here before like about 2 years ago and noted the amounts of people who  would not converse with anyone who was not greekI took that review down myself on my own volition due to the fact that it was 1AM and 2 years ago. I feel that is fair.I was here recently and noticed they changed the menu. The food was awesome and for those of you checking the score the service was great and prompt.I had Beef Kabob.This place gets really hopping after 11PM on Friday and Saturday Night with a variety European and middle eastern  professional who live in the area. They have a DJ who plays good euro style musicThe vibe is really cool.The drinks are stiff as well should you be looking for that type of service :)

45.description: Superb food.  Garlic mash off the hook.  Sometmes the wait is a bit long, even when they are slow.  The food is really good.  The chicken in all of their dishes is very tender and flavourful.  The Euro club music gets a bit annoying when there arent enough people in there to drowned it out.  Go eat there and fist pump.

33.description: Warning signs of a bad Greek restaurant:1.   No lamb on the menu.2.   No moussaka or other traditional Greek dishes.   (Souvlaki and gyros aren't enough.)3.   No Greeks.4.   Few diners.I should have known better than to eat here, if not right when I walked in the door, at least when I looked at the sad, sad menu.    There are certainly a lot of Greek restaurants in Chicago's Greektown.    Perhaps 9 Muses is one too many.My platter certainly *looked* appetizing.   The Greek salad had nice presentation, but was unfortunately quite flavorless.    My pork chops looked big and sumptuous, but were actually THE WORST PORK CHOPS OF MY ENTIRE LIFE.    They were so dry, it was like I was eating jerky.   These chops were so tough, I injured my elbow trying to saw through them with my steak knife.     (One of my dining companions ordered pork kabobs that were also overcooked.   Who runs the broiler in this place?   He should be taken out back and beaten with spatula.)My friends raved about the french fires at 9 Muses.   I found them soggy, uninteresting, and no better than that of any hamburger joint.One of my companions ordered the calamari (predictably deep fried almost beyond recognition) and they certainly smelled good.    But I was horrified to taste squid so old it smelled rotten.    I hope my friend didn't end up getting sick from eating this spoiled fare.Other dishonorable mentions:   lousy beer list, poor ambience, and lukewarm service.The only saving grace to this place was that it wasn't too expensive.    My share of the bill was only $24.    A better meal elsewhere would have cost more, but certainly have been worth it.All I could do after eating here was drive home, feeling disgusted, yearning for a shot of good ouzo, and praying for better meals to come.If you want Greek food in Greektown, I can think of half a dozen better places.     Easily.

43.description: saganaki what what!awesome place. i've always gone on a random weekday night so it's not packed. their fries are great and the shish kebob platter is huge. definitely fit for 2. i forget what kind of dessert I had but it was good, some kind of creamy pie with nuts and a honey drizzle? who knows but i scarfed it down whole.

2.description: This was my first stop upon arriving in the city. Its a regular haunt of a good friend and so here found ourselves for an early dinner.Coming in with a regular does give you a bit of an advantage, but I'm pretty sure everyone would have been just as nice and friendly had I come in by myself. After all, I'm a pretty swell guy.Mike, behind the bar, quick with a greeting and very friendly. We sat at the bar and scanned the menu (if it's online, check it out. I just trusted the choices my friend made). We got the Meza, a selection of meats, pork, gyro and chicken. and it was fantastic. Usually there would be a weak runner in the race, dry chicken or bland pork, etc. But not here, each one was prepared as if it were the only thing going on the plate, a splash of fresh lemon juice and we cleared the plate.We got a side of the greek fries, purely for scientific research, since neither of us is supposed to be eating fries and we had plenty to manage with the Meza. They were great, flavorful and nothing was over done. Trust me, the food was on point. It was so good that I just quoted Guy Fieri and I don't hate myself for it, that good.Atmosphere could make or break a place and 9 Muses has that in the bag too. The staff were friendly and the patrons were too. We stayed way longer than we needed because we were chatting and making friends.They have a full bar, and coffee (I had a Greek Coffee which is like a punch in the face with a velvet boxing glove) and we split a piece of cheesecake.  It was a Wednesday night, not too crowded and just a really good time.

18.description: Warning signs of a bad Greek restaurant:1.   No lamb on the menu.2.   No moussaka or other traditional Greek dishes.   (Souvlaki and gyros aren't enough.)3.   No Greeks.4.   Few diners.I should have known better than to eat here, if not right when I walked in the door, at least when I looked at the sad, sad menu.    There are certainly a lot of Greek restaurants in Chicago's Greektown.    Perhaps 9 Muses is one too many.My platter certainly *looked* appetizing.   The Greek salad had nice presentation, but was unfortunately quite flavorless.    My pork chops looked big and sumptuous, but were actually THE WORST PORK CHOPS OF MY ENTIRE LIFE.    They were so dry, it was like I was eating jerky.   These chops were so tough, I injured my elbow trying to saw through them with my steak knife.     (One of my dining companions ordered pork kabobs that were also overcooked.   Who runs the broiler in this place?   He should be taken out back and beaten with spatula.)My friends raved about the french fires at 9 Muses.   I found them soggy, uninteresting, and no better than that of any hamburger joint.One of my companions ordered the calamari (predictably deep fried almost beyond recognition) and they certainly smelled good.    But I was horrified to taste squid so old it smelled rotten.    I hope my friend didn't end up getting sick from eating this spoiled fare.Other dishonorable mentions:   lousy beer list, poor ambience, and lukewarm service.The only saving grace to this place was that it wasn't too expensive.    My share of the bill was only $24.    A better meal elsewhere would have cost more, but certainly have been worth it.All I could do after eating here was drive home, feeling disgusted, yearning for a shot of good ouzo, and praying for better meals to come.If you want Greek food in Greektown, I can think of half a dozen better places.     Easily.

41.description: We just happened to end up at 9 Muses last night for Valentine's and I was not expecting much.... but wow was I surprised!  First off, our bottle of St. George was 1/2 off!  Keep that deal going and we'll be here every week.  I wasn't expecting this place to be very authentic(not sure why), but I was wrong.  The food is extremely well done, and some of the best greek potatoes I have had here in Chicago.  Our waitress wasn't pushy, and our buss boy was was working his butt off at our table.  Cheap too!  Our bill was like 45 bucks with a bottle of wine, 2 apps, and 2 dinners.  Good stuff right there....

52.description: Great place for lunch or a casual date night. In Greek town this place is one of the most modern in it's food and look. I have been coming here for years and it just keeps getting better.

50.description: Saturday nights here are hit or miss....but this place gets 5 stars for the food alone.  They have a surprisingly tasty menu!  The souvlakia are how they make them in Greece.  The sandwhiches are really outstanding as well.  Also, the service is great, the waitresses are always really nice and attentive and the bartenders as well.  The doorman on the weekends is a little scary and not too friendly but I don't mind if I am going with friends to hear the Greek tunes from a really good DJ.

4.description: So we came into this restaurant with high hopes. I mean we r in Greek Town. Well we had about 9 ppl in our group and as i walked in the music to me sounded like i was in a night club instead if a Greek restaurant. The bar was empty in a Saturday night which was odd to me because all the other greek spots were pretty crowded. Ok, so i look at the menu. I find it strange that i cant fibd grilled octopus.  Every greek restaurant down town has this on their menu! I order two skewers a chicken and pork and ask for Greek Potatoes. The waitress says we dobt have greek potatoes on the weekend.  Wait. What!!! They only serve fries or mashed.  Are you kidding me?? Ok well i get the mashes. Ih ya, and my order was the platter with salad. after the waitress took all our orders we never saw her again. The bus boy was a great runner tho.  Forty five minutes goes by before we get our food. The three of them come out and start asking everyone is this your order. What!!! Im a bit annoyed by now. I get my plate and i get 2 tiby skewers with a big pike of smashed red skin potatoes. Thats it!  No ome even came in this restaurant to sit at the bar in the hour and a half we were there. I wont be back.

6.description: To be seated within the restaurant but to feel like you're outdoors! It's a Sunday evening around 6pm and the front windows were wide open. We were showcased as we dined away. I certainly don't mind the attention and Greektown scenery. It was a bit early and we had an appetite for small bites: roasted Florina peppers, calamari, beef kabob, and creme brulee. The peppers were soft and soggy. It did not please us much but the flies liked it. The calamari and beef kabob were standard. They were generous portions and filling. My friend had the creme brulee and said it was too sweet. I think he even scooped off the top layer of caramel before he devoured the rest of the dessert.Note: The gyros seem to be presented in a deconstructed manner. Seems quite interesting to lure a return. P.S. Parking was free!

22.description: All the Greek restaurants on this strip seem almost identical, so to try something new my friend and I came here for dinner on a Friday around 530.  It's smaller than the big famous restaurants, and doesn't do as much of the "Greek" decor.  Just looks like a casual restaurant/bar with sports on and strange euro music.  Didn't have much atmosphere so I got a little nervous at first, and not seeing a crowded dining room made me cross my fingers and hope that the food would be good!The menu actually has more Middle Eastern and Mediterranean influence rather than just straight-up Greek.  It's a smaller menu than you'll find at the other Greektown joints, with some original choices.  We each got a glass of wine (presented nicely, in pretty rounded glasses with mini-carafes alongside), and my German riesling was nice and sweet.  I ordered the chicken kabob, and when we saw our huge plates coming we were like "holy crap, did we really order all that food?"  My kabob platter had 5 big pieces of chicken, a salad, pita with tzatziki sauce, and a separate plate of rice.  And wow, did the taste surpass my expectations!Chicken was juicy and tender, with a delicious crisp-char on the outside.  I could only eat three pieces since there was just so much of it!  The salad was simple, mixed greens, red onion, olives, tomato, and feta, but the dressing was subtly tangy and very appealing.  The pita was warm, and the soft fluffy rice went great with the crispy chicken.  My friend felt similarly about her souvlaki platter.I ate as much as I could.  I only wish I could have eaten more!  The only thing I didn't like was the service.  After the food came we had a very hard time trying to get them to clear our plates, and then it took them almost 20 minutes to bring the check. Server was standing in clear sight of us, just watching TV.  I had to just creepily stare at her until she happened to look at me and then gestured with my wallet.  That was kind of annoying.  But not so much to take away from how great the food was.Sounds like this turns into a really different place at night!  More like a Greek nightclub with food?  Trust me at 6 pm it is nothing like that!  At the early dinner hours it is pretty quiet but you will get a great meal!

15.description: Everything about this place is good.  Great place to eat lunch or dinner.  Food is very delicious.  I choose between the Penny's Salad and Shish-ka-bob sandwiches.  Greek fries are a must.  Meat is always juicy and flavorful, never dry or cold.  Good wine, coffee, and drinks for later on at night when you want to pretend like you are in Greece again. Greek or not, go.

57.description: 9 Muses is great if you are looking for a Mediterranean twist on bar fare. The food is very good, but the drinks are pricy and not very big. 9 Muses usually  isn't too crowded or too loud and they have TV's for watching the game. Personally I love coming here in the summer because you can sit outdoors and watch all the people go by on Halsted street.

20.description: Great place to grab a quick lunch and a drink.  Prices are great and service .

36.description: I ate here earlier this week with three of my friends for the first time.  For appetizers, we ordered the saganaki and spanakopita.  I was surprised that the saganaki wasn't lit on fire tableside, but maybe that's just what I'm used to from usually going to the same Greek restaurant.  The spanakopita was delicious, and the Greek fries we got with it was also very tasty.  I was planning on ordering the Meze platter as an entree, but the server warned me that it was way too large for one person, so I appreciated her honesty.  I was shocked that they didn't have lamb here either.  Isn't that a Greek restaurant staple?  I ended up going with the Shish Kabob, which was sooo good.  In addition to the mound of marinated pork, it came with 4 pita slices, a Greek salad, and a choice of a side (I got rice).  No complaints on the service, the busser always had our water glasses full, and table cleared, and the prices were amazing.  As a huge plus personally, there was also outdoor seating :)

14.description: Stopped in for lunch. Place wasn't busy. Food was decent - not as good as the other Greek places around it. Service was a bit lackluster. Not sure that I'd go back. Maybe it was an off day. I don't know. Nothing wowed me enough to give it another shot.

3.description: I got this as a birthday present and have never really painted before and neither had my friends.  They made my friends and feel very welcome right from the start! Our instructor came around to everyone in the class making sure we were comfortable with each technique and made sure everyone was doing well. She was not only a great instructor making things simple for those of us who had never painted before but also added humor into the class as well. My friends and I were planning on coming back before the class even ended. We cannot wait to go back :-)

1.description: Girl friends and I had a fabulous time on a Friday night here. They were very nice and welcoming. They even have wine glasses and regular glasses, as well as bottle openers for the BYOB bit.

2.description: I did this art class with  Bolingbrook Fun Run Club last night. The staff ( Gina, Joe, Carly and instructor Visum were so awesome and friendly. They give you an apron, paint, yes the snacks could be better ( cheese balls, pretzels) but this is really not a big deal. So if your on a gluten free diet bring your own. They provide brushes and paper towels too. I think next time I am bringing my own brushes, since I do like painting. Also they encourage you to interpret the art the way you want. One girl drew tee pee's instead of houses.  I could not believe we all did such an awesome job, our instructor was so patient too!! By the way you don't have to bring wine, you can bring beer. I definitely plan to be back again with my husband.

5.description: BEST TIME EVER!  If you are looking for something fun and different to do...you have got to book a BYOB event at Corks and Brushes!  Bring your girlfriends, bring your favorite wine and let them do the rest!  Gina is an absolute delight to work with!  She made our special day so fun!  No special occasion needed...just the desire to kick back and have some great fun!  Why are you still reading this????  Call and schedule your BYOB EVENT NOW!

6.description: I love this place!!  The staff is GREAT!!!!!  Willing to work with you to create a fun, friendly environment to relax, and enjoy. The only suggestion I have is to make the class a half hour or hour longer. We went over our scheduled time, which didn't seem to be a problem, but I felt rushed myself. AMAZING staff, thank you Gina as well for being so fun and helpful!!

7.description: This is my first time and I can guarantee it won't be my last! I had a great time and everyone was super nice! Cool spot super cozy! Will definitely return to the Loop Location!!!

8.description: Decided to arrange a Girl's ' Sunday Paint Fest after purchasing an amazon local voucher. Although the location is off a side street on Halsted; it was easy to get to and the studio was super cute. Loft style with art on the walls as well as a small gallery in the back. Gina the owner was very nice & accommodating. The class was small only 6 women (2 sep groups) but if you're an amateur or seasoned artist...you'll still have fun. The instructor Ricardo (whose work is in the gallery) was very good; patient & helpful. Although I've had art experience from my high  school days it was fun; relaxing & therapeutic. It's a byob & we also brought chips/salsa. I'm glad Painted Rubbish was our first "BYOB Painting Party" since there's a lot of them in the city. There's something rewarding about tapping into your creative side via paint & brushes! I'll definitely be back. Thanks Gina for a great first time experience!!!

9.description: This store is an absolute delight!  The owner has a fabulous eye for detail - showcasing her latest finds from estate sales and 'repurposing' vintage furniture into must haves!   Great prices on beautiful glassware, great fresh ideas for decorating --- I couldn't get past the front door and had to circle back through the store twice before my senses could calm down to focus on what I loved the most.   Have been back,  never disappointed and it's a great place to go with the girlfriends.  Gina is always wonderful - she'll help you with any ideas you have for your home or gift selection. It's not just home decor - jewelry, small gift items, candles and more!  Offering classes is a fabulous way to have a girls night out - or to turn into a 'gift registry' and have family help a new bride furnish the new home!    In a great location - after you have done your retail therapy you can have a bite to eat at many of the cute restaurants in downtown La Grange.  Painted Rubbish is a 'must-stop' destination!!!!!

0.description: The folks behind Painted Rubbish are just the sweetest.  The store is super cute and filled with up-cycled and painted items for purchase and for inspiration. Thanks to Pinterest, I'm kind of obsessed with up-cycling window panes and PR had some already done up for sale/inspiration. PR also offers painting classes called "Corks and Brushes" and that's the reason I was out there one night. In just a couple of hours, you'll go home with a painting done by your very own hands. No skill or prior experience needed! You can sign up to join a class or host a private party. My friends were celebrating a birthday and because they had enough guests, were able to get the private room. We were able to bring in food and drinks, even offering an electrical outlet for us so my friend could bring meatballs in a crock pot. Awesome. Either way you attend, the instructors are super sweet and super kind (I hated my picture but Gina was so enthusiastic and encouraging--I did like my painting by the end of the night).  The picture you paint is determined by the class you attend, and that's all listed in the calendar online. They do offer wine for purchase too and the night I attended it was horrifically snowy that many gals were late to class. The instructors kept me company and gave me a complimentary glass wine--totally unnecessary but so thoughtful. I really want to come back here soon!  For our group of about 15, we paid $20 each. The location is kind of hidden, mapquest took me right there, but it seems my friend's GPS were giving them the run around. It's not too far from Del Rea's chicken basket, tucked away in a semi-industrial park next to 55.

4.description: This was a blast! It was a little difficult to find but worth the wait!!!! The teachers and everyone who work there are fantastic! I was a little lost outside and Joe helped me! Nasim was our painting instructor and was the greatest! Her directions were easy and I felt like an amazing painter! They had good music playing and you could bring your own wine!! The people we're very friendly, encouraging and super sweet!!! Very attentive group! My running club and I went together and we loved every minute!

58.description: Went here on Saturday night, walked in there was only one other couple seated at another table. Should have been a sign. The place is nicely decorated and the bathrooms are updated. But regarding the food it's a don't. We sat down and the waiter took our order, the husband ordered the hot wings and the three of each ordered the steamed crab legs. The wings came out in about 10 minutes, which were pretty spicy and good. An hour later and several apologies, the crab legs finally came out. They were ice cold as well as the butter. So we all send them back and then about 10 minutes later, he brings back the same crab legs that were reheated. We never got our side and the crab was not fresh. And as we were finishing the other table there sent back their oysters stating they were old. So we will not be returning. The price is cheap but for old, cold food we will go elsewhere.

56.description: Good place, sea food Chinese style so imagine that... They have a full bar till 2am I ate there around 11pm. Good feel, good bartender chick, good prices and  good food.

29.description: Found this place during a day layover in Chicago. It's convenient in that it is open late even on a weekday. Also, with a check in you get a buy get one free drink. Happy Crab has a lot to offer in terms of food but it's confusing--is it a seafood place, an Italian restaurant, a Chinese restaurant--but a weird fusion of all three. The place is very clean and has a decent bar in the center of the restaurant. When we walked in, we seated ourselves. The bartender was also the server. She was very nice and made conversation with people at the bar. We ordered the fried squid to start which was mediocre-it was basically a watered down version of fried calamari. I asked for a drink on the menu, but they were out of one of the ingredients. For entrees, I had a pasta dish and the portion was HUGE and heavy on the garlic. My boyfriend ordered a 2 pound crab which was also mediocre. It sat on a bed of glass noodles which was incredibly oily from the crab. Overall, it was a bit overpriced for what it was but since it's open late and has so many options, it might be worth hitting up for late night munchies!

42.description: My $65 delivery order was extremely disappointing.It took 2 hours 5 minutes to deliver.  Its 1.9 miles away, or a 9 minute drive.Granted, there was a Blackhawks hockey game tonight, but after I called the 2nd time to follow up on my order, 50 minutes after I called the 1st time and told the driver was out to deliver, I still didn't have my food.The lobster was 70% shell and 30% meat.  This lobster had to be the least expensive lobster they could buy from their seafood distribtorI will not ever order from here again.

23.description: Had the snow crab, it was delicious. Specials every night. Saturday is $4 Jameson shots. Very friendly service and decent prices. Would definitely come again.

47.description: Went there for Valentines Day because we couldn't find any other place to go to, and needless to say, I will never be back. Food and service, but most of all service was very poor.

8.description: My $65 delivery order was extremely disappointing.It took 2 hours 5 minutes to deliver.  Its 1.9 miles away, or a 9 minute drive.Granted, there was a Blackhawks hockey game tonight, but after I called the 2nd time to follow up on my order, 50 minutes after I called the 1st time and told the driver was out to deliver, I still didn't have my food.The lobster was 70% shell and 30% meat.  This lobster had to be the least expensive lobster they could buy from their seafood distribtorI will not ever order from here again.

31.description: I cannot speak highly enough of this place. Happy Crab makes Happy CustomersPrice- Not bad at all. We had a party of 10 and got SOOOO much food. Total bill came out to about $20 per person.Quality- Fantastic! We got crab cakes, fries, shrimp cocktail, ginger and onion dungeness crab, garlic whole lobster with vermicelli noodles, salmon and spicy fish fillet. The lobster was fantastic and the crab cakes were so good too.Quantity- Look above...it's like you're on the deadliest catchAtmosphere- Very open and welcoming. Lots of Chicago sports memorabilia.Staff- FANTASTIC! I originally wanted to got Angry Crab, but they don't take reservations and this place did. They were able to get a seat for 10 of us and the staff was sooo attentive and kind. I definitely will be going back. Also this a great place for kids. The staff showed off live lobsters and crabs and split plates for the kids to share. For those of you that don't have crabs....you might as well get them from here.

34.description: Squid Fries!Oysters!Soft Shell Crab!Wine List!Pinyo!Five amazing things you will find at the happy crab!  I'm guessing everything else is amazing also! Check it out!

16.description: Let's get the weird part out of the way.... The decor is bizarre. The place doesn't know if it wants to be a Chinese restaurant, a sports bar, or a seafood spot. But, whatever, the food is fabulous so I don't care what's on the walls. I am from Boston and have attitude about Midwestern seafood because I've had some weird stuff passing as fresh shellfish in Chicago....But, hands down, the King Crab legs at the Happy Crab were the best I've ever had. Ever.  $22 got me three huge legs and drawn butter. I couldn't possibly have been happier. I work down the street from this place and will become a regular for sure. Look beyond the weird decor and order the King Crab Legs, served at Market Price (and the fried mozzarella sticks because you're an adult and you can).

13.description: After not having Happy Crab in a year, I can say the food is still just as good as ever (spicy fish fillet, I'm looking at you!). However, the service is not really up to par and it pains me to say that because the server seemed nice enough. She was just not very attentive and unprofessional at times such as assuming my husband was Chinese without any other reason besides that he's Asian, smoking right in front of the restaurant on a break, and just more focused on talking to her friends at the bar. Given my husband and I worked in the restaurant industry, this may be something we are just more aware of but we experienced something similar the past couples times we've gone there where the service was not attentive or slow and the servers seemed to just want to hang out with their friends.

11.description: A really cool small bar/restaurant to enjoy seafood late in the evening/night

39.description: Amazing Dungeness crab, spicy fish and salt and pepper smelt! Cannot wait to go back!!!

37.description: In Chicago on Business, it was late the wife and I were hungry. We found the Happy Crab through an internet search, because most of everything closes by 10pm. Joe the porter at the Hyatt Regency said he had eaten there before and it was good. So we go.I have to say up front they were busy and one of the servers was helping with a delivery so there was one waitress for the whole place. At first her attitude was lack luster to say the least, but it appeared she was a little beaten down by how busy it had been. Earlier 2 million people converged on downtown to celebrate the Blackhawks Stanley Cup Win. Anyway after talking to her I think she warmed up to us, it was probably my southern accent...So we order Snow Crab Legs, and Butterfly Shrimp. The Shrimp was obviously frozen then fried but still decent. The Crab Legs is why I am on Yelp right now! They were big and really flavorful. I will be going back when back in Chicago, thank you Happy Crab!

0.description: I love this place. I hesitate to write a good review because I don't want it to get spoiled.  If you want really good seafood, and are ok dining like a local, come here. Sit at the bar with the other locals, cheer on the Bulls or Bears, get served a few shots, make a few new friends, gobble down awesome fresh seafood.If you like fancy restaurants and expect white tablecloths and expensive dinnerware and a romantic atmosphere, go over to Michigan Ave with all the snooty tourists. Conversely, if you want great food in a simple and unpretentious atmosphere, and you are ok with rubbing elbows with locals, then Happy Crab is your spot.

38.description: Great little gem in Greek town for affordable fresh seafoods (inexpensive fresh crabs) and drinks.

51.description: Fantastic new West Loop restaurant/bar. So glad this place is here. Unassuming at first, this place has a combination of fantastic food including amazing fresh crab (you can pick them right out of the tank live) to traditional Asian cuisine, to seafood pastas and even honey sesame chicken wings. Bar is well stocked and the service is friendly and conversational. If you live in the west loop or Greek town, add this place into the rotation.

27.description: Let's get the weird part out of the way.... The decor is bizarre. The place doesn't know if it wants to be a Chinese restaurant, a sports bar, or a seafood spot. But, whatever, the food is fabulous so I don't care what's on the walls. I am from Boston and have attitude about Midwestern seafood because I've had some weird stuff passing as fresh shellfish in Chicago....But, hands down, the King Crab legs at the Happy Crab were the best I've ever had. Ever.  $22 got me three huge legs and drawn butter. I couldn't possibly have been happier. I work down the street from this place and will become a regular for sure. Look beyond the weird decor and order the King Crab Legs, served at Market Price (and the fried mozzarella sticks because you're an adult and you can).

32.description: Two months into living in the neighborhood and we can't beat The Happy Crab. Pinjo, Julia and the entire staff make you feel welcome and happy. The bar is amply stocked and the food.... THE FOOD... Is amazing. The crab cakes are fresh and not overly breaded and fried-yay!!! This restaurant is less than a year old and should be a staple in your routine (they deliver too!)

54.description: Yay!!! Great place for fresh seafood and drinks! the west loop has been craving a place like this ;) happy crab lives up to it's name, very happy!!!

48.description: The owner of Happy Crabs contacted me and asked me to give them another chance and to come back and try their food (he offered a 30% discount). We ordered $36.00 and received a $10.80 discount [Fish Fillet (me), Chili Chicken (friend), Calamari & Smoothie (both of us). I wish to thank the owner for handling the situation in a professional manner and reaching out to me and address the issue ASAP, and I really liked the service I received when I came inside (the bartender brought us water even though we said we were going to carry-out). He made sure to take care of us while we were waiting for our order. He was VERY VERY polite, good guy (long ponytail, Asian, older looking good guy). Professionalism and accommodation is why I gave 3 stars, I would normally just give 1 star and leave it at that. I really hate pointing out the negatives after the Owner and the Bartender were so accommodating but I just want to be and honest reviewer ----- The food we got was VERY VERY SALTY. My friend and I stopped eating it after 3-4 pieces because the SALT just made it really really hard to eat. I tried to fight through it because $27 is still expensive for a college student and I just couldn't... I was very very sad because I hate wasting my money because I work so hard to save every dollar. We also ordered calamari and that was good. Very good, my friend said we should have just ordered three of those,. We also got a smoothie and that was delicious as well. I just don't know how our main meals turned out to be so salty! I noted another 2 star review posted a couple weeks ago with the same complaint. $15 for a Fish Filet meal you can't even eat... it would make anyone sad. However, the overall 4 stars mean something, they obviously are doing something right and maybe it's just these two meals that are like that. Anyways! The ambiance is cool (check out the pictures), laid back like a sports hang out place. There are 4 TVS hanging around (2 big ones). I can see this place getting packed with UIC students   when the Bears are playing OR during the Bulls playoffs. They have everything set up well. If our food was eatable today, I would have definitely came here multiple times in the future with a bunch of friends to watch the games because most of us love seafood. I wish this business success because they are making an all out effort to make their customers happy. I'm sure they will fix it as they are new. But here is my review and for them to build on it! (Please refer to my pictures to see how this place looks like, menu, and a $5 discount the offer)

44.description: Wasn't the best, wasn't the worst. The drinks were cool and the server, a cool Asian dude, was friendly enough. Food was good, not great, but fairly priced. My only complaint was that we didn't stay longer as we'd intended (to drink because we had a 50% off drinks coupon). Because we asked for to-go boxes it was assumed we were ready to go and the check was brought, and we hadn't told him we had the coupon. So, we couldn't use the coupon because he said he couldn't re-open the tab (???), but whatevs. We'll probably go back at least once more to use the coupon and for the good ass garlic and butter infused veggies.

24.description: So happy I decided to go here. This was the best meal and experience I've had in quite awhile in Chicago. I sat at the bar and got to listen to a great story about having an elephant as a pet on a rubber tree farm (sorry I didn't catch your name, elephant man :-)).I had a crab cake appetizer with fries and a pound of snow crab. The crab cake was crunchy and full of crab. I think they forgot my tartar, but only because I saw it come with someone else's meal - I didn't miss it. Even the fries were really good. The snow crab legs were thick, easy to pick and fresh! I skipped this place the night before because I judged a book by its cover - big mistake. Almost everyone here chatted with each other, probably because the bartenders were so personable. I came in in a bad mood from a rough day at work, and left quite happy.  Thanks to LauraJulia, the bartender and my new work buddy Darcy.

7.description: I cannot speak highly enough of this place. Happy Crab makes Happy CustomersPrice- Not bad at all. We had a party of 10 and got SOOOO much food. Total bill came out to about $20 per person.Quality- Fantastic! We got crab cakes, fries, shrimp cocktail, ginger and onion dungeness crab, garlic whole lobster with vermicelli noodles, salmon and spicy fish fillet. The lobster was fantastic and the crab cakes were so good too.Quantity- Look above...it's like you're on the deadliest catchAtmosphere- Very open and welcoming. Lots of Chicago sports memorabilia.Staff- FANTASTIC! I originally wanted to got Angry Crab, but they don't take reservations and this place did. They were able to get a seat for 10 of us and the staff was sooo attentive and kind. I definitely will be going back. Also this a great place for kids. The staff showed off live lobsters and crabs and split plates for the kids to share. For those of you that don't have crabs....you might as well get them from here.

49.description: For a place named "Happy Crab" , they don't have many crab items on the menu, and I was not happy.I was a little confused walking into this place, the decor is like you walked into Joe's Crab Shack if they ran out of money to finish decorating. A few weird Chicago sports items here and there but nothing had a complete thought to it. And now for the food, let me start by saying there were only two crab items on the whole menu, steamed or chilled crab.  No fun crab appetizers or even salads. If you are in the mood for Jalapeno poppers or similar type bar food your found the place. Me and my best friend ordered a salad to start. The chef must have made too much salad dressing that day because the salads were drowning in dressing, I'm talking about submerged in salad dressing, it was awful. The waitress was sweet but didn't know the menu at all. The crabs was ok, nothing special. By the time the crab came I was full from all the salad dressing anyway.

40.description: Nice spot for some tasty seafood. Quick fix for steamed crab legs. Reasonably priced.

53.description: 2.5 stars. Nice place, great service, decent beers. The food, the prices..ehhh... I loved, loved the grilled dried red chilis. I'm stealing the idea and making themto snack on at home. Sadly this garnish is where my praise ends.  Spicy fish fillet: Fillet!? No. More like Chinese General Tso with tiny fish fragment substitute. Huge portions of batter and tiny amounts of fish. Incredibly salty, way too much oyster sauce.  Use bigger pieces of fish and cut the sauce with scallion/vinegar. Get some acid in there to balance this salty mess. Screw it, this place will be out of business in a year.  Good hustle out there.  #asspat

30.description: Summary: Delicious food, Warm environment, Amazing ServiceThe seafood was fresh and tasty. Everyone in my party (6 year old to 75 year old) enjoyed the food and the ambiance. Pinyo, the host and bar tender, allowed my 6 and 8 year old nephews to choose the crab and lobster that we were going to eat at dinner. Recommended Items: Spicy Fish Fillet and Ginger and Onion CrabThe Chicago Tribune has a great write up as well (chicagotribune.com/dinin…)

46.description: Another order of the squid fries please!!! Decided to try this place out after seeing it recently open in my neighborhood. In addition to the squid fries, I also ordered the seafood basket, which came with an assortment of steamed veggies, seafood chunks (crab, lobster, shrimp) and a french fry like basket to hold all of it in. The dish reminded me very much of a chicken with veggies dish at a Chinese restaurant. It was marinated in a creamy white sauce and the veggies were chinese broccoli, carrots and some other veggies.Overall I loved the atmosphere and I am glad they are here. I will be coming back again to try other dishes for sure!

1.description: Delicious seafood without the crazy wait that comes with Louisiana-Chinese style crab feeds?! Sign me up.I love The Happy Crab! It's such a hidden gem in Greek Town especially when it is surrounded by establishments that entertain college students thanks to their affordability. I am a huge sucker for seafood and calamari, so when my friend and I dropped by one late evening after a show, we were extremely satisfied.From reading up on the past reviews, it seems like they've really worked to improve their selection. Both times I've been here have been fantastic- none of the food I had felt overly salty minus the fries that came with my friend's crab cake meal.If you only order one item from here- definitely make it the Spicy Fish Fillet ($15). It was delicious and our order came in huge portions. I was extremely satisfied even after just taking one bite out of the fish! Their "happy crab" sauce is killer and should be on everything.The salt & pepper calamari here is another winner. Lightly battered without the grease, and actually has the salt and pepper taste that other restaurants often lack. Ask for a lemon to squeeze over to make it perfect.Don't forget to take advantage of the daily specials. You can get $3 Blue Moons on Wednesdays and cheaper shots on Fridays and Saturdays. The real winner is Sunday where calamari, smelt, and the squid fries are just $4 a piece. Amazing!Thanks Happy Crab. I'm looking forward to coming back soon for more seafood goodness.

55.description: nice service. Fresh oyster. Quiet place to have seafood with friends. the waiter is so nice to teach you how to eat a crab leg

9.description: This place is a hidden gem! I live right around the corner, walking distance, and only recently discovered this fun spot! The food is YUMMY and very heartily portioned. I usually have to take my leftovers home. PLUS, they deliver! The bar service is AWESOME and so much fun! Pinyo, the manager is an excellent host and takes very good care of the customers, some being regulars, like me. Most enjoyable, beyond the food and drinks is sports days/nights. Be sure to visit when the Bulls, Bears or Blackhawks are playing, you're in for a treat!

26.description: One could argue they have the finest crab legs in Chicago. And, finally, a restaurant with staff that knows how to make customers feel welcome. Our meal here was an all-around pleasure.

25.description: Only thing seafood about this place is the name.  No themed drinks.  Sat at the bar around and wasn't offered a drink or food menu.  Was looking forward to a shrimp cocktail. I thought of asking but the lone worker was having dinner with her friend with another friend passed out across chairs.  No lie...Very disappointed.  Didn't stay long.

12.description: There food is amazing love the smelt and that chicken dish... Great customer service.... Love love this place...

59.description: Pregnant and hormone over here.Craving some crab legs yesterday after walking around for hours with my husband and toddler at the auto show yesterday. I didn't want to sit in a fancy restaurant to get my crab fix. Thank goodness for Yelp and The Happy Crab! Got a pound of Alaskan King Crab for $20!My belly was happy and my husband's wallet was happier.

21.description: After not having Happy Crab in a year, I can say the food is still just as good as ever (spicy fish fillet, I'm looking at you!). However, the service is not really up to par and it pains me to say that because the server seemed nice enough. She was just not very attentive and unprofessional at times such as assuming my husband was Chinese without any other reason besides that he's Asian, smoking right in front of the restaurant on a break, and just more focused on talking to her friends at the bar. Given my husband and I worked in the restaurant industry, this may be something we are just more aware of but we experienced something similar the past couples times we've gone there where the service was not attentive or slow and the servers seemed to just want to hang out with their friends.

17.description: Summary: Delicious food, Warm environment, Amazing ServiceThe seafood was fresh and tasty. Everyone in my party (6 year old to 75 year old) enjoyed the food and the ambiance. Pinyo, the host and bar tender, allowed my 6 and 8 year old nephews to choose the crab and lobster that we were going to eat at dinner. Recommended Items: Spicy Fish Fillet and Ginger and Onion CrabThe Chicago Tribune has a great write up as well (chicagotribune.com/dinin…)

10.description: I wish I had the same experience as my fellow visitors.  Okay, if you're hungry but not as good as the Angry Crab.  Four customers on a Saturday night, should have been my clue.  Perhaps carryout would have been better.

5.description: I sat at bar on a Tuesday, the place was deadI ordered the crab cake sandwich w/ friesAll hit the spot and was exactly what I was looking for only suggestion would be to maybe make the cake a little larger or use smaller buns. I hate it when I eat something with a bun and the protein is half the size of the bunThey had some Chinese beer on special for $3, I am sure it is the Chinese equivalent of miller high life?

3.description: It's an odd place... feels like a Chicago sports bar, but they must have a Chinese chef in the kitchen.  Why not, right?  We go to plenty of sports bar with Irish or Greek food, so this is a good alternative if you are in the neighborhood, stop by for a quick dinner or take out.The place was pretty empty when we went on a week night.  Service was quick and nice.

35.description: I sooo like this place. The atmosphere, the food and the service are all on point. We ordered the squid fries as our appetizer. After that I had a side salad with the Asian dressing DELISH. Then I had the garlic lobster (because upon my ordering I mentioned lobster tails, so Pinyo (either the owner of the guy that runs the place) recommended an entree with tails instead of the full live lobster) it came with steamed rice. I loved my meal and the attention to make sure we were well attended to during our visit was right what the doctor ordered. He even gave my guy his second Jameson on the house. I DEF recommend this place. They have daily specials and they're opened until 2am......

19.description: Came here last night for a friend's birthday meal very late at night. We arrive at 1AM but the service was still very welcoming and friendly. Basically all the food we ordered was on point. The seafood plater, the oysters, the snow crab, the king crab, the salt and pepper crab, and the spicy tomato pasta, all delicioussss (my favorite was the salt and pepper crab). The bartender was also very friendly! He made us yummy tequila shots for my friend's birthday. All in all, a great experience.

28.description: Food took a long time to come out and was cold, service was slow because they were understaffed. Waitress was very nice but took forever. I was unimpressed.

45.description: Nice place. Crab was amazingly affordable. My crab legs were a little cold but was able to still enjoy because I'm a crab lover. Bar on inside and nice atmosphere. Will be back soon for crabby snacks and homemades

33.description: Great little place!  Affordable prices and great service! Jazzy was our waitress and she did a fantastic job! Really liked the squid fries! Dungeness crab was good  but messy Will come back again and try the crab legs.

43.description: This place is amazing! We received amazing service at like 1 AM. He even gave us recommendations. Seriously the guy there takes really good care of everyone and looks like he loves his job. The seafood tasted fresh. The spicy fish fillet was amazing. Everything is also reasonably priced.  I mean if you're out past midnight and want seafood come here or anytime for that matter.

2.description: What an interesting culinary experience.  The salt and pepper calimari were perfect - lightly battered, not greasy at all,  tasty. The breading on the crab cakes was heavier than I like, but inside the crab was sweet and delicious. The side salad was huge and very good. The sauce on the basil shrimp linguini was really good, but the linguini itself was really overcooked.Somebody put some real thought into the  soundtrack - mostly late 50's/early 60's music from Dion and the Belmonts to Jerry Butler to Ray Charles and Nina Simone, with a liberal spicing of modern artists with roots in that era, i.e. Amy Winehouse and Adele. It all flowed really nicely. Nice place for a long hangout to catch up with a friend to great music over tasty food.

18.description: Only thing seafood about this place is the name.  No themed drinks.  Sat at the bar around and wasn't offered a drink or food menu.  Was looking forward to a shrimp cocktail. I thought of asking but the lone worker was having dinner with her friend with another friend passed out across chairs.  No lie...Very disappointed.  Didn't stay long.

41.description: Amazing food!!! Better than most seafood places I've been to. Highly recommend it! The service was excellent! The waiter kept checking in to make sure we were ok. Great place.

52.description: Place is FANTASTIC!!!!! The food was delicious, well prepared, and sooo tasty. The waiter, might have been owner, was sooo nice, helpful and recommended appetizers.For apps, we had the calamari and cocktail shrimps and it was one of the best I ever had!  We also had the happy sandwich was sooo delicious. The snow crab legs were one of a kind. Definitely coming back for the food and the drinks. Very good looking drinks that tasted soo good and had a good amount of alcohol!!!! Definitely coming back!!!!!

50.description: Can't beat the price for what you get here. Great seafood at reasonable price in downtown . Great spot . Can't say anything negative

4.description: The owner of Happy Crabs contacted me and asked me to give them another chance and to come back and try their food (he offered a 30% discount). We ordered $36.00 and received a $10.80 discount [Fish Fillet (me), Chili Chicken (friend), Calamari & Smoothie (both of us). I wish to thank the owner for handling the situation in a professional manner and reaching out to me and address the issue ASAP, and I really liked the service I received when I came inside (the bartender brought us water even though we said we were going to carry-out). He made sure to take care of us while we were waiting for our order. He was VERY VERY polite, good guy (long ponytail, Asian, older looking good guy). Professionalism and accommodation is why I gave 3 stars, I would normally just give 1 star and leave it at that. I really hate pointing out the negatives after the Owner and the Bartender were so accommodating but I just want to be and honest reviewer ----- The food we got was VERY VERY SALTY. My friend and I stopped eating it after 3-4 pieces because the SALT just made it really really hard to eat. I tried to fight through it because $27 is still expensive for a college student and I just couldn't... I was very very sad because I hate wasting my money because I work so hard to save every dollar. We also ordered calamari and that was good. Very good, my friend said we should have just ordered three of those,. We also got a smoothie and that was delicious as well. I just don't know how our main meals turned out to be so salty! I noted another 2 star review posted a couple weeks ago with the same complaint. $15 for a Fish Filet meal you can't even eat... it would make anyone sad. However, the overall 4 stars mean something, they obviously are doing something right and maybe it's just these two meals that are like that. Anyways! The ambiance is cool (check out the pictures), laid back like a sports hang out place. There are 4 TVS hanging around (2 big ones). I can see this place getting packed with UIC students   when the Bears are playing OR during the Bulls playoffs. They have everything set up well. If our food was eatable today, I would have definitely came here multiple times in the future with a bunch of friends to watch the games because most of us love seafood. I wish this business success because they are making an all out effort to make their customers happy. I'm sure they will fix it as they are new. But here is my review and for them to build on it! (Please refer to my pictures to see how this place looks like, menu, and a $5 discount the offer)

6.description: my girl and i stopped in after driving past it just cuz the happy crab sign is so cute! we had the onion rings, fried smelts and raw oysters for apps and they were all yummy! i wouldve liked the smelts to have more of a crispiness to them but they were still pretty good. she had the king crab legs & i had the steamed garlic lobster over clear noodles. both were delicious! i love garlic on almost everything so it was fantastic! they cut up the lobster for u so u dont have to do it yourself which was helpful. ive never had lobster with noodles before so it was a nice new dish to try. our server was really nice & if im in this area again id definitely come back here!

22.description: Wow such good food!! The penne was so good and the jalapeño poppers. Our waiter was so funny and friendly. Loved this place. Next time we are in town we will definitely come bye again. Stop here if you're in the area. You won't be disappointed!

15.description: Pregnant and hormone over here.Craving some crab legs yesterday after walking around for hours with my husband and toddler at the auto show yesterday. I didn't want to sit in a fancy restaurant to get my crab fix. Thank goodness for Yelp and The Happy Crab! Got a pound of Alaskan King Crab for $20!My belly was happy and my husband's wallet was happier.

57.description: great place for "food"...not sure what type of restaurant you would call them....The Happy Sandwich is very good with the spicy mayo.....the only downside the hours have changed...so no more lunch specials

20.description: Sprung for the salmon. Came without the vegetables or the rice, so all I had was an oversaturated piece of salmon doused in cheap Teriyaki sauce. Not to mention that the order took about an hour and a half to arrive, even though I live less than 2 miles from the place.Food was cold too. Recommend dining in if dining with Happy Crab at all.

36.description: I can't wait to go back! I really enjoyed the pasta with salmon & my partner the crusted salmon dish with teriyaki sauce!  Great taste, portions & super friendly service!  I'm so glad to have a casual seafood place near me!  Loved it!

14.description: This place is amazing! We received amazing service at like 1 AM. He even gave us recommendations. Seriously the guy there takes really good care of everyone and looks like he loves his job. The seafood tasted fresh. The spicy fish fillet was amazing. Everything is also reasonably priced.  I mean if you're out past midnight and want seafood come here or anytime for that matter.

58.description: I love greek food, and I especially love dining in Greektown, but this was my first experience at this restaurant and it will be my last. I decided to take my date here on a Friday night at around 8:30pm. I was planning on dining at a different greek restaurant just a block away, but figured since we were already next to it, to give it a try. We walked in, and no hostess. I was a bit taken back cause the staff walked right by us and did not engage us with a smile, or hello, someone will be right with you.. nothing. 5 minutes past by and the hostess finally showed up. She sat us right away, but it seemed as if she was drained and unhappy. We look around the room and notice that we were surrounded by mature couples in their 50's, 60's, 70's.. There was absolutely no energy or laughter inside the room. The restaurant was beautifully decorated, but lacked energy and sign of life. The waiter comes by, and takes our drink order. 2 minutes later, a second waiter comes by to take our drink order. We inform him that a different waiter took our order. He looked frazzled and confused, not to mention that he was sweating and had greasy hair. Not exactly someone that I would want as my waiter serving me my food. The first waiter was no prize winner either, but nothing we could do at that point. The staff looked underpaid, unhappy, and overworked.We ordered a glass of cabernet each. I want my wine in a wine glass and unfortunately they arrived in smaller glasses. I asked the waiter to bring us regular wine glasses, and it took him forever to find 2 wine glasses for us. We ordered the greek salad for 2 to start with and when it arrived it was a dry little sad plate for 1. Normally, I love dipping my bread into the sauce, but this time.. there was no sauce to dip in.
