33.description: Usually eat @ Athena's when we visit Greektown but decided to try out the Isles since it was top-rated. Great choice! The ambiance/decor was really original- many "semi-levels" with only a few tables at each.We did the family sharing meal- about $25 per person and boy does the food keep coming! In addition to the standard bread with olive oil you chose one of three apps to share, two blocks of Saganaki lit at the table, followed by a big Greek salad, a p;ate of gyros meat, then (as if you are even still hungry at this point!)  your entree arrives. Dessert and coffee is the final arrival- its a plate of three pastries including baklava. Trust me you will be taking that dessert to go!The food was all very tasty but what I liked best is that the staff really tidied the arrival of all these courses very well. My pet peeve is when the bring out each course so fast you need to skip or stuff the food in your mouth to keep up and get a warm bite, and waiting TOO long is never good either. So yeah they really nailed the timing in between bringing all this food out.Great place to take an out of town guest!

43.description: December 29, 2015 - 6:30pm - the restaurant was jammed with a lot of large parties.  Restaurant seats 400 and has 185 staff (I asked).  We were a part of 8 and I was very worried as our event was a birthday celebration, so we wanted it to go well.I have worked in restaurants and I know the problems of logistics, service, food.It could not have been better - our orders were taken promptly, water and bread appeared immediately, the food all came out at the same time, everyone was extremely pleasant and efficient (crumbs were brushed off the table regularly).  AND the food was terrific (everyone agreed).  However they do it, they are masters at it.

2.description: I went with a group of 8 for a party and I was rather unimpressed with Greek Islands. Greek Islands is like so many other Greek restaurants I went to in the fact that it is set up banquet style (think Reza's) with large rooms, opulent over the top Greek statues, white-wash walls (as if all of Greece was Santorini), with too many dining rooms to count. Greek Islands is a Greek restaurant that tries to be a Greek restaurant. During my travels in Greece I never once encountered a restaurant like Greek Islands, and all of my favorite meals in the country were unassuming small places that just made good food with fresh ingredients. Our group elected to get the fixed prices menu, which makes sense since it works well in large groups and we got an assortment of food. First off, no pita bread, which is a bummer. But instead of providing other types of Greek bread (like Psomi), you just get generic bland sesame bread, which makes dipping less excited. The gyro meat with tzaziki and garlic sauce was fine, but nothing one hasn't had before if they've had Greek food. The flaming cheese was tasty, the potatoes and rice were ok, the lamb and chicken were overdone, and the dessert was average. On top of that the "Greek" salad came with lettuce and no anchovies. The anchovies are understandable as not many Americans enjoy anchovies, but I always judge a Greek restaurant by their salad. There's nothing quite like a true Greek salad with a heaping bowl of chopped cucumbers, red and green peppers, vinaigrette, olives, and delicious salty blocks of feta cheese. No lettuce need apply for my Greek salad, thanks. Can't recommend Greek Islands, I'd rather eat elsewhere or better yet, save some money and head back to Greece to get some delicious food from the source!

18.description: I was impressed with Greek Islands the moment that I walked in. We arrived after 7pm on a Friday evening with a group of 8 people, including 2 individuals that use wheelchairs. We were seated immediately, when I fully expected on having to wait. The host and our server were both friendly and attentive, ensuring that we had everything we needed. Now, onto the food. The oh-so-delicious food. We started with a few orders of saganaki - yum! They light the cheese on fire by your table (prepare for the heat from the flames) and yell "Opa!"  This tradition always brings me great joy. For dinner, I ordered the spanakotiropita (filo dough with spinach and cheese). It was a HUGE slice, with a lot of spinach and cooked well. The other people at my table also enjoyed their food thoroughly, having ordered the gyros, lamb, and souvlaki. I also recommend sampling the Greek alcohol, including the wine and beer, to complement your meal. I enjoyed a glass of the Nostos (a dry, white wine).This is an amazing Greek restaurant, which exceptional food and service, in the heart of Greektown.

41.description: Every time I'm in Chicago, I try to eat here. I love their food. The homemade sausage is incredible, as is everything else I've had here. The service is phenomenal as well. Seriously, try this place!

52.description: Our waiter was way over the top.He offered us family style... And kept saying trust me, you trust me.We did the meal was great.The only thing we didn't care for were the kabobs. They were dry and flavorless.They could have been amazing if they were removed from the flame a day earlier.The lamb chops were out of this world.You must get the fried zuchinni.

50.description: Service was good but restaurant was over staffed. Creepy to have waiters staring at you while you were trying to eat. Food was unimpressive! Greek salad was mostly iceberg lettuce and was overdressed. Way too much garlic in every dish. Not worth the taxi ride to greektown!

4.description: I had heard Greek Town in Chicago was amazing and I'm so glad I got to experience it firsthand. The service at Greek Islands is amazing and our waiter was attentive throughout our meal. The food and wine are amazing as well and the saganaki is one hell of an amazing appetizer; there's nothing like having cheese lit on fire table side and then getting to eat that amazing piece of cheese. The atmosphere makes you feel like you're on vacation in Greece and Greek Islands is a fantastic restaurant overall!

6.description: The Greek Islands is a Chicago staple smack dab in the heart of Greek Town.  As soon as you walk in the door, you can smell the deliciousness.  Lemon and Oregano!!!!!  If you like Greek food, there is no place better!!!!As far as appetizers go, the gyro meat, saganaki, calamari, and the tirokafteri are all amazing!  When it comes to entrees, every chicken dinner on the menu is awesome, but the lamb chops are unreal!!!  Meat falls off the bone!The service here is very quick and most of the servers enjoy their job.  This place has the decor of a Greek outdoor cafe, and with the music playing you think you are actually there.Greek Islands is great for parties and big groups.  Lots of good size appetizers for big groups.  If you want to have a great time and enjoy some of the best Greek American food, this is the place!!

22.description: Weekend brunch with some friends from out of town, friends wanted Greek food, didn't know any place, so per usual, I yelped it up and found Greek Islands! First thing first, FREE valet parking! I quickly realize that nearby Greek restaurants offer the same thing, but omg, someone needs to appreciate it, and that would be me!Service was amazing. We got seated pretty much right away. Our waitor was attentive, and...professional! I only say this because he literally put a small plate in front of me for our appetizer to share, and I looked at it, didn't even notice there was a teeny-tiny stain on it, before I knew it, he took it away with an apology for the "dirty" plate...What?! Also, after we had the bread, he came back with this little tool (in a shape of a credit card?) that he used to clean up the bread crumbs off the table in the most gracious way possible. He's really not your typical nice waitor who try to do his job right, mine was killing it! Last thing, your water will never be half empty for a long time! My friends and I were actually so impressed we jokingly tried to drink our water so fast to see whether or not they'd be able to get us more right away, and they did!!! Top-notch service Greek Islands!Food was alright. A little too greasy for my brunch taste. That said, the appetizers were delicious. We got one cold combination appetizer and one pan fried calamari dish to share! We also got the cheese that they flame up right before serving, which was really cool and probably one of their most popular dishes (we saw a few other tables who got the same thing!). Prices is honestly reasonable, considering their insanely good service, free parking, and generous portion size. The seafood dishes could get a bit pricey, but still within the $$ range! Our party of 6 got 3 appetizers, some coffee and juice, 6 entrees for about $150 altogether. Not bad in my opinion! I'd love to come back to try other menu options at Greek Islands!

15.description: My favorite Greek restaurant. Awesome staff. I love to share a Greek salad and order the combination plate for my entree. Veggies (bryami) are excellent. Saganaki to die for.Last week we ordered the Greek sausage for an appetizer which was excellent.

57.description: This restaurant just lost a loyal customer.  The food was mediocre and the room we were seated in was taken over by a private party.  When we arrived, the restaurant was fairly empty, we could have been seated anywhere.  Instead we were seated in the back room and then asked to leave before we were finished with our meal.The head waiter should have sent us to the bar for a drink on the house - instead, we were asked to go to the bar to finish our conversation so the "private party" could have the room.

20.description: Food and service were great!! Ordered today's special, spaghetti with lamb. Highly recommend it!!

36.description: valet parking. YES.good lunch selections and friendly staff.

14.description: Greek Islands is my all-time favorite Greek restaurant. The food is delicious and tastes the same as it did 30 years ago - a hard feat to accomplish. Their lamb dishes are tender and flavorful and a must. My go to is the lamb Rosa Marina but Kokkinisto is also wonderful. Their fried zucchini with skordalia is second to none. Saganaki, gyros and village salad are other favorites.Service is attentive and efficient but don't look for lots of chitchat. They offer free valet parking if you're driving, which is pretty amazing. They don't take reservations but since it's so huge, the wait isn't terrible.

28.description: For some reason (ahem, stupid boot) I go to Walgreens often. During the week, I go to the one nearest my work, but on the weekends I hit up the 24-hour Walgreens on Halsted. They have all of the same stuff, the pharmacists at both places are extremely nice and fast, but the kicker is that the employees are actually really nice at this one. There are no huge lines like my weekday Walgreens, either.

1.description: All I wish is for the checkout lines to be staffed better at peak times. First world problems I know.

39.description: While this Walgreens is fine to pick up a bottle of shampoo or advil, DO NOT get a prescription filled here. I had  them a refill of a very common medicine. When i picked it up and brought it home, the packaging looked different, but it was the same brand so I thought no biggie. Well I saw my doctor today and showed her what they gave me and it was the WRONG RX!! Good thing i wasn't allergic to anything in this particular medicine. Giving someone the wrong medicine is completely unforgivable. I will be going to cvs from now on,

9.description: Looking forward to Seniors Day this Tuesday, 11/3/15.  If you are 55+ you will get 20% off most items in the store!  Can't beat that!

29.description: Wanted you all to know that it has been since 2009 since I wrote that review and I kept my word.  I will not give them money no matter how DAMN convenient they are... grrrrr!

42.description: What isn't there to like about Walgreens? There's always something to buy at Walgreens! I used to work near the one around 400 N Michigan Ave and the staff never changed which was kinda nice. The location in Greektown is my primary Walgreens and while I haven't gotten to be buddies with any of the staff, there is always someone within ear shot willing to help, especially with items behind lock and key. This store also has a big wide aisle of seasonal items which is great during the holidays. Everyday basics are always well-stocked and the store is bright and clean. The in-store cash machine is also a nice convenience.

23.description: This Walgreens sells alcohol! I've been to many and I have never found one like that before.Also, last time I went here, they were having construction done on at least 1/2 of the store, so be warned!

5.description: It's a big walgreens and doesn't feel too cluttered. They have a nice big parking lot, which is convenient, although they certainly say they're serious about people not going anywhere other than walgreens while parked there, and I haven't tried. This location does the yellow fever vaccine upon request, which is good to know because I've heard it can be a hassle to get it.

31.description: What can I really say about Walgreen's? It's a pharmacy. What sets it apart from CVS and others? For the most part, the employees are proactive in helping people out. Just stand looking clueless for a bit and you'll know what I mean.

25.description: I've never ran into panhandlers when I come here, but I'm not surprised by other yelpers complaints.  I come to this Walgreen when I am staying the Crowne Plaza, cause it's just so darn convenient, and apparently I don't trust supermarkets with parking on the roof (I'm talking about you Dominick's). The staff here is super friendly and always joking around with one another, but they do take time to help you and be courteous. Things seem alil pricey, but I am from out of town and Chicago has crazy sales tax. Oh and the signs in Greek never get old.

12.description: I've been using this Walgreen's for over a decade.  I used to live in the area, now live in the 'burbs, but I still keep using this Walgreen's.  It's open 24 hours.  It's a short walk or Divvy ride from the Ogilvie train station.  It's a good excuse to visit Greektown for lunch after shopping at Walgreen's. And they're a quick walk to Mariano's if I want to combine a drug store and supermarket trip before taking the Metra home.  They have a drive-through window (which was useful when I owned a motorcycle, not so much now that I don't).  For drivers: big parking lot with entrances/exits on three sides; electric charging station for plug-in cars; seconds away from the expressway on-ramp.  Service has always been friendly and competent (I tried using a Walgreen's in south Evanston a few times but they seemed to mess up my prescription and insurance billing several times, so I went back to this Greektown Walgreen's).  They've completely remodeled and brightened up the place in the last year or so, like a lot of other older Walgreen's stores. Also like other Walgreen's: express pay; emails and text messages when your prescription is being filled and is ready; loyalty program on smartphone or just by tapping in your phone number on the terminal.

37.description: Up yours, Blockbuster. I'm converted. You can return the DVD to ANY redbox! It's worth it! Cheap and convenient. Only wish they had Blueray. When they get that, they'll get 5 stars from me.

21.description: I like this Walgreens because it's not your typical one. It has a charging station for electric cars outside. It has a mini grocery store inside.It's actually clean and organized in here.

16.description: I like this Walgreens because it's not your typical one. It has a charging station for electric cars outside. It has a mini grocery store inside.It's actually clean and organized in here.

17.description: Found a dead fly floating around in one of the "fresh fruit cups" here.MMMMM DELISH

10.description: It's Walgreens so what you expect to be here is, the extra perks are a better than average selection of last minute food items, they carry Delish which I'm assuming is their brand. I was happy to see that they carry 1% milk as many drugstores don't.They also have a plug in station for your car, which is pretty cool.

11.description: Clean, easy to park and fairly fast service (I came here for passport photos). Don't forget to check online for coupons if you're in need of passport pix...or pix in general.

26.description: Greektown Walgreen's is always an adventure... The last time I went here, my friend and I were confronted by a homeless guy in the greeting card aisle who scolded me for not smiling at him, demanded to know where we went to church, then pestered us for money and/or food.  Usually the aggressive panhandling only takes place just outside of the door.  Unfortunately, this 24-hour Walgreen's is too damned convenient and there isn't a viable alternative nearby, so I'm stuck with it.

27.description: Short and sweet - Pros: - It's close by.- It's open 24 hours.- The pharmacists are very nice.- The cashiers are generally nice.Cons:- Yes, the panhandlers can be aggressive. Handle or don't but it's a fact of life in the city.- Another store that could use an interior facelift and updating.- It's not the staff that generally bugs me but the customers sometimes who seem to lose all common sense and courtesy when they walk in the door.

35.description: Ah, the WAG.  You love it, but you hate it.  It's always so convenient yet simultaneously a headache and sometimes a bitter pill to swallow, but you have to take your medicine like your mommy told you.I can't hate too much on the WAG, as my great aunt worked for them many years ago and was able to enjoy over 25 years of retirement thanks to her pension and performance of WAG stock.  WAG was a stellar performer in the market back in the day and used to sell at 35 times.  That's hardly the case anymore, as WAG is now firmly entrenched in the discount aisle with the crappy generic toilet paper.  I digress.Right, well Walgreen's is nice and convenient for picking up your day-to-day sundries, a Powerade or a Three Musketeers bar.  I'll give them that.The problems with Walgreen's are the prices, the fact that you'll have to case the entire store before you find the item you specifically came into the store to purchase and that you'll be suckered into purchasing other items by happenstance as you wend your way around the store tracking down the same item.  No two Walgreen's stores are the same.  Just when you think you know where to find an item based on a prior visit to your local Walgreen's, you go into another Walgreen's store (how can you not, as they're ubiquitous) and the layout is entirely different.  Why?  Probably because they want to confuse you so you get a look at all of those other enticing items that are overpriced.  To compound matters, this particular Walgreen's just remodeled and changed the entire layout.  Talk about rats in a maze.  As to the prices, you can find some deals if you look, but the perfect example of their high prices is in the condom aisle.  You're looking at $12.99 for a 12-pack of nice jimmy hats.  You know, just in case.  On my travels last year, I noticed in southwestern Michigan and in, uh, Tennessee that they were half the price they are in Chicago.  Thanks for ripping me off, Walgreen's.  I don't feel sorry for that stock performance any more.  Walgreen's: you love it but you hate it.  But you'll always be back.  It's two-and-a-half stars, but I'll bump them to three for being good to my great aunt.

8.description: Craft beer fans pay attention.  This Walgreen's has a top notch selection of craft brew.  Yes, you read that correctly.  Who even knew they sold beer?  This past weekend whilst perusing their beverage aisle, I stumbled upon my Michigan favorite Greenbush.  They've got bottles of Anger, Sunspot and the potent Brother Benjamin.  I've also seen beers from Revolution, Rogue, Dark Horse, Bear Republic, Goose Island, Oskar Blues, and Stone.  They've got it all: bombers, bottles and cans.  Get some!I really like the redesign that they've done here too.  The pharmacy is great and we are always out quickly.  There is even a drive thru if you need to be fast.  It looks like you can get some food shopping done here too.  The cosmetic section has anything you would need, including those tiny little bottles of whatever that the little lady always puts on the shopping list and run like twenty bucks.  I also love the convenience of having a Red Box right down the block in this store.  So, yeah.  I like this Walgreens.  It's got everything I need and it's 24 hrs too.

0.description: Best Walgreen's experience ever! Was asked by 3 separate people if I needed help with anything. Very happy! Whoever was the manager for the morning of 12/11 has a fantastic crew.

38.description: Is it only me that finds Blockbuster's movie rental rates ridiculous?! I've found my solution: Redbox. There is a Redbox inside of the Walgreens. Let's just say that I am a HUGE fan.  I had gone there on the fly for a movie and was frustrated that they were all out. Alas, you can reserve it online and find which store it is at! :-) Doing that is much better.  Yet - you do NOT have to return it to the same place - ANY redbox works! Cha-ching! That is awesome! And guess what? Some locations are outside or in 24-hour places so you are never out of luck!It's relatively easy to use. Reserve online with your credit card and you pick it up. (be sure to bring that card with you so they know it's you!) You can't beat $1/night + tax - take that Blockbuster!  There aren't any due dates - it is an additional $1 for each night.Now I do have to say selection can be limited either by date or how busy that location is, but it beats $5 from otherplaces (sidenote: some production/movie places refuse to rent to Redbox because they are pissed off so your movie might not ever go to one of those locations). At this point, I think I am ready to break up with Blockbuster and go steady with the Redbox.

20.description: Craft beer fans pay attention.  This Walgreen's has a top notch selection of craft brew.  Yes, you read that correctly.  Who even knew they sold beer?  This past weekend whilst perusing their beverage aisle, I stumbled upon my Michigan favorite Greenbush.  They've got bottles of Anger, Sunspot and the potent Brother Benjamin.  I've also seen beers from Revolution, Rogue, Dark Horse, Bear Republic, Goose Island, Oskar Blues, and Stone.  They've got it all: bombers, bottles and cans.  Get some!I really like the redesign that they've done here too.  The pharmacy is great and we are always out quickly.  There is even a drive thru if you need to be fast.  It looks like you can get some food shopping done here too.  The cosmetic section has anything you would need, including those tiny little bottles of whatever that the little lady always puts on the shopping list and run like twenty bucks.  I also love the convenience of having a Red Box right down the block in this store.  So, yeah.  I like this Walgreens.  It's got everything I need and it's 24 hrs too.

19.description: New clean and spacious.   Had my photos and photo album prepared there.  Great quality. The Bridgeport Walgreen doesn't prepare them as good as this place.

33.description: Besides the homeless beggars standing at the doorway as you walk in and out of this business, this Walgreens is great. I know what I am getting with Walgreens. The pharmacy staff is quick. The store is clean. Generally a good experience.

2.description: Customer service at this store is outstanding.  I never had a bad experience!  Great staff, good selection of products, fair price, and always a speedy checkout.

34.description: Easy Walgreens to get to in the city and in Greek town take the Adams street exit if going East and turn right 2 times and here you arenice store with good employees and it has signs in Greek so a little difference from other locations

32.description: As I got off the train this morning, I needed a quick snack to take me through the day. Needing something close to the #8 Halsted bus, this Walgreens location was perfect.  I bought some Planter's NUT-rition nuts for a sale price of $3.79 (normally 5 something). This WAG store is clean, close to public transportation, open 24 hours and has proper ad tags for their products, big plus in Chicago!

18.description: Store is clean and always well stocked, employees are pleasant (even late in the evening).  Perhaps most importantly, they have an ample parking lot!

41.description: Walgreens is always creme de la creme in terms of drug stores.  Gotta love em.  The people that work here are totally sweet and helpful.  I always spend mad $$$, because I find the most ridiculous things to buy.  Here's my one problem: There's a person (I won't even mention gender!) that works in the pharmacy who either completely hates their job or just hates customers.  I know this person's name (I wrote it down in my Yelpin' pad) but I promise not to rat anyone out.  However, I might have to do a review update if this person continues their bitchy (men can be bitchy too, so this doesn't give away anything) streak.  However, if I rat them out I might not be able to come to this Walgreens again, which would just be unbearable.  Decisions, decisions.

13.description: This is Walgreens so it's not like anything amazing really happens here. I did really enjoy the nice welcome from the counter clerk as I walked in. She said hi to everyone, which is great, even if they are required to do it, it makes them seem a little more friendly. The prices at Walgreens are a little high, but definitely use the coupon books!

4.description: It's a Walgreens! The staff are helpful. Checkout is friendly.BTW, Walgreen's has a Senior Discount Day (usually monthly) when AARP members and Senior Rewards members can receive additional discounts on select items! Staff are not informed in advance of the public the schedule for Senior Discount Day.Large selection of sale items, and they are usually in stock! Large parking lot.24 hour pharmacy. This is our back up pharmacy when Costco is closed or doesn't have our prescription drugs in stock, or doesn't have an OTC item we need! The pharmacists are very helpful and willing to work with clients to find items in the shelves as well as help with issues!

24.description: I have had several great experiences at the pharmacy at this Wallgreens.  I just ordered a refill online it was ready when I showed up making it quick and easy.  The staff here is friendly.  It's great to have a 24 hour pharmacy, with lots of parking and a drive through in the city.

6.description: First of all I want to say that I know yelp from work experience and know that people usually only will write reviews if they are 5 stars or 1 star; however, I truly think they deserve 1 star for my experience. I am a student from out of state and needed to get medicine. After approximately 20 minutes of the pharmacist punching things in the computer and asking me questions to verify my identity she basically accused me of being a criminal and wouldn't fill my prescription. I believe her name was Anne or something with an A but I know she was the pharmacist and not the Pharm tech. I ended up having to take a cab to another pharmacy to get my prescription filled. I will not be back at Walgreens again because of that experience. I hope this comes to the pharmacists attention because her duty is to have public health as her top priority, not play tough guy with 20 year old kids.

22.description: We used to go hear several times per month but not anymore. Tonight we found a broken container of orange juice and thought it would be nice to give to a staff member. We could have easily just left it there but my husband picked it up and walked up to Ashley who appeared to be straightening merchandise. He told her he found it broken and wondered if he could give it to her. She told him he could take it to the counter. Really? someone is being nice bringing damaged merchandise to you and you can't take it?  That in itself is annoying but what she did next was completely uncalled for and really bizarre. My husband said, "you can't take this?." so she grabbed it from him aggressively and said in the rudest snottiest voice "Yes, I'll take it for you!".  OK, he's trying to help her do her job and she acted like she just asked him to demean herself. Clearly helping customers is not what she thinks she should be doing. Maybe she's some supermodel that is doing a guest gig at Walgreens or something and asking her to help was just too insulting.  She is clearly too good for this job.Then I asked our checker what her name was...he said he didn't know. Really? He was mumbling under his breath about us to another clerk. I guess being an ass to customers is ok in this store now.  Then when we were talking with the manager, the clerk that "didn't know Ashley's name" came over and was listening as if he were somehow involved. Why  was he there especially if he had no idea who Ashley was? These people do not need to be working with customers.    Unbelievable. Good thing Target is opening up down the street. By by Walgreens. Your customer service has really gone down the drain.

15.description: This Walgreens sells alcohol! I've been to many and I have never found one like that before.Also, last time I went here, they were having construction done on at least 1/2 of the store, so be warned!

40.description: This Walgreens is horrible if you are trying to fill or pickup a prescription. Last time I went to this location I had already called in my prescription hours before and just needed to pick up and pay. Unfortunately, there was a very large very scary man in front of me convincing the pharmacist that he needed him to fill his meds because he took all of his. Um? Isn't a doctor suppose to make that call? I never knew "I took 2 a day instead of 1" was a valid argument when it comes to refilling pharmaceuticals. Obviously your doc gives you what you are suppose to have. Anyways, the scariness of this man worked because the pharmacist filled the prescription while myself and 3 other people waited around 20 minutes. He actually didn't even acknowledge my presence, and no apology when it was my time to checkout. I refuse to go back here.I thought after college I could stop being weary of anything wearing greek letters?

7.description: I needed some assistance in a time of need. Their manager Amy went above and beyond what was required of her. Absolutely amazing, there are still some nice people around. Well done Walgreens keep her around!!

36.description: This is one of the only drug stores open on Sunday in the downtown area. I was staying at the The W Hotel - City Center - and needed a few things.I walked about 7-8 blocks from the hotel to this Walgreens. It's open 24 hours a day.Picked up all of the items I needed:  hand lotion, beverages, and snacks.

30.description: There's a guard standing by the door at night, so why can't he shoo away the people standing inside waiting for the bus to arrive at the corner? I've had to nudge people out of the way on more than one occasion here just to get into the store.Adequately stocked Walgreens as they typically go. Friendly staff that actually respond to questions or summons for help unlike other locations.Being open 24 hours is a plus. I tried to find a birthday card in Greek, but failed miserably. Dad ended up with a Spanish card again this year. He speaks neither language, but if I'm going to buy a greeting card, it might as well be interesting instead of sappy. Maybe next year.

3.description: Great pharmacy! Newly remodeled and very nice staff.I picked up a prescription and it was relatively quick with out much hassle. Big store so you can also shop  while you wait.

14.description: The store aspect of the Greek town walgreens is very nice and modern. There is a large and well stocked beauty section with Essie nail polish (my fav) and a very complete infant/baby supply section. The checkout is also smooth and quick. The pharmacy aspect is another story.  I was waiting over half an hour and finally went to see what was taking so long. Apparently the electronic name board in the waiting area wasn't working so customers were just sitting and waiting much longer than needed. Hopefully it was a one time fluke!They have an indoor redbox which is nice in the cold winter months if you want to get a video without freezing your hands off.

3.description: If you are going to grab the pre-made sushi in the fridge, forgetaboutit!  It is fresher to order from Oki Sushi and make it to go.Good bite portion.NO extra charge for brown rice.  Service and cleanliness of the dining counter is a hit or miss.  The same with food presentation and preparation.  Depends on who is working.  When you get the older Asian guy, you are doomed.  Tem knows the proper etiquette of food service including preparation, presentation.  You always have to ask for water.Limited availability of selections after 9 pm.Spider Roll -- the soft shell crab went back to the ocean.  Nowhere to be seen.Super White Tuna -- good clean fresh taste of the fish.Latino Loco Maki ($13) -- nothing special but good enough to fill an empty stomach.Coming back for Udon...

1.description: This review is exclusively for the incredible value of the sushi platters. We often order one to go and enjoy it at home. 4 large maki rolls for 35? You can't beat that. Our favorites include a mango and tempura shrimp roll, and of course the old faithful Rainbow roll that's light and filled with fish. Have been disappointed only a few times with the tempura rolls, but honestly those may just not travel as well so I can blame the orderers. For two hungry, sushi loving adults.. This is a weeknight staple when we want great sushi (and fast!) at a great price.

2.description: I came to Chicago almost a year ago to visit and that was my first time in a Marianos. I was blown away with the "grocery store". I used quotes because I don't feel like it really is a grocery store. Sure, you can buy groceries here, but it's so much more. There's also a lounge with gelato, wine, and beer, a sushi bar, which I'm reviewing today, Oyster bar, wine bar, grilling station, and other stations that sell already cooked food.The sushi bar is one of the first things that is seen when you go upstairs. The bar usually has a few people sitting there already, but when I was there, it was completely empty. Unlike some of the reviews I've read about this place, it was quite tidy and the service wasn't bad. Being from California, I'm very particular about my raw fish. The wasabi, the rice, the freshness of the fish, and more. I haven't actually eaten sushi in Chicago yet, so I was kind of looking forward to this place, but not exactly bringing my expectations as high as my usual spots in California.Looking at the menu, Oki Sushi is mostly a roll place with few pieces of sushi available. I ordered the Godzilla Maki roll for $14, cause the picture made it look pretty good, as well as a Sushi Combo for $10. The Godzilla Maki consisted of 10 pieces of "tempura shrimp, cream cheese, avocado, tobiko, chili sauce, scallions, sesame seeds, covered with tempura crumbs, wasabi mayo and sweet soy sauce". Seeing as I was the only customer, the roll came out super fast, and to my surprise, it was actually really good. The Godzilla was a good mix of flavors and textures. However, it wasn't what I was really looking forward to. What I wanted most was the sushi. For those who aren't familiar, sushi is the ball of rice with a topping of raw fish, sashimi are cuts of raw fish, and rolls are... Well, things rolled up in rice/seaweed/whatever they want to roll it up with.Anyways. My sushi combo. Was super disappointing. It came with 8 pieces of bland California rolls and 3 pieces of sushi. 1 Salmon, 1 Tuna, and 1 Yellowtail. The presentation was nice. The 3 pieces of fish in alternating color with the 8 California rolls in a curved display above it. The taste however, was lacking. My favorite fish, the salmon, was not fatty at all, the tuna looked like it was falling apart, and the yellowtail felt kind of mushy. None of them tasted fresh. I really hope my stomach doesn't hurt tonight. The rice was bland and mushy and there weren't any wasabi in any of them. There was a fair amount of pickled ginger and wasabi given with the plate so I had to add the wasabi in myself. On the upside, the wasabi and pickled ginger was pretty good. I'm usually not the biggest fan of pickled ginger, but when they make it a bit sweeter, I can eat a bunch of it, which I did. The wasabi's texture was a good consistency and it wasn't too... I don't know the English word for it, but it didn't burn your nose too bad.Overall, like its name, it was just Oki. The Godzilla Maki was 5 to 10 times better than their Sushi Combo. For charging the same prices as outside places, I expected them to do MUCH better than this. BUT! If you want some fast rolls to go, order it from them instead of grabbing it from the to-go fridge. Two Stars.For more reviews,  come check out eatpeterepeat.com

5.description: This place is inside Mariano's. The sushi was average supermarket sushi. I was disappointed with the service, and sat down next to a dirty plate that hadn't been cleared away and would remain there for the  twenty minutes I sat and ate.

0.description: Not sure about the not-so-positive reviews. I guess it depends what you're comparing this place to. You have to keep in mind that this is in a grocery store. That being said, I think their sushi is pretty awesome. I like simple rolls with not too many crazy ingredients, so their choices are fine with me. I usually get the negi hama roll which is about the same price or cheaper than other sushi places, but you get about twice as much at Oki Sushi. They have a great lunch special for $10 which includes miso soup, seaweed salad, and a maki--negi hamachi, California roll, or salmon roll.After you purchase 10 rolls (including spring rolls), your 11th is free. Lastly, I've always had good service there. The people are super friendly, attentive, and quick to prepare your order. I definitely recommend this place for fresh sushi at a decent price.

4.description: My BF and I were in a hurry to grab something quick before a comedy show. We decided to go to Mariano's to grab some food. We saw there's a sushi bar, and we were not in a mood for salad or fried chicken, so we went for the sushi bar. Our expectations were really low, but it turned out pretty good. It's definitely not a place to ask for great service (you sit yourself and you ask for water yourself), however the sushi were good based on the standard of supermarket sushi. Give it a try!

58.description: Honestly best gyros I've ever had. Could do better cleaning it up, but super tasty.

56.description: Pretty good place for late night eats, and right in the heart of Greek Town. Always end of stumbling into a great little place. Lol. Gyros are good, fries are tasty, burgers also consistent.

29.description: Absolutely terrible moral ethic. I don't respect or patronize establishments that don't respect their clientele. To know that a man was asked to leave this establishment after standing up for what was right by management is deplorable. I will never, ever, eat here again. Consider yourselves boycotted.

42.description: Aside from the employees being nice I will not pay $18.10 again for those Gyros. The meat was so dry it was crispy. The fries were sitting and not made fresh. Lesson learned.

23.description: If it was possible to give less than one star I would. Stay away from this place. They are rude and racist. The owner has no problem making racist remarks in the presence of customers!!!!DO NOT SUPPORT!

47.description: They give you a lot of food for not a lot of money. They're relatively fast and the food is tasty. They did mess up my order (the cashier was very rushed, even though I was the only customer), but were able to correct it quickly. Customer service could use some improvement; when I told him my order was incorrect, he gave me attitude, but if you're looking for something Greek, cheap, and fast, it'll do the job.

8.description: Costed $11.66 for the Gyros Plate, but worth it because you should share it with 3 people at least. I shared it with my friend, and we both couldn't finish. The gyros are tasty! Love the Vienna beef! The gyros plate comes with 2 sides, so we got fries and a side salad. Both were good. I wanted rice, but they didn't have it, so I settled for the salad (still good tho!)Love how the place is 24 hours, and you can pay with cash or credit! I will definitely come again!

31.description: Do not support this restaurant. The owner is a bigot. Black dollars should NOT go to this establishment. You canNOT say what you want and expect to continue to get rich off if us. We are sharing your restaurant on Facebook and Twitter. We are going to shut you down.

34.description: Had a very bad experience yesterday I watched the owner converse with a young white man and his son in a very racially disrespectful manner and the young black man that took offense was thrown out and all he ask if they could be a little more mindful of the fact that's his present

16.description: The bomb! By far my favorite quick and easy gyro joint in Greektown. If you go in expecting fancy Greek BS you're gonna be disappointed. This place is kind of a dive and that's what makes it fantastic. The gyro is inexpensive and with the combo you get fries and a drink. Try the baklava, it is to die for. Don't ask me what else is on the menu because the only thing you need is a sweet delicious gyro. Also, did I mention. Open 24 hrs. So after a night of drunken debauchery you can stumble in here for something greasy to coat the tummy and stave off projectile vomiting. Check it out, you won't be disappointed... If you are, you're just a strange, strange person.

13.description: I always pass by Mr. Greek Gyros when I walk to Mariano's but never hungry enough to walk in. I decided to just go for it today and try them out. Walking in, the whole place seemed pretty normal. Tables, chairs, the works. There was quite the selection of food, but I just ordered the #1. The gyro sandwich combo for $8.15. Which is a pretty good deal seeing how just the gyro sandwich was $7.15, which makes the drink and fries only a dollar! The guy at the counter was pretty fun and friendly when I ordered.I've never been a big fan of Greek food, mostly cause I really don't come across it or when I do, I don't eat it, but from what I could tell, it was a lot of meat on a pita, topped with raw onions, tomatoes, and this yogurt tasting white sauce. I believe the meat was made by taking a bunch of ground meat, sticking it on a stick, and roasting it. Then, they cut the outside layers off in thin strips.My food came out pretty fast and wow. It was big. The gyro was incredibly oily and the meat was a bit over salted, but good nonetheless. The yogurt sauce made things milder but I would have preferred a bit more in my gyro. I enjoyed eating the gyro, but it wasn't great. I felt like I was just trying to finish the food in front of me instead of savoring each and every bite. The fries were slightly crispy and fluffy, but they weren't salted. They could've been in the fryer for a while longer or maybe even double fry them. The amount Mr. Greek gave weren't a joke either. I haven't been this full from a $9 meal since I last ate at Chipotle. And let me tell you about their soda fountain. They have Mountain Dew Code Red! I haven't had that in so long! So good...For the taste and quantity given, Mr Greek Gyros is decently good. Plus they're open 24 hours a day and they deliver! Though I'm not too sure how good they'll be once they get cold. I think I'd come back if I was drunk and around this area. 3 Stars.For more reviews, come check out eatpeterepeat.com

11.description: I actually was going to another Greek restaurant two doors down, but they were closed. This place was clean, people were nice. The food was really good, and not to high. I ate my first chicken gyro here, and was very happy.

39.description: I always pass by Mr. Greek Gyros when I walk to Mariano's but never hungry enough to walk in. I decided to just go for it today and try them out. Walking in, the whole place seemed pretty normal. Tables, chairs, the works. There was quite the selection of food, but I just ordered the #1. The gyro sandwich combo for $8.15. Which is a pretty good deal seeing how just the gyro sandwich was $7.15, which makes the drink and fries only a dollar! The guy at the counter was pretty fun and friendly when I ordered.I've never been a big fan of Greek food, mostly cause I really don't come across it or when I do, I don't eat it, but from what I could tell, it was a lot of meat on a pita, topped with raw onions, tomatoes, and this yogurt tasting white sauce. I believe the meat was made by taking a bunch of ground meat, sticking it on a stick, and roasting it. Then, they cut the outside layers off in thin strips.My food came out pretty fast and wow. It was big. The gyro was incredibly oily and the meat was a bit over salted, but good nonetheless. The yogurt sauce made things milder but I would have preferred a bit more in my gyro. I enjoyed eating the gyro, but it wasn't great. I felt like I was just trying to finish the food in front of me instead of savoring each and every bite. The fries were slightly crispy and fluffy, but they weren't salted. They could've been in the fryer for a while longer or maybe even double fry them. The amount Mr. Greek gave weren't a joke either. I haven't been this full from a $9 meal since I last ate at Chipotle. And let me tell you about their soda fountain. They have Mountain Dew Code Red! I haven't had that in so long! So good...For the taste and quantity given, Mr Greek Gyros is decently good. Plus they're open 24 hours a day and they deliver! Though I'm not too sure how good they'll be once they get cold. I think I'd come back if I was drunk and around this area. 3 Stars.For more reviews, come check out eatpeterepeat.com

37.description: We had the gyro combo it came with fries and a drink for $8.19. They give you a lot of fries and also a lot of meat. Delicious!! friendly atmosphere

0.description: Once upon a time this was a regular stop for me at some point during the week. Many times it was late at night to soak up some of my libations of the evening. In either event, I've always left very happy with what I ate. Even though my work day or evenings don't take me past this place very much anymore, I will still make a stop there at least once a month because the burgers are just that good. I've had their gyro as well and definitely got my money's worth. While I've never seen any of the loudness, fights or unruly drunks that others have mentioned about this place (I've been in there at various hours around the clock), I will say that if I can find ANY fault with this place, it's that the staff are not exactly friendly and inviting. But really...who cares? Personally, I like to have my order taken, let me pay, get my food and get on with my day. But that's what works for me. I also don't have a problem with them switching from 24 hours to closing at 4am. I'm sure there is little to no profit taking place in those three hours. I will keep going here for the foreseeable future.

38.description: Attracts a lot of shady people at night and creates garbage all over the neighborhood. It feels unsafe to be in here late at night. Food is just greasy fast food.  There is nothing special about how their Gyros

51.description: The gyro was room temp and the fries were almost cold. Zeus is miles ahead of this place in quality.

27.description: The food is only acceptable when drunk. Not good, go to Gyro Mena across the street, much better. Owner has made racist remarks I'm told.

32.description: I will never show patronage to a racist, bigot. It's DISGUSTING to take money from blacks and dog them out at the same time. It's all over facebook now. People if you want equality and do not want to tolerate hate, hit him him were it counts. His pockets. I will NEVER recommend this place to any of my friends and family and their friends and family.

54.description: Great gyros and beefs usually, but they are a bit inconsistent.  Great for the price and close to UIC.

48.description: This place is perfect when the desires for gyro and fries arise. Open 24 hours and though the menu is huge and overwhelming, when a place has gyros in the name, stick with that if you're not sure what to eat. The gyros are packed to  overflowing.  I actually had to eat with a knife and fork for the first time in my life. Lots of seating and it's easy enough to grab a bite while waiting for the next #8 Halsted bus to show up.

44.description: Usually a good experience here, the past few times have been a bit edgy. If you're looking for high quality for the same amount of money, you have many lateral options within seconds of walking distance. Keep that in mind. No wow factor here.

24.description: Don't support this restaurant and their apparently obvious racist behavior. I've only eaten here once and their food isn't better then what can be found elsewhere! #Chicago #Greektown #mrgreekgyros

7.description: I will never order from here again!! The service stinks.  I ordered via Grubhub and the driver got to my place with cold food.   The person who answers the phone is very rude.  I explained that the food was cold and he hung up on me.  I call back and he says that he won't make it over and hung up again!!  No matter how ok the food is, customer service will ruin a place for me.  No thanks!!

49.description: Ill give  this place three and a half stars. Its the type of place u'll see on the food network as a local must visit. But it delivers a lot of average food. Basically if u've been drinkin its the best experience. If you havent been and your in the mood for gyros go two doors down to Zuess they actually have cucumbers in their taziki sauce.

40.description: I just left this place today , the person taking my order was really rude . All I wanted was help with the menu, but I seemed to be bugging him and the cook. I have been here before , and have had the same problem.But today was just over the top, so I told him that he has lost a customer, do to his attitude.

53.description: Restaurant dirty staff very rude i ordered a Italian beef with moz chz and they didn't even add it i wouldn't be going back

30.description: The owner has been repeatedly caught making racist statements. Don't eat there unless you too are a racist.

46.description: Gyro is real good and this place is open 24 hours! Mostly contains fast food and the place can get you some sketchy people on the weekends. U bump into the wrong crowd once in awhile but food is real good and workers are always pretty cool. Not the place you wanna take your wife or kids though I wouldn't.

1.description: Mostly for nostaglia purpose, Mr. Greek's has been around for a long time, from high school to college days. Ask anybody who's been out late night in Chicago, and inevitably, Mr. Greek's is on that list of places to go for after boozing recovery and hunger pangs.The gyro can be done in many ways, but this one is the greek hot dog version. They pile it on in along with sauce and onions, I almost feel bad for that pita bread. For a buck more, it comes with a big bag of fries and drink. Food is hot, fries a little underseasoned, so grab some salt and shake it, or just be glad they're not trying to completely kill you and eat your food.

55.description: I would say if you like gyros you should give it a try at least once. When I got the gyros, it was good but I thought it was a bit too greasy. You can see all the grease on the wrapper. The fries were decent. Its a good place to have once in a while but not everyday.The employees were nice, and its a casual place to eat at or take for togo.

9.description: We had the gyro combo it came with fries and a drink for $8.19. They give you a lot of fries and also a lot of meat. Delicious!! friendly atmosphere

26.description: Save your money and eat somewhere better.  Do not support this business.

25.description: Was never crazy about the service. The food was mediocre and over priced. I only went here for the chicken gyros cut off the spit. After what I just read on Facebook, I understand why the service was so shitty. Won't get any more of my hard earned dough. You don't like black money, you won't get my green money.

12.description: If you want a solid gyro. This is a great spot.  They jam pack the gyro with tons of meat.  The tzatziki sauce tastes great.  I always get the combo, fries and a drink for under $10.

59.description: decent gyros, especially late at night.  no more needs to be said.

21.description: The bomb! By far my favorite quick and easy gyro joint in Greektown. If you go in expecting fancy Greek BS you're gonna be disappointed. This place is kind of a dive and that's what makes it fantastic. The gyro is inexpensive and with the combo you get fries and a drink. Try the baklava, it is to die for. Don't ask me what else is on the menu because the only thing you need is a sweet delicious gyro. Also, did I mention. Open 24 hrs. So after a night of drunken debauchery you can stumble in here for something greasy to coat the tummy and stave off projectile vomiting. Check it out, you won't be disappointed... If you are, you're just a strange, strange person.

17.description: Food is subpar, but the reason I felt compelled to write a review is because of the not so subtle racists comments spewed about with no regard for customers (or human decency for that matter). There's too many good places in Chicago that want your business no matter what color your skin. It's a shame because they are immigrants just like many in America. Maybe they should go to their native country and complain about their own president. Obviously, it wasn't that great if they came here. Shameful way to behave.Plus, stop complaining about our president and our country when yours is the bankrupt laughing stock of the world. America has given you your fortune. I just hope enough people read this to see how much you don't appreciate it.

10.description: This isn't exactly what I'd call fine dining, but if you're hungry and its late it will do the job. There is plenty of seating in there. And at night it is usually packed.

5.description: I've been here a couple times, albeit sometimes a little tipsy but I can't say much for the food. The gyros are bland although they are pretty tender. The spanakopita is disappointingly soggy. The fries are so soft and undone. One time 5 of us got fries and all had to send them back for being under fried. The redeeming qualities are the late hours and the very accommodating staff...the food unfortunately is sub par

3.description: No longer 24 hr...now, 7am - 4amI feel like I do owe them a review even it's of the lickety-split variety...This place has been a "go-to" in my life for a long time...yes, even the 2am time. It is different in the wee hours (the crowd, not the fare, in my experience.) Yes, late-nighters, after-bars people and assorted others, plus I usually see some of Chicago's Finest grabbing some grub. I think their gyro is one of the best I've had. Plus, they have some amazing fries. Thick-cut, potato-y & fresh. Good fries taste good in the moment, amazing fries can get on the plane with you the next day and make your seat mate envious, while you savor them...cold!I heard the Philly cheesesteak here is worthwhile so I gotta break my 20-year-gyro streak!

35.description: Okay gyros. Garbage service. Guy will shout at you and charge you for stuff you don't want then refuse to refund you. Not worth the hassle to go here

19.description: Ok, this is the late night spot when you are so hung over and need some food ASAP.. They are open 24/7 I believe, and the food is always consistent. Always going for the gyro and fries. Walk right in and don't get nervous of the clientele here. No one will bite. I believe that there is a cop inside this place at all times. If not, they have a security guard. For the last 5 years, I have not had a problem.

28.description: This Place is disgusting and its not just the food it's the people who own and manage this business. I use to patronize them frequently but now I will never step my "GHETTO" foot in his door again. The ignorants and disrespect the owner has towards black people is ridiculous. He expects us to support his business while he degrades the people who keep his front doors open. I hope no one ever spend a single red cent in Mr. Greek Gyros. I can't respect a man who has no INTEGRITY. I will boycott this place for life, because being black is not a game or a choice but he seems to not care about respecting the people who pays his bills. Fuck your gyros I had better. Learn to keep your comments and opinions to your self mr gyro, at least keep your racist comments in the private of your home. You should be ashamed.

45.description: I have been going here quite a bit in recent months. Their gyros are delicious. I have ordered the gyros and gyros plates. Service is great. I never had a problem with any order. They serve huge portion sizes!

33.description: Just a sad sad little place. Used to eat here a lot a few years ago. Then once Obama got in office, owners became more belligerent and openly discriminatory

43.description: The last time I tried to order food from here it was really soggy - I threw it out without even trying it - and I agree with the reviewer who said the guy who usually takes the food orders is kind of scary - I need to stop trying to buy food here.  This business was here before the neighborhood went upscale, and it's more geared towards late night drinkers and the SRO that was a quarter block away until it closed last year.  Most of my co-workers like Zeus (next door on Jackson) much better, and Gyro Mena and Jaks (east and west on Jackson) are becoming my go tos for take-out.

2.description: The first thing that comes to my mind when someone says Green Town is Mr. Greeks. Open late + near a college campus (UIC) = drunk people at night, fights, and noise! At times, you feel unsafe because their may be a drunky who will try to start a fight with you for no apparent reason. On a late-night, everyone is here to get their salt fix before they call it a day. The main food items are descent. Big portions and enough to fill you up. The fries are horrible, just chopped up potatoes. Service is pushy, they want to get your order and start making it ASAP so they can take care of the next customer. Word on the street is the owner is openly racist here. I haven't seen that in the many times I've been here but there are many reviews that point that out.

18.description: I just left this place today , the person taking my order was really rude . All I wanted was help with the menu, but I seemed to be bugging him and the cook. I have been here before , and have had the same problem.But today was just over the top, so I told him that he has lost a customer, do to his attitude.

41.description: I tried there chicken kabob dinner plate. It was ok, but I felt like I could've gotten more chicken & rice for the money I paid....Overall the taste was good.

52.description: Same a-holes at the counter. The gyro meat was cold and the fries were dry. Go to Zeus next door.

50.description: Are you people seriously complaining about "the shady characters" that are here around 3 AM? Go back to suburbia.Anyway, you get what you pay for. It's not terrific and it's not healthy (everything is either fried, frozen, or greasy). But it's open 24/7, and it's good enough to satisfy your late-night hunger craving. I've never had issues with the staff, my order has never been incorrect, and unless there's a large amount of people there it won't take them too long to make your food.

4.description: Delicious Gyros if you happen to be in Greek town and seeking a late night meal.  The fries are ok. The Gyros meet is abundantly filled inside the pita bread.  Extra gyros sauce on the side if offered as well.

6.description: Great place to go at 2pm for lunch or 2am after a long night out. Their burgers are amazing. Never have had a problem with the service here. Perhaps I should give their Gyros a try...

22.description: Food is subpar, but the reason I felt compelled to write a review is because of the not so subtle racists comments spewed about with no regard for customers (or human decency for that matter). There's too many good places in Chicago that want your business no matter what color your skin. It's a shame because they are immigrants just like many in America. Maybe they should go to their native country and complain about their own president. Obviously, it wasn't that great if they came here. Shameful way to behave.Plus, stop complaining about our president and our country when yours is the bankrupt laughing stock of the world. America has given you your fortune. I just hope enough people read this to see how much you don't appreciate it.

15.description: Don't support this restaurant and their apparently obvious racist behavior. I've only eaten here once and their food isn't better then what can be found elsewhere! #Chicago #Greektown #mrgreekgyros

57.description: I have been coming here for years! Delicious chicken gyros, and cheese fries! At 4am I absolutely love this food!

20.description: I actually was going to another Greek restaurant two doors down, but they were closed. This place was clean, people were nice. The food was really good, and not to high. I ate my first chicken gyro here, and was very happy.

36.description: Hot dog was ice cold, ingredients old. Not Vienna as advertised, probably out of date. I need to report this place to the health department. Nicer, cleaner cheaper place next door on Jackson.

14.description: If it was possible to give less than one star I would. Stay away from this place. They are rude and racist. The owner has no problem making racist remarks in the presence of customers!!!!DO NOT SUPPORT!

58.description: GA-ROSS!my ice tea tasted like cod.  not just a general fishy taste, but i could pinpoint the variety of fish it tasted like.   the place is really weird and red.  i get all agitated in it.i give it and extra star because my partner likes it for the convience to our place and the food is really not that bad, except the fish ice tea, not recommended.

56.description: After living next Greek Town for 4 years, Spectrum is the only place that I actually get a craving to go to.  While no one has ever trumpeted Spectrum as the pride of Greek Town I have to say that they have some of the best bar food around.  The pork souvlaki, greek meatballs and pizza are my favorites.  This is the perfect late night destination.  The price is right, the food is great, the kitchen is open very late and they have live music on Saturday nights (jukebox available the rest of the time) make this one great place.  Note that I didn't mention the great ambiance or crowd.

29.description: I was looking for a place that served traditional cypriot sausages called Sieftalia and stumbled across Spectrum. I emailed the to double check they were still serving them and they emailed me straight back saying yes! Hooray!So 5 of us went there for dinner! Wow! It was so good! Far too much food though! The kebabs were fresh and tasty, the salad large and delicious and great prices! Service was awesome!I will defo go back!

42.description: Checked this place out a few times after making my Halsted Greek town gyro city run. There is another bar next to it and they both are open late. Seemed like a small well dressed crowd in it for a Sunday night. Not too impressed with the interior or the food. Service was pretty good and went away thinking so so about the place. If it disappeared tomarrow not too many people would notice. Seem like a good place for UIC students to go to after eating some late night Gyros. This place inspired me to check out some other places around this vicinity.

23.description: Besides the slow wait for food, it wasn't off putting at all...until I got my check. For a small bar, you'd think they would AT LEAST have table numbers, or a solid memory for the 4 people in the bar on a slow Monday afternoon, instead of labeling me as their 'Asian' customer on my receipt. Rude.

47.description: I've been here twice.  Each time I have gone, I was impressed with the atmosphere and the service received.  The drinks are a bit pricey ($9 margarita) but they make them well.  Every weekend, there is a live band crammed in with the patrons. The food is actually pretty friggin good considering they aren't a complete restaurant. Their gyros rivals the other Greek places on the block.  I can definitely say it is a place to go when you just wanna knock back a few good drinks and have great conversation.  The music is not bothersome nor are the servers snobby or inattentive.  They appear to be in a good mood! You see every sort of people here and it is worth the trip to Greektown.  I suggest you go!

8.description: I am happy that I found this place that's so close to my house that stays open till 4am and serves food. It's your typical bar joint. Don't expect any fancy music or environment. You make your own fun here. They have a mixed crowd, and most people are really chill.

31.description: I think they have great shish ka bobs and I like the fries a lot. I ordered the wings the other day and they were so so. I would def go back, would just avoid the appetizers.

34.description: I love this place. My husband and I went in around 10 pm on a Sat. Not knowing what to expect. We were starving.. the owner suggested that they have good pizza...so we ordered. And YES the thin crust pizza was wonderful! We had a couple of beers and the tap was fairly good price. While we were leaving we noticed a band setting up...the owner said they play blues here every Sat. night! WOW!!! how cool!!! We will be back to hear some blues next time while we get some great food and drinks!! Thanks Spectrum!

16.description: Husband and I always end up here for some late night grub. The food is amazing for the price- some of the best greek food I've had in greek town. The souvlaki and halloumi are  our favorites. They have live blues too late night on the weekends and this place gets packed!

13.description: Hi Michael. & Sandra  Welch a friend and customer of spectrum 17 plus years so in love with the bar & grills beer drinksfantastik calimari. AWESOME have been all over chicago il no one can top Spectrum food drink and friendly people live blues way to go Andy nice touch Love you Spectrum always Michael and Samdra Welch

11.description: Want to hang out with some of the most pretentious people you will ever meet and not get waited on?  This is the place for you! I was looking for a nice place to hang out and have a cold beer but ended up seeing some a side of people that I didn't know existed.All of this occurred while being ignored by the bartenders over and over and over.  The place wasn't that busy either. GO ELSEWHERE!

39.description: This place is a MUST! I am hesitant to review it because I feel like it's a hidden gem and want to keep it for myself.   Let's see...how to review this wonderfully crazy place:First thing...the owner is always around and is always talking to customers and generously buys rounds of shots and drinks if you chat it up with him.  His wife comes too, and they are extremely nice and make you feel like you are in your living room instead of a bar in West Loop.  Second (this should be first, actually), the food here is amazing!  You would never know...it's got a chic Mediterranean menu full of shiskebob, pita sandwiches, kalamari, feta sprinkled french fries (*YUM*) and their salads are AMAZING.  Also has great thin crust pizza.  Open until 5 a.m. on Saturdays and 4 a.m. Sundays, and their kitchen is open until 3 a.m.The crowd is always eclectic and fun--I never know who I'm going to talk to or what's going to happen when I go there.  This place is great.  Check out the live BLUES every Saturday too starring "Hoochie Man" a lot of the time.  He said he plays at Kingston Mines too and is an allstar Blues singer.

37.description: Here's why Spectrum is a GREAT find in the city of Chicago.1. Nice atmosphere.  To be honest, this place is NOT a "dive"-- people that describe it as such are on crack.  Nice wood floors, big tables and big windows, with a dart board and jukebox.  This place is super comfortable with a diverse crowd of people and super clean.2.  CHEAP beer with great selection. You get a lot for your $ here.3. Live blues on Saturdays.  Imagine my surprise walking by one Saturday after a meal at Greek Islands and hearing Buddy-Guyish-blazing-electric-guitar-licks nearby.  I'm talking REAL good music.  Of course, I followed the music and wound up outside Spectrum-- thinking WTH, a Greektown bar plays live blues?? Til 4am??  Hell yeah!!!  Have been back many-a-time since, and I always have a blast.  4. Awesome Food!  AND THEY SERVE THE FOOD ALL NIGHT.  Full menu of anything ranging from your greasy pizza puff, to a shrimp salad, to a full-fledged entree, to thin crust pizza.  First bar I've ever seen that provides healthier options, even at 3am.5. Good Service!  Even when you're there at 2am and the place is hoppin, the bartender still manages to find you among other beer-drinkers and make sure you get your drinks.All in all- excellent.  Good food, entertainment, and cheap drinks.  Overall, this is the place is ideal- because I can get a happy buzz going on for less than 20 bux. :)

0.description: WOW! We were here for GREEK FEST and the food was AMAZING!  The lines were down the block all day and night. We had the most succulent lamb chops. They were tender, and delicious. They were made on an open charcoal grill. My husband told me his father, who was from Greece, made them the same way.(special charcoal)Everyone that I spoke with, (I love to talk) said it was the BEST FOOD AT GREEK FEST!  I also love many dishes at Spectrum.My whole family loves the Pork Kebobs, they have Greek seasonings, and I put lots of lemon on them.  The Greek Salad and Greek fries are the bomb, such delicious Feta cheese. The owner Andreas makes these Special Meatballs. They are off the charts. They only make them on the island he came from, so you won't get them anywhere else.  You have to try them. Thinking about the food makes me want to go there as soon as possible. Spectrum is all about the food and drinks, and my Family loves it!

38.description: Tiny little bar in Greek town. We had an hour to kill before dinner, so we sat here and had a beer. Bartender was nice. Not that many beers on tap, but there are the standard ones. There were only 2 other people here, so I don't think we came at the right time. It's passable.

51.description: What?! I haven't reviewed this place yet?  The only reason I can think of is of some sort of subliminal desire to forget my behavior at Spectrum, which somehow always turns from shy to relaxed to having a good time to ultimately unacceptable by any earthly standard.Don't go to Spectrum on a Friday or Saturday night.  People reserve those nights for cool bars.  Rather, the best time to come here is if for some reason you decide you'd like to go out late on a Wednesday or a Tuesday - and on these days, it's packed.  There's often a really great blues band playing - the best part, though, is the fact that this bar is always filled with weirdos.  From all walks of life.  I met this lovely young woman from Kentucky, killing time at the bar while waiting for her bus to leave.  She showed me a picture of her kids and her husband.  By the end of the night, she was making out with an Algerian cab driver on one of the tables.Another time, I found myself having to split up a fight between a transvestite that looked about seventeen years old and a die hard Ron Paul supporter wearing the mask from the movie "Scream."Everyone is puzzling here:  the guy from Australia who had a German accent and quite a bit of trouble speaking in English when drunk. The soft spoken elementary school teacher who ended up threatening to punch me in the face because I grabbed her souvlaki. The guy who looked Mexican and spoke Spanish but claimed to be from Winnipeg.   He did a tap dance number for me.Ack!  For some reason I get crazy when I walk in here too.  It's something in the beer . . .

27.description: Spectrum wait staff - if you have to ask for a bigger tip you obviously don't deserve one...

32.description: Order the souvlakia (pork kabobs)! Just like homemade!I love that this place often has live music, and though it is a bar, the food is restaurant quality.Also, if you've never been to a Greek plate breaking, this is the place to go, it was quite an experience, and very fun!

54.description: I was 'too cool' to swiftly respond to the Yelp invitation to the beer garden at Pegasus on Thursday, 26 June. The event hit capacity.But darn it, I still wanted to go out on Thursday evening, and since I had mentioned in the commentary thread for the beer garden that Spectrum, just down (or up, depending on your vista) Halsted Street was *_a 4:00 am bar_*; I concocted a parallel non-event event.Spectrum is *another* bar with which I am familiar with on a professional level. But it was not nearly as satisfying at Arno's Place. However, that was not its fault. Some of you may have known that in the span of August 1994 to April 1996, I was keenly involved with the faltering Chicago POWER indoor soccer franchise. There are World-Wide Web pages in which *I* take the blame for our catastrophic back-to-back 6-34 seasons. [In actuality, the National Professional Soccer League was running the financial aspects of the franchise. I do not have to tell you that it was squeezing pennies.] After the serious fiasco of 1994-95, in which the Rosemont Horizon gave us the cold shoulder in favor of its *new* minor league ice hockey team (We wound up playing "home" games in Rockford.), the League finally got the memo that we would be better off playing at a facility *in Chicago*. For 1995-96, it moved the bulk of our home games to the U.I.C. Pavilion. We actually had better players and some coherence in the front office that season - but the League made one crucial mistake when it decided to extrude me from doing any work for it in mid-October 1995. I had some feelers out for advertisers and sponsors for the team that season, and was in conversation with Goose Island Brwg. Co. to sponsor the green jerseys for Saint Patrick's Day for our final Chicago home game of the season [on Sunday, 17 March]. The extrusion lasted all of seven weeks. A person the League hired and was paying to be the media relations officer put out media releases with _inaccurate_ information. The feedback from other teams' media officers was swift and brutal. He quit around Thanksgiving Day (even before our Chicago home opener). I more-or-less resumed coordinating our media releases for free. [I was willing to invest in the franchise in June 1995. I didn't need its money.]The Spectrum Bar & Grill became the venue for our post-game parties. I liked its location. If I drove to the Pavilion, I learned where I could park on the nearby streets to go to post-game. I liked that you could get something good to eat just about everywhere (not necessarily at Spectrum). Lastly, Spectrum's beer prices were cheap.As it turned out, we only won *one* game in Chicago that season. Three of our "home" victories were in New Haven, CT.; and we won road games in Baltimore, MD., & Wichita, KS. [Baltimore _fired_ their head coach three days after they lost the home game to us.]The only game we won in Chicago was on Sunday, 17 March! But my extrusion meant that Goose Island had allocated its spring promotional budget by the time I got back in. John Hall offered, "Let us know for next year."Spectrum hasn't changed much since 1996. It's definitely a dive bar. But it's a quality one. I started out here with one glass of Heineken on draft ($3.50). Then I switched to a beer I nearly never have, Miller Genuine Draft on draft (Turn Turn off off that that echo echo.) ($2.50). Spectrum doesn't have Old Style or Pabst Blue Ribbon. It *does* have some interesting eastern European beers in bottles if you want to go that route. There is a digital juke box, but it's usually off in favor of XM Satellite Radio. (I can't get the hang of those. I like to learn what the juke box has, scrawl down some selections, go back to my bar stool, and marshall my playlist.) It has DirecTV dbs, but it does not subscribe to any sports packages.I had a nice time this Thursday, even though I didn't notice anyone from Pegasus visiting here afterward. [I made my cameo appearance on the rooftop at Pegasus telling all the Yelpers there that I was going over to Spectrum.]The rating was pushed up to four stars due to when the N.B.A. draft finished, and the women's basketball game finally ended on espn2 [it went triple overtime]; someone erroneously turned off the one television set which then showed the Thursday night Major League Soccer game on espn2. I asked my bartender if it could please turn the soccer game back on. The manager of the venue learned of my query, and he put the soccer game on not just that television set, but two others. Thirty minutes later, somebody made fresh (free) popcorn.[Turning it back on paid off as well. SportsCenter premiered on espn2 due to the N.B.A. draft, and when that ended, that afternoon's Euro 2008 semi-final was reshown.] I left here at 11:20 pm.Transit options: Take the Blue Line "L" to UIC / Halsted. Walk 3 blocks north. The #126 Jackson quits at midnight (11:00 pm weekends). The #8 Halsted quits at 1:15 am northbound.

48.description: How did I wait so long to review this place.  This is one of those dive looking place amongst other Greek town restaurants that have patio, rooftop deck and valet parking.  This place has none of that.The five stars goes to the cheap but fantastic food!  Greek meatballs, souvlaki, pizza, calamari...  You should really just put their number on your phone so you can call for late night take out.  I love it!

44.description: How anyone could ever rate this as better than "it sucks" beats me...After reading some reviews I decided to drop by last Friday around 9PM - I was probably the 7th person overall in there (and probably the only one with a full set of teeth and the only who had taken a shower within the last week)...I still decided to sit by the bar and get some food (to the day I still wonder why...). However after finishing half of a semi cold sandwich with more fat than meat I decided it was enough and left the place- never to come back...There were so few people and so lousy service that even if I had gone there with 20 friends it can't be a good place - I would rather force the 20 friends to sit on the floor and look into a white wall while drinking boiling hot Jaegermeister - it will still be more fun than Spectrum...

24.description: The following is written in a satirical fashion.  Please read in the voice of an 80's electronic store commercial, kinda like from Short Circuit II.
