Hey bluesman!  Don't want to hang out with college students atKingston Mines, and don't want to pay a $20 cover to get it to any of the other north side blues bar around???  Well I have a place for you!  Come on down to Spectrum Bar and Grill.  NO COVER!  GREAT BLUES!  NO DOUCHE BAGS (some weirdos, but they keep to themselves)!HURRY HURRY HURRY!PS - Tip the bluesman on the way out

7.description: Ended up here at about 2:30am on the 4th of July. I had no idea that this place existed. There was a live Blues band and they rocked! I can't wait to come back.

49.description: If you are in the city and you go anywhere for a gyro but here, it's a shame!  I have never tasted a  better gyro in my life.  Plus the serve them into the early morning hours!  Prices aren't bad either!  This is a good laid back, low key atmosphere.  For all you romantics out there who just want a good gyro and a beer, this is the place to be!

40.description: chill - but if you're their late on the weekends, the crowd gets a little weird, dawg.

53.description: Spectrum is a great late-night place to crash after you've been out drinking.  They have this pretty funny pseudo-lounge euro-trash vibe going on that I really like.  Thanks to thursday night specials on miller drafts and various chicken products, I'll definitely be back to fill up before crashing.  It should also be fun for people watching since it was packed with all kinds of people last night at 1am.

30.description: Oh Spectrum, I don't understand how you can only have eight people in your bar, yet it takes twenty minutes for me to get a draft.  If you want slow service with a side of serious attitude, this is your place. Maybe it was an off night, but I just don't get the allure. A Greek bar that blares hip hop and has a piss poor excuse for a beer list are all serious clues that this place has some identity issues that it needs to sort out.

46.description: I love Greek Food, I love the Greek culture and did I say, I love Greek Food?! Spectrum has amazing gyros and they have the best rice for some reason, not sure why but it's so good. The service is always so awesome, there booth at Greek Fest is my favorite stop every year. They have delicious "Feta Fries" omg they are to die for! My two favorite things cheese and french fries all in one. Trouble! It's not the best looking restaurant on the exterior but it's cheap, it's good and you get great service.

1.description: Food: good selection and is good and cheap.Bartender: very much "down to business" and nothing else. Drinks: about 10 beers on tap and decently priced. Think I'll come back when the live music is playing.

55.description: You can walk straight out of coal mine and into Spectrum and feel clean.  This place is dirty dirty.  But dirty dirty in a good way.  I can't remember the last time I was in a place where I met Puerto Rican coke dealers, Italian mafiosos, students, an assortment of Greeks, Serbs and other fringe Eastern Europeans, drunk ass gueys and legit prostitutes working the room.  Then again you usually don't come to Spectrum unless you are fucked in the head and need to keep drinking.  Spectrum is a 4 am bar, but if the place had no windows you would not know what time it was because for some reason real drunks hang out here.  I mean drunks that are drinking the strong stuff before noon, some even taking shots.  Maybe it is the fact that Spectrum is under a transient "hotel."  Either way, I highly recommend Spectrum if you are looking to put together a photographic portfolio of degenerate drunk bastards, most with gigantic booze schnozes, who clearly didn't get the memo about using soap.  On the other hand, it is also a good place to go if you are depressed.  If you go into Spectrum and you are depressed, after seeing the clientele the congregates here, you will walk out and never need another Prozac again.  Translation; you have a long way to fall before buying some heavy rope.  So all in all a very therapeutic experience not to be missed!

9.description: This place could use a makeover something fierce, and plays the worst music known to man, but I'm pleasantly surprised by my first visit. The food was damn decent. Good $1 tacos and $2 beer held up to a $12.00 tacos place down the street. Nice bartender, open air front is great. Now I LOVE a good horseshoe bar, But someone please call Bar Rescue and get them makeover.

26.description: Day-of-week seems to matter when Spectrum is deciding what level of service to provide patrons. From the bartenders, I've had friendly/solid service and, alternatively, brusque/inattentive service. I've been here twice and since I believe in giving the benefit of the doubt, I'll give 3 stars now and let my next visit be the tiebreaker.

25.description: We didn't order but a few appetizers and what we got was expected. The pricing was reasonable until the cost of drinks.  But that was also expected too. There was a live band which we enjoyed, but caution: the place is loud.

12.description: Great place, great service and bartenders are very friendly. The prices are decent comparing to other Chicago bars. Highly recommended !!!

59.description: This place is my guilty pleasure.  Talk about a dive bar!!  It's smoky, some drunks, some I'd even categorized as alcoholics.  But I just love their pork souvlaki and their meatballs (can't remember the greek name).  They are the reason why I put on 10 lbs since I moved into West loop!

21.description: Went here on a Thursday night around 11pm. Wasn't crowded at all. The place is dimly lit, with only real lighting from the TVs and the bar section (from what I remember).. Ordered the Calamari and a Greek Burger. Both were made decently, and was awesome drunk food. I'm sure they are decent when not drunk too. Their serving sizes are enough. The calamari had about 15 pieces and was really good in my opinion. The Greek burger was large, just about right if you are very hungry. Otherwise I don't see myself finishing it. Prices were decent, in fact lower than I expected. Seemed like a very clean bar too.

17.description: Besides the slow wait for food, it wasn't off putting at all...until I got my check. For a small bar, you'd think they would AT LEAST have table numbers, or a solid memory for the 4 people in the bar on a slow Monday afternoon, instead of labeling me as their 'Asian' customer on my receipt. Rude.

10.description: Its a beautiful bar..its quite n a lovely ambience to hangout with your girl or with friends...great service and good choice of drinks to keep u continue for the night..good choice of music which plays in the background..i think visit once and u would love it...

5.description: I can't believe anyone would eat here.  It stinks like bathroom disinfectant even with the windows open.   My friends got some pitchers.   They seemed pleased with the price point.   Cheap beer...if that's all you're looking for...

3.description: Awesome local bar to start or end your night.. Open till 4am!!.. They have a blues band on Saturday around 9 that is not bad and no cover. Waitresses are cute, but my favorite thing is the cheesy pizza. Nothing better before or after a night of drinking. Do yourself a favor and order a pepperoni, olive and green pepper pie.. Definitely not organic ingredients, but its amazing.

35.description: Personally, I like bars that serve greek food. And I like diverse crowds. And on Saturdays, they have blues.However, this is another place where fancy people should absolutely never go. Don't be tempted, it's just not made for fancy people.Here's where my mind kinda gets blown: late at night it smells like smoke. I don't smoke, and I don't usually like it. But this place gives me a feeling of classic Chicago from the 80s/early 90s. The kinda place that could make an appearance in Blues Brothers.Everyone in here probably has a story. It might not be fancy, but it's a different sorta place to go.

19.description: Walked in here and the place was completely empty.  The waiters seemed to have a problem that we walked in.  The fries and feta were good. The cocktails were ok.

28.description: They get a late crowd due to the fact that they stay open until 4-5am. I arrived at approximately 1:30am, because I like to party. There were only a few people, but  many others swarmed in shortly after.I enjoyed the fact that their kitchen seemingly stays open as late as the bar itself, so all the booze hounds can order something to grub on. I had a gyro plate with fries, and it wasn't exceptional, but pretty good. I witnessed the live blues band, who only sang about the women who betrayed them. I can get on board with that! Which is rare because I seldom care for live music.I wasn't too thrilled about the service, however. Particularly, the vacant responses we recieved whenever we asked for something. It was clear the bartenders/servers couldn't give negative asses of rats about anything. Too much jerk face also. The beer selection was weak. Where is this cheap beer people keep talking about? I overheard some guy order a bottle of Miller Lite, and it was $5 (WTF?). I would have been fine paying $5.50 for Blue Moon in 2006 when everybody thought was the best beer ever made, but those days are over. Not a place I'd want to spend an entire night, but for an after hours place, it's still okay.

45.description: I don't know what it is about Spectrum but it usually yields a good time. The food is okay for Greek bar food, but definitely hits the spot after some late night boozing and darts. It's true, this place is a little on the grimy side, but it's oh-so-good-grimy. The right level of creeptastic and shitsandgiggles good times. If you're with the right group of people, Spectrum doesn't disappoint.

33.description: Met a friend here from out of town. First clue when I walked in was he was the only one here.Service - horrible. Clearly didn't want to be there. Beer was funny tasting - soapy. Soda in drink was flat flat flat.Not a fan. They must still be in business due to already buzzed after hours customer base.

43.description: I went there once with a group of friends after work on a Friday night. The place was fairly empty, so we figured we would get decent service. The waitress approached our table and immediately started having issues with us as we were placing orders for drinks. Those issues were such awful things as wanting to pay with a credit and asking for separate bills. Oh NO! The waitress literally stood at our table in a tantrum while we sat there and watched. I kid you not, I have never seen anything like it. Anyway, our drinks arrived and they were great. Appetizers were excellent, too. Then, our crazy waitress went home for the night and another one had to pick through the mess she made. We felt so bad for her, as the crazy waitress did not even write down what we ordered and only listed the prices. The poor girl sat with us as we tried to figure out how much our drinks were and who should pay what. We left a big tip for the 2nd waitress, because she was great, but the experience with the psycho waitress has kept us away from this place for good.

2.description: Came here late at night (open til 4am) a few Saturdays ago. I was treated incredibly disrespectfully by the bouncer. I went outside to have a smoke and when I tried to come back in I was informed that the bar was closing and I was refused reentry.I tried to walk past this man and he aggressively blocked my progress through the doorway, causing my head to hit the door frame and while hitting my mouth in the process.I am sure it was an accident on his part but the next morning I had to go to the ER at Rush Hospital to get 6 stitches in my mouth.It did not only lose $300 dollars paying for the ER, but I lost complete and total respect for this establishment.A business is only as good as the people that represent it. This gentleman has completely changed the way I view Spectrum. I now shudder at the thought of just walking past this place.

18.description: The following is written in a satirical fashion.  Please read in the voice of an 80's electronic store commercial, kinda like from Short Circuit II. Hey bluesman!  Don't want to hang out with college students atKingston Mines, and don't want to pay a $20 cover to get it to any of the other north side blues bar around???  Well I have a place for you!  Come on down to Spectrum Bar and Grill.  NO COVER!  GREAT BLUES!  NO DOUCHE BAGS (some weirdos, but they keep to themselves)!HURRY HURRY HURRY!PS - Tip the bluesman on the way out

41.description: Who would've thought that this little bar would have the best food in Greektown?  I think the owner's true calling was to be a restaurant owner, because the food is pure deliciousness, and so cheap!  My fave: the Halloumi Panini, it is the Zeus of grilled cheese sandwiches.  My second fave: their thin crust pizza, yum.  And they make the BEST saganaki, or flaming cheese.  When I want to add an "OPA!" to my day, I hit Spectrum!

52.description: 1.50 chicken or pork souvlakis and 2$ MGD's are just some of the late night specials just this past Thurs night. Great for poor med students. Most of us got the chicken. The meat came on skewers accompanied with some diced tomatoes and onions and some of the fluffiest, toastiest pita bread around. I wasn't so much a fan of the chicken as it was dry and tough but the pita bread was spectacular. Toasted that was nearly too hot to touch at first, tasty and chewy. Once could tell it definitely wasn't just out of the freezer and heated. Laugh all you want but that pita seriously mesmerized me. I wasn't even hungry and ate it all anyway. Buffalo wings were also a surprise treat. This is where all the tenderness of the chicken kebabs went. The meat was flavorful and juicy and it wasn't TOO greasy. Mushroom poppers were also fresh, though zit inducing with the fried breaded outside. Careful if you eat it right away, the mushroom juices can be hot and squirt everywhere!I wasn't too keen on the ubiquitous techno music boppin' over our heads but the crowd was eclectic, the waitress accommodating.  A relatively healthier and different choice for late nite dining in Chicago.

50.description: This place gets 5 stars just for letting me in. No, I'm not a hobit or anything but I've never seen the inside of this place before 2am. So when I stumble in and fumble around in my purse for like 10 mins looking for my ID, then pull it out of my back pocket, and slur something like "geesh i knew it wath there aaaalll along" and you still take my drink order? You're the most awesome of the awesome. Oooh, ready for my epiphany?  The call this place 'spectrum' because the folks here range from one end of the 'spectrum' to the other! Genius right? Yeah, I know.

4.description: Came here a few times in the past and the food was very decent. Now, no fish on the menu, less than average bar food. The staff is nice enough and lots of TV to follow sports makes it a good local dive..but the change in menu was a real disappointment. I can't recommend but suggest you give it a try.

6.description: My husband came here two nights in a row while on a work trip, and I joined him here the second night. It's sort of a divey sports bar and seems like a fun local hang out. They have a full menu of food, which is better than typical bar food. The staff was hard working and friendly, and even gave my husband a free shot when he said he was new in town. They had the Blackhawks game on all the TVs when I was there, and we ordered Greek pizza and Greek fries (when in Greektown...) which were good. I'd recommend it for a chill place to watch a game and get decent food.

22.description: Walked in here and the place was completely empty.  The waiters seemed to have a problem that we walked in.  The fries and feta were good. The cocktails were ok.

15.description: They get a late crowd due to the fact that they stay open until 4-5am. I arrived at approximately 1:30am, because I like to party. There were only a few people, but  many others swarmed in shortly after.I enjoyed the fact that their kitchen seemingly stays open as late as the bar itself, so all the booze hounds can order something to grub on. I had a gyro plate with fries, and it wasn't exceptional, but pretty good. I witnessed the live blues band, who only sang about the women who betrayed them. I can get on board with that! Which is rare because I seldom care for live music.I wasn't too thrilled about the service, however. Particularly, the vacant responses we recieved whenever we asked for something. It was clear the bartenders/servers couldn't give negative asses of rats about anything. Too much jerk face also. The beer selection was weak. Where is this cheap beer people keep talking about? I overheard some guy order a bottle of Miller Lite, and it was $5 (WTF?). I would have been fine paying $5.50 for Blue Moon in 2006 when everybody thought was the best beer ever made, but those days are over. Not a place I'd want to spend an entire night, but for an after hours place, it's still okay.

57.description: Had a work Xmas party here last night and it is definitely a dive type bar but I thought the food was great!  Had the gyros and I felt it was some of the best I've ever had and the cucumber sauce was dynamite!The shishkabob had good flavor and seasoned just right.  I also tried the spinach pie and that tasted pretty good as well.I can't say what the bar feels like on a regular night but I thought the food was pretty good and I will make a point of stopping in again.

20.description: Way to overpriced for this place and the food isn't that good , also the service was really slow. There are much better bars close by than spectrum

36.description: I've been going here for years, and it's always an adventure.  First of all, nice facelift!  I hadn't been here in well over a month, and just went and visited-- the place has been COMPLETELY re-done.  There's a lot more open space, and the best part of all the renovations are the windows.., the floor-to-ceiling windows on Halsted now completely open to the outside, making the place that much roomier.  Also, the menu's been redone.  There are more burger selections and some new apps... I'm just glad that they've left my favorites-- the souvlaki (pork kabobs) and the greek meatballs (sheftalies or something like that).  The only thing I wish this place added to the menu is dessert!!!I love this place, and it's always a great time.  The owner really makes us feel special whenever we go.  The drinks are stiff and pretty cheap, and the crowd is always changing, though if you visit enough, you'll always find a couple of familiar faces.

14.description: late night food and beer.  diverse crowd. This place is great.

58.description: Um, YUM. Seriously.I went to Pegasus recently for a work lunch and was very impressed by the food as well as the service. Everything I tried was excellent, but I'd recommend the saganaki (flaming cheese), the spicy feta, the hummus, and the lamb shank in tomato sauce. Our server was fantastic as well and made great recommendations. If you're in the mood for Greek, look no further.

56.description: Nice atmosphere, decent food decent service. Not a bad experience, but probably won't be going back.

29.description: A great roof top patio!!!

42.description: This is my all time favorite restaurant in Greek town... I always get the chicken mom soup, grilled octopus and calamari, and the whole fish filleted at the table... My guest had the roast chicken... That was just average. Service is always a 10 and drinks are great, but they are pricey so beware. They also play a Greek radio station that you will either love or hate.

23.description: Had diner there on Saturday night. We arrived around 8PM and the place wasn't fully booked inside - but they had a little bit of waiting for their rooftop, so we decided to seat inside.A friend who never had Greek food was here with me, so I wanted to give him a nice overview of this delicious cuisine.We first ordered Haloumi as appetizers - they were really good, small portions but very tasty.Then, he had the Pikilia #1, which seemed to be very good. He had me tried some of the dishes and they were all very good. I ordered Spanakopita, I had a small appetite that night, but it was extremely tasty.Also their bread is good - this is something I like a lot in Greek restaurants, the bread and butter.Finally, service was really good, our waiter was extremely nice to us - I appreciate a lot!Great experience!

47.description: Went there using a groupon, usually go to Greek islands or Parthenon.  Bread basket was soggy, not like the crisp bakery fresh breads at the others.  Flaming cheese, saganaki had a weird bitter taste, not as good as Greek island or Parthenon.  The waitress even seemed afraid of lighting the cheese!We then for the main course, tried the gyros - real crisp and tender, sliced lamb - good but not warm and could of used a gravy, Greek lasagna - good, spinach cheese pie tasted like it had just been reheated; again not comparable in quality to the Parthenon or Greek island.Overall it was worth it since we had a groupon, but without it I wouldn't come back.  The overall quality is better at the others.

8.description: I've eaten at most of the Greektown establishments over the years and recently tried Pegasus for the first time.   It pales in comparison to the nearby standards in terms of service, food quality and value.I was part of a decent-sized party on a Friday evening (8:00 reservation and the dining room was 2/3 full when we were seated for context) and we were there for 2 1/2+ hours and only 2 of us had drinks and no one ordered dessert.   The server would be around but wouldn't offer to refill drinks.   We received 1 basket of bread and even after ordering a tzatziki appetizer, two orders of saganaki and other dishes, weren't asked about or offered more bread until after ordering dinner.Beers were room temperature-a frosted mug only does so much.  Entrees and sides were average at best.  Pork souvlaki was the best item that 2 of us ordered.   Potatoes and rice were bland, and moussaka, a staple at Greek restaurants had almost no béchamel sauce and was dry.I was fairly surprised at the total bill-I am ready to spend money when dining out and particularly in Chicago-but didn't feel it was worth the price.  I'll revisit other spots and recommend others do the same.

31.description: I've eaten at most of the Greektown establishments over the years and recently tried Pegasus for the first time.   It pales in comparison to the nearby standards in terms of service, food quality and value.I was part of a decent-sized party on a Friday evening (8:00 reservation and the dining room was 2/3 full when we were seated for context) and we were there for 2 1/2+ hours and only 2 of us had drinks and no one ordered dessert.   The server would be around but wouldn't offer to refill drinks.   We received 1 basket of bread and even after ordering a tzatziki appetizer, two orders of saganaki and other dishes, weren't asked about or offered more bread until after ordering dinner.Beers were room temperature-a frosted mug only does so much.  Entrees and sides were average at best.  Pork souvlaki was the best item that 2 of us ordered.   Potatoes and rice were bland, and moussaka, a staple at Greek restaurants had almost no béchamel sauce and was dry.I was fairly surprised at the total bill-I am ready to spend money when dining out and particularly in Chicago-but didn't feel it was worth the price.  I'll revisit other spots and recommend others do the same.

34.description: So after a pretty good meal I will NEVER be back to this restaurant again!! After we ate the waitress gave Teresa the bill which was around $64. She gave her 70 and told her no change needed. As she walked down the stairs the waitress asked her if the service was okay. She says yes why do u ask? Waitress then says because u tipped me so low. A bill like this is normally a 20% tip. Teresa went in her pocket to give her another $8 and walked down the stairs. Yep I had something to say once she told me what happened. First of all I'm not required to tip you anything and u will not tell me how much to tip. Not to mention I'm sure that comment would have never been made to the two couples sitting on either side of us. We went back to speak to the manager who basically said there was nothing he could do and got agitated with us and got in our faces. I will be calling to speak with the owner and like I told the manager they will never get my business again!! Feel free to share this status.

16.description: The service was great and that's why I gave 4 stars. The staff was friendly and courteous. Free valet parking was a plus! Ability to make reservations on Open Table app was nice too. The food was good. Saganaki is always a crowd favorite an was great. The mussels had good flavor as our appetizers. My main entree off the specials menu of the Lamb was pretty good. I wish it had more au jus on the plate. My lamb chops were good but tended to be slightly dry and over cooked. The spinach rice kind of disappointed me, it had a creamy spinach mixed into the rice which was also mushy. The 2 put together had the same texture and I thought it would have been better with a harder rice texture. My wife had the oven roasted chicken, which was really good. The roasted vegetables and potatoes were done perfectly. We also splurged on the desserts with the baklava and rice pudding. The baklava was made just right with the texture and not over powered with the syrup. The rice pudding was made nicely as well. All in all it was a good time with good food and great service.

13.description: So the food is closer to a 3 just because it's very very salty and you will need a lot of liquids for the night. However, our service was excellent and we were given pretty good recommendations. Plus, the rooftop dining area gave us a relaxing late afternoon in the sunshine and breeze. Basically, an overall pleasant trip had me rounding this up to a 4.  I came for post-work tapas with 3 of my co-workers and we very much indulged in a whole slew of dishes after a busy day. I think tapas are a great option for small groups that want to try a ton of different plates at a reasonable price. I would recommend getting a couple of dishes to start off and then adding more if stomach allows.Soutzoukia - The meat balls are delicious but the sauce tastes like Greek pasta sauce. Skippable or not depending on how much you really like meatballs. Gyros - Awesome! Comes with lots of beef and lamb. Very flavorful but salty to the max.Dolma - Excellent homemade yogurt sauce on the side. The dolma was standard.Souvlakia - Pork kabobs! One of my favorite plates but also very salty.Arni Kebob - A good choice if you're into lamb. I thought this was just average but lamb isn't really my thing. Melitzanosalata - This grilled eggplant spread with pita bread is such a good appetizer if you're looking for a lighter type of spread. Tirokafteri - This one is a spicy feta and cheesy spread with pita. I wouldn't say this was spicy at all and it's heavier and saltier than the eggplant one but I still enjoyed it.

11.description: Was craving seafood, but was unfortunate enough to be located in the Midwest region. However, I was told that this place's probably got one of the best seafood cuisine in Chicago. On top of that, I never had Greek cuisine before, so naturally I had to give it a go. I heard a lot about the infamous appetizer known as the "flaming cheese". The waiter brought it over and literally lit the cheese on fire on a metal plate that is also abundant in alcohol and olive oil. The flaming process fried the cheese and gave it a crispy exterior while maintaining an interior of melted cheese. Exquisite!  My sister in law also ordered baby octopus as an appetizer. They not only grilled the baby octopus to give it a little charred flavor, but it was so well done that the texture of the octopus transformed from soft to chewy. Talk about satisfaction!For main dish, I chose to go with lamb cut with seasoned artichoke hearts. I find myself astounded by the texture of the lamb. For it to be so juicy and tender requires a lot of work, especially for lamb. The dish is covered with a cheesy sauce that appear heavy at first, but surprisingly easy to eat. Definitely would come here more often if not for the fact that I am watching my weight...but hey! Treating yourself once in awhile can't hurt :)

39.description: I've enjoyed Pegasus for many years now.  It is my favorite Greektown restaurant.  The menu offerings and prices are reasonable.  Staff is very accommodating, even when I recently had to revise large party reservation twice including the evening of a birthday dinner.

37.description: Went here as they opened there upstairs for the summer.  NEVER AGAIN!!   While the food was average at best, the service was horrible,  The check had $50 worth of mistakes on a $120 tab.  We asked for corrections at first $6 was corrected.  Pointed out it was not all corrected, another $20 was corrected and finally after a 3rd time we had all corrected except for an extra appetizer, but at that point we gave up.  2 weeks later received credit card bill.  It was more than $30 than the bill. This place is not worth the hassle.  There are so many Greek Restaurants within a block radius I would recommend another.

0.description: Despite the bad reviews we read, my boyfriend and I decided to try this place out. We have never been to any restaurants in Greek Town so we have nothing to compare our experience to.We asked our server for a white wine recommendation and he offered us a taste of one of his recommendations and it was very good and spot on with what we liked. We ordered the saganaki for an appetizer and we were not disappointed.I ordered the lamb kebob special and my boyfriend ordered the gyro plate and both of us were very satisfied with our selections. Both were very large portions and I had to get some of mine wrapped up to go. The bus boy was very kind and even packaged up some extra tzatziki sauce for me!We got the chocolate mousse cake for dessert and it was just right for us at the end of the very filling meal. Overall we were very pleased with our wait staff and our experience overall!

38.description: Give it a pass. Terrible bread, terrible salad, terrible waiter. Charged us $l.75 for 4 pieces of feta when we ordered a salad for 4 that came with 2 small pieces of feta and 4 small slices of tomato. Wasn't even a real Greek Salad. Had to send back one of their specials. Bill was still $85.00 per couple.

51.description: As a native Chicagoan I've had Greek food many times. As a Greek person, I've had good Greek food, too. Last night, Pegasus did a superb job of 'getting it right' so I had to let you know.I got the combo#1. The dolmas (grape leaves stuffed with meat and rice) were authentic and delicious. I'm tired of places giving out the cold, rice only version which I read as "cheap" so this gets extra credit in my book. The gyros strips were dry and should have been tossed out IMO but I had come for authentic Greek food. The spinach pie was a delight, much like grandma used to make. Even the potato gets high marks! They put chicken in the egg lemon soup which I'm not accustomed to so we'll give that a plus as well.I also had a Greek brandy Metaxa for $5. I had just paid $7 for the exact brand an hour before, just a block away.The main dining room is open and painted white with bright blue trim, like the Greek flag and houses by the sea. You know I'll be back.

27.description: We headed to the rooftop on a perfect Friday summer night. Free valet service, no parking headaches, pleasant and speedy service.We were seated within minutes, though the place was pretty full. Waters on tables within minutes, rolls, too. Our server, Bojanna, brought menus promptly, and wine list when we requested it. We chose a young, light, Greek white. Refreshing, and delicious. Tableside chiller. Small plates only on the rooftop! We started with saganaki, not served aflame, but hot, fresh, and good. Horiatiki salad, fresh and light. Zucchini chips, shrimp on a skewer, meatballs with potatoes. All tasty, except sauce for meatballs was a bit too salty for my taste.We finished the evening with rice pudding and a couple of Greek coffees -strong, small and smooth, as they should be. Server was very helpful and friendly, gave great info and suggestions. Great atmosphere, skyline view. The only bad part is the season up there is so short. Can't wait to return. Opaa!

32.description: Great night to sit out on the patio. They have a separate small plates menu for the patio which is top notch. Recommend the gyro and flaming cheese!

54.description: Worst service I have received in decades from any restaurant.  With so many competing restaurants in Greektown, I would have expected something much better.Normally we go to Greek Islands, but found a parking space and wanted to try a different restaurant--perhaps a different experience.  I suppose we can claim "victory" on that goal, it was certain a "different" experience, but pyrrhic.  I would type more, but why bother.

48.description: Was craving seafood, but was unfortunate enough to be located in the Midwest region. However, I was told that this place's probably got one of the best seafood cuisine in Chicago. On top of that, I never had Greek cuisine before, so naturally I had to give it a go. I heard a lot about the infamous appetizer known as the "flaming cheese". The waiter brought it over and literally lit the cheese on fire on a metal plate that is also abundant in alcohol and olive oil. The flaming process fried the cheese and gave it a crispy exterior while maintaining an interior of melted cheese. Exquisite!  My sister in law also ordered baby octopus as an appetizer. They not only grilled the baby octopus to give it a little charred flavor, but it was so well done that the texture of the octopus transformed from soft to chewy. Talk about satisfaction!For main dish, I chose to go with lamb cut with seasoned artichoke hearts. I find myself astounded by the texture of the lamb. For it to be so juicy and tender requires a lot of work, especially for lamb. The dish is covered with a cheesy sauce that appear heavy at first, but surprisingly easy to eat. Definitely would come here more often if not for the fact that I am watching my weight...but hey! Treating yourself once in awhile can't hurt :)

44.description: We went here for our last meal before heading back. We've been wanting to try Greek in Chicago, and this place was a GREAT representation of what Greek food is!! When you first get there, they offer complimentary valet!!!!  When you enter the restaurant, the atmosphere was very nice. Tablecloths on the tables, candles lit, and then lots of color!! The welcome in was very nice and made me feel at home. It's important to be "inviting" upon arrival. When we sat down there was bread of different kinds brought to the table, with a tall bottle of olive oil to be poured on the plates for dipping the bread in. We ordered the Saganaki, which is also known as "the flaming cheese". They have the cheese centered and pour Greek alcohol on it, then light it in fire......followed by the ever so popular word, "OPA"... It was time to try the cheese, and it was delicious!!!  We ordered a fantastic Greek salad with kalamata olives, fresh tomatoes, onions, and lemon juice with olive oil....topped with a nice squared slice of feta cheese, (of which we both wished there was more of)..For the main dishes we ordered the Kotopoulo Fournou and the Moshari Tashkebob. The Kotopoulo is a half chicken with oregano, olive oil, and lemon juice. It is served with potato riganatti and roasted vegetables. The Moshari is beef cooked in a wine tomato sauce served over rice pilaf, which happens to be Orzo. These dishes had so much flavor, it was unbelieveable!!!It was an overall amazing dinner, and it was beautiful!!!  We are definitely going back there!!! *****If you're going to Chicago or if you live there and haven't been to this place. Please go there!!!!! I promise you won't be disappointed and you will be thanking me later!!!***** OPA!!!!!!

24.description: I went there for a business social event up on the roof. The staff was very nice and the buffet style meal we had was very good. I remember having the hummus, pita bread, chicken skewers, some fancy yummy cheese thing. The ambience is great. The location is easy to get to. The free valet parking is extremely convenient. I can't say anything about the table service since I was there for a group event, but I would recommend this place for anyone looking for some quality Greek food in Chicago.

7.description: First off, this is NOT the best Greek restaurant in Greek town. That would be, hands down, Greek Islands. If Greek seafood is what you want in a more intimate environment, without the noise and ooopa, then Santorini is the place. But, if you would like a warm friendly place to go, drink some reasonably priced cocktails and eat some decently good Greek, after parking your car with free valet parking, in Greek town .............. all while sitting on the nicest rooftop patio in or around the Chicago loop, then Pegasus is the ONLY place to go. Seriously, the Pegasus rooftop is great. Now if only Greek Islands food was served there.

49.description: Sat at the bar.  Bartender was very nice and helpful.  The specialty cocktails were good.  We only ordered tzatziki for an appetizer.  But if that is a reflection of the rest of their menu it was horrible.  So overwhelmed with garlic we couldn't even taste the cucumber.  Horrible!  Also the lighting in the main dining room is way to brite.  Turn the lights down a little, create some atmosphere.  Would not return.

40.description: Greeks are beautiful, engaging, and help elevate a party to a memorable celebration.  Our guide tonight was no exception!   GiGi, an amazing server at Pegasus, was very attentive and personable. Best service received in the city so far and I've lived here since 1999.

53.description: Fabulous food and very friendly staff... Will defiantly be back.

30.description: The highlight of the visit was definitely our server. He made our meal much more enjoyable. We were nearing the end of our vacation and had a very cranky toddler when we met up with family here. The server was so kind and friendly with our son. Our son absolutely loved him. Probably because he kept giving my son treats like cherries. Then he would yell "opa!" For my son which he loved and mimicked for the rest of the day. The food was great. Plenty of food was served to us. I had saganaki, salad, moussaka and baklava. Everything tasted fresh and delicious. Valet was kind enough to help us flag down a taxi afterwards. I just wish the rooftop patio had been open.

46.description: We went to Pegasus last night with an acquaintance who was staying at a nearby hotel. We had a wonderful time thanks to our waiter, named Frank. Our friend has a gluten allergy, so our flaming saganaki was specially cut fresh cheese with no flour in deference to his needs.  He also had roasted chicken stuffed with feta and spinach which he enjoyed. I had fried zucchini from the appetizers with fantastic tzaziki sauce. The yogurt in the cucumber sauce tasted very fresh. We had wonderful Greek coffee for dessert. We mentioned that we were Caeser fans, thanks to reading his interesting responses here on Yelp, and although he wasn't there to meet last night, I could tell they were a bit surprised he has a fan club! Friendly service, good food, what's not to like?

1.description: Our friends invited us & we thought we had a reservation - there was a show at9 pm and  95 percent of the tables were empty - the manager said they were booked - what a disaster!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!We did get seated - my husbands glass of water had a chip out of it the size of an inch by too inches. We had appetizers, and our friends stayed on for dinner. We left at 9:40 and still half the tables were empty.

55.description: I wanted to like this place. I really did. I heard about it from a friend of mine who highly recommended this joint for some authentic Greek food. I think they forgot to make Greek food; it was more like low-budget Italian food. Think a step below the Olive Garden. My dish had so much oil in it I had to pour it out on a separate plate, and it was suffocated in a garlicky cheese. There are places out south that I can go to get the same quality of food for seven dollars a plate, but with more flavor. However these plates cost an astronomical 20 bucks each. My husband and I also got mixed drinks, which were also horrible. My husband's drink was very watery, and mine had way too much thyme syrup. I only drank about a quarter of it. How horrible! It's Christmas Eve! I want a buzz not a sugar rush. * insert sad face* We also had the meatball appetizer, which tasted more like an authentic Greek dish so if anything get that, even though that was only just okay as well. Overall I think this place would've been right on time for a greasy spoon joint if the prices mirrored the quality of the food and I was drunk and hungry as hell. I'm definitely never eating Greek food in the city again. I'll just have to travel to Greece for the real deal. Service was great though!

9.description: Had diner there on Saturday night. We arrived around 8PM and the place wasn't fully booked inside - but they had a little bit of waiting for their rooftop, so we decided to seat inside.A friend who never had Greek food was here with me, so I wanted to give him a nice overview of this delicious cuisine.We first ordered Haloumi as appetizers - they were really good, small portions but very tasty.Then, he had the Pikilia #1, which seemed to be very good. He had me tried some of the dishes and they were all very good. I ordered Spanakopita, I had a small appetite that night, but it was extremely tasty.Also their bread is good - this is something I like a lot in Greek restaurants, the bread and butter.Finally, service was really good, our waiter was extremely nice to us - I appreciate a lot!Great experience!

26.description: A really nice dinner here. Started with a big bowl of avgolemono, a rich cream of chicken with rice soup that you squeeze a half lemon into before enjoying, accompanied by a loaf of good Greek white bread, with its crisp crust covered in sesame seeds, dipped in excellent Greek olive oil.  For my main course I had "Pikalia #2", one of the two combo specials. A huge plate of lamb, chicken, rice, pastitsio (kind of a lasagne of elbow macaroni and ground beef), spinakopita spinach pie and potato. To drink, I had a 500 Ml bottle of cold retsina, a white wine flavored with pine, which is a bit of an acquired taste, but if you 'get it" is crisp and refreshing, cutting through the richness of the food.  I then carried my last glass of wine up to the rooftop deck, with it's breathtaking view of the skyline, to toast the sunset. It wasn't quite like drinking to the sunset in Santorini, but close enough.

25.description: A group of 4 went here Thursday 7-30-15. It was beautiful outside so we went to the rooftop. We arrived at 5:45 p.m. and were able to be seated immediately (do not take reservations for rooftop). From the time we were greeted by the Host, Seated on the rooftop by the upstairs Host and served by Ramon (awesome fun individual) the experience was 5 star. The best part besides being on the rooftop and having a great view was the food was great (only serve tapas size dishes) and the bill for 8- dishes (more than enough food) and 7 drinks was $155 before tip (we left 30% for the great service). When we arrived and left the Valet (complimentary) was also very polite and appreciative for the tip. We cannot wait to go back.

12.description: The food was fantastic. Saganaki X 2. The portion size of the gyro appetizer was huge. The 3 meatballs appetizer were excellent and huge. The only negative was our server was grumpy and slow.  15 minutes to get a glass of wine.

59.description: I believe that, among all the restaurants we go to, this is probably the worst. No wonder all the Greek ones nearby are busier than this one. I was at the Walgreens across the street and thought I'd drop by for a protein filled salad at 3pm. I requested the ribeye Roka salad. Asked the waiter what's in it, he said it has Roka (green leaves), ribeye slices and dressing with balsamic and oil. i asked to add tomatoes and onions. 25 minutes later (the place was totally empty except for 1 table), here comes the salad. The roka leaves were whitish and it smelled like cheese. i couldnt swallow it because of how strong the cheese taste was, and there was no balsamic anything. The meat was way too geasy. i told him he didnt say there was cheese, he first said there was no cheese, then i showed it to him and he said "well some cheese is sprinkled over it". He went to get another one and came back after 15 minutes. Same extremely greasy meat (50% was grease), no tomatoes, and the dressing which was on the side, came with red cooking vinegar and oil. i started coughing because the vinegar irritated my throat so bad i had to dilute it with more oil to be able to swallow it. The waiter didn't even ask if this time the salad was ok. i didnt want to return this plate too, but that is the first and the last time i go to this place.

21.description: I'm giving four stars because of the rooftop. The view is great and the atmosphere is awesome as well. Great place for small plates and wine. Love the dolmates.

17.description: We went here for our last meal before heading back. We've been wanting to try Greek in Chicago, and this place was a GREAT representation of what Greek food is!! When you first get there, they offer complimentary valet!!!!  When you enter the restaurant, the atmosphere was very nice. Tablecloths on the tables, candles lit, and then lots of color!! The welcome in was very nice and made me feel at home. It's important to be "inviting" upon arrival. When we sat down there was bread of different kinds brought to the table, with a tall bottle of olive oil to be poured on the plates for dipping the bread in. We ordered the Saganaki, which is also known as "the flaming cheese". They have the cheese centered and pour Greek alcohol on it, then light it in fire......followed by the ever so popular word, "OPA"... It was time to try the cheese, and it was delicious!!!  We ordered a fantastic Greek salad with kalamata olives, fresh tomatoes, onions, and lemon juice with olive oil....topped with a nice squared slice of feta cheese, (of which we both wished there was more of)..For the main dishes we ordered the Kotopoulo Fournou and the Moshari Tashkebob. The Kotopoulo is a half chicken with oregano, olive oil, and lemon juice. It is served with potato riganatti and roasted vegetables. The Moshari is beef cooked in a wine tomato sauce served over rice pilaf, which happens to be Orzo. These dishes had so much flavor, it was unbelieveable!!!It was an overall amazing dinner, and it was beautiful!!!  We are definitely going back there!!! *****If you're going to Chicago or if you live there and haven't been to this place. Please go there!!!!! I promise you won't be disappointed and you will be thanking me later!!!***** OPA!!!!!!

10.description: We headed to the rooftop on a perfect Friday summer night. Free valet service, no parking headaches, pleasant and speedy service.We were seated within minutes, though the place was pretty full. Waters on tables within minutes, rolls, too. Our server, Bojanna, brought menus promptly, and wine list when we requested it. We chose a young, light, Greek white. Refreshing, and delicious. Tableside chiller. Small plates only on the rooftop! We started with saganaki, not served aflame, but hot, fresh, and good. Horiatiki salad, fresh and light. Zucchini chips, shrimp on a skewer, meatballs with potatoes. All tasty, except sauce for meatballs was a bit too salty for my taste.We finished the evening with rice pudding and a couple of Greek coffees -strong, small and smooth, as they should be. Server was very helpful and friendly, gave great info and suggestions. Great atmosphere, skyline view. The only bad part is the season up there is so short. Can't wait to return. Opaa!

5.description: Had a great time at Pegasus last night. My girlfriend and I came here before the Bulls game. I made a reservation for 5:30 but traffic on the way down to Greektown from the suburbs was horrible so we didn't get there until 6. The staff was very understanding and sat us right away. Our server Howard was very friendly and prompt and even got us an extra high flame on our saganaki, which was amazing. We also ordered the dolmades, gyro plate, and shrimp and feta all of which were delicious. Over all really great experience.

3.description: A) I am well aware the Greek wine I ordered was not a sherry, I did not mention anything about sherry when ordering. I don't drink sweet wine, most sherries are actually not sweet FYIB) Server was a condescending snob, grouchy 70 something year old. C) Yes I asked for more tomatoes, when I asked server shook his head and stormed off.D) What the hell does it mean when I, as a paying customer, is asked by my server, "your not from around here, are you?" Supposed to mean? F) I did not order feta, I ordered goat cheese. The server said the goat cheese was from Malta. Yes it was highly salty compared to what I have had at other establishments nearby. I can assure you all of my experiences in my original review are accurate. Thank you for your concern.

35.description: The food was fantastic. Saganaki X 2. The portion size of the gyro appetizer was huge. The 3 meatballs appetizer were excellent and huge. The only negative was our server was grumpy and slow.  15 minutes to get a glass of wine.

19.description: Food was amazing! Missed a star all because the water service delayed and I was thirsty. Other than that, nice environment. Friendly staff. OPA!

28.description: BEWARE BEWARE BEWAREValet Service hit my car while parking then lied that they did not do it. They took a picture of the damage one hour after arrival claiming this is how they got it.  $1000 in damagesFood: extremely poor quality, tasteless, cheap ingredients and low quantities. Chicken ws not edible and tasted like rubber. Pair that with sweaty, smelly servers who are running around hitting customers. Worst of all - ZERO customer service. Prepare to wait for a long time between servings to get bad, cheap food. Atmosphere is very cheap with roof seating that looks like rooftop ghetto. I cannot in good faith recommend this place.

45.description: My party consisted of myself and daughter on our first visit to Chicago from Montana and her boyfriend who lives here. Knowing we wanted to try something different, he suggested we try Greek. we arrived and were greeted and seated. Our waitress Gigi was very attentive and described several dishes to us. We ordered our food and then a bottle of wine. Everything was very good. We had lamb, a baked shrimp and orzo pasta dish and spanikopta. I rarely  order desert, but we were enjoying ourselves so much and everything was so good, we indulged. Great food, great service!

33.description: Love love this place. I never actually dine in but I order carry out. There lamb is out of this world delicious. Great portion. Brooke, Howie and the staff are one of industry greats. Seriously there always go above and beyond service. Now back to the lamb!!

43.description: If you go to Pegasus, I hope you get to have Frank as your waiter. He was friendly and helpful throughout the dining experience. He even made friends with my 6 month old daughter. Throughout the night, she kept looking for him. As soon as she saw him, she giggled, smiled, or gave him "raspberries". Frank even offered her something to eat. When Greek Islands has a 15-40 min. wait time, just walk over to Pegasus. You get a good meal and great service in a shorter amount of time. We recommend getting their yogurt with honey, figs, and apricots for dessert with Greek coffee medium sweet.  The yogurt is made in house, so it has a milder taste. Also, we recommend trying their daily specials. I had a braised lamb shank with carrots and artichoke hearts. Lastly, just for fun, get the saganaki!

2.description: We came here for a random late lunch over the weekend. It was quiet but in their defense it was about 3:30 on a Sunday.We had a really nice server who hooked us up with some sides and we enjoyed calamari, gyro and artichokes.I still think Greek islands has better gyro meat but it was still an enjoyable, satisfying experience!

18.description: The highlight of the visit was definitely our server. He made our meal much more enjoyable. We were nearing the end of our vacation and had a very cranky toddler when we met up with family here. The server was so kind and friendly with our son. Our son absolutely loved him. Probably because he kept giving my son treats like cherries. Then he would yell "opa!" For my son which he loved and mimicked for the rest of the day. The food was great. Plenty of food was served to us. I had saganaki, salad, moussaka and baklava. Everything tasted fresh and delicious. Valet was kind enough to help us flag down a taxi afterwards. I just wish the rooftop patio had been open.

41.description: This place has the best pomegranate martinis.  The food was ok.  We got the family dinner.  The potatoes were so salty that I could barely eat it.  The cucumbers in the salad were not very crisp.  They seemed like they were starting to be past their best date.  The baclava was very good.

52.description: The friendly, welcoming, and knowledgeable service gets 5 stars.The atmosphere is casual with Greek murals and street tile that you may find in Greece - I haven't been there yet.I got the egg-lemon soup which was decent but it is extremely mild. It may be traditionally like that but in my humble opinion they could add some oregano and black pepper to add some zing. My white fish was well seasoned but a bit dry and slightly fishy.The prices are very reasonable with glasses of wine around $7 and most entrees under $25.I'd comeback to try some other entrees.

50.description: For being named after what is presumably one of mythology's faster animals, the service doesn't match up. We waited forever for our water to arrive, then longer for our server to greet us. Then another long period passed before he took our order. Our food took forever to arrive too, and we had a long wait between each course. The flaming saganaki was enjoyable as always, but I thought it was kind of bland and not as good as the flaming saganaki at Parthenon. The Kolokithakia was probably the highlight of the meal (pre dessert) for me. The veggie Mousaka and Spanakopitakia were okay - average, no complaints. I really enjoyed the homemade Greek yogurt with caramelized fruit for dessert - and this was probably my favorite part of the meal. I'd say this place would be average/3 stars if the service was better, but for now, two it is.

4.description: Ordered delivery from Pegasus via seamless and the 19$ pork souvlaki arrived as three chunks of ice cold pork fat with cold rice. Seamless contacted Pegasus who maintained that's what the dish should have been and refused to fix the situation. Previous in person visits have been decidedly mediocre as well. When in Greektown, skip this dump and go to the friendly, delicious, and beautifully remodeled Athena instead.

6.description: Zero quality control for delivery. Surprisingly dismal taramasalata, pasticcio and crazy dry porkchops. Big FAIL!!

22.description: Four of us had an excellent dinner yesterday on the rooftop patio at Pegasus. It was humid and hot, but there was a nice breeze up top, and we loved the view of the Chicago skyline. The menu features little plates for sharing, which gave us an enjoyable sampling of 4 appetizer-type dishes, and then 4 that were heartier. All were good, and I particularly enjoyed the chewy souvlaki, tangy salad, and nicely-spiced roasted pork kabobs. Our waitress was friendly and helpful with our wine selection, and the busboy kept our water glasses full, which we appreciated given the humidity and heat. Altogether, it was a terrific place for dinner to enjoy a hot night in Chicago. One warning: there is a relatively steep stairway up to the roof. Please don't review this business if you received a freebie

15.description: A really nice dinner here. Started with a big bowl of avgolemono, a rich cream of chicken with rice soup that you squeeze a half lemon into before enjoying, accompanied by a loaf of good Greek white bread, with its crisp crust covered in sesame seeds, dipped in excellent Greek olive oil.  For my main course I had "Pikalia #2", one of the two combo specials. A huge plate of lamb, chicken, rice, pastitsio (kind of a lasagne of elbow macaroni and ground beef), spinakopita spinach pie and potato. To drink, I had a 500 Ml bottle of cold retsina, a white wine flavored with pine, which is a bit of an acquired taste, but if you 'get it" is crisp and refreshing, cutting through the richness of the food.  I then carried my last glass of wine up to the rooftop deck, with it's breathtaking view of the skyline, to toast the sunset. It wasn't quite like drinking to the sunset in Santorini, but close enough.

57.description: Great service and delicious food I would recommend boneless grilled fish and the meatballs"Beef" with tomato sauce...I think if you are a fish fan Youll like the fish here,  very tasty ..Greek coffee wad good Its similar to Turkish coffee..  Both of them strong Chocolate mousse was Yummy

20.description: My boyfriend and I was looking a different place to eat. Checked and reviewed the reviews on this restaurant, so ended up eating here. The food, service, and price was great would love to come and recommend this place to everyone.

36.description: I don't have a lot of Mediterranean cuisine experience, but I enjoyed the food here. I had the Dolmadakia Yialatzi, Tirokafteri, and Gyros. All had a lot of flavor.My father and I sat in the rooftop area, which offered a nice view of the skyline. They had some nice background music. When we went there weren't many other people there, so the service was virtually instant.

14.description: So what I ate was tasty but it was a strange meal overall. Service was lacking. They didn't come over enough to check in. My food wasn't right. I ordered a gyro meal and then got a gyro salad. I knew it wasn't right but didn't complain because as I stated above it was tasty. And in the end it did save me a few bucks, so there's that I guess...  Then when we were trying to pay the bill, my friend and I were splitting it on two credit cards and the employee took them and then was gone for I'd say at least ten minutes. He finally came over and said it would just be another second but if the system is down, tell people a little faster so we're not confused about what's happened to our cards. Really I'd give the service tonight probably just two stars. Shame since my friend raved about this place. My friend liked her spanakopita. It looked good and big, nice portion size. My friends salad wasn't nothing to write home about.  And my gyro salad was good but way, way, way too much dressing and sauce. I didn't care for my 'apple pie' dessert but my friends liked the lemon dessert they shared. I wouldn't jump to come back here which is a shame because I love Greek food and the restaurant is pretty. It has a nice feel. Oh well  we'll see what happens.

58.description: 4am me and my buddy ordered chicken fried rice, orange chicken and lemon chicken two eggrolls...we surprised that the lemon chicken sucked dick!! Although the Orange chicken was phenomenal but lacked some crunchyness... they gave us a shit load of white rice that we barely touched... overall it was slightly fulfilled for 4am Chinese food...

56.description: The chicken wings were the bomb!!!  Nice big crisp wings!  Stick with the rice dishes and you won't be disappointed.  Beef with broccoli or chicken with mixed vegetable were alright.  No surprises.

29.description: My bro Jordan placed an order to this place around 1AM this morning. I was loaded so I was asleep by the time our food showed up, but he said the Kung pao shrimp was OUT OF THIS WORLD! I did eat one of the fortune cookies this morning and it was to die for. I also have some sort of fish dish sitting in the refrigerator that I'll probably dig into tomorrow. YUM YUM is right!!

42.description: Considering there is a blizzard outside, delivery was rather fast and not TOO long after estimated. I ordered Vegetable Udon Noodles with tofu and a pineapple smoothie along with 2 vegetable rolls. The rolls didnt come with peanut sauce (sad face), the tofu was okay (I dont think they do anything it it before it's cooked) and my smoothie...was peach but still yummy!I would order again as they are open late but next time not during a blizzard ...late night cant be helped since I work overnight

23.description: To be quite honest, I was skeptical about eating here, but I'm glad I did. I placed an order originally to be picked, but due to the rain, I called and had them deliver the food. He told me he was swamped and would have it to me within 45 minutes and in 45 minutes, I received it.I ordered the salt and pepper wings (spicy) and the Singapore noodles without the curry sauce. Both arrived hot and good. The chicken wings were exceptionally crispy (delivered) and delicious! I ate every single bite. I wished there were more jalapeños though! The Singapore noodles exceeded my expectations. It was so flavorful even without the curry sauce.I would definitely order from here again when I'm back in town. At its price point, its quality is on point. You can't expect to eat 5-star food at 1-star prices. This was on good! Hell, my chicken was still crispy after being delivered!!!

47.description: I got a WHOLE LOTTA food, for very little money. I ordered ahead and the food was ready when I got there. The men behind the counter were friendly-enough, and the food was good. A colleague who recommended the place said something along the lines of, "it'll satisfy your Chinese food craving, but it's not the best." I definitely agree.

8.description: Horrible service.  They charge a $3 delivery fee and the delivery guy has the nerve to deny my request to come up to my room so I go down to the lobby and the first thing he says to me: "do you have my cash tip?"  No greeting?  Then I ask him what the $3 extra is for?  I was getting ready to actually tip him if he could explain to me what the fee was for but instead he walks away saying "I know you guys."  I'm not sure exactly what he meant by that but it def had some racial undertones to it and the way he walked off was so rude.  No wonder this place gets horrible reviews.  Never ordering from here again after that incident.

31.description: DID NOT DELIVER THE FOOD WE ORDERED AND NEVER CORRECTED THE ORDER! Maybe the food is good, but we will never know. Ordered via delivery at the recommendation of the front desk staff at our hotel. When our food as delivered, half our meal was missing. When I called the restaurant, they promised the rest of the food would be delivered in 45 minutes. Sixty minutes later the food had not arrived. When I called again, they hung up on me. Had to take my sad, hungry 10 yr old to 7-eleven for Cheerios since he never got a full meal. Disputing the charges with my credit card company. Not the best way to spend out last night in Chicago.

34.description: I'm surprised the reviews are so bad. Things I've eaten here are: shrimp fried rice, pot stickers, soups, smoothies, orange chicken, sweet and sour chicken, egg rolls, lo mein and other various things I can't remember. But basically all the typical american fare. The orange chicken had a fresh crisp to it, definitely my favorite orange chicken. Only thing is... They give you so much! I usually spend under $10 for lunch and it will last me 2-3 lunches. The watermelon smoothie, which is just frozen watermelon chunks run through a blender is also one of my favorite things in greek town. Gotta add the boba balls and take it for a walk at the park when the weather is great. I'm deducting a star due to the level of friendliness and service. It's sort of an awkward ordering process.

16.description: I'm surprised the reviews are so bad. Things I've eaten here are: shrimp fried rice, pot stickers, soups, smoothies, orange chicken, sweet and sour chicken, egg rolls, lo mein and other various things I can't remember. But basically all the typical american fare. The orange chicken had a fresh crisp to it, definitely my favorite orange chicken. Only thing is... They give you so much! I usually spend under $10 for lunch and it will last me 2-3 lunches. The watermelon smoothie, which is just frozen watermelon chunks run through a blender is also one of my favorite things in greek town. Gotta add the boba balls and take it for a walk at the park when the weather is great. I'm deducting a star due to the level of friendliness and service. It's sort of an awkward ordering process.

13.description: To be quite honest, I was skeptical about eating here, but I'm glad I did. I placed an order originally to be picked, but due to the rain, I called and had them deliver the food. He told me he was swamped and would have it to me within 45 minutes and in 45 minutes, I received it.I ordered the salt and pepper wings (spicy) and the Singapore noodles without the curry sauce. Both arrived hot and good. The chicken wings were exceptionally crispy (delivered) and delicious! I ate every single bite. I wished there were more jalapeños though! The Singapore noodles exceeded my expectations. It was so flavorful even without the curry sauce.I would definitely order from here again when I'm back in town. At its price point, its quality is on point. You can't expect to eat 5-star food at 1-star prices. This was on good! Hell, my chicken was still crispy after being delivered!!!

11.description: UIC Students love this place because it's open late and they can get food at 3 AM while they are studying (they deliver). It is in Greek Town (near Halsted and Jackson), so the walk is only 7-12 minutes from Library and less then 5 minutes if you live in the dorms. It's cheap and it tastes descent, but it's super oily! There are times when you can get the rice from the bottom of the pan and your food will be "oilier" then usual. Chances of that happening is 1/20. They give you a lot of food though, and I'll take that. It's only carry out or delivery, don't plan on dining in here. Also, it's easy to just drive here and pick up your food too because there is always parking outside. Overall, nothing too fancy, but not crappy either. Because it's cheap, tastes good, and they give generous portions, I'm definitely a fan.

39.description: Work in the area and have been to the restaurant several times over the last two and a half years. The two times I've been this year it has been totally disgusting!!! The meat has been sooo over cooked, or cooked multiple times and hard as a rock. I will not recommend this place to anyone and will never order food from this place again!

37.description: Tried going again after receiving an apology email from the owner and an offer for a free dish coupon. Found an animal hair and two bones. However, the chicken and batter were much better, but I have yet to receive a free dish coupon. :(

0.description: Mapo tofu and general tso both dope - it's obviously just cheap American Chinese but it's my favorite one despite everyone else's ratings.

38.description: The food is actually not that bad. My husband got delivery from here about 15 times and every single time it took FOREVER. I would make my husband call after an hour and it almost seemed like they had forgotten about our order. Today my husband ordered extra early because we knew it would take so long and after 75 minutes he called to ask the status of the order. The man who answered (manager) told my husband that the order was made for pick up which was not true because I heard my husband make the order for delivery. So the guy said he would change that and they hung up. About 2 minutes later the man from the restaurant called back to tell my husband that he had voided the order and needed the credit card number again so he could put the delivery charge on there. My husband was livid because we had NEVER picked up and this was obviously the managers fault. After continuing to bicker with my husband for about 5 minutes on how this was my husbands fault the manager hung up. We will never order from here again. The manager really needs to take a customer service class.

51.description: I have ordered delivery from Chinese Yum Yum twice. While the food is about average, their delivery can be very very very very slow. Before ordering from here, I would check out other Chinese options that deliver to you.

27.description: Food was ok. Smoothies were damn good. Took over an hour to get the food so was already disappointed.  Won't be the last time I order from here, but will likely be the last resort.

32.description: Yum-Yum packs a lot of food for the amount you pay. Sure this place isn't 5 star restaurant, it's Chinese FAST food for goodness sake, but their food is pretty   tasty. I recommend picking up your order yourself and save the headache of waiting for delivery though.

54.description: I was wondering why this place had 3 stars instead of 5 or 4. The food is reasonably priced and the portions are fair. After they HAD MESSED UP MY ORDER 4 TIMES I UNDERSTAND! I am vegan so I know what I can eat. I asked for tofu and veg fried rice. Since the yum yum meal comes with a free egg roll I didn't think I had to specify veggie. The person who took my order was rushing me of the phone and wasn't listening. I get there don't check my food even though they had screwed my order up before with chicken and shrimp. I start to eat the egg roll taste funny. Get home and I have shrimp fried rice!!! I call back the man is rude and arguing with me about how its my fault but HE MESSED Up. Then he tells me there is meat in the egg roll. I have spent an hour throwing up in hopes not to get sick. I have not eaten meat in 14 years and as I type my stomach is killing me. This is food poisoning.When I go back to get a refund he gives me more food. Are you crazy? I will never eat here again !!! I might even protest out front. How rude, inconsiderate and unprofessional. This place is honorific and the Thai noodles are gross. Never again will eat out suggest this place!

48.description: I ordered from Chinese Yum Yum last night via grub hub. I ordered my food at approximately 8pm with an eta of 9:10pm...My food arrived at 9:45 ish! When I called Chinese yum yum at 9:15 I was told it was around the corner. At 9:35 I called irate and requested my money back and to cancel the order. The person declined to refund my money and stated they had 5 orders before mine... I live 15 mins away from the place and it doesn't take 1hour and 45 mins to make shrimp fried rice and egg foo young. I ordered 3 rice box entrees which include shrimp fried rice and a can of pop. I received entrees with white rice and no beverage. It was all cold and dry. I completely wasted 40 bucks. I will never order from them again and I am reporting them to the BBB. There should have been some offer of idk at least an apology but hot food would have been nice as well. Horrible place!

44.description: I got the General Tso's chicken because it's my go-to at all Chinese Restaurants. I'll give them this: their portion size is HUGE. Unfortunately, that was their only pro. The chicken was gray and the rice was stringy. I was wondering if what I was eating was even real food.

24.description: Horrible- an "aggressive " woman literally called to demand "we pay extra" for extra chicken and upon grubhub complaint (already paid )  - administered LAXATIVES in food! My front desk person - unrelated to my experience-  can validate and confirm we were both sick for 48 hours

7.description: Ordered at 3:18 am. Did not arrive until close to 4:30 due to driver having a flat...Ordered combination egg foo yung yum yum box and chicken and rice soup.  Soup was not hot.  Patties were extremely tough and clearly overcooked, NOT EDIBLE. Fried rice was lackluster, no veggies/onions/sprouts

49.description: My coworkers and I have ordered here a couple of times. The only complaint that I would make is the delivery time, but it's understandable. I honestly don't know why this place only received 3 and a half stars. It's a great late night spot considering since it closes at 5 in the morning. Whenever I order, I get the Orange chicken yum yum box.

40.description: I order shrimp fried rice and it was the worst. The most  uneatable  food I've had in my life. So call them back was told the management was out but will have him call me back, put that never happen so I call back they pick up the phone and never said anything because they can see the number , next I use a different number and the sound of my voice they just didn't say anything. So at the end of day DO'NT EAT FROM THIS PLACE .

53.description: I love the yum yum! Delivery time is between 45 min-1 hour. I know there are some complaints but I've seen how busy they get (how many Chinese restaurants do you know open till 6 am??) and I understand how delays can happen. But I've been pleased with my food and the delivery guys have been great. It's a good deal for great food. Their smoothies truly hit the spot for those hot days! They also have some comical workers over there. Quite entertaining at night time. Definitely the place to go to after a night out!

30.description: On so many levels this place is an insult to its customers. It's not just that they cooked the wrong item, the lady tried to tell me there's little bits of basil in the basil chicken when it's obvious there were none. They also started cooking several minutes after the order was placed, while it's basic practice to start cooking seconds after the order is placed -especially since I was the only customer there at the time. Getting an order wrong is a mistake that can happen once in a while but to try to lie to a customer is ethically despicable. This might be the worst Chinese food restaurant I've ever been to in Chicago ...probably worst one in my life. This was not the only LIE they tried to have believe. Don't be surprised if you get similar treatment and you're left feeling like they just want your money and shut up. Feel free to contact me via Yelp messaging if you have any specific concerns or specific questions, this review is already much longer than what I intended.

46.description: I guess if you are in a pinch this would be a good place to go and get something. I ordered steam veggies the  sauce was so salty I could not eat it. The soup was okie but you could taste the salt in broth. Pros:CheapOk portion size Quick take outCon's:Salty food!No won't recommend to a friend!!

1.description: I'll start by saying that I have had a bad experience with this place before when they told me that they do not clean their small shrimp. On today Nov. 5th 2015 I ordered the orange chicken meal with chicken fried rice since I've had a bad experience with their shrimp before - on this night my order took more than an hour which is odd because I literally live a mile up the road - I've walked before took me less than 20 minutes. Anyway, that's not a really big deal. The big deal is upon receiving my order my chicken was hard and Luke warm and the rice was cold. I'm so sad because after I called the manager said he'd remake my order - no apology just a reconciliation or so I thought. When he came to bring my order over an hour later HE ONLY BROUGHT ME CHICKEN! I was and still am so heart broken about this like seriously I just wanted to eat my food - I've been at work and school all day and no time to go shopping I tipped well and gave them the benefit of the doubt and the chance to correct it and these mofos couldn't even do that. To top it all off I called the manager back he quickly said "I'm off duty" when I asked if he was the manager. I said that's fine but why would you bring me chicken only do you expect me to eat cold rice. He told me "microwave". Seriously I have never been so insulted or upset. Has anyone ever tried eating reheated fried rice. IT'S HORRIBLE! So after I told him off about how wrong that was and that I wasn't going to order from them anymore he just hung up no sorry no nothing. WORST PLACE EVER! They may be a little rude in China town but guess what they're good is always fresh and good. I spent $15 tonight for food that I can't eat I'm devastated and heart broken! Smfh

55.description: I love their food. The Yum Yum box is my go to (Sweet & Sour Chicken w/ Chicken fried rice and egg roll). Large portions are large. They have a decent amount of bar stools set up with a shelf for eating in, but no tables. Love the atmosphere, but it gives me the vibe that they're making more money than they know what to do with it - Five tvs, really? Love the hours, perfect for late night munching.However, I do have to mention the language barrier. Everytime i have gone there, they have had super thick accents. They haven't screwed up my order just yet, so I'm not going to dock a star. But the menu is your best friend.

9.description: The food is great, also they have a lot of Vegetarian options. Apart from that, they deliver till 4 am, so if you get late at work, or hungry for a midnight snack, this is the place.

26.description: The place is convenient and although you could say affordable, the other options nearby offer much more taste and filling for the dollarIssues tonight include:1) attitude from the host. She had plenty of sass for me and the other people who took the time to walk in and order. I'm sorry it's so upsetting that we come in and give you business so that the business can stay afloay2) incorrect order. Given meat egg roll rather than veggie. Much less tasty.

25.description: Great place to get quick, easy Chinese if you live in the Greek Town/West Loop area. Not exactly sterling quality food, but the price is right and the food tastes good, and that is all one can ask for with neighborhood cheap n easy Chinese.

12.description: The soup and the egg roll were good. I had a couple bites of the Orange Chicken. It was terrible. The fried crab wontons were overcooked and tasted old. No thank you.

59.description: I ordered from Chinese Yum Yum for my friends and myself after a concert despite the bad reviews because it was one of the only Chinese restaurants open late near me. They said the delivery would reach my home in 45 minutes. After an hour, I called and asked where my food was, and the man who took my order said it was currently on the way. I called again after another half hour passed (I live about ten minutes away) and this time a girl answered and said "something in the system went wrong, but your order is in transit for real this time". Finally after another 45 minutes and total of over 2 hours of waiting, the delivery came, and the food was very cold. I will not be ordering from here again.
