21.description: I should have just skipped a meal rather than ordering from this place. I waited an hour for my order, received the wrong order and I'm still arguing with the restaurant to get my money back. Do yourself a favor and don't go here.

17.description: I was skeptical about the taste when I first ordered. Soon enough it has become a favorite Chinese delivery. They're open till late and the delivery is quick.

10.description: I should have just skipped a meal rather than ordering from this place. I waited an hour for my order, received the wrong order and I'm still arguing with the restaurant to get my money back. Do yourself a favor and don't go here.

5.description: This place is really cheap and the food is good! Of course, it isn't the finest Chinese dining option in Chicago. But it's a solid place to grab a quick meal if you like American Chinese. The General Tso's is really good; just crispy enough, but not overcooked. And you can even sit inside of the restaurant and watch soap operas while you eat.

3.description: I've eaten here a few times and it's never impressed me much. Only particularly bad experience I've had was when i ordered Mongolian beef and ended up getting about four pieces of beef and the rest was just onions. Other than that, I've never had a problem with anything; no wrong orders or poor service. I always pick up, so i don't know what the delivery service is like. The food is always just ok, not great, and a little overpriced in my opinion. I'm pretty convinced that the only reason this place is still in business is because it's near a college campus and all the other Chinese places in the area (which are pretty good; China Night is my first choice) are closed by 10.

35.description: expensive for low quality food. If you're drunk or high, then go here. Wouldn't recommend.

19.description: I was wondering why this place had 3 stars instead of 5 or 4. The food is reasonably priced and the portions are fair. After they HAD MESSED UP MY ORDER 4 TIMES I UNDERSTAND! I am vegan so I know what I can eat. I asked for tofu and veg fried rice. Since the yum yum meal comes with a free egg roll I didn't think I had to specify veggie. The person who took my order was rushing me of the phone and wasn't listening. I get there don't check my food even though they had screwed my order up before with chicken and shrimp. I start to eat the egg roll taste funny. Get home and I have shrimp fried rice!!! I call back the man is rude and arguing with me about how its my fault but HE MESSED Up. Then he tells me there is meat in the egg roll. I have spent an hour throwing up in hopes not to get sick. I have not eaten meat in 14 years and as I type my stomach is killing me. This is food poisoning.When I go back to get a refund he gives me more food. Are you crazy? I will never eat here again !!! I might even protest out front. How rude, inconsiderate and unprofessional. This place is honorific and the Thai noodles are gross. Never again will eat out suggest this place!

28.description: Nice greeting from the cute young lady behind the counter. She was friendly and helpful. Very positive personality. Ordered Red Curry, coconut milk dish with chicken. Took about ten minutes to prepare. Walked to Union Station for my commute home. When I opened the to-go box I was astonished, even the guy next to me asked where it was from. Huge portion of shrimp fried rice, and giant sized main dish. It was piping hot , even after the hustle back to the station. Looking for great, fast Chinese food, check out this place, it was amazing. Sorry to stuffed to type, gotta take a nap now. Thanks Yum Yum! All for a great price too!

45.description: Chinese Yum Yum is great if you want something that resembles Chinese food. Their portions are very generous and it is cheap. We went here a couple of times for convenience, but I would not recommend to to eat if you wanted real Chinese food.There needs to be a great Chinese restaurant in West Loop!

33.description: This place is great. It's best for take-out - the only dining you could do is on a couple of stools in the window. Food is tasty, staff is exactly what you'd expect from a restaurant that is open 20 hours each day - a bit bland, humorless, but efficient. Take out typically takes 15 minutes to prepare. I live near here so I haven't ever done delivery. The large fried rice is enough for a very hungry one or a reasonable two. Hot & Sour soup is good. If you want fancy go to PF Chang's. If you want good food at 1am this is your joint.

43.description: Nothing special here but does the job if you are crabing chinese food

2.description: Not a review of the food but just the service quality. Called to place and order for pickup, was told it would take 20-25 mins. Walked in after 25 mins, 2 dudes were ordering some food. Waited for a little while, Asian lady says not ready yet. Asked her how long it would take, she just says still preparing. After another 20 minutes, my order still wasn't prepared and I was getting pretty frustrated. Then two orders came out for the 2 dudes who just placed their order. I just walked out at this point. Totally poor service, and at no point does the owner try to explain or check on the order to see if it was coming out. Another guy who was there apparently also had to remake his order cause they lost it. Reading through other comments, this is not surprising at all. Avoid.

18.description: I wish I could give a review of the food but I dint get a chance to taste it. The delivery was slow that I expected.  I orderd at 545 pm thinking I would receive it by my dinner break at 7 pm.  By 715 I had called and cancelled the order then magically my food appeared at 725 when it its over. The order was in correct. Its nothing worse than paying for something and not getting it....I should have listened to the consenus of yelpers.. $20 wasted...

41.description: UIC Students love this place because it's open late and they can get food at 3 AM while they are studying (they deliver). It is in Greek Town (near Halsted and Jackson), so the walk is only 7-12 minutes from Library and less then 5 minutes if you live in the dorms. It's cheap and it tastes descent, but it's super oily! There are times when you can get the rice from the bottom of the pan and your food will be "oilier" then usual. Chances of that happening is 1/20. They give you a lot of food though, and I'll take that. It's only carry out or delivery, don't plan on dining in here. Also, it's easy to just drive here and pick up your food too because there is always parking outside. Overall, nothing too fancy, but not crappy either. Because it's cheap, tastes good, and they give generous portions, I'm definitely a fan.

52.description: I've been living in the neighborhood for several years and was happy when a late night Chinese place opened up near me. However after going here several times, I've decided to throw in the towel.The food was always just mediocre at best, but the service has been bad. Mixed up orders, food not prepared to order, etc. but I kept going there because it was nearby and convenient. The last straw was last week when I went in to get some egg rolls for a snack. I placed the order to go, with the person at the register and waited there for over 15 minutes. People that came in after me, put in their order and even got their food and I still hand't gotten my order. The person behind the counter was busy making smoothies and I couldn't even check on my order with him. Finally someone came out of the kitchen and asked me what I was waiting for. When I told him, he asked if I had even put in the order in the first place..   I realized that the cashier hadn't even put in my order! How does one charge me for my food and not even put in the order when I had been standing there right in front of him for several minutes??I finally got my egg rolls to go, more than 20 minutes after I ordered. When I went home, I noticed that they had put the piping hot rolls directly onto the Styrofoam box and the box had melted all around the roll. I couldn't even eat it anymore.Needless to say, I'm never going there again and wouldn't recommend it.

50.description: My first time and I was pleasantly surprised by the Empress chicken! The Yum Yum box is great, but next time I'll get veggie fried rice. The shrimp in the fried rice that the Yum Yum box includes was NOT deveined. I was throughly grossed out. They really should either invest in deveined shrimp or just devein it themselves.

4.description: Probably the worst  Chinese food I've ever had. Took one bite of an egg roll and spit it out. Quality of the beef with brocolli was comparable to a Taco Bell.  Potstickers decent.

6.description: Never going to order food from this place again. Delivery took 1hr & 30mins to get here; by then the food was cold. This restaurant seems to be extremely unorganized because if they were planning to deliver my food at a later time they could have made my order last instead of just letting it sit there and get cold. Don't get their yumyum boxes unless you want gritty plain fried rice with an occasional complimentary baby shrimp.

22.description: Looking back as an alumni of UIC I wish I had ordered from here more. Unfortunately they're within a 0.5 mile of Joy Yee's so they tend to lose out for those of us who occupied South Campus (those d@mn JY smoothies, they're irresistible). Anyway they're chicken dishes are pretty good especially the orange chicken and general tso's chicken. They also have good pot stickers and crab rangoon. And they have dim sum on the menu. A delivery place that has decent siu mai dim sum deserves a gold star. And I also recently learned that they have pretty good Mongolian beef on the menu. In my experience Mongolian beef is only good in places that are predominantly sit down restaurants. Being that it's my favorite Chinese food, that alone earns my recommendation. My one critique is that their delivery times tend to be long (45 minutes+) where as Joy Yee's tend to have food ready in 20 minutes. But if you live or work in the west loop and don't mind a long wait or don't mind picking up I highly recommend Chinese Yum Yum. They're also open til 5am which is awesome.

15.description: My go to for Chinese  takeout. They are always open and the food is always delicious.  Chow fun noodles, cashew dinner, & the bbq pork fried rice are some of my favorites.

57.description: We stopped by for fresh fruit smoothies and a little beef stick on our way to an apt in the west loop. We were starving but had dinner reservations in a few hours so didn't want to fill up. This place was very good! We watched him make our smoothies using real fruit! And the beef sticks were sooo yummy! While we were there several people ordered food and some ate it there, it looked really good. If we are ever in the neighborhood we will probably actually order a meal.

20.description: I read the reviews before ordering from this place and the reviews were spot on. The food was mediocre but the service was great. It was a late delivery because we slept through the day. The food actually warmed up alright the next day! I got the orange chicken with shrimp fried rice and pad Thai for my girl friend. It was indeed a 2-2.5 stars.

36.description: I would select no stars if that was an option. I am suffering from food poisoning as I write this. On Wednesday night I ordered a small wonton soup, Singapore rice noodles, a banana and mango smoothie and two Powerades. I ate about 1/3 of my order and I've been sick ever since: rushing back and forth to the bathroom, excruciating stomach pains, sweating, body aches, my stomach has felt full for the last two days and I've had a diarrhea sensation. I called to notify the management since I was a frequent customer. I was told I needed to speak with the owner and that the owner was in the next day (today). I just called and I was told the manager would be in after 8:00pm - this was all after repeating what transpired three times. I kept a portion of my order for evaluation because it's obvious the food was not fresh or something was placed in it to cause this horrible reaction. I've been drinking water and plenty of fluids to try and flush it out of my system. Never again.

14.description: The place is convenient and although you could say affordable, the other options nearby offer much more taste and filling for the dollarIssues tonight include:1) attitude from the host. She had plenty of sass for me and the other people who took the time to walk in and order. I'm sorry it's so upsetting that we come in and give you business so that the business can stay afloay2) incorrect order. Given meat egg roll rather than veggie. Much less tasty.

58.description: As I had already gone to the Greek Town gyros and it's brother on the opposite sides of the road I decided to give this a try and was pleasantly surprised by the taste.I thought it was better than the former ones.One big difference that I noted between two is that Zeus had put proper tahini sauce in the gyro whereas the other ones had put loads of sour cream.So this was much more authentic and tasty.Thinking of going tonight as well.

56.description: I really don't eat a lot of greasy food but I had a one-in-a-blue-moon craving and I decided to treat myself to a gyro and fries because I had had a long day.Well, needless to say I was kind of disappointed. The fries were NOT up to par. In fact, I've had McDonald's fries that tasted better than they did and that's saying something. Also, the gyro was wrapped in paper that was so greasy, it was transparent by the time I unwrapped it. The gyro was a huge pile of meat, uncooked onions, and three dinky tomato slices on top of a pita. The sauce was only on one half of it and when I took a bite, I almost chipped my tooth on what I think was a piece of bone. All in all, I don't think I'll be heading back here and I also don't think I'll be treating myself to gyros anytime soon.

29.description: You guys at Zeus are just setting me up for failure on my diet. Yes I take no personal responsibility for my actions when I walk into Zeus!!! Mmmmm... This could be the beginning of a problem for me. I went to Zeus with a bunch of co-workers for lunch and tried the Gyro burger. A beef patty topped with gyro meat, lettuce, tomato, onion & cucumber sauce. (tzatziki)         It was pretty damn good I must say. My fries as well. I'm glad I chose the gyro burger because I was contemplating the Greek burger .I was totally expecting greatness from that Greek burger. I figured hey I love Greek chicken that burger might be awesome. My coworker got  the Greek burger  and I could tell she wanted to shoot herself for picking this sandwich.  I tried it and it was boring. It was a burger  with feta cheese on  a baguette looking roll. #Fail I felt bad for her because my  gyro burger gave my mouth an orgasm! Hers was more like a premature ejaculation. (can I say that ish??)             I will definitely be back. Now the challenge will be to try something new!! I'm kinda hooked on that gyro burger! Later Gators!!!

42.description: You want ambiance? You have the wrong place. You want great food at a no frills place? You've come to the right place. Ordered a mix plate (chicken & gyro meat) with salad, pita, and rice. I wasn't that hungry so I figured I'd pick off my husbands plate. Can I say, please get an extra plate as I will be eating half of your plate. It was incredible. The grilled chicken breast was whole as I saw the gentleman slice it up and put it on a bed of rice. The gyros with tzatziki sauce was outstanding. The pita bread was toasted nicely without being greasy. I appreciate this very much. As I sat there waiting for them to make it, I noticed a lot of patronage comes in and order it to go. It's definitely hopping. Worth the trip.

23.description: Small shit hole in the wall place with amazing food. I wanted to try some Greek door in Greek town and this was just what I wanted. The price and portion dead on. The amount of meat you revive was out of this world. I saw a few salads go out you should try this place if you have not.

47.description: Excellent value for $$.  Well seasoned meat.An order of gyro for $2.50 can be eaten twice.  With Boston Lettuce, slightly salty gyro becomes a wrap.The one and only place for gyro for my family!

8.description: I can only say good things about this location I have came here for years and the food is outstanding

31.description: Food was ok nothing special . Customer service is very poor . They made my order wrong and I told them about it. They promised to fix it next time and I don't know how they managed to mess it up for the second time. I don't think I'll be back

34.description: Gyros are my personal favorite. Sometimes your just in the mood to get down with some really good grease food and this is the spot to do so. The taziki sauce has cucumbers and the portions leave you in a coma if you order the gyros plate. Im a fan of their gyro slice and the fact its a small place thats better than their competitor two doors fown (mr greek gyros.) if you want a very conservative gyro place go down the street to gyro-mena which has a very comprable gyro just smaller portion plus belly dancing!

16.description: Excellent Greek-American fast food joint. Smaller dining area, only boasting about six tables inside, so it can get cramped. We were able to grab a table for lunch...lucky. Tried the Philly Cheesesteak with everything, and enjoyed evey freaking bit of it. Fresh bread jammed with piping hot cheesesteak, melted provolone, sautéed onions and peppers, and topped with shredded lettuce. Freaking delish. My co-diner tried the gyros, and exclaimed them to be the best he's had in YEARS! Tall praises considering our South side gyros roots. It's not Gordon Ramsay, but its five stars for what it is does, and the food its putting out!

13.description: You want ambiance? You have the wrong place. You want great food at a no frills place? You've come to the right place. Ordered a mix plate (chicken & gyro meat) with salad, pita, and rice. I wasn't that hungry so I figured I'd pick off my husbands plate. Can I say, please get an extra plate as I will be eating half of your plate. It was incredible. The grilled chicken breast was whole as I saw the gentleman slice it up and put it on a bed of rice. The gyros with tzatziki sauce was outstanding. The pita bread was toasted nicely without being greasy. I appreciate this very much. As I sat there waiting for them to make it, I noticed a lot of patronage comes in and order it to go. It's definitely hopping. Worth the trip.

11.description: Fast food place with good food and friendly staff. Get the gyros pita, the meat tastes fresh with good spice. Only downside is the place seemed a little dirty, but not enough to keep me coming back.

39.description: Cheers to Quality, Filling, Tasty, Fair Priced Greek Food! If you're looking for a solid gyro (Lamb or Chicken) and don't want to fork over a lot of $$$, I'd hit this place up. I usually go with a Gyro Platter/Dinner and definitely cannot put it all down in one sitting. Add this lunch spot to the list!

37.description: Delicious gyros that can easily feed two people with the combo.  Service was quick and prompt.  I have ordered this meal at least twice in the past week.   That is how addictive the gyro is!

0.description: The almighty Zeus has come forth and given the folks near UIC some of the greatest, cheap gyros ever!!This hole-in-the-wall is definitely my favorite low-key restaurant in Greek Town. It has all the makings of an affordable, tasty dinner that will satisfy any crowd. Their dinner plates are massive and come with plenty of fresh toppings alongside your meat or veggie of choice. Most of the plates here are served alongside with either rice or fries, so you've got your carb option taken care of as well.I've also tried the fried mushrooms which are tasty when dipped with Tzatziki sauce, but definitely brace yourself because they are rather oily.Although slightly pricier than its main competitor Mr. Greeks, Zeus offers higher quality food and will guarantee get you full for the right reasons.

38.description: I ordered the fried mushrooms and an order of fries - late afternoon fried food fix. The mushrooms did not disappoint: nice batter and not overly greasy. The overall rating would've been much better if not for the fries. The fries were not as good as I'd been led to believe but certainly acceptable UNTIL I got to the bottom of the bag which tasted as if the fries had been coated in urine. I have no idea what that was about, but I'm going to assume that employee hygiene is not all that it can be there. No matter how little it cost, it's not a bargain when you spit your food out in disgust.

51.description: i love zeus. i love everything i've ever had here. the fish sandwich combo or a chicken pita plate or a pizza puff. the service is good and fast. love love love. that's it. significantly better and cheaper than anywhere else around.

27.description: Great place for burgers, gyros, and chicken breasts. Delicious grilled flavor.  All ingredients are fresh and meals are hearty. Breakfasts are affordable and good portioned!

32.description: Gyro plate was awesome, always have the news on so you feel better about eating junk food.  Also there are always cops in there, so you know it's good.

54.description: Good value greek fast food.  I enjoyed the (huge) gyro salad and recommend it!

48.description: Not as good as the little mo, and pop Greek places, but definitely good.  My husband had the gyros sandwich with Greek feta fries and I had the gyros plate - it came with a salad, fries and gyros.  The salad was simple, but good - feta is extra.  The gyros portion was for the plate was heaping and very tasty!  My husband was definitely jealous of how much bigger my plate was.  We also saw someone who ordered the Grecian 1/2 chicken plate which was enormous - we'll def get that next time.  Yum.

44.description: Was here recently for lunch as I was in the mood for a good gyro. Or at least I hoped would be a good gyro. I was not disappointed. I got the number 1, and enjoyed every bite. The gyro is one of the best I've had in the city. The meat is very tender and tasty. The fries came nice and hot and were a nice balance of soft but a little crunchy too. Looking forward to ordering other items in the future.

24.description: My fave greek spot close to UIC.

7.description: I was going to head to Mr. Greeks when I saw Zeus. Outside it smells greasy as hell; However, this place is well-ventilated. Also, it's very clean and well-kept. The food was delicious. I got the gyros and it was put on the grill. It was nice and crispy. Also, they stuffed the pita and the cucumber sauce... Yum. It was such a nice cool counterpart to the warm gyros.

49.description: Havent tried most of the menu, but the burgers are wondreful and def. worth the price

40.description: I ordered Grecian Chicken and asked that they put the fries in the sauce (marinade). No one there understood my request. That's when I realized that there were NO Greeks working there. Chicken was tasty but dry as were the crinkle cut (what?!) fries.

53.description: Let me say that I was quite hangry (hungry + angry) as it was taking a really long time for the food to be done the first time I came here.However, once the food came, it was delicious and I was really pleasantly surprised by how good it was. The gyro meat was the best I've had in Greektown and the chicken was super flavorful. I can't see myself going anywhere else next time I'm craving a gyro!

30.description: The food is good.  Especially the Greek chicken salad.  Customer service needs to improve. It is often my go-to spot on the near West Side. Maybe they can try saying "Thank you" to the customers...

46.description: This place is awesome. Good bang for your buck! I always get the italian beef.

1.description: Ahh the Zeus,Great place to eat, ask all the people at are double parked.  The Chicken plate is fantastic. There is little negative that can be said about The Zeus, parking but that comes with that part of town. Food is always hot and fresh every dry and usually pretty friendly service even when slammed. They are amazing you really need to give them a try. They are not more then 5 minutes off the highway so no excuse not to visit if you are passing through. The rough times come late night when, "The Clubs", let out. It in turns brings some less desirable patrons, again those pesky double, and triple parkers whom are entitled and above the law as they party is still going on. They leave the windows open to better share the music of their choice with you. Often enough CPD  gets involved when said individuals can't be nice together. How ever the only negative fall upon them is having such great food that every one, good or not so good from all parts of the city need their fix of, The Zeus!

55.description: decided to give this place a try since i wanted to try a new gyro place... ordered the rib tips and a gyro.. the rib tips came with bread, ribs, fries, and coleslaw.. it was really oily and the ribs had a weird taste to it.. the BBQ sauce was too sweet also.. the fries was below average.. it wasn't as crispy as it should...the gyro was OK.. not the best and not the worst i had.. they loaded it up with a lot of onions and sauce..

9.description: Was exploring greektown and happened to stop by this place. Generous portions - the salad was on point and the pita bread was a lovely texture - unfortunately the seasoning on the meat left a weird aftertaste in our mouths that wouldn't go away.

26.description: This is a solid place if you want to grab some food on the go. The portions are HUGE with very reasonable prices. The food is fresh and prepared with each order. Nothing to complain about.

25.description: Friendly young man greeted me when I walked in and was polite and helpful even though he was about to close. The food is good prices. Typical of what you'd find in a hole in the wall gyro shop.  The gyro had tons of meat on it! Seriously the most I've gotten at a place like this. Took me forever to finish. Came with fries and a drink too for only $8

12.description: You can save 40% by ordering direct by calling instead of through Grub Hub.  Menu items are about $2 less, and the delivery charge is less.Good inexpensive Gyros.

59.description: So I'm on a hunt for the best gyro in Chicago since I have had a hard time finding one that measures up to my hometown standard. I realized one day that I'm always complaining about how ridiculous it is that you can't get a good gyro in Chicago and realized I haven't even tried one from Greek Town. I mean, what kind of person was I exactly? To remedy the situation I did what any other taste tester/food detective would do. I parked my car on Halsted and Jackson and ordered a gyro from each of the three gyro joints within this 50ft strip. I'd be lying if I said the shame of gyro hopping and smuggling said gyros of competitors in my purse from place to place didn't burn like Prometheus's teet, but it had to be done ... for science. The point of the story is that Zeus was the clear winner. (Not the winner of the gyro portion of my heart by any means, but definitely the best of the three.) Everything about it was good. The portion was plentiful and the tzatziki was spot on. I'm still on my hunt but Zeus is a solid option for some stinky, meaty goodness and I will be a repeat customer for sure. I would also highly recommend it above any of its neighbors. If you're in or near Greek Town and needa to eata da gyro meats, you should make Zeus your choice.

21.description: Better gyro and fries than mr. Greeks while costing less. The gyros actually look like they were put together by someone who has functioning eyes, and their fries actually taste like fries and not potato wedges like next door.

17.description: I am hooked on the gyros Greek salad. Huge and enough for two people but too good to share!!

10.description: This place is straight up solid for a quick bite.  We usually head over here for a quick lunch pickup.  It's straight forward, you walk in, you order, they call out your number, you're on your way. If you're expecting more, don't.I usually get their mixed salad combo, it's a perfect lunch, not too heavy.  you get a deliciously seasoned chicken breast, some gyro meat all sitting on top of some salad and a piece of pita bread.  Oh and your choice of dressing.  It's clean tasty and hits the spot. I've also had their chicken sandwich, which i do enjoy with lettuce mayo on french bread.  The chicken is grilled you can tell its been marinating.  It just hits the spot.  They have all of your typical options, gyros, dogs, burgers, fries etc... its a solid place.  The only thing I am not a fan of is their cheese fries, not a fan of the krinkled fry and the cheese is too watery for me.  I head to Mr. Greeks for my cheese fries.  But I do enjoy eating the food from here, no fuss, just good ol lunch! do it!Oh and if you read this again Lauren D. Bite me! :D

5.description: Nothing like a good gyro when your hungry & Kronos is an excellent gyro. Served with onions, tomatoes & tzatziki sauce

3.description: I recently came here for a gyro combo plate. The cashier/cook gave my food to the wrong customer. After I waited another 5 mins and asked where my food was they started yelling at me and said that I had to take the other guys food. As angry as I was I just walked out. I will never come back here and suggest that you never try it. The management really needs to improve if they want to last.

35.description: Awesome fast food Gyro place. I would stick to the gyro's, my favorite is the lamb, but for the money you could probably try both at once. They are fast and their service is good, my buddy had the Philly and liked it but I was not the biggest fan. For a cheap fast gyro this is probably one of the better places in Chicago.

19.description: Excellent value for $$.  Well seasoned meat.An order of gyro for $2.50 can be eaten twice.  With Boston Lettuce, slightly salty gyro becomes a wrap.The one and only place for gyro for my family!

28.description: This place is straight up solid for a quick bite.  We usually head over here for a quick lunch pickup.  It's straight forward, you walk in, you order, they call out your number, you're on your way. If you're expecting more, don't.I usually get their mixed salad combo, it's a perfect lunch, not too heavy.  you get a deliciously seasoned chicken breast, some gyro meat all sitting on top of some salad and a piece of pita bread.  Oh and your choice of dressing.  It's clean tasty and hits the spot. I've also had their chicken sandwich, which i do enjoy with lettuce mayo on french bread.  The chicken is grilled you can tell its been marinating.  It just hits the spot.  They have all of your typical options, gyros, dogs, burgers, fries etc... its a solid place.  The only thing I am not a fan of is their cheese fries, not a fan of the krinkled fry and the cheese is too watery for me.  I head to Mr. Greeks for my cheese fries.  But I do enjoy eating the food from here, no fuss, just good ol lunch! do it!Oh and if you read this again Lauren D. Bite me! :D

45.description: Great price and portion size. I alternate between the Grecian chicken or gyros quite often.

33.description: I was going to head to Mr. Greeks when I saw Zeus. Outside it smells greasy as hell; However, this place is well-ventilated. Also, it's very clean and well-kept. The food was delicious. I got the gyros and it was put on the grill. It was nice and crispy. Also, they stuffed the pita and the cucumber sauce... Yum. It was such a nice cool counterpart to the warm gyros.

43.description: Saturday -- April 26 2014/1:04pm -- Order #103 TO GO / $14.54Hi Zeus Gyros, I visited your restaurant for the very first time yesterday and the only issue I have is that my crinkle-cut fries were not separated [placed separately] from the grilled chicken/lettuce/tomatoes/onions/dressing.  The crinkle-cut fries were SOGGY because the grilled chicken was placed ON TOP of the fries, in the Styrofoam container and I also believe that some sort of liquid dressing was placed on the lettuce/tomatoes/onions.  I don't understand that practice, the practice of placing chicken on top of fries :/  I was not happy after making it back to my car, and did not feel like returning to request another order of fries; I threw the soggy/chicken-flavored fries in the garbage when I got home.  Soggy fries that taste like chicken is NOT appetizing in my opinion.BTW, 4 stars-"Yah! I'm a fan" because the grilled chicken pita was delicious, NOT because of the soggy/chicken-flavored fries.  I will return for the Chicken Breast Plate and will REMEMBER to ask that my fries be placed "ON THE SIDE".  NOW, I know.

2.description: They serve ALOT for the dinner plates. I got a mixed plate with rice and it was really good. The pita bread is especially delicious. I wish I would've gotten a gyro instead, though. I couldn't eat all of the dinner plate. My boyfriend had the gyro plate, and together it was about $21. Not expensive at all considering how much food we ate. They also only have RC products, so I got pink lemonade. The area was pretty accessible too. We parked down the street at a Pay and Park. There's also a park nearby at walking distance that you can go after and walk off the calories.

18.description: You guys at Zeus are just setting me up for failure on my diet. Yes I take no personal responsibility for my actions when I walk into Zeus!!! Mmmmm... This could be the beginning of a problem for me. I went to Zeus with a bunch of co-workers for lunch and tried the Gyro burger. A beef patty topped with gyro meat, lettuce, tomato, onion & cucumber sauce. (tzatziki)         It was pretty damn good I must say. My fries as well. I'm glad I chose the gyro burger because I was contemplating the Greek burger .I was totally expecting greatness from that Greek burger. I figured hey I love Greek chicken that burger might be awesome. My coworker got  the Greek burger  and I could tell she wanted to shoot herself for picking this sandwich.  I tried it and it was boring. It was a burger  with feta cheese on  a baguette looking roll. #Fail I felt bad for her because my  gyro burger gave my mouth an orgasm! Hers was more like a premature ejaculation. (can I say that ish??)             I will definitely be back. Now the challenge will be to try something new!! I'm kinda hooked on that gyro burger! Later Gators!!!

41.description: I had the mixed plate and it was pretty good. An enormous serving of chicken and gyro over a large salad with awkwardly incredible fries was served to Mr for right around ten bucks. Not a bad deal. They only give one pita bread (cut into fours) so that can be a plus or minus.There's a ten percent off discount for UIC students.Also, they put fries underneath the meat. So heads up before they get soggy!

52.description: As good as Zeus was (and dirt cheap always fits for me), it won't take me away from my closer 'hood spots, Niko's Gyros and Falafel & Grill.  Incredibly, $7 for the combo at Zeus (gyro loaded to the hilt, what amounts to a small order of McDonald's salty fries and nearly uncarbonated RC Cola) is hefty compared to the prices at Niko's/Falafel, where I can get out for $6 depending on when I go and the combo I order.  That said, Zeus does the meat and the pita just right...but the gyro meat in this town is so close on quality (even Covo, pricier than all three of these, is great in the meat department) that I would never drive out of my way to hit this spot.  But if I'm a UIC student and get 10% off and live really close by?  Totally different.  The divey interior was comfy and we got to watch CNN break down the Duck Dynasty "controversy" while throwing down our meal.Note--for true value, get the platter; a friend of mine ordered the combo dinner plate, and for $8, you can live like a filthy king.  Seriously, the word used when the plate arrived:  "mountainous"

50.description: Tried their gyros and their mixed plate. Both were delicious.The mixed plate is a LOT of food. it comes with both chicken and gyro meat over a salad with pita.The gyros is standard and overflowing with ingredients, all of them tasty. The mixed plate was $9 and the gyros was under $6. Good deals for the amount of food.They are open quite late which is good for the late after bar/club crowd.UIC students get a ten percent discount.

4.description: It wasn't a perfect experience, but I won't let my nit-pickiness get in the way. I ordered the mixed plate and for ten bucks I got a mountain of food. Everything was fresh and the meat was seasoned and cooked to perfection. It's kind of a grimy sit down joint, which made the food quality a surprise. Five stars hands down. My only complaints - The cashier was a little abrasive.The salad barely had any dressing.The plate didn't come with any feta.All easily remedied with the exception of the 'tude, but that's not really a big deal to me. I'll be back.

6.description: First time at Zeus last Friday, and it has made it on the list on my lunch rotation.  The service is fast, portions are huge, and the price is right.  I got the mixed plate: Gyro, grilled chicken, salad, pita, all on a bed of fries!   All in it was under 10 bucks.  The quality of the proteins, pita, salad, and tzatziki sauce was great.   The name even sounds cool!  "Where you going for lunch?  Going to Zeus!"

22.description: Had the 1/2 Greek chicken which includes a salad, fries & garlic bread. Tons of delicious food at a great price. Absolutely loved the entire meal. Definitely will be my go to spot for takeout.

15.description: Friendly young man greeted me when I walked in and was polite and helpful even though he was about to close. The food is good prices. Typical of what you'd find in a hole in the wall gyro shop.  The gyro had tons of meat on it! Seriously the most I've gotten at a place like this. Took me forever to finish. Came with fries and a drink too for only $8

57.description: Had dinner last night here and we were pleasantly surprised.  Food was great!  I had the chicken dish with a salad and rice that was YUMMY as was the gyro my friend had as well.  Inexpensive, good service and great service - you can go wrong with that combination.

20.description: You can save 40% by ordering direct by calling instead of through Grub Hub.  Menu items are about $2 less, and the delivery charge is less.Good inexpensive Gyros.

36.description: Excellent Greek-American fast food joint. Smaller dining area, only boasting about six tables inside, so it can get cramped. We were able to grab a table for lunch...lucky. Tried the Philly Cheesesteak with everything, and enjoyed evey freaking bit of it. Fresh bread jammed with piping hot cheesesteak, melted provolone, sautéed onions and peppers, and topped with shredded lettuce. Freaking delish. My co-diner tried the gyros, and exclaimed them to be the best he's had in YEARS! Tall praises considering our South side gyros roots. It's not Gordon Ramsay, but its five stars for what it is does, and the food its putting out!

14.description: Absolutely fantastic. I ordered the mixed plate dinner (chicken, gyro, french fries or rice, simple salad, grilled pita) The food was absolutely delcisous, moist, tender, flavorful...and a TON of it. Hit on all three components of the trifecta, bulk, quality, price = maximum value. Simply incredible. Will be back VERY soon.

29.description: I come for the coffee, I return because of the employees.  Quite possibly the friendliest Starbucks staff I've encountered.  They are always upbeat and do everything in their power to get your drink the way you wanted it.

42.description: I really try to keep my reviews of large chains to a minimum, but this particular Starbucks location has really earned this one.First off, I don't know what the morning crew is like, but I've been here a number of times in the afternoon because it's close to UIC. Every single time, the afternoon crew is slow-moving, not at all friendly, and they get my order wrong. Every. Single. Time.Grande Black Iced Tea, sweetened. I have NEVER once gotten the tea and had it be sweetened, anyone who tries dissolving raw sugar in a cold drink will understand why it has to be done with the liquid sugar behind the bar. When I ask politely for the error to be corrected, the barista then proceeds to painstakingly add sweetener in a huff, as if I just asked some huge elaborate favor. The iced tea is already made, you just have to shake it with some liquid sugar and ice, hardly a complicated order.I've literally gone through this routine on at LEAST 5 separate occasions. Despite the convenience, I swear I'll never stop here again.

23.description: I love the crew here! The ladies are great! Clean bathrooms. I just wish they had longer hours and brought back those tasty rice crispy treats.

8.description: This is easily the worst Starbucks in the city. The employees are rude, the service is slow, the espresso is burnt and they have forgotten my order more than once. Today I waited 15 minutes for a latte.

31.description: I didn't like the fact that they talked over the phone while I was in the line waiting in the morning. I felt like they needed more personel to serve clients. Overall, it's a nice place, good location and everybody was friendly.

34.description: the morning crew is just....great. i've cheated on them a few times and, appallingly, visited the starbucks inside dominicks (don't even get me started on the Greektown Dominicks in general. don't.) where they assumed i'd want sugar-free syrup since i ordered nonfat milk. they've done this twice now. gross. ...but, getting back to Greektown Starbucks...friendly service, "high five fridays," and great behind-the-bar banter with each other. their morning service is probably one of the best in chicago. and they are far enough away from the loop that we, as customers, don't have deal with offices sending down their minions to grab 10 lattes and such. yeah. i've been behind "that guy" several times in locations throughout the loop.

16.description: I love this Starbucks location! It's located in Greektown, so it's only steps away from amazing restaurants and bakeries. When I don't feel like being cooped up studying at home, I usually make my way to this location. There are plenty of tables with outlets inside along with comfy chairs. There's also additional space outside on the patio, which is great for people watching. If you're gonna be studying or just want to surf the web, there is free wifi that you can get (the name of the wifi network has 'ATT' in it FYI)The staff has been incredibly friendly and welcoming every time I've been offering suggestions and recommending new drinks and treats. My go-to drinks are the caramel macchiato, green tea frap, shaken iced tea lemonade, and pumpkin latte just to name a few.In terms of parking, there is plenty of street parking, but also a parking lot behind the building.Overall, great spot to study or catch up with friends!

13.description: Ok Google - How many Starbucks are there in the world? Answer as of today: 21,160With that many stores, your processes and products will be pretty standard so like always - let's focus on the people and place (building).The layout is fairly spacious and accommodates good workspace and hangouts for those "work from home" days. There's also a small corner near the front of the shop with a few arm chairs and mini ottomans for a more intimate and relaxed environment. The music level varies from time to time but overall is usually at a good level. |Speaking of "working from home"| Let's address the one thing that's becoming almost as crucial as air - WiFi. The connection is fairly reliable here but whether or not it'll meet your capacity (bandwidth)  needs is a whole different story. I spent a ~4 hours here during one visit and was not able to pull data from an enterprise-size database as I experienced heavy delays retrieving results from fairly short queries. Another thing to note is that while the sign says the WiFi is supported by Google it is in fact supported by AT&T still - which isn't the biggest show stopper but I do experience slower speeds using a device on a non-AT&T network than I do using a device on AT&T when connected to this locations WiFi. I suppose that's to be expected and there's tons of variables that could cause this but its something to highlight and consider. All in all, if you're only looking to do web/app browsing and email, you'll be fine but anything more than that and you may want to take that into consideration.|Do you really need a car in Chicago|Something I haven't really had to consider until moving to Chicago is - parking. Not every place has free parking, especially downtown and when it does its for a reasonable limited time (approx 2 hours) before you need to pay some type of parking charge. While this location does have a parking lot supporting it, the parking lot is shared with a bank and a small retail strip. Some parking spots are marked for "Bank Customers Only", however the times I may or may not have parked there were non issues for me in the morning and afternoon (quick trips running in and out btw). All in all (and this is something I assume Starbucks isn't responsible for) the parking lot should be better labeled. In the end, you're in Chicago though so enjoy your walk (maybe not in this current weather) or take advantage of the CTA bus stops located less than a block away.|Baristas make the world go round|The staff here is awesome, friendly and quick to learn your order, which is always appreciated it. They're able to keep the line moving while keeping the ordering process personable and enjoyable. I have to say that while personalities differ from city to city, the staff at this location balances a nice "Chicago feel" w/the Starbucks experience. All in all, this location is a winner. This Starbucks location is one that is sure to meet your needs when you're in the West Loop/Near West area.

11.description: I've been coming to this location every weekday morning for about two weeks now. I love the morning crew. They all know my name and drink order now. They are all very friendly and welcoming. The lines always go fast if there is one. The store is large, and always has at least one open table. There is also seating outside which is great for these nice spring/ summer mornings.Going for gold!

39.description: Favorite Starbucks in the city. Very nice people. Two options for Starbucks in Greek Town. 100 S Halsted is much better than Union Station Adams Starbucks.

37.description: Very little seating at this location and what they do have isn't comfortable. But why the 1 star? When I was getting my change, they cashier motioned it into to the tip jar and asked "In here?" The bloody nerve!

0.description: They have more staff for the morning rush which is helpful in getting drinks out quicker. It's also warm place and big with a lot of tables to just sit and hang out in the morning. Very close to work which makes it more convienent

38.description: I absolutely LOVE LOVE LOVE the service and staff at this location. I have been a loyal customer to Starbucks for at least 16 years. This location had exceeded my expectations. I have been going to this location for a little while now and I swear by my 4th visit they already knew my name. How cool is that!?! The staff even reminded me about me wanting to try out a new coffee today. It made me realize that you just don't get service like that any more. It certainly made me feel special that they remembered. I walk past another starbucks to go here and i suggest you do too! Highly recommend!

27.description: My choice for Starbucks because they have a small parking lot in the back.

32.description: I love this Starbucks location! It's located in Greektown, so it's only steps away from amazing restaurants and bakeries. When I don't feel like being cooped up studying at home, I usually make my way to this location. There are plenty of tables with outlets inside along with comfy chairs. There's also additional space outside on the patio, which is great for people watching. If you're gonna be studying or just want to surf the web, there is free wifi that you can get (the name of the wifi network has 'ATT' in it FYI)The staff has been incredibly friendly and welcoming every time I've been offering suggestions and recommending new drinks and treats. My go-to drinks are the caramel macchiato, green tea frap, shaken iced tea lemonade, and pumpkin latte just to name a few.In terms of parking, there is plenty of street parking, but also a parking lot behind the building.Overall, great spot to study or catch up with friends!

44.description: I mean, it's a Starbucks.  The coffee's just okay and they don't have free wifi.  Even as far as Starbucks(es?) go, this place its pretty small and unimpressive.  The one thing it does have going for it is that they actually have parking behind the building, which is a pretty nice find in Greektown.

24.description: It's a Starbucks - you are going to get the coffee you are expecting.  The staff aren't particularly friendly.  What more is there to say?

7.description: This place gets kind of busy, I forgot how busy. The girls at the cash and the baristas are really nice but I noticed they don't know how to make a few of the drinks (and day as much). They're nice about warming up snacks for you. Nothing like a warm thousand calorie brownie to get you through a study sesh. I RECOMMEND- Getting in before 2pm for the good tables EXTRA TIP- Sandwiches finish quickly.

40.description: Crew is very nice people. Paola mmm. The rest u already know. It's a Starbucks.

30.description: Pretty average as far as Starbucks go. Not a lot of seating inside. I've been there some weekday mornings when it was standing room only. On warmer days, the sidewalk cafe is a nice option.

1.description: Unprofessional, dirty, slow.I am confident that this establishment would not succeed as an independent coffee shop.This is my neighborhood starbucks and today will be my last visit. Customer service is so so so slow, really amateur. An employee today put his luggage onto the food preparation board and did not clean it afterwards. Very little seating, a lot of it people clearly camping out for the day to get out of the cold. One plus point is that their coffee tastes just as good as other stores.My experience was very consistent with the other recent reviews on here, and was the fourth time I have had a bad experience.

9.description: Absolute rudest staff I've encoutered at a Starbucks. Oh and beware - they close the bathrooms around 9:30 (30 minutes before close) and block it off!!! Absolute craziness!!!

26.description: The service here was great and so was my chicken sausage wrap and iced green tea.  I'll definitely be back.

25.description: I only gave it 4 starts because I've only been here once and i was satisfied with my visit. I only drink fraps and their's was good

12.description: Came here for the first time and dealt with some pretty terrible customer service.  Renae definitely made a name for herself by acting extremely rude!  Usually I'm understanding of people in the industry because I used to work in the restaurant industry myself, however the snooty attitude is worth a review

21.description: There are many Starbucks around but this one of my favourite. Located in Greek Town gives a great view on Chicago skyscrapers. I also like the service at this Starbucks. It has big table and comfortable corner chairs to work or read.

17.description: There are many Starbucks around but this one of my favourite. Located in Greek Town gives a great view on Chicago skyscrapers. I also like the service at this Starbucks. It has big table and comfortable corner chairs to work or read.

10.description: Was surprised to see a clover press at this location since the ambiance of this place does not feel upscale as any other store without a clover press. The customer service for running out of a exclusive bean is lacking - In my experience, if a rare bean is out, you usually get a free drink coupon. My favorite rare bean is Kona and on the menu it shows available but when I order a cup, they told me it was out. Besides that, there are plenty of hidden plugs all along the counter and a great outdoor seating (no plugs outside).

5.description: I like the view from window and they have plenty of outlets that you can charge your phone easily. The other starbucks in the city usually dont have that much outlet or they dont let you charge your phone or laptop. It's so close to mariano's so you can have a little rest after you shop for groceries. The caramel macchiatto is the best.

3.description: At first I thought my review would be a stand out, perhaps I've just had 10-12 bad experiences and that wasn't the norm. After reading the other reviews it looks like this store is in serious need of new employees and management. Here's what people are saying : 1. Rude Employees2. Filthy Store3. Zero customer focus4. Employees that treat the work place like a social club / locker room. I personally witnessed four employees horsing around 'spanking' each other making jokes while customers went without help.

35.description: Great staff!!!! Had ordered a couple of travelers and the guy named Shawn helped me to carry it for at least a block all the way to my destination. Awesome!

19.description: I Would give the Starbucks negative stars but of course yelp doesn't have it. I used to love this Starbucks the people were friendly and awesome. Until one morning I decided to walk with my dog to get a quick coffee.  My dog is 9 pounds a puppy and from a shelter. He was abused and it's still not good with people or other dogs. Ive carried him in before to quick grab my coffee and everyone was always so friendly with him. Until today when I go in and some random Starbucks woman looks at me and says you can't have your dog. She tells me to go tie him up to a pole like everyone else. I tell her He's 9 lbs and easily frightened. Shes an obvious dog hater. I look at her and say can I quick grab my coffee and then I'll leave he wasn't hurting anyone. Starbucks woman "no you need to leave with your dog". I could not believe this person. Terrible service

28.description: Pretty average Starbucks. There is plenty of outlets and space for people. When the summer hits, they have a nice outdoor patio.

45.description: You know those pre-packaged bags of Starbucks coffee you can buy at Jewel or Dominick's?  Some of those bags are also vouchers for a free tall coffee at Starbucks stores.  I've presented these vouchers previously and have been served up a tall coffee with a smile at the Morgan Street location. I wanted to use the voucher I had on this day at the 100 South Halsted store instead so my coffee wouldn't be cold when I got home.  They refused to honor it.  I guess they aren't a "participating" location.  Furthermore, they told me to go to the Starbucks in Dominick's or back to the Morgan location.  Wow.  Just wow.  Howard would be appalled.  Starbucks at 100 South Halsted: they aren't a "participating" location.  I recommend you participate at the Morgan Street location if you're in this area.

33.description: It's just another starbucks, but fairly friendly service.  But beware!!!  If you park in the 'no parking' zone, tow trucks mysteriously arrive within seconds.  they camp out in the bank parking lot or a nearby location and tow instantly.  I've seen at least half a dozen cars towed out.  Unfortunately, in the morning, the parking situation is terrible, so I usually find myself at the dunkin donuts at Washington and Sangamon.  The remaining handful of W. Loop Starbucks also suffer from the same shortage of parking.  Its time for a drive thru coffee service in the neighborhood!

43.description: Hands down, my favorite Starbucks in the area. The baristas are super friendly and my coffee is always delicious.

2.description: Worst Starbucks ever. Terribly Slow service. Employees are extremely rude and will actually have personal conversations rather than wait on people in line. AVOID THIS LOCATION AT ALL COSTSUpdate. Got stuck going here again and I caught the barista adding water to my iced latte instead the requested 5 shots of espresso. Oh Starbucks my patience is wearing thin with your now normal terrible customer service. Never will I visit this location again. ABSOLUTELY NEVER

18.description: Eh, it's alright. Sometimes they're nice, sometimes they're mean...

41.description: Love the Crew here the girls are super nice and friendly I used to go in here a lot as the bf was working across the street, wish he still was I miss going here

4.description: this Starbucks used to be great, but those days have passed. extremely rude employees & the place is filthy. I was here a week ago and there was literally a used diaper on the floor of men's room. I told an employee and they shrugged. time to find a new coffee shop, this place is the worst.this is probably why no one wears a name tag.

6.description: Eh, I asked for little ice I. My iced tea and the glass was all ice.  For $3 I can go somewhere better!

22.description: Standard drinks just like any Starbucks but this was just different than most Starbucks trips, I've been here a couple times and the service wasn't bad but it wasn't what I'd expect from a Starbucks. I walk into a Starbucks expecting a smile (fake or not) and at least to get my order right, I've only gone in around 3:30-4:00pm so I can only speak for this specific shift. I went in after seeing the new secret menu item butterbeer, a Harry potter inspired drink that's only around during the holiday season, when I asked for it the barista that was taking the order was baffled, I expected this but then out of no where another woman barges her way next to me sweeping at my feet and orders my order for me, because me making conversation with a barista on how I'd like the drink is I guess bad for business, and they weren't packed and I was the only one in line so I had to have my order ordered for me incompletely just put me off because I  got espresso in what was supposed to be a non espresso drink, sooooooooo maybe it's just me but I just don't care for the pissy faces and the idc about anything but getting out of here attitude in this Starbucks was pretty much where I was going with this.

15.description: This Starbucks is the worst in the area. I only use it for convenience.  First of all, the staff is SLOW. Second, they forget to make your drinks and then are RUDE about it. Get a clue and get a new manager to manage this staff.

20.description: Not to jump on the bandwagon but the many reviews about the weekday morning crew are 1000% correct. They are always so happy to see you, they remember your drink almost all of the time, and actually give you the impression that they genuinely WANT to help you! They always have great tunes playing and most of the time, one, if not all of them are cheerfully singing along with the music. I specifically remember one time letting a mother and her 3 children go ahead of me in line, as the youngest child was starting to get impatient....not a huge deal considering she's got 3 people to worry about and I'm simply taking care of me. By the time I got to the register, the barista offered my coffee "on the house" for such a nice gesture. I was so taken aback because customer service like this is unfortunately dead in society today. I thanked her and put what money it would have cost me for my coffee, into the tip jar. If you're looking for a place for coffee in the morning and you need something to make you smile, I HIGHLY suggest hitting up this starbucks, you won't be disappointed!

36.description: Very small, not best suited for students which by the way UIC is a few blocks away.  Not quite due to the intimate layout.  Great for meeting people I guess.

14.description: Fast service with lots of indoor and outdoor seating. Well definitely come back to this location when I'm having a Starbucks craving!

58.description: I'm always on the lookout for places that deliver to where I work on the UIC West campus after 3am. I only know of a few and even though the food is good it also isn't exactly anything special. Im glad I found a menu for Toppers laying around because it tunrs out some of their food is actually Great. Their Cheesy Bread sticks are Awesome especially with the garlic sauce, I also Loved their Pizza and the toppings I've tried so far. I've heard good things about their Grinders so I'm gonna try them next. I like Toppers so much thay I'm even gonna give it a try at home one night. KUDOS TOPPERS!

56.description: Yo, this place has the best buffalo chicken sandwich that I've ever had from a pizza chain.I saw it for the first time many months ago and tried it very recently. Really hearty ingredients.

29.description: Fast, hot, tasty pizza and the best delivery bread/cheese sticks. Obviously this isn't Coalfire, but it is very good for delivery pizza and they have way more options than Papa John's or Dominos. Also, Toppers delivery drivers are nice and not creepy.

42.description: Excellent late night pizza.  Get the sausage. Open to 3 am.

23.description: The twice baked potato pizza is the best pizza I've ever had. Ever. I love potatoes. Like, a lot.

47.description: I don't understand what everyone is raving about. I ordered Topperstix and a Large Cheese pizza. I've had better at Sbarro. The 'stix' were bland and rubbery. The Garlic dipping sauce was room temp (I live half a mile from the place), but edible, and pretty much a necessity to get through them. The pizza was lackluster at best. I'm not sure where they get their cheese from but it had practically no flavor, though perhaps that just because the sauce was so sweet it overpowered everything else. The only part of the pizza I specifically liked was the crust. Ordered from them because of the great Yelp reviews, and Yelp failed me. Never ordering from this place again.

8.description: I have no idea what these people with bad reviews are experiencing, but I've ordered from toppers at least half a dozen times and every experience has been amazingly wonderful! The hand tossed pizza is the absolute best, and their endless options of dipping sauces makes my heart rejoice. I love their Parmesan garlic wings and their toppers cheesy bread. It all makes my boyfriend and I so very, very happy. The waiting times are usually always exactly what they say they are and I've never waited longer than 45 minutes for pizza from them (but it's usually much shorter). The food is always hot and delicious and I wouldn't have it any other way.I had previously ordered from the domino's off of Madison (which has one and a half stars on yelp if that tells you anything) so I'm incredibly grateful to find a replacement pizza place that gives 100% all the time.

31.description: My girlfriend and I pass this Toppers regularly on the way to Mariano's, so we decided to give it a try last night. Ordered a large buffalo chicken (the "Freak of the Week" $10.99 special) and a Topperstix. Delivery: Very fast, probably around 30 minutes which beat their estimate of 40. We live less than a half mile away, but quick delivery is always appreciated. Driver was super nice.Pizza: The bacon was excellent, had a smoky taste and wasn't overcooked like Papa John's bacon. I liked the 50/50 combo of ranch and buffalo sauce. The chicken was decent, nothing to write home about. Severely lacking on cheese, to the point of maybe 40% of the pizza being a bald patch under the toppings.Topperstix: Sufficient, a bit bland, no seasoning or anything. Also lacking on the cheese :(Sauces: We tried Chipotle Ranch and Parmesan Garlic. The CR was very good, heavy smoke flavor when first opened but after that it was a good amount. The PG was very flavorful, but way too salty. Felt like the ratio of parmesan to garlic wasn't very balanced.Leftovers: Tasted pretty much the same after going back in the oven, which is more than you can say about a lot of pizza places.All in all, not too bad and I'd like to try some of their other house pizzas. The cheese-skimping was disappointing though, so I'll probably try a few other places before returning.

34.description: Food was awesome! Topper Stix are great and definitely a cut above the average pizza chain.

16.description: Literally the worst. Super bad experience. I don't care how good or bad the pizza is, the place is the worst service ever.  They are awful!

13.description: If you're not a pizza elitist, and want a good old Midwestern pizza place (ala Papa Johns and Pizza Hut and Dominos), this is your place. The breadsticks are great and so is the pizza. It is quick and convenient, too

11.description: This place is horrible !!! We just had them delivery our pizza and it was cold, old, and burnt.... Please save your time, money, and stomach ...

39.description: This place sucks. I'm 2 blocks into a neighborhood that's on grand which apparently is just a 30 seconds too far for them to deliver to me. I will never be a customer as a result. Way to bring in new business.

37.description: Food is ok if you are looking for a late night pizza place.  Service was not so good.  Called in the order and the guy who answered the phone was rude and very short.  I asked him what dipping sauces they had and he said we have them all.  I then said, not sure what I want so can you name them for me.  He started naming the sauces but he was talking so fast that I didn't understand what he was saying.  Of course when we picked up the pizza he gave us the wrong dipping sauce.They said it would be ready in 15 minutes but when we picked it up it took about 35 minutes.  They are VERY slow.  A

0.description: The topper stix here are amazing and my go to hangover food when I'm having one of those days in the cube farm. My only complaint is it's really inconsistent. Sometimes they are like the best thing I've ever put in my mouth and sometimes the dough is not right or there is not enough cheese. But the times it is really good makes the risk worth it. Staff is always SUPER friendly! And I could drink the garlic butter....so there's that...

38.description: The pizza is very good with sausage and extra cheese. I like hot, so I always put the red pepper on it too. Visit this place in person, as the delivery isn't always super quick. But for a nice, evening or late night pizza, they are a great choice.

51.description: fast easy and greasy.

27.description: We delivered what you ordered! Really? Love the pizza but customer service sucks. Somebody please give  manager, Frank, some customer service training. Toppers made a mistake with our order..never apologized, nor did they offer to deliver the pizza we ordered. I see others have issues with service too.  "Sorry" goes a long way. So now, we're done!

32.description: I no longer have to diet. I just eat at Topper's. It's amazing. For every pounds of food I eat I seem to crap out two pounds in the most painfully explosive way possible. The food is great for late night... I highly recommend the bacon sticks. They may actually increase the ratio of pounds in /out. Bottom line though.. I will not need to spend hours in the gym sweating when I can just eat Topper's pizza and lose weight with no effort and only slight anal bleeding.

54.description: This place just does not have it. Not sure whether it's management or other issues. I placed a pretty simple order and everything was wrong (asked for a 2 liter and got 2 20 oz bottles as a sub, didn't get the sauces I asked for). I called back after after I received my order, and I was offered a coupon as a best option. I will say the food is good, but the other stuff needs some work.

48.description: Late night Buffalo chicken pizza delivered right to your door!

44.description: Always pretty quick when I have ordered. Toppers sticks are always good as expected. Will continue to call back!

24.description: I used to have no issues with this place, but lately if I call them, no one answers (even though they're supposed to be open until 3am) One time we ordered online, went to pick it up and they were closed (Again, before 3am).

7.description: 1/2 smoky BBQ chicken, 1/2 three little pigs (the side with green onions) on crispy thin crust. Delicious for fast food pizza.

49.description: So obviously Chicago is known for good pizza - and there are definitely a multitude of better options for pizza in the city, BUT every once in a while you need a GOOD SHITTY pizza!  Toppers blows Papa Johns, Domino's, Pizza Hut, etc. out of the water!  I have only tried the pizza - but can't wait for my next craving to try the Toppersstix.  Toppers wins the best shitty pizza award in my book.

40.description: I came and picked up breadsticks for Fat Tuesday. They were the bacon breadsticks. Delish! Food was ready and warm when I got there!

53.description: I just moved to the South Loop and this was the first pizza place I tried (delivery).  It was sub-standard.  The taste was fairly bland and there was not nearly enough cheese.  The top of the pizza was overcooked yet the dough was undercooked.The reviews of this place seem pretty high for what I experienced.  It wasn't the worst pizza I ever had, but it was disappointing.

30.description: Poor service. I ordered a delivery pizza and waited 1.5 hours.  The first person I talked to said it was on its way,  then the manager accused me if giving the wrong phone number so they could call me even though I had my confirmation screen up on my computer where it was clearly correct. They didn't even apologize. I would go somewhere else if looking for reliable service.

46.description: They used to have this pizza with a honey mustard sauce and canadian bacon which was soooo good but even though its no longer on the menu I am still a regular here for their topperstix.

1.description: One of the closer locations for a quick pizza fix in the neighborhood. It was a simple equation on Sunday to fill up and assume the position on the couch for football.Order was pretty painless and the normal pick-up time was 15-20 minutes versus the delivery window which is always an hour. A nice departure from Lou's or Giordano's and you can't beat the price by comparison while maintaining the satisfaction level. Currently, when you check-in at this location you receive 30% off the entire menu which is an incentive to carry-out.The pizza was on par with major chains but in the face of a couple issues. Once I got out the door I realized the garlic butter (crack sauce) had broke open and saturated the entire bottom of the pizza box. I was more let down by the loss of the sauce rather than the mess. Bacon strips (there is an option for strips or pieces) on said pizza were kinda skimpy and almost transparent. Topper stix should be accompany any order and if you keep your expectations where they should be this is an easy win.

55.description: This is our go-to pizza delivery place. They are pretty reliable and the pizza's good for delivery. Definitely better than Domino's or Papa John's. We tried the Mac & Cheese Pizza for the first time last night. And it is exactly what it sounds like. And awesome. I'd be scared of what would happen if I were left alone with a large one of those and a strong desire to eat my feelings...

9.description: Toppers must treat their employees right. This isn't the first time I have experienced good service at Toppers (did so at a Milwaukee location as well last December). These guys are awesome. The pizza was well made (carefully, baked right, etc), and while Toppers isn't necessarily my favorite pizza in the world, this was really quite good. I asked for it well done (like crispy crust), and they did just that.  Super quick service, and super nice guys.

26.description: If there were negative ratings this place would get one! When the manager was taking my order, I had to repeat the order over three times because he couldnt get the address or phone # right. I ordered my pizza around 11:30am and it didnt arrive until 1:30pm! This place is literally two blocks away! I would have picked up the pizza myself but I was working at the time(ordering the pizza for coworkers at the business) After the pizza didnt arrive by 1pm, I called and they said the pizza guy got lost and that they will have to remake the pizza (IT'S TWO BLOCKS AWAY). When they finally got here all they did was give us a 16oz coke. SERIOUSLY?!?Not only that but they forgot the plates and forks AND didnt even cut the pizza fully. If anybody ever ordered food at work, you know you dont have these supplies just laying around. The pizza was undercooked and extrmemely greasy. Also the wings were nasty. After eating, almost all the workers's stomachs were upset.WILL NEVER EVER GO BACK

25.description: Pizza is kinda ok. Service is too bad! Rude and careless manner and never delivered on time! Never! Same excuses about being delayed (lost their way). Not a place I would recommend when you are really hungry! So disappointing!

12.description: I refuse to pay full price and you should too.  And I don't mean throw a temper tantrum in the pizza shop, I mean always look for deals like restaurant.com coupons, Yelp check-in discounts and/or their Toppers special offers.I walked-in, placed my order and was ready to bounce with 2 hot pizzas about 15 minutes later.  I did a much better job of picking pizzas that demanded I have more than one slice.I ordered the Smokey BBQ chicken, a super sweet one with loads of BBQ sauce as the base, topped with chicken, onions, bacon and more BBQ sauce drizzled over it all.  I had to order a second pizza, because I'm eating for....my inner fat girl.  I have a hard time ordering just one pizza because I like the variety.  For the second pizza I threw in a wild card choice, the Hangover.  It's a butter crust, topped with green peppers, ham, and POTATO!?!  Hells yeah I said po-tat-O!  I didn't really notice a big difference between the "butter" crust and the other crust.  It didn't seem to have a flakier or crunchier texture or anything drastic like I was expecting/hoping for.  There was no sauce on the Hangover either, almost just like when you're really hungover and you forget to put everything on because you're about to get baked.  P.S. Both taste really good the next day (re-baked or not)

59.description: I have ordered from here a few times when they opened up and I lived down the street.  I also ordered once when I moved from West Loop to West Town.  Pizza was always warm and on time.  However I tried ordering again at my new address after receiving a mail flyer.  I was informed I am outside of there delivery area !?!? WHY send me coupons? My first address was 1.0 mile from them.  My current address is 1.5 mi according to google maps only a 6 min drive.  I can't  believe they mailed flyer's and delivered here before and wont deliver!   I tired pleading with the manager  not to mention I was ordering $50 of food.  She told me its a insurance complication... I have worked multiple food delivery jobs and have never heard of this before.

21.description: Great place! Pizza is Phenomenal! Everything is just so great there.  It would be 5 stars but it took a LITTLE long for our order. In their defense, we ordered a lot and it was late. However, it was definitely worth the wait I'll be returning again soonish!

17.description: If there were negative ratings this place would get one! When the manager was taking my order, I had to repeat the order over three times because he couldnt get the address or phone # right. I ordered my pizza around 11:30am and it didnt arrive until 1:30pm! This place is literally two blocks away! I would have picked up the pizza myself but I was working at the time(ordering the pizza for coworkers at the business) After the pizza didnt arrive by 1pm, I called and they said the pizza guy got lost and that they will have to remake the pizza (IT'S TWO BLOCKS AWAY). When they finally got here all they did was give us a 16oz coke. SERIOUSLY?!?Not only that but they forgot the plates and forks AND didnt even cut the pizza fully. If anybody ever ordered food at work, you know you dont have these supplies just laying around. The pizza was undercooked and extrmemely greasy. Also the wings were nasty. After eating, almost all the workers's stomachs were upset.WILL NEVER EVER GO BACK

10.description: Ordered a Medium Pepperoni thin crust, three different kinds of wings, and a triple order of breadsticks.  The bill was $60!!  EVERYTHING showed up cold.  The wings were the best part of the meal, but we had ordered (1) boneless wings and they came with bones. The pizza and breadsticks might have been better if they were hot.  The dipping sauces are horrible and I suspect one of them had my husband either sitting on OR hugging the toilet for 12 hours the next day! If your going to spend money like this, order from Lou's (or for a cheaper pizza fix, Sarpinos)!  At least there you won't spend the next day in the bathroom!!

5.description: I thought I'd try them since I live close. I paid almost $20 for a medium pizza that was really subpar. I mean, this pizza was just depressing. Soggy, tasteless... Not even worth the carbs, so I tossed it after 2 slices (and I was in the mood to abuse my body with fat and grease). After that, I got sick to my stomach for a day and a half. I come to find out my friend's roommate worked at that location. She pays for Giordano's despite getting free Toppers. That's how bad this place is.

3.description: Not to encourage this, but delivery places that mail out flyers to customers in their delivery area advertising deals, get new customers. The mac n cheese pizza on the menu, along with various breadstick options, whet my appetite and so I filled in an online ordering form to get the medium pizza and topperstick deal. I couldn't decide between the taco and mac n cheese pizzas, so I got a half n half. This option was only available on the thin crust or tall boy, and since I don't like a cracker type pizza, I ordered the tall boy crust, which is supposedly a topperstick turned pizza, and costs you $1 more. For my toppersticks I ordered pepperoni and then added cinnamon toppersticks for dessert. Delivery was fast and hot and came without issues. The food sank like a pit in my stomach, but I appreciated the thick, chewy, greasy (very greasy), nicely browned dough that my toppings came on. Taco wasn't my favorite but I really liked the mac n cheese one. The food was even good heated up in my toaster oven the next day. I had some indigestion the next day but that's what you get for overloading on greasy bread and cheese. Not the best pizza ever, but I'd imagine this would be perfect for a late night post drinking feast with leftovers to cure your hangover the next afternoon.

35.description: The service I got from this place was phenomenal I was having a bad day taking care of someone who was wasted. I prayed the food would get here fast. Fortunately it did and when I showed up the delivery person greeted me and made my whole day better by handing me a Chinese paper trap and 3 smarties along with my food. The only thing that bothered me was that the pizza got smushed. Other than that I was fairly happy with Toppers.

19.description: Just regular pizza. Nothing special.
