28.description: I really want to like this place.  I really do.  When the food is good, it's GREAT.  Solid pizza, solid topperstix.  However, we've been burned by them 3 times now.  First time we ordered delivery, they forgot a dipping sauce.  No biggie.  Second time, we came home late and I ordered online.  1.5 hours later, no food.  2 hours later, nothing.  I called and they said they never received the order.  They assured me they were making it now and it would be on its way in a half hour.  Hour later, I call again.  The manager lets me know that the food was never made.  She apologized profusely and blamed it on understaffing.  When the pizza finally arrived, the dough was still raw.  Barely edible but we were so hungry we ate it anyways.  From time of first order to actual delivery -- 3.5 hrs.Last night (Saturday), we walk by to put in an order and the place was closed.  Door said they should be open till 3am, but at 11:00pm on a Saturday, they were completely closed.  Went online and the system said they were taking orders.  I wonder how many poor souls ordered pizza online last night only to never get it.Bottom line, Toppers, as a franchise, makes great pizza, but this location needs to get their act together.

45.description: Went to use my 30% off coupon and they said they couldn't use it. It is specifically for this location when checking in. The manager said there was no option on the register for it. Not cool at all.

33.description: So I've been to the toppers in the South Loop and I wasn't impressed. It was kind of like a Little Caesars (yuck)! But I was working near this location in the west loop and one morning one of the employees of toppers walked in with a box of pizza. He said that someone had placed an order and never picked it up and asked if I wanted it. Being the bargain person I am, I was like "hell yeah!". We talked for a bit before I ate any of it and he was a cool guy. I appreciated the gesture. The pizza was actually really flippin' good. I like thin crust and that's exactly what it was. It didn't look like an old pizza so I was gobbling it down real fast. It was green peppers and sausage, something I would never order! Loved it! Somewhere in me I think that it was kind of a marketing strategy, because the pizza did not look like it was old and waiting for someone else. Well if it was, it worked! I will totally give Toppers a call when I want another pizza in the West Loop!

43.description: Friendly team, decent pizza, perfect for a late-night quick fix. Hubby and I got home much later than expected from a long flight and the staff was super helpful in answering my questions and customizing my order.

2.description: Toppers is my alternative to Papa Johns. Both are my go to pizza take outs and are close to my home. Only problem I have is that they can be a little greedy when it comes to toppings.For instance, if I decide to order a pizza with the only topping being Pineapple, I'll see perhaps 2 or 3 pieces per slice, which in my opinion is a little pointless. Otherwise no real complaints. Pizzas come out quick and they have great specials.

18.description: More of a pizza factory than a pizza palace. Service is an afterthought rather than a priority. Enjoy your COLD pizza. Play it safe, and go elsewhere...

41.description: I refuse to pay full price and you should too.  And I don't mean throw a temper tantrum in the pizza shop, I mean always look for deals like restaurant.com coupons, Yelp check-in discounts and/or their Toppers special offers.I walked-in, placed my order and was ready to bounce with 2 hot pizzas about 15 minutes later.  I did a much better job of picking pizzas that demanded I have more than one slice.I ordered the Smokey BBQ chicken, a super sweet one with loads of BBQ sauce as the base, topped with chicken, onions, bacon and more BBQ sauce drizzled over it all.  I had to order a second pizza, because I'm eating for....my inner fat girl.  I have a hard time ordering just one pizza because I like the variety.  For the second pizza I threw in a wild card choice, the Hangover.  It's a butter crust, topped with green peppers, ham, and POTATO!?!  Hells yeah I said po-tat-O!  I didn't really notice a big difference between the "butter" crust and the other crust.  It didn't seem to have a flakier or crunchier texture or anything drastic like I was expecting/hoping for.  There was no sauce on the Hangover either, almost just like when you're really hungover and you forget to put everything on because you're about to get baked.  P.S. Both taste really good the next day (re-baked or not)

52.description: Ordered pizza at 11:08am and was told the pizza would be here by 11:48.  At 11:58 called Toppers and they said it would be here within in 20 minutes (which is still 30 minutes late).  At 12:18 called Toppers because the pizza still had not arrived and was told it would be here "momentarily".  At 12:38 I called Toppers because it still had not arrived and the Manager put me on hold because he was "calling the driver".  After 7 minutes of sitting on hold I called Toppers from a different phone as my phone continued to sit on hold and the manager answered....um were you going to just keep me on hold until i hung up?  It has now been an hour and 45 minutes and I still do not have my order and I also do not have an ETA on the delivery because as the manager said the driver "is not picking up".  What a joke this place is.  The food has been comped and supposedly they are sending a gift certificate for our trouble but give me a break.  Why would I want to order from this place again given this garbage.

50.description: Amazing creative pizzas, taste delicious on many levels!

4.description: They said they do not use Yelp coupons and did not accept the coupon. Employees were clueless, and poorly trained.

6.description: I walked in at about 5pm to get a pizza (medium one topping) and wings (10) for $26 The staff was friendly and the food was decent not better or worse than what I expected.My only complaint was the wait. I knew I should have called ahead but didn't expect to wait 25 mins for the food. I would return but definitely call ahead.

22.description: The quality of the pizza and ingredients is awesome.  We love this place.  They also have good cheese bread sticks (with sauces), and they're open really late, too.

15.description: Pizza...average. Manager...is there a negative star? Every time we order from this location our pizza shows up wrong, the manager is rude, the manager is stubborn, the manager is terrible. This guy, Eri?, is the worst. Every time we have dealt with him has been a huge ordeal that ends up getting escalated to corporate. I don't understand how this guy is still employed. I am currently waiting, in the store, for a pizza we ordered to be delivered but Eri refused to deliver (well within the delivery zone) unless we paid for this pizza in store. We show up, and have to wait another 30 minutes?! This guy is the worst. If the price wasn't decent and the location convenient we would NEVER order from here. How many complaints about the same incompetent person does it take before a company realizes they've made a mistake by hiring this guy. We've been called by the district manger, we've been called by corporate, everyone apologizes, but Eri is still employed by this organization. He is incompetent and is costing the company money and customers. How many complaints does it take? Please correct this problem.

57.description: There are just too many good options in Chicago to deal with average pizza and sub-par service. Pizza: It's good enough, and better than Dominos or Pizza Hut if those are your other options. If you live in the city, you can do a lot better.Service: I'll just say that for a newer brand trying to break into one of the biggest Pizza cities in the world, you'd think they would try a little harder. My most recent interaction with the manager at this location was unpleasant, and she came off robotic and unsympathetic. I called them at a busy time, so I'm sure they won't miss my business tonight, but they will in the future. (still probably not, but I can hope.)This is what I get for trying outside the Pequods box. Sorry!

20.description: Just regular pizza. Nothing special.

36.description: For the price, you can't beat it. Pizza is good, the cheesy bread sticks are addictive. I usually go get pick up, not delivery.  I've even eaten it there a few times.  The staff aren't always the most put together bunch, but I haven't been disappointed by the food yet and they're usually pretty nice.  Last Saturday I had a party for 125 peeps and we ordered 7 pizzas and 6 orders of triple sticks for a mid-evening snack. We just called up and ordered.  It was the first time i got delivery and i am happy to say that it all showed up on time and was devoured by all in short order.Never order without looking for their specials or coupons. Usually you can get a large pizza with whatever you want on it and an order of breadsicks for under or near $20.  My only gripe with the food is that you don't get enough dipping sauce with your order, i always have to get extra which isn't complimentary.

14.description: My girlfriend and I pass this Toppers regularly on the way to Mariano's, so we decided to give it a try last night. Ordered a large buffalo chicken (the "Freak of the Week" $10.99 special) and a Topperstix. Delivery: Very fast, probably around 30 minutes which beat their estimate of 40. We live less than a half mile away, but quick delivery is always appreciated. Driver was super nice.Pizza: The bacon was excellent, had a smoky taste and wasn't overcooked like Papa John's bacon. I liked the 50/50 combo of ranch and buffalo sauce. The chicken was decent, nothing to write home about. Severely lacking on cheese, to the point of maybe 40% of the pizza being a bald patch under the toppings.Topperstix: Sufficient, a bit bland, no seasoning or anything. Also lacking on the cheese :(Sauces: We tried Chipotle Ranch and Parmesan Garlic. The CR was very good, heavy smoke flavor when first opened but after that it was a good amount. The PG was very flavorful, but way too salty. Felt like the ratio of parmesan to garlic wasn't very balanced.Leftovers: Tasted pretty much the same after going back in the oven, which is more than you can say about a lot of pizza places.All in all, not too bad and I'd like to try some of their other house pizzas. The cheese-skimping was disappointing though, so I'll probably try a few other places before returning.

3.description: Not the best Subway I've walked in to.  They're what you would expect but it's dingy and small inside.

1.description: Placed my order at 8:54 p.m. for delivery via Grubub.com. Projected delivery time was 10:55 p.m., which I already don't understand. What sandwich takes two hours to prepare at Subway? At 9:38 I receive a text message (no, no telephone call) informing me that my order was cancelled and my money refunded in full, though the restaurant doesn't close until 11:00 p.m. No reason whatsoever was given for said cancellation. This franchise owner is a complete joke. Take your business elsewhere.

2.description: This is by far the worst subway to ever order from. I used a delivery service called delivery.com to place my hour. I waited almost two hours and my food still hadn't arrived. So I gave subway a call and I was told the deliver driver isn't there yet. Long story short, my food never came. Do yourself a favor, find a different restaurant.

5.description: What a joke. If you're a night owl looking for some late-night grub, just go to Taco Burrito King or Chinese Yum Yum across the street. I walked into this subway, and there's one person there who's just leaning on the counter, face buried in her hands, and she stays there for close to a minute after I've walked in and am standing at the counter. Finally she makes her way towards me (very slowly), and without looking up at me asks in a harsh and disinterested tone "what kind of sandwich do you want." I tell her, and then she starts moving food trays around (again, very slowly) and doesn't even start to make the sandwich! She just takes various meats out of one tray and puts them in another. I waited patiently for 3 minutes; she didn't say one word to me during that time and never started actually making my order. I think her plan was to make me leave, and it worked. What a lazy ****.

6.description: My rating has nothing to do with the food, but rather the service.I come to this Subway location often because I like Subway sandwiches and this location is a 2-minute walk from my apartment.  I have been to numerous Subway locations across the country, and the service at this particular location is the slowest I have ever experienced.  The lackadaisical attitude of the employees is unacceptable to me, both as a customer and as a former restaurant employee.  Furthermore, I am convinced that every employee I have encountered here has been high on marijuana (I base this conclusion on the slow service and the telltale bloodshot eyes).  I come here almost exclusively during the after-dinner hours, which may explain but certainly does not excuse what I have observed.

7.description: I've been going to this subway around once a week after I moved a few months ago. Everything was okay until today.I walked in after some other guy who was mid sandwich order when the girl told them they had no more spinach, whereupon he canceled his order and walked out. The thing I didn't like about that in particular was that the girl behind the counter literally shook all of the lettuce she'd put on his bun back into the bin. Now, I know she was wearing gloves and that the lettuce costs money (but not that much, which is why they push it more over other toppings), but it was still weird. At least she gave me my own bread instead of slicing his 12 inch bread into halves and giving me one, though I did end up with some of the lettuce that had been on his sandwich. The whole time this guy was ranting about no spinach, a fly was literally walking all over the roast beef. It sits in a big pile and the fly was walking around on the top piece. Eww. I know flies are everywhere and walk on food, etc, but I don't really want to eat from somewhere that doesn't pay enough attention to that stuff. Luckily for me, the chicken teryaki is usually covered with some paper. It's one thing to know in the back of your mind that this kind of thing happens, it's a whole other to have to watch it.

8.description: Eh, it's a Subway. It's OK for a cold traditional sub. Here the service sucks. The lady who was making my sandwich kept sighing for each additional topping I wanted. They place wasn't busy either.

0.description: It's Subway.  Just about everyone has been here at least once.  It's next door to my office, so I frequent here.  They do a fine job, but rarely have the soup that they have posted every day.  Hmm, how about we take down the little sign if there is no soup?  Ingenious, I know.  I will of course still visit and cross my fingers every cold or rainy day in hopes that they will have soup.

4.description: I guess this isn't a fast food Subway company is proud of...rubber sandwiches, with occasional sloppy service...
